description: Are you passionate in building the future of LEGO e-Commerce in China?  To support e-commerce long-term growth, we need an Key Account Manager for JD.com, who is responsible for both on strategic level as well as on tactical and operational level.   Core Responsibilities  EC Business Development  To support e-commerce long-term business growth, we are seeking for a Key Account Manager to take care of JD.com (JD Direct 自营) business management, who operates both on a strategic level as well as on tactical and operational level.  PSI Management   Responsible for planning and managing full year demand plan. Responsible for weekly stock sell in and client’s handshake management.   Portfolio Management   Responsible for planning and managing full year portfolio plan and achieve theme line sales target. Provide product level insight to KAM for business decision.   Budget Management   Manage JD.com full expense including expense planning, application, progress tracking and also communicating and negotiating with clients.   Daily Routine Coordination   Responsible for daily communicating and negotiating with clients. Coordinate with internal supporting segment about daily routines including order management, product demand and expense claim etc.   Play your part in our team succeeding  The key objective of the Key Account Manager to further develop the joint business and partnership with customers. This requires a strong partnership with our clients, and customer focus with an ecommerce insight driven approach identifying and winning new commercial opportunities, in order to create value for both LEGO and our retail partners.  LEGO China is leading and driving the Customer growth strategy and business objectives. The ecommerce team is building a sustainable and healthy business platform. We coordinate and collaborate with multi-functional resources to ensure synergy and coherence. China eCommerce plays a key role in presenting LEGO brand on different eCommerce platform and creating best in class online shopper experiences. We serve as trusted partners, decision making through our valued eCommerce insight and expertise.  Do you have what it takes?   Bachelor’s degree, in a business-related field preferred Strong business understanding of the online market Strategic perspective combined with strong executional skills Excellent communication skills Excellent ability to build long lasting relations Excellent negotiation skills Strong analytical capabilities, expertise in driving online operation KPI People management experience is an advantage Some domestic travel required IT skills Excellent user of MS Office tools, especially Excel, PPT Must be fluent in both written and spoken English   Join the global LEGO® family  Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.  The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.”  The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.  Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.  Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.
jobFunction: Project Management, Business Development, and Product Management

description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  Key Account Manager  MAIN TASKS AND RESPONSILIBITIES Provide routine visits to key stakeholders in health management governments and hospitals, especially hospital director & Pharmacy head. Build/update data-base of key stakeholders in hospitals, and monthly report to KA Management. Implement company projects on targeted stakeholders smoothly and effectively, build up strong partnership with Key Accounts in region, and build good Bayer Brand Image. Obtain feedback and information from stakeholders and project participants timely and provide suggestion to HQ for on-going or future improvement Cooperate closely with local Sales teams, sharing information and project progress, cooperate in drug listing, removing amount limitation, andavoiding stopping prescription Cooperate closely with local Sales teams and Marketing teams in bidding and reimbursement affairs Receive and implement the assignment/tasks required by KA and company management Who You Are 2 years or more experience as District Sales Manager or KA Manager Excellent performance record Good skill and experience in communication and negotiation and good stakeholder management skill Good at Strategic thinking, planning and implementation Good collaboration with people internal and external Customer service oriented Be proficiency in computer skill YOUR APPLICATION  If your background and personal experience fit this profile, please send us your complete application at www.career.bayer.cn If you have any recommendations, please kindly send mail to cnreferral@bayer.com  L ocation:  China : ShangHai : ShangHai  Division:  Pharmaceuticals  Reference Code:  488701

Job Profile Summary Grade HResponsible for managing regional direct sales activities, delivering the strategic plan to meet the business' growth aspirations and supporting the development of sales direct/B2B strategies to maximise profitability and Business to Business (B2B) sales opportunities. The scope of the role will influence the grade – this can include financial accountability, geographical scope, leadership responsibilities and overall level of responsibility.  Job Advert Key Accountabilities： Accountable for financial delivery – Volume, Turnover and Cash results from the assigned Key accounts  Construct and understand the overall KA contact map; build strong relationship with senior management team through various event, meeting, and work shops  Build and maintain a strong pipeline of accounts to deliver volume, NTO & new customer acquisition objectives. Utilize CRM to document customer activities’  Interact with regional sales and function team to deliver and modify the value proposition designed for the KAs (include but not limited to product, application, service, strategy alliance, co-development, and senior strategy partnership), and ultimately bring sustainable and profitable growth to Castrol Industrial  Set growth target for each key account and highlight resource plan for the execution; develop and keep strategic account plan up to date  Design achievement for each growth project with clear growth target; Project manage these landmarks with high effectiveness by utilizing project management principles and engaging different partners  Connect with both external and internal partners on progress, barriers, and resource concerns; be resourceful to bring to bear resources to solve problems so as to move the project forward  Keep informed about the industry trend, customer insight, and technology developments; communicate these findings properly through different channel so to enhance the total offer for the key accounts and secure internal resources (include but not limited to new product development and total offer enhancement)  Work closely with peers and Global Key account managers to delver specific agreed KPIs  Ensure all the business activities conform to BP’s code of conduct, country legislative requirements as well as BP strict Health, Safety and Environment policies  Requirements： Minimum Science / Engineering Graduate with business degree preferred 10 + years of experience in Sales / Marketing including exposure to Industrial product sales 5 + years in managing relationships in large accounts – National / Transnational Account strategy & business planning Negotiating Value Internal functional navigation in the service of customer We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discrimin ate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  Entity Customers & Products  Job Family Group Sales Group  Relocation available No  Travel Required Yes - up to 50%  Time Type Full time  Country China  About BP CUSTOMER AND PRODUCTS We’re gearing up for the future. At bp our goal for C&P is to deliver the future of mobility, energy and services for our customers by innovating with new business models and service platforms.  C&P will become a hub, housing our midstream, lubricants, aviation, sale of chemicals, mobility and convenience, marketing and our next-generation businesses, making it a highly integrated and interconnected organisation. And with safety being our core value, our commitment to safe and reliable operations will never change.  Want to join the team? This means: being customer-centric, agile and responsive to changing customer needs and dynamic markets focusing on growth and development of customer offers optimising the chemicals and fuels value chains to maximise integrated value contributing to the reduction of carbon intensity of the products we create, and sell, by 50% by 2050 or sooner creating strategic partnerships that drive long-term value for C&P being digitally enabled and empowered by customer insights and data to deliver solutions. Experience Level Intermediate

Job Profile Summary Grade IResponsible for delivering the indirect sales strategy and financial performance targets including Sales Volume, Gross Margin and Overdue, managing local distributor partners and intermediaries/resellers in the sales territory or geography, finding prospect partners, coaching distributors and monitoring their financial position to ensure long term sustainable value for the company. The scope of the role will influence the grade – this can include financial accountability, geographical scope, leadership responsibilities and overall level of responsibility.  Job Advert Purpose of role： The role exists to manage local top workshop partners in the sales territory. The role is accountable for delivery of the PCO IWS indirect workshop sales strategy and execution of market offer strategy. The role is also responsible of finding and developing prospect partners, and finally contribute to territory distributor’s sales performance Accountabilities Implement country PCO IWS indirect business strategy within territory by translating it into clear business plans Deliver IWS channel strategy by developing new customer and continuously improving existing customer in store share in top workshops Work closely with IWS Territory Manager and Distributor Sales team to secure and improve Castrol market share in workshop level, and finally contribute significant financial performance to distributors Leverage cross function resources and joint approach for the best outcome Develop, agree (both internally and externally) and implement the market offer strategy with the Channel partner, providing permanent support in all areas of its contents, and in particular regarding: sales capability (skills and knowledge) b. customer offer deployment, coverage and satisfaction  c. financial Return on Investment and cash flow performance  d. brand representation and compliance  e. HSSE and Ethical compliance Collect the information about the key customer database and manage the pipeline of key customer development Develop and manage the business relationship with the key customers in the area by using the tools and resources smartly to deliver the desired business results Share field findings and experience at team level, extracting comparable information Improve and deliver customer experience in targeted sectors and customer groups. Ensure delivery of our promises by seeking continuous improvement and efficiency in all operations making sure the voice of the customer is represented in every decision we make. Drive standardization of our sales offers in line with our basic customer offer Ensure that all activities conducted through 3rd parties or intermediaries in country comply fully with our own CoC and local competition legalisation. Ensure compliance with country regulations, bp Group, Segment and regional policies and standards Experience & Expertise Minimum 3 years working experience in distributor sales and management Track record of delivery of sales targets and performance Experience/track record/confidence representing the company externally and dealing professionally with distributors and workshops. Experience of managing negotiations at senior level. Capability to work independently but also skillful on teamwork. Ability to develop and implement strategic and tactical business plans. Ability to be hands on and drive the business with direct responsibility Flexibility of thought and action to be able to respond to changing market environments and dynamic business situations Adapted for frequent business travel We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Description Lead category end to end business management including： 1）Design and execute annual sales plan. 2）Sell-in/sell-through and execution. 3）Deliver sales targets. Build positive relationship with customers and build values to both customers and company via joint business planning. Own business analysis, including but not limit to sales data analysis, issue solution and gap closing plan. Description Lead category end to end business management including： 1）Design and execute annual sales plan. 2）Sell-in/sell-through and execution. 3）Deliver sales targets. description: Major Responsibilities Take charge in promotion of diabetic products in target area, and realize sales target of the company. Client management in the target area, including filing and updating client data, maintaining client relations, and utilizing resources of the company in a reasonable manner. Complete various statements required by the company. Collect information of the rivals in the area. Observe OEC policy of the company in a strict manner, and effectively implement the marketing plan. Minimum Education Required  Associate degree or above, medicine, pharmacy or related field preferred  Minimum Experience Required 2 years or above sales experience in pharmaceuticals or medical devices, work experience in foreign companies preferred. Excellent sales sense and strong capacity of judgment as well. Good communication and language skills. Love sales, responsible and be able to bear pressure. Team spirit, be able to bear hardships and stand hard work.

Job Profile Summary Grade IResponsible for delivering the indirect sales strategy and financial performance targets including Sales Volume, Gross Margin and Overdue, managing local distributor partners and intermediaries/resellers in the sales territory or geography, finding prospect partners, coaching distributors and monitoring their financial position to ensure long term sustainable value for the company. The scope of the role will influence the grade – this can include financial accountability, geographical scope, leadership responsibilities and overall level of responsibility.  Job Advert Job Purpose The role is accountable for delivery of shared business objectives in the given portfolio, including Volume and GM performance targets, as well as other activation targets like in-store penetration, share of wallet and training etc.. An information source of the latest “voice of customer”, the competitor activities and the change of local market. Key Accountabilities Workshop development: Work with Key Account sales team and planning team to define a local area business plan including target workshops, coverage, sales target, activities etc. Understand Key Account sales contract terms, policy and agreed offer Prepare specific workshop value selling offer and sell to the target customer. Workshop management: Understand, build relationship with, and influence customer in order to gain commitment for the activities proposed. Implement activities aligned to customer needs and company strategy to maintain the good relationship with existing customers. Actively defends and grows existing customer share of wallet through needs based and effective use of our offer. Holds regular meetings to agree and track KPIs with customers. Coordinate with Key Account team on workshop activation planning for responsible area Manage designated service provider for workshop activation if needed. Customer and market insights: manage an updated database and maintain close relationship locally. Understand customer needs and competitor’s approach and provide feedback to company. Represent “voice of customer” in the company in order to improve our approach. Requirements Bachelor’s degree, with major of sales & marketing related is preferred. At least 3-5 years sales & marketing experience. More than 2 years sales & marketing experience, automotive aftermarket experience is plus; Demonstrated track record of driving growth in a very competitive market environment; Working experience in Lubes industry is preferred. Good at building up relationship with customers Strong implementation capability and customer management capabilities Coordination skill to ensure the teamwork of various partners in delivery of effective trade-up programs. Able to translate customer needs into customer propositions, and to sell into the customer and business in a persuasive way We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Why this role  Design to be a true growth engine for GS, that consistently delivers a high volume of highly profitable sales, through enthusiastic, skilled and knowledgeable people’s drive to meet the needs of our customers. Specifically delivering: Volume sales to an assigned set of accounts; supporting vertical field teams and/or direct ownership of accounts aligned to inside sales team New Business, Growth and high margin contract value based on a defined scope of accounts/customers Build and maintain strong relationships with both internal and external customers Secure and defend existing revenues Develop and grow account base, cross-sell, up-sell, proactive lead generation  Scope  Outbound calling/messaging to drive pipeline. Identify key contacts, trends, and messaging to be used to support discussions. On specific accounts within sub-verticals, support the end to end account management ofcustomer. Support any marketing/campaign planning to help develop leads and drive the leads to opportunities within customer base. Responsible for achieving quarterly and annual targets based on defined set accounts and objectives set by the business. Generate new leads via customer relationships, campaigns and pro-active working and record on SFDC. Adhere to corporate guidelines (CCA rules) and ensure opportunities are managed in a professional and compliant way. Manage indivdual pipeline on SFDC to provide accurate forecasts and pipeline management. Ensure customers are managed professionally and proactively while building and expanding relationships with key contacts and influencers through regular, proactive contact. Utilise specialist resource on complex opportunities, where needed Take responsibility for product knowledge and market awareness in order to effectively advise customers Resolve customer issues and dissatisfaction swiftly, through effective engagement and hand-off with appropriate internal departments to maintain customer satisfaction Ensure close working relationships with the account virtual team to ensure a ‘One BT approach’ is evident to key account contacts  Skills required  Ability to cross-sell, up-sell opportunities Commercial awareness Basic product and solution knowledge of telecom industry; network, unifed communications, and security Basic understanding of competitive landscape Multi-lingual, depending on country Customer relationship skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Proficient experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce, LinkedIn, etc.) and MS Office Ability to work independently or as an active member of a team Self-motivated and self-directed Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently Previous sales and/or account management experience Proficient experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce, LinkedIn, etc.) and MS Office Strong verbal and written communication skills Fluent English speaker Multi-lingual depending on region/country could be required Basic product and solution knowledge of telecom industry; network, unifed communications, and security

Job Description  Major Responsibilities/Activities: Work with marketing & sales team to establish bidding strategy and action plan. Manage bidding information and bidding policy analysis. Work with distributor in bidding process. Negotiate with local authority and try to get optimal bidding price. Full supports for local staffs to follow up the whole bidding process and provide feasible action plan to accomplish bidding projects with other related departments. Build and maintain good relationship with professional associations and KOLs. Provide guidance and help for Sales team to get our products listed in key individual hospital. Develop distributor management strategy, establish/implement effective distributor management policy. Establish and implement policy to confront cross zone sales activity, maintain the legitimacy of orders within respectively sales territory. Communicate and lobby with government decision makers in different levels with specific goal. Build up relationship with central governments to ensure corporate business is well protected and fit with government development agenda and direction. Get our newly-launched or licensed products onto national reimbursement list. Lobbying government in new product price application to get optimal price. Establish and build on relationships with key contacts within the company, and govt. agencies. Requirements Industry experiences: Minimum of 6years working in MNC or government office. Familiar with Government Affairs and have relevant exposure and experiences in product bidding, distributor management, reimbursement listing and pricing either in pharmaceutical products or healthcare products. Position experiences: Minimum of 4 years relevant experience in hospital bidding practice. Experience in new drug pricing application and medical reimbursement practice Better to have relevant experience in distributor/wholesaler management for medical products Language Skills： Good command of written and verbal English. Computer Skills: Proficient computer skills in MS Office (Excel & PPT) and Lotus Notes. Mobility: Be flexible to travel as business need Certificate Required: Essential-At least bachelor's degree on pharmaceutical or related major Other Special requirement: Able to work under pressure to meet tight dateline Able to work independently and yet contributed as a team player Good interpersonal communication and coordinating skills Self-motivated, creative and well organized.

Description Key Account Manager is the end to end owner for distributor hub business He/she needs to lead hub business plan alignment, execution, tracking, review and optimization. He/she is encouraged to lead sell in/sell through of top stores and enable distributor team to win First Moment of Truth in top stores. Be accountable for key projects sell in and execution. He/she also shall develop distributor's capability and fully enable distributor team. Deliver IWS channel strategy by developing new customer and continuously improving existing customer in store share in top workshops. 工作职责:  职位描述：  Job Description Summary  Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Jobs at this level operate with some autonomy but are covered by well-defined Commercial policies or review of end results. The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (typically annual volume, margin and compliance requirements). Responsible for medium-sized sales territories.  GE Healthcare is a global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Roles and Responsibilities  Selling to named account(s), addition of a new customer is typically rare and usually subject to review process. Include key accounts within a single business group/ P&L  Utilizes in-depth knowledge of own and others sales territory, product lines, markets, sales processes or customer groups and uses analytical thinking and commercial experience to execute policy/strategy.  Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market  Uses some judgment and has some ability to propose different solutions outside of set parameters to address more complicated, day-to-day problems with projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, or customers. Ability to prioritize information for decision making. Uses technical experience and analytical thinking. Uses multiple internal and limited external sources outside of own teams to arrive at decisions.  These sales jobs will mainly be individual contributors.  A job at this level requires strong interpersonal skills. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. May lead small projects with low risks and resource requirements. Explains information; developing skills to bring team members to consensus around topics within field. Conveys performance expectations and may handle sensitive issues.  任职条件:  Required Qualifications  This role requires advanced experience in the Sales & Account Sales. Knowledge level is comparable to a Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college ( or a high school diploma with relevant experience).  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

SALES REPRESENTATIVE - CHINA NORTH  A fantastic opportunity to join a fast growing and dynamic spirits company with numerous new product launches planned for the next 18 months. The Crimson Spirits Company is looking to hire a Sales Representative based in China North, ideally Beijing or Tianjin. You will work as part of a small, but dynamic and motivated team, working on driving sales for our in-house brands and products.   JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Contacting potential and existing clients to establish rapport and arrange meetings. Strong focus on clients in North China, covering Beijing, Hebei, Tianjin, Shandong, Shanxi and Liaoning, as key areas. Helping to plan and oversee new marketing initiatives alongside the Shanghai marketing manager Researching bars, restaurants, hotels and distributors to find new business opportunities  Increase the value of current customers while attracting new ones Finding and developing new markets in the China North and boosting sales revenue. Monthly and quarterly sales reports.   CANDIDATE 1-2 years experience in sales, preferably in the Food and Beverage industry  Strong communication skills Ability to manage complex projects and multitask. Be personal and amiable.  Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive and handle uncertainty Be goal orientated and sales driven Good level of English required  SALARY & BENEFITS Basic salary of 8,000-10,000/month DOE + structured monthly commission  Travel expenses covered   WORK HOURS Monday - Friday 14:00-22:00 (office hours, plus visiting clients)  LOCATION Work remotely, Beijing or Tianjin candidate ideal.

Sales Representative  Smith is currently looking for experienced sales professional to join their Asia-Pacific Sales Team. As one of the world’s leading independent electronics distributor, the successful applicants will play a significant role in Smith’s market leading expertise on global electronics sourcing, logistics and distribution.     At Smith, we encourage our sales team to take an entrepreneurial approach to their work, believing that every impact can make a difference. We are looking for talented individuals who are driven, self-motivated and hungry for success. If you are not afraid of a challenge and looking for a rewarding environment, we would like to speak with you.  More senior candidates with more than 4 or 8 years of experience may be considered for a Senior Sales Representative or Sales Manager position.   Key Responsibilities Develop and maintain a portfolio of prospective OEM customers within the region and internationally Become an expert in the customers’ industry and act as the main point of contact for any client related inquiries Identify potential customers and develop sales strategies Provide effective cost-saving solutions (PPV) to customers based on accurate marketplace insight Assist customers to remove excess stock proactively  Requirements Bachelor degree in any disciplines At least 2 years of sales experience in electronics or any relevant industries is highly preferred Passionate, proactive, self-motivated and result-driven Ability to handle work independently, systematically in a fast pace environment Excellent communication skills and passionate in cold calling Good command of both written and oral English and Chinese, Japanese is a plus  About Smith Founded in 1984, Smith is a global distributor of semiconductors and electronic components and a trusted provider of efficiency-enhancing supply chain services to electronics and high-tech manufacturers. Smith’s investment in advanced in-house labs, a highly trained professional team, and strategically located global support centers offers our partners complete sourcing, inventory management solutions, cost-saving program, and more. About BHP  At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success.  About The Role  In this role you will liaise with customers and where relevant, suppliers to support relationships and interactions following direction from the General Manager Marketing, Head of Sales Liaison, Manager Seaborne Iron Ore Sales and the Book Manager, in line with agreed marketing objectives and strategies.  Core Accountabilities Demonstrates an overriding commitment to health, safety, environmental responsibility and sustainable development. Demonstrates commitment to the BHP Charter and Code of Business Conduct. Provides necessary preparatory and liaises to facilitate contract negotiations with customers and suppliers. Builds and maintains (long term) favourable relationships with suppliers, customers and other key relationships. Collects relevant market information from external interactions and exchange with relevant key internal relationship. Ensures adherence of marketing activities to external and internal policies and legislation. Represents the BHP Trading and Marketing Unit externally with customers, suppliers and partners, as needed, to create a positive external image of the Company. Assists the General Manager Sales / Head of Sales Liaison/ Manager Seaborne Iron Ore Sales with projects as required. About You  Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a commercial, economic, technical and/or relevant business discipline Experience & Technical Competencies Strong communication skills 5+ years working experience in sales/marketing roles in commodity markets Experience in the Iron Ore market would be advantageous Experience with SAP application would be advantageous Languages Fluent Mandarin and English, both verbal and written required Supporting a Diverse Workforce  The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance based bonuses and unique BHP employee share program.  At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourage applications from all qualified applicants regardless of race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, people with disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.  We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.  BHP is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disability.

Please contact us to request accommodation.  Entity Customers & Products  Job Family Group Sales Group  Relocation available No  Travel Required Yes - up to 75%  Country China  About BP CUSTOMER AND PRODUCTS We’re gearing up for the future. At bp our goal for C&P is to deliver the future of mobility, energy and services for our customers by innovating with new business models and service platforms.  C&P will become a hub, housing our midstream, lubricants, aviation, sale of chemicals, mobility and convenience, marketing and our next-generation businesses, making it a highly integrated and interconnected organisation. And with safety being our core value, our commitment to safe and reliable operations will never change.  Want to join the team? This means: being customer-centric, agile and responsive to changing customer needs and dynamic markets focusing on growth and development of customer offers optimising the chemicals and fuels value chains to maximise integrated value contributing to the reduction of carbon intensity of the products we create, and sell, by 50% by 2050 or sooner creating strategic partnerships that drive long-term value for C&P being digitally enabled and empowered by customer insights and data to deliver solutions. 销售运营分析师专注于理解和制定销售团队的KPI指标。需要支持销售运营经理，提供清晰的问题挑战分析和业务目标。运用各种工具例如Excel和Tableau来提供详细的至关重要的分析数据对于销售运营分析师的成功是至关重要的。向团队清楚地传达销售管理目标，同时收集日常业务问题反馈。销售运营分析师还需要确保销售团队学会使用各项销售工具来提高工作效率。最后，分析师还要能为销售经理和销售运营团队提供专业性建议，应对日常工作中的挑战，采取措施克服困难。  主要职责 为销售管理团队提供详细精确的每周、每月、每季度的报告来支持业务目标 在相关报告、客户关系管理系统、销售运营流程等方面，给现场销售组织团队提供支持 和每个层级的销售管理团队交流调研结果 确保及时递交准确可靠的标准报告 根据销售团队的需求，完成临时报告请求 开发高效的销售工具，整合运营流程 为了完善新品推出的流程，提供IT销售工具的培训 简明，清晰的与区域销售经理沟通，评估销售可提升的潜力 创建和维护用于销售组织管理的详细Excel模型 其他职责：根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作 岗位要求： 3-5年数据分析工作经验，本科及以上学历； 对数据敏感，优秀的数据分析能力和逻辑分析能力，能独立解决跨部门和跨组织的问题； 有较强的抗压力，能在快节奏、充满活力、结果导向的环境中工作；

description: About Kentik  Kentik is the network observability company. Our platform is a must-have for the network front line, whether digital business, corporate IT, or service provider. Network professionals turn to the Kentik Network Observability Cloud to plan, run, and fix any network, relying on our infinite granularity, AI-driven insights, and insanely fast search. Kentik makes sense of network, cloud, host, and container flow, Internet routing, performance tests, and network metrics. We show network pros what they need to know about their network performance, health, and security to make their business-critical services shine. Networks power the world’s most valuable companies, and those companies trust Kentik. Market leaders like IBM, Box, and Zoom rely on Kentik for network observability. Visit us at kentik.com and follow us at @kentikinc.  The true meaning of Kentik is visibility. We are committed to making sure everyone feels empowered to use their voice, has a sense of belonging and is represented at Kentik. We don’t look for individuals who fit the culture, but those who will continue to add to the culture. We encourage everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in the industry: people of color, LGBTQI+ community, women, individuals with disabilities (both seen and unseen), veterans, people of any age or family status.  About The Role  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is the crucial first touchpoint into prospective customers in our Asia-Pacific Market. SDRs at Kentik drive targeting and outreach to prospective customers in partnership with the field sales team. Once trained, this role provides an opportunity for creative thinking and approach to meet the business objectives laid out by leadership. SDRs will enjoy working with and learning from the mentoring of great sellers, strong leadership, and an environment of support, learning, and career advancement. You have multiple options as an SDR in terms of your future career path, including joining the Sales ranks, Customer Success, Marketing, and other departments within Kentik, as well as potentially stepping into management.  Responsibilities Work with RSMs to build territory plans for outreach Qualifying Inbound and Outbound leads thru personalized email communications Schedule meetings with the Sales team for new opportunities Generate interest and create opportunities with new prospects through outbound cold calls and emails Decide which accounts to target and whom to reach out to Meet your monthly and quarterly targets Perform the research on targeted accounts Meet your daily and weekly activity goals Qualify prospective customers and understand an organization’s business Drive interest in and schedule meetings at industry events throughout the calendar year Create strategic activities leading up to industry events to allow entire sales team to efficiently execute during event meetings  Requirements Location: Singapore At least 1 years experience as an SDR/BDR/Inside Sales in the enterprise software space Familiarity working with the following tools: Salesforce, Salesloft/Outreach, LinkedIn Navigator, MSOffice, ZoomInfo Multilingual with English and second language of: Mandarin, Japanese, Korean, Hindi, and others Understanding of Sales, Sales Development, Business Development, and Lead Generation processes and needs Excellent verbal and written communications skills Strong listening and presentation skills Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively Strong time, project management skills and ability to work autonomously, while being proactive in working with cross-functional teams to learn and grow Ability to work effectively within and across multiple timezones in the APAC region Have a proactive work style that ensures you stay in touch with remote teams, managers and RSMs to stay aligned and productive  Bonus points Understanding of basic networking terminology  Benefits* Medical, Dental, and Vision that is 100% covered for employees & dependents Health Reimbursement Account Wellness Benefits Maternity/Paternity leave Stock Options Flexible time off Vanguard 401(k) Benefits are as listed for US employees. Local health insurance coverage and similar benefits are provided for employees outside of the US.  Why work at Kentik?  We offer a competitive salary, first-rate benefits and the chance to work at a fast-growing, well-funded startup that builds something special: the industry's most powerful observability platform for the network professional. You will have the opportunity to work alongside world-class engineers, network experts, and technology thought leaders to build the future of digital operations. Kentik is headquartered in San Francisco with team members around the world.

MISSION and ACTIVITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES in Artemide:  The person in the role will be responsible for visiting and establishing regular contacts with architects, technical offices, lighting planners and prescribers, in order to promote ARTEMIDE’s architectural & design products in the contract business; The person will also be responsible for maximizing sales, business development and presence of Artemide products within the retail channel in China (specialized lighting shops, furniture shops, generalist department stores & specialized in design / furniture / lighting, etc.); His / Her main task will be to develop and manage projects with such prescribers, as owner of the responsibility for the overall quotation & sales process; Bidding & quotations process (preparation, presentation, follow up) will be under direct responsibility of the candidate; Delivery to customers of training activities on products could be part of the job; The person will devote most of his/her time visiting prescribers and developing sales as per above. Strong willingness to grow and to attain sales results since the short term; Strong organizational skills in sales activities (planning & forecasting, reporting, etc.); Basic knowledge of lighting calculations techniques and tools is a plus (Dialux); Fluent in English.  OTHER: Extremely movable throughout the Country.

To achieve the sales targets, the Sales Manager proactively works with Sales Engineer, Solution Sales and Product management to lead the whole sales cycle in discovering new big potential opportunities as well as driving the existing business to grow. In addition to do daily sales management work, this position needs to involve a broad range of sales related activities, including but not limited to participate and represent SM business at tradeshows, conferences with customers, workshops and online virtual meetings. Present our company and solution’s value to key customers and prospects, develop business value oriented solutions and strategy to win the competition against alternative solutions and competitors, and analyze industries trends, build deep trust with high level management of customers, to ensure our SM products and solutions remain leading position in the market. Key responsibilities of this job: ·       Developing new big opportunities and building pipelines on SM business ·       Regular meetings with key accounts and partners, maintain and driving the existing business to grow ·       Implementing company strategies and proactively tracking results ·       Partnership management and support ·       Inspiring partners to develop new business and expand to new areas ·       Support regional marketing programs and events ·       Regular meeting and reporting sales forecast and new business opportunities to management ·       The candidate will report to China Regional Sales Director   Knowledge, Skills and Experience: ·       This candidate must have 5-8 years of direct touch sales experience and experience with channel partners management ·       The candidate must have 5+ years of software solution selling experience and well understand software monetization market is preferred ·       Have a Bachelor's degree, Business or IT related major is preferred ·       Candidate must be proficient in English speaking and written ·       Candidate must be proactive personality and willing to take pressure

description: This role supports the Global Sales Offices who service Rosewood Hotels and Resorts, KHOS and New World Hotels & Resorts in responding to general client inquiries and requests, assisting clients in the absence of a manager or director, follow-up and handling of leads/opportunities, oversight and optimization of sales technologies, and overall management of office administration functions.  Responsibilities: Provide direct sales support to the Director(s) of Global Sales in China Provide direct administrative and data support to the Senior Director, Commercial, Asia Pacific Respond to general incoming sales inquiries/opportunities and facilitate any follow-up required to the appropriate director of global sales or hotel sales manager Assist in responding to clients in the absence of a manager or director and forwarding relevant information to the hotels as appropriate Communicate with customers, on-property hotels managers, staff, and corporate office on a regular basis or as requested by directors Maintain an accurate and updated sales resource database – to include contacts, accounts, opportunities, and lists Prepare, assist, develop and provide all sales & marketing related reports as requested – or facilitate requests to appropriate individual as necessary Coordinate sales trip itineraries for directors to include organization and follow-up as needed Provide coordination support to the appropriate director of global sales for tradeshows, roadshow and sales events as assigned Conduct budget and expense management including review of all incoming bills, submitting to directors for timely approval, and processing bills with corporate finance Support client events, sales missions, and tradeshows through planning and coordination Manage group inquiries in the sales resource database including status follow-up with respective hotels Process Travel Agent requests including reservations, commission issues, special VIP requests, etc Manage Corporate RFP tools and related process and issues  Support collateral procurement and fulfillment: process requests and maintain database of requests. Coordinate in-house direct mail and/or email campaigns with Corporate Director of Marketing Communications and/or Corporate Director of Global Sales Represent Rosewood Hotels and Resorts, KHOS and New World Hotels & Resorts in the highest standards with colleagues, customers, at customer events and tradeshows  Skills & Qualifications: Experience: Diploma/College/Bachelor’s Degree or a relevant field of work, or an equivalent combination of education and work-related experience Education: 2+ years progressive work-related experience in the hotel industry is required. Experience with multi-brand entity preferred References: Strong personal and business references upon request Must be able to perform job functions with attention to detail, speed and accuracy Ability to prioritize, organize, multi-task, and follow-up; attentive and responsive to client needs; obsessively service-oriented; be a clear thinker, remaining calm and resolving problems using good judgment; follow directions thoroughly; understand a guest’s service needs; work cohesively with co-workers as part of a team; meet deadlines; maintain confidentiality of guest information and pertinent hotel data Reading, writing, and oral proficiency in English Demonstrate an affinity with technology; proficient in computer skills (including Windows, Microsoft suite of tools, internet) necessary to complete correspondence with internal and external customers via proposals, letters, emails, and inter-office communications. Salesforce, Cendyne, Delphi, RevIntel experience a plus  While this job description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the duties involved in this position, the company reserves the right to add, remove or alter duties when business need dictates.

Applause empowers leading brands to deliver flawless digital experiences for their customers on any device, in every location. The company’s testing, feedback and research solutions enable businesses to delight customers, drive topline revenue and innovate faster.  Applause ensures digital quality for websites, mobile apps, IoT products and in-store interactions in a way no other approach can – via its technology platform and managed global community of over 550,000 on-demand digital experience experts. Only real people on real devices in real locations can provide the real issues and feedback that brands need to deliver great digital customer experiences. Thousands of companies of every size – including Google, FOX, Nike, BMW, PayPal and Slack – rely on Applause to dramatically decrease the time and cost of delivering great digital experiences for their customers.  To help us grow the APAC market, we are looking for a:  Business Development Representative (m/f/x)  As a Business Development Rep (BDR), you will act as the first contact for many Applause prospects with the objective of assisting our field sales team in selling products and services. Must be highly competitive with the ability to collaborate in a team environment, possess strong interpersonal and communicative skills. The BDR is responsible for partnering with the Sales organization in driving the early stages of the sales cycle and to help in New Customer Acquisition. The Enterprise BDR team also works closely with the marketing team to follow-up on marketing campaigns/events/conferences/seminars.  Responsibilities: Generate outbound qualified opportunities per quarter within target industry accounts- each opportunity should contain: Diagnosis of the prospect’s business pains, Applause’s solution identification, and understanding of prospects’ infrastructure, timelines and budgets. Act as the single point of contact for all inbound calls/requests for the assigned region, qualify these opportunities and pass to the relevant Enterprise Account Manager Support the internal industry or solution specific marketing campaigns and events in the region. Work with the Enterprise Account Manager team to identify accounts and do extensive territory planning for the assigned regions. Also conduct prospect research within focused industry verticals. Ability to develop a ‘Why Applause, Why Now’ proposition for each prospect interaction as well as a close cooperation with the sales team to identify and follow up on new leads/opportunities. Ongoing and precise record keeping and forecasting within the sales database, SalesForce.com CRM as well as the ability to make use of prospecting support tools such as Linkedln, Data.com, Hoovers, etc. Conduct targeted and non-targeted account prospecting and qualification via different channels Achieve monthly, quarterly and yearly pipeline and forecast goals and defined objectives that our field sales team can convert into qualified opportunities. Develop, present and implement plans to your manager for acquiring new business and traction in your assigned area - including activity breakdowns, performance milestones and resource requirements.  Qualifications Has successfully executed prospecting/new Account Development campaigns in the local regions. Has experience in the Enterprise, SaaS, Cloud or High Tech Industries Eloquent and self-confident communicator comfortable speaking with C level contacts Experience and understanding of the SaaS, Cloud Computing and related services Can express their ideas in persuasive emails and other written communications Creativity to think outside the box and leadership to execute effectively Minimum 1 years of sales, telesales or marketing experience running outbound enterprise B2B demand generation and lead generation activities in Enterprise/SaaS/Cloud Excellent written and verbal communication skills with an ability to influence others. Conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure. Mature and confident with strong interpersonal skills and a true team player. Self-motivated, driven and dynamic personality. Attention to details, forecasting lead goals Bachelor’s degree preferred Fluent Mandarin/English Preferably based in Shanghai  Do you want to be involved in the expansion of an international company and work for one of the fastest growing tech firms? If so, then this position at Applause is perfect for you!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Internet, and Computer Software

description: This role is part of Early Talent Programe HC. This person will be instrumental in increasing Cloud (PaaS and IaaS) bookings . They will work closely with cloud presales team for new business, as well as bringing in net new business in their territory.   Responsibilities: Define strategies and act to generate long term and short term customer success and business results. To exceed quarterly sales targets by selling Oracle PaaS/IaaS and On-Premise Database into named accounts and/or within an assigned geographical or vertical market. Manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while expanding existing accounts. Territory identification and research, to formalize a go to market territory strategy and create qualified target account list within 30 days. Pipeline development through a combination of cold calling, email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence. Adequate pipeline to ensure over-achievement within the designated territory Daily update of the Oracle Sales Cloud system with accurate customer and pipeline data. Accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery. Continuous improvement in self-research, learning and readiness on the new product offerings Working closely with customer success managers ensuring the PaaS/IaaS customers are deriving value from their investments and ensure very high subscription renewal rates.  Requirements: Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in selling enterprise software solutions or services. Aggressive,call high ability. Successful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent over achievement against targets. Ability to build reciprocal relationships with different parts of the business, partners and customers and identifies synergies across LOBs and acts on opportunities to integrate business, with credibility at all levels, including Lines of Business and CxO.

Company Overview  Company Description  Third Bridge was founded on the belief that human insights drive intelligent investment decisions.  To make the right investment decisions, our clients require access to the most relevant experts and their insights – we enable this through private consultations and exclusive content drawn from expert interviews.  Our clients consist of some of the largest private equity funds, hedge funds, mutual funds and management consulting firms, who are serviced by a team of over 900 employees located across eight global offices.  Third Bridge operates in a global, multi-billion-dollar market with double digit annual growth and has consistently received accolades for Great Places to Work and the top 100 fastest growing companies.  Job Description  As an Account Associate, you will play a vital role in driving engagement with clients across Third Bridge’s Connections and Forum offerings. You will proactively contact investment professionals and/or consultants within our client base on a day-to-day basis, building rapport and credibility to drive end-users towards our services. Your work will be pivotal in guaranteeing the retention and growth of our account base.  In This Role You Will  Responsibilities Support Account Managers on renewals and cross-sell opportunities by working closely with them to execute on territory and account plans to achieve strategic goals Identify and engage inactive or potentially new users across priority accounts and to increase utilization of Third Bridge offerings Reiterate the value proposition of Third Bridge’s services to drive usage and help embed our products in the daily workflows of end users Maintain constant dialogue with clients to understand their research processes and gather feedback on Third Bridge’s services. Support clients by offering training and demo sessions on how to use Third Bridge’s services. Maintain and update team structures, client user preferences, client investment coverage sectors and geographies, and pertinent account and contact data in our systems, ensuring tailored content and service delivery to exceed client expectations. Develop an awareness of client buying processes and Third Bridge sales and renewal processes to support revenue generation Collaborate with internal stakeholders - legal, marketing, research, sales and product teams, to ensure client requests are executed quickly and effectively. Attend internal and external meetings punctually and well-prepared Address and/or triage inbound client questions and requests; assess solutions and next steps alongside the Account Manager and execute the agreed approach Skills A client service-focused mindset Proven experience in building and maintaining relationships by phone and face-to-face would be beneficial Excellent organization, written and oral/presentation skills Collaborative approach in solving problems Qualifications A client service-focused mindset Proven experience in building and maintaining relationships by phone and face-to-face would be beneficial Excellent organization, written and oral/presentation skills Collaborative approach in solving problems Bachelor’s degree 1-2 years of account management experience and/or client support experience, preferably in a similar industry Highly motivated with a track record of consistent achievement of quota(s) for at least 1 year Effectively leverages internal resources, tools and systems daily Experience applying industry and product knowledge in written and verbal client communications Successful past adoption and effective use of internal workflows, processes and technologies to accomplish work objectives Strong communication, active listening, interpersonal and presentation skills Intellectual curiosity and a passion for learning Easy adaptable to changing, ambiguous and fast-paced environments Strong time management skills with the ability to multi-task and prioritize work Familiarity with Salesforce.com as well as Microsoft Office and G-Suite tools Additional Information  We know that to be truly innovative, we need to have a diverse team around us. That is why Third Bridge is committed to creating an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you are not 100% sure if you are right for the role, please apply anyway and we will be happy to consider your application.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Business Development Manager - Remote (China)  App Annie is always looking for extraordinary candidates with Mobile, SaaS, analytics background and we'd love to get to know you! We do not have any current openings for a Business Development Manger in this location, however, in the event that a position opens up, we'd love for you to be the first person to know! Below is what we traditionally look for:  Something About Us...  App Annie is the industry’s most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. Our mission is to help customers create winning mobile experiences and achieve excellence. We created the mobile app data market and are committed to delivering the industry’s most complete mobile performance offering. More than 1,200 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the standard to revolutionize their mobile business. We are headquartered in San Francisco with 12 offices worldwide.  Along with a market defining product, we take great pride in our culture and values and strive to embody them daily! We set a high bar for our success and have made Excellence as our standard, hold each other Accountable, continuously push Innovation and Win with Style.  What can you tell your friends when they ask you what you do?  As an App Annie Business Development Manager, you are a high-energy, driven individual with knowledge of technology and solid business-to-business sales and account management experience. AA offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be empowered to sell advertising analytics to the world's most innovative brands and publishers. Our goal is to build an organization of smart, ambitious team members committed to our mission and focused on winning, but always doing it right. Bias to action, bias to learning everyday, self-starter, great collaborator, and focused on learning and growing daily.  At AA, integrity and reliability are as important as talent and effort.  You will be responsible for and take pride in…. Drive adoption, engagement, and usage across the Connect product set for all market segment Showcase the value of our App Annie Connect offering to new and existing customers Forecast sales activity and critical achievements in salesforce.com, while creating satisfied and reference-able customers Ability to decipher key product gaps within the current product offering and regularly provide feedback to the product team. Ability to work effectively Cross-functionally as well as globally Exceptional customer relationship skills, and time management Bias towards high activity, (calls, emails, webinars, content, etc) Strong analytical ability to spot data trends, and uncover key customer insights desired. You should recognize yourself in the following… Experience managing complex sales-cycles Previous Sales Methodology training 3-4 years sales experience w/at least 24 months in closing role Strong, demonstrated written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment Track record of over-achieving quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions Strong customer references What We Offer… We provide a WFH allowance to set you up for remote work success. Internet allowance for stable internet connection, so your video does not freeze on Zoom. Flexible working days. We love to meet, but if you need to get your kids behind school-zoom, need to leave early to get to your band repetition or gym classes, do your thing. Paid leave, so long as you promise to come back! Health and dental benefits. An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations. Wellbeing allowance for any activity that matters to your wellbeing; (online) gym classes, fitness equipment, mindfulness apps or even childcare support! Unlimited access to online learning platform Udemy to help you develop your skills. Virtual initiatives and events to keep you connected with your colleagues. Yes, I want this job!

description: Responsibilities  Main responsibilities Demand Planning Maintain all items in the demand planning framework with the most current information, so that the process is run properly, updated, which includes maintenance of inventory, forecasts. Organize monthly demand plan meetings with internal & external teams to align demand forecast according to sales marketing activities. Provide sales analysis report to management team on monthly basis and identify status of all items. Excellent communication skills, well-organized, detail-minded with ownership Business oriented & result driven True team player and able to manage multiple tasks Fluent in English and Mandarin.

description: Sales Representative  Smith is currently looking for experienced sales professional to join their Asia-Pacific Sales Team. As one of the world’s leading independent electronics distributor, the successful applicants will play a significant role in Smith’s market leading expertise on global electronics sourcing, logistics and distribution.     At Smith, we encourage our sales team to take an entrepreneurial approach to their work, believing that every impact can make a difference. We are looking for talented individuals who are driven, self-motivated and hungry for success. If you are not afraid of a challenge and looking for a rewarding environment, we would like to speak with you.  More senior candidates with more than 4 or 8 years of experience may be considered for a Senior Sales Representative or Sales Manager position.   Key Responsibilities Develop and maintain a portfolio of prospective OEM customers within the region and internationally Become an expert in the customers’ industry and act as the main point of contact for any client related inquiries Identify potential customers and develop sales strategies Provide effective cost-saving solutions (PPV) to customers based on accurate marketplace insight Assist customers to remove excess stock proactively  Requirements Bachelor degree in any disciplines At least 2 years of sales experience in electronics or any relevant industries is highly preferred Passionate, proactive, self-motivated and result-driven Ability to handle work independently, systematically in a fast pace environment Excellent communication skills and passionate in cold calling Good command of both written and oral English and Chinese, Japanese is a plus  About Smith Founded in 1984, Smith is a global distributor of semiconductors and electronic components and a trusted provider of efficiency-enhancing supply chain services to electronics and high-tech manufacturers. Smith’s investment in advanced in-house labs, a highly trained professional team, and strategically located global support centers offers our partners complete sourcing, inventory management solutions, cost-saving program, and more.  A privately held company, Smith employs more than 600 people worldwide, with over $1.39 billion in sales annually. Smith's regional hubs in Houston, Hong Kong, and Amsterdam are ISO-certified. In addition, sales and purchasing offices are located in Austin, Beijing, Silicon Valley, Guadalajara, New York, Beijing, Shanghai, Shenzhen, Seoul, Taipei, Penang, Cluj-Napoca, Munich, and Bangalore.

The Business Development Manager will be supporting the strategic direction of Ogilvy’s New Business Development and Client Growth in this highly visible role. He/she will be supporting all business development activities to support the overall growth strategy for Ogilvy China and work across Ogilvy’s 6 offices in China.  The Business Development Function is responsible for developing and executing a growth and go-to-market plan focusing on new growth categories, services and products as well as driving growth on our existing Client base.  The BD function works with the various Client teams to drive new business pitches and organic growth and is the main function where all business development material (credentials, thought leadership, case studies) is produced and shared.  One of the main tasks of the BD function is to manage the overall pipeline in Sugar CRM and make sure that leads are properly captured, managed and converted.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Research & Strategic planning Strong capability in strategic thinking and knowledge analyst and will need to contribute on cases and new biz proposals through analysis and insights. Background of industry/cases editor or analyst in those blog & digital media is preferred, i.e. business insider Knowledge about the working way of market and agency industry Research and develop a thorough understanding of the company’s people and capabilities. Assists in recommending, establishing, and being accountable to implement strategic and / or tactical new business marketing plans designed to achieve agency goals and objectives. Evaluate market research and adjust new business strategies to meet changing market and competitive conditions. Support and drive thought leadership against key new business opportunities Maintain and update our case bank of credentials and case studies. Highly organized, self-motivated and detail-oriented with great follow-through on projects/tasks  Business Development & Planning Prospect for potential new clients and turn this into increased business; Support new business approaches and presentations; Work with account, strategy, creative team leaders to develop proposals that speak to the client’s needs, concerns, and objectives; Attend industry functions, such as association events, creative awards, and conferences, and provide feedback and information on market and creative trends; Identify opportunities for campaigns, service enhancements, and distribution channels that will lead to an increase in recruiting results; Using knowledge of the market and competitors, identify and develop the company’s unique selling propositions and differentiators.   Experience & Qualifications  4+ years of relevant working experience Fluent English and China speaker Bachelor Degree or above Professional writing and presentation skills Advance knowledge of working software (MS Office, Keynote) Ability to independently and within a team. Proactive, self-starter. Appreciates creativity and design

Globalization Partners simplifies global business by enabling companies to hire great talent anywhere in the world, without the complexity of setting up foreign branch offices or subsidiaries. You find the talent, and we put YOUR candidate on OUR fully compliant, in-country payroll. This enables you to expand into almost any country around the globe – quickly and easily. Our platform enables you to leapfrog over the legal, HR and tax complexities without having to figure out “how” to do business in a foreign country, while getting all the benefits of a global team.  Globalization Partners’ Globalization Partners’ Global Expansion Platform™ enables you to hire in more than 170 countries within days, and without the need to set up costly international subsidiaries. You identify great talent anywhere in the world, and we put them on our fully compliant global payroll—lifting the burden of global corporate tax, legal, and HR matters from your shoulders to ours. This Business Development Manager position is set up to develop incremental business for Perfect Corp. China. This role has two focuses, 1) deepen the business partnership and increase revenue contribution with existing customers; 2) acquire new customers which have solid business needs of Perfect's enterprise solutions in the Beauty industry of the China market. The major responsibilities include but are not limited to the following.  Responsibilities Passionate in Cosmetic, Skincare, and luxury business and has a strong desire to develop him/her self as the industry expert with Perfect's accumulated experiences and resources. To explore the target brand's business objective/challenges efficiently and respond to customer key stakeholders' requirements effectively with excellent communication skills. To determine appropriate follow-up actions to push business progression with keen business acumen and problem-solving skills to support customer's business success. To ensure business on the right track with the ownership mindset and excellent teamwork spirit. To scale the current business with a strategic mind and realistic plans.  Qualifications With at least three years of sales experience in technology solutions business development (software or solutions/services experience preferred) to large enterprises in China (Beauty industry preferred) . Extensive account/territory management experience, and capable of establishing territory analysis and coverage plans, prioritizing and aligning them with the organization's strategic and engagement plans. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with strong interpersonal and communication skills. The candidate must be a high-energy and hands-on individual with strength and conviction. Experiences managing sales teams and Digital Marketing/eCommerce is a plus.  Perfect Corp. is an equal opportunity employer. description: FULLTIME: ROASTER SUCCESS AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT Coffee Exchange is a global coffee marketplace that connects coffee farmers directly to coffee roasters. Using transparency and supply chain tracking technology the Coffee Exchange is changing how Coffee is traded on the planet. Coffee Exchange has operations in over 10 origins and imports coffee into China and the USA.  RESPONSIBILITES ·      Roaster Relationship Management -      Connect with existing roasters to gain a deeper understanding of customer demands -      Contact all new roasters to introduce Coffee Exchange and learn about their operations -      Act as the main contact point for all questions and issues ·      Business Development -      Prospect and develop a database of new leads using various online channels (Taobao, JD, Ect.) -      Call new leads to introduce the Coffee Exchange platform and offer samples -      Document the optimal process from Lead Generation to New Client within a CEx sales manual that can be used to onboard and teach new colleagues ·      Samples Tracking and Execution -      Ensure that samples are offered to all appropriate roasters for each incoming batch -      Follow-up on samples sent to obtain feedback on coffee and book product orders -      Manage and continuously improve sample distribution and follow-up system ·      Business Development Events -      Project manager for Coffee Exchange booth and operations at trade events such as HotelX, Beijing Coffee Show, Etc. -      Plan booth design, cupping activities and sales + marketing materials -      Pitch and execute other in person coffee events to attract new clients and followers  Requirements ·      Languages: Native level Chinese and fluent English ·      Experience within Sales, Account Management and/or Customer Success ·      Ability to self-manage time and projects ·      Knowledge of and interest in the coffee industry ·      Passion for startups and desire to learn! ·      Unlimited free coffee  Benefits ·      8,000 RMB (Net) base salary 20,000 RMB on target earnings ·      Advancement and growth opportunities ·      Fast paced, supportive and fun working environment

Top MNC brand company opportunity Good company culture and benefits  About Our Client  The client is one of the top MNC company, selling high-end home appliances products to its customer. They are now under rapid development stage and want to recruit high potential telents to achieve the business to the next level.  Job Description  Quickly and comprehensively understand project market of assigned region related to business opportunity so that define and develop short-term and long-term plans that are comprehensive and realistic for Key Account Project Channel. 2)Set up the business strategies and sales account plans for Key Account Project Channel and implement a professional project sales system/process, including pricing strategy, project tracking, information collection, bidding and negotiation, contract management, goods delivery, and after sales service etc. 3)Help customer recognize the value of Strategy, product, policy etc to his own business, and choose it as long-term business partner. 4)Leverage internal resources on sample display, SKU selection and quotation analysis, etc. 5)Identify the key competitor in the market and conduct competition analysis. 6)Set up the process for managing our projects business (use the Projects planning tool to provide management info and then use it as a tool to drive performance) and resources (specifically to develop the tools for us to track and improve KA team effectiveness); 7)Demonstrable expertise in driving a sales team to superior performance based on data and analysis.  The Successful Applicant  University degree. 2)8 years or above project sales experience, among which 3 years managerial level experience. 3)Good relationship with Real Estate Group and Excellent Account management and Project Management Experiences. 4)Excellent negotiation skills and influencing. 5)Excellent communications, presentation and interpersonal skills. 6)Independent, Integrity, trust. 7)Systematic and data orientated. 8)Business acumen/result driven and eager to win / Aggressive.  What's On Offer  Promising development platform. 2. Competitive performance-related incentives  Contact: Lusinda Fang  Quote job ref: 4222877
