jobTitle: Vice President, Specialist Sales - Test & Learn
description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Vice President, Specialist Sales - Test & Learn  Who is Mastercard  What role do we play in the modern world? Are we an enabler of purchases or a facilitator for transactions? We play a much larger role in the world by enabling those that have no access to financial systems – every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We have the technology, people and Brand to serve modern society. Today, we are a global tech company that connects everyone to endless possibilities, priceless possibilities.  Overview  The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include payments-focused consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, business Test & Learn experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services. Client verticals include Financial Institutions, Retail & Commerce and Digital Partners, Governments and many others.  Role  Vice President role supporting Test & Learn platform sales in China and/or Japan, leveraged by 300+ clients globally and growing revenue with new clients in key segments (Digital, Tech, Retail, Restaurants, Travel). Responsible for developing and executing the sales strategy for a key set of prospect accounts within China and/or Japan to secure multimillion-dollar, multi-year deals Build and develop a cold pipeline into an active one, ultimately progressing to signed platform deals Ability to message the benefits of bundling Test & Learn with other Data & Services products (SessionM, Managed Services, SpendingPulse, Customer Data Enhancement, etc.) Advocate for funding incentives the Market Development team and with Mastercard Core for CBA penetration Strong communication and influencing skills, should be a compelling presenter to senior client audiences and able to influence large deals Ability to seamlessly partner across our Data & Services Sales CBL population Proficiency in Mandarin and/or Japanese Excellent problem solving and analytics skills and should be able to go head to head with internal stakeholders and customers alike with fact-based thinking Will serve as the face of Mastercard D&S to senior level client stakeholders, including c-suite  All About You Deep understanding of the suite of Mastercard Data & Services value propositions with a thoughtful approach to executing within and across markets Deep understanding of the Mastercard merchant business and account management function Strong commercial drive with ability to build and monetize senior client relationships based on empathy, thought leadership and subject matter expertise Strong software or data driven solution selling background with success with 12-18+ month sales cycles; never give up attitude, excellent at ‘pounding the pavement’ through email/phone cold outreach 15+ years of progressively complex hunting sales within Financial Services, Digital / Retail / Restaurants / Tech / sectors; rolodex of C-Level / EVP / SVP contacts preferred Ability to thrive and build robust pipeline with limited lead generation support Strong networker across relevant stakeholder base with the ability to listen, build common ground and influence in order to effectively advance business opportunities and generate revenues Revenue management and P&L experience Revenue goal-setting abilities Top-level sales skills (internally and externally) combined with strong negotiation capabilities required for large deals  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. description: Company Info  Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!  Job Description Manages a medium domestic territory -- Develops expertise in an aspect of business, financials, products/services, the market and the needs of assigned accounts -- Leads a small sales team on an ad hoc basis to meet specific client needs -- Provides informal guidance to junior staff -- Has a solid understanding of business, financials, products/services, the market and the needs of assigned accounts; may help develop colleagues understanding; may be recognized as an expert in one area -- Complexity is high (territory/account, products/services, sales or account management process); may serve as team lead -- Has high level of authority/opportunity to set and negotiate product/service terms -- Plans own territory or account approach and manages own resources Qualifications  Function  Sales  Sub Function  Medical Representation  Reports To  In process of validation  Already Working @TEVA?  If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site  The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.  Teva’s Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment  Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. description: 海外销售经理/ Sales Director 职责描述： 1.对移动支付产品的推广和销售； 2.独立开拓海外市场和外企客户； 3.有效利用公司资源开拓重大项目； 4.维护客户关系和处理客户需求。  任职要求： 1.大学本科，有至少5-8年金融POS同业海外市场开拓或者外企开拓经验； 2.有大项目和渠道管理经验； 3.有优良的英语或外语水平； 4.乐观积极，对重大事情有推动力； 5.目标导向，团队配合。

Why is this role important at Infobip?  As Sales Development Representative you will have the opportunity to be our first impression on all prospective clients in the APAC market. Our vision of greatness in a Sales Development Representative is a brand ambassador that opens doors to all of our target clients, meaningfully filling the top of the Sales funnel, with a competitive drive to succeed.  You know you are doing a good job when you are:  Reach out leads and follow up as required Managing Outbound leads, setting up meetings with Account Executives (A and B). Work closely with Enterprise Sales team, defining the best strategy to approach new leads and focus on target verticals. Provide ongoing feedback to the sales and marketing department for continuous process optimization. Use and maintain the Salesforce for data quality. Achieve defined KPI goals. Accept feedback and training to keep continuous development with Inside Sales Team Leader and peers. Identify customer segment and vertical and/or need early in discussion in order to route properly to the Sales Enterprise Team in the region. Support Sales Team with outbound prospect accounts into the A/B segment.  Qualifications  More about you:  Experience with lead development from first contact of target customers. Minimum 1 year of experience in sales roles. Good sales-oriented communication skills. Robust negotiation skills. Passionate about creating meaningful connections. Creative problem solver with a proven ability to think strategically. Strong administrative and organizational skills, with a focus on metrics supported results.  Additional Information  Why our employees choose us (and stay)?  Awesome clients – We serve and partner with the majority of the leading mobile operators, OTTs, brands, banks, social networks, aggregators and many more. You can look forward to working with the likes of Viber, Zendesk, O2 and… Seriously, our clients are really cool. Work with the world’s leading companies and impact how they communicate with their users! Opportunity knocks. Often. – Being a part of a growing company in a growing industry – we challenge you not to grow! Whether it’s horizontal, vertical, or angular, we want to support the path that you want to carve. Learn as you grow – Starting from the Orientation Week as an onboarding program, to internal education, education resources, e-learning to external educations, we invest heavily in employee learning and development. Connect globally  – Work with people from different countries, participate in the biggest IT and Telecom events, join us in our Summer Connect conference in Croatia. We put the “global” in globalisation. Pay & Perks – Competitive salary, travel allowances, expatriate compensation packages for your business trips, rewards and holiday bonuses, a team taking care of all the equipment you need, team buildings and other organised activities, company library, organised sports, kitchen stocked with the usual suspects… Talk about a balanced lifestyle!

工作职责: 向合作伙伴和分销商销售或通过其进行销售。可能包括渠道销售支持和渠道开发职责。 扩大自己对销售区域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群体的认识，以执行政策/策略。不断培养更高水平的知识和技能。 理解关键业务驱动力的基础知识；用这种理解来完成自己的工作。了解自己团队的工作如何与其他团队融合并为该领域做出贡献。 可能具有一定的自主权，从而在定义的框架内进行决策。以良好的商业知识和判断力解决在规定程序中遇到的问题。就定义的说明/参数之外的问题咨询更多的高级团队成员。 此级别的职位需要良好的人际交往能力。向直接相关的同事和业务部门传达所提供的设计和协调服务。对于面对客户的角色，建立牢固的客户关系并充当客户与 GE 之间的接口。向他人介绍技术信息 任职条件:  基本资格  该岗位要求在领域具有初步的工作经验。学力水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历）  所需特性  优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够独立工作。较强的解决问题能力。

Job Description Responsible for AOP for all products and projects of one customer line. Monitors budget, capacity, investment, tooling and initiate countermeasures in case of deviations Establishes / builds up an effective local organization to fulfill the customer’s requirements Responsible for the regional customer strategy in alignment with global CBU and Region, and provides input for the regional footprint strategy, as well as provides input for the respective customer strategies and ensures their implementation Identifies business opportunities and supports the business development and growth in alignment with the global CBU Organization Responsibility for profitability, timing, quality and cost of project portfolio with the other team members of the respective CBU Required Skills Supervisory role with specific leadership experience more than 3 years and/or responsibility for medium to large size customers. Minimum 8 years working experience, with more than 5 years of proven success in Automobile Parts company. Above 3 years sales experience in OE accounts and a track record of working with a wide range of business partners Fluent English both in oral and written An understanding of Auto industry and products would be a distinct advantage What we offer Our commitment – to living these values (Integrity Always, Make Tomorrow Better, Will to Win, One Team) that matters the most. We establish a heath, challenged and inspired working environment and competitive compensation and benefits structure to ensure your personal and professional growth. Who we are Tenneco is one of the world's leading designers, manufacturers and marketers of automotive products for original equipment and aftermarket customers, with 2019 revenues of $17.5 billion and approximately 78,000 team members working at more than 300 sites worldwide. Tenneco’s commitment to operating in a socially responsible and sustainable manner is absolute, no matter the challenge. One of our values is Make Tomorrow Better, and one way that we do that is through our commitment to our customers, employees, and communities to build a more sustainable future. This focus includes a formal policy that outlines Tenneco’s commitment to enabling a healthier and more productive world. Our four business groups, Motorparts, Ride Performance, Clean Air and Powertrain, deliver technology solutions for diversified global markets, including light vehicle, commercial truck, off-highway, industrial, motorsport and the aftermarket. With more than 20 years of operation in China , Tenneco Ride Control business operates two wholly-owned plants in Suzhou and Changzhou , one joint venture engineering center with in Beijing . The Changzhou plant is capable of full manufacturing process include welding ,pretreatment ,painting , assembly, and currently employing 700+ employees .Ride Control is dedicated to help drivers experience the perfect ride and its customers innovate the ride experience in an emerging age of shared mobility . What you can expect next We’d like to provide a professional journey to you. You’ll first hear from someone in Talent Acquisition team to schedule a phone screen, and then will arrange interview with our Hiring Manager. We pride ourselves on moving through processes quickly, and you can be sure of transparency and prompt communication throughout.

Leon Cycle is an e-bike business that was established in Germany in 2014 and has since developed business operations in over 10 countries across Europe, North America and APAC. Leon Cycle offers a range of e-bike models from mountain bikes, folding e-bikes, trekking e-bikes and step thru e-bikes. Our range of products are sold via both our own online website as well as E-Commerce platforms and via our dealers and our own retail stores worldwide.  Shanghai is the global commercial headquarter of Leon Cycle, currently we are hiring E-Commerce/Sales & Operations Specialists to join our Shanghai HQ, you will be tasked with:  Take part in the definition of the overall global digital sales strategy Work hand in hand with marketing team to drive organic traffic, develop sales Constantly optimize online stores to maximize conversion rates and performance Overall management of Leon Cycle website, Amazon and other local 3rd party E-Commerce platform stores such as planning, daily operations, advertising and promotions for Italy marketplace Set up SEO to increase online presence of our website Set up digital marketing and sales campaigns through Google, Facebook and other medium Scheduling and communicating intensive site maintenance as needed, Follow the global strategy to position the brand as a top e-bike player in local countries Analyze sales-related data to predict future sales and stock forecasts Coordinating operational issues including customer services, logistics and warehouse and other enquiries between Italian team and Shanghai  Furthermore you should have:  1-3 years of working experience in E-Commerce, sales or consumer goods or marketing Experience working with an international brand Fluency in Spanish, Chinese and English Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Familiar with google and Facebook and other internet tools

description: What makes Gartner Sales a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll set your career on track for outstanding achievement with a company that knows no limits. We’re the world’s leading research and advisory company, steering clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they can’t find anywhere else. Our sales associates earn a competitive base salary, uncapped commissions and exceptional benefits — along with top training and support, and recognition for high performers. If you’re coachable, persistent, smart, executive-savvy, and looking for your next great adventure, Gartner is the place for you.  Interested in learning more, view and register for any of our upcoming recruiting events here !  Business Development Executive  About This Role  The Business Development Executive is a field sales role responsible prospecting into companies that are not presently purchasing Gartner Research. The territory for this role includes specific enterprise level prospects across the banking and insurance sectors.  What You’ll Do Leverage key best practices to drive and successfully sell new business opportunities; build and effectively manage a territory of prospects to drive business development. Strong focus on selling to only net new/prospective clients, transitioning closed clients to existing Account Executive team to manage the relationship moving forward Master and consistently execute Gartner’s internal sales methodology Collaborate with internal resources and external network to prioritize and penetrate key accounts; quickly build relationships with key stakeholders to drive business. What You’ll Need Bachelor’s degree is required; Masters or advanced degree a plus 5+ years of proven consultative sales experience in high technology (services, software or hardware) Ability to prospect and develop C-level and senior-level relationships within large global enterprises Proven experience building excellent client relationships, offering value added, insightful and strategic vision into their business Knowledge of the full life cycle of the sales process from prospecting to close Who You Are Comfortable selling to, influencing and building trust-based, value-added relationships with senior executives Able to solve complex problems and successfully manage ambiguity and unexpected change Teachable and embracing of best practices and feedback as a means of continuous improvement Consistently high achiever marked by perseverance, humility and a positive outlook in the face of challenges The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.  Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at 203-964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com .  Job Requisition ID:58803  By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence. description: BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With large production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, as well as a global and regional research and development hub in Shanghai, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry. BASF posted sales of approximately €8.5 billion in 2020 to customers in Greater China and employed 8,948 people as of the end of the year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en.  Objectives Ensure the successful achievement of company business objectives in the assigned product segment and contribute the sustainable business development in responsible customer group. Conduct key account management to develop the business according to the country strategy and objectives. Collaborate with internal technical stakeholders to accelerate innovation for customer and market requirement. Proactively implement customer service packaging to ensure long-term customer loyalty. Main Tasks Conduct sales strategy and business plan of responsible key accounts Develop deep and trusting customer relationships that ensure access to growth opportunities Grow business in potential applications by developing new customers Analysis competitors and derive actions plan to defend our position of supply share in responsible customers Proactively collaborate with TS/AD/R&D to pursue customer-driven innovations and new application fields and manage joint development projects with full accountability. Implement long term business strategy and support all improvement initiatives. Support team leader to identify product development direction so as to meet the latest market development needs Work with supply chain, CSO and logistic function to establish a reliable and high efficiency services for responsible customers. Manage credit limit, account receivable and volume rebate to ensure business quality. Requirements Education: Bachelor degree or above in Chemistry or other related subjects Working Experience: Min. 5 years’ Sales relevant experience in Chemical industry. Preferable to have good knowledge in polyurethane Key account management skills are preferred Adoptable to efficient business travelling Strong team-work spirit Effective communication skills in English and Mandarin Primary Location  CN-Shanghai-Shanghai  Job  Sales / Technical Sales  Ongoing  For BASF, diversity is one of the essential keys to business success and the well-being of our employees. We promote an inclusive culture that accepts the diversity of people, experiences and capabilities. Join the team and connect with more than 117,000 other minds. Stay alert for possible recruitment fraud!  This can include fake websites, fake job offers, or contact from a person falsely claiming to represent BASF.

Guangzhou, China; Remote;  H.B. Fuller is a leading global adhesives provider focusing on perfecting adhesives, sealants and other specialty chemicals across all industries throughout the world. While our products are virtually invisible, they play a vital role in ensuring the quality of modern life and we are committed to connecting what matters to solve some of the world's biggest adhesion challenges.  Position Overview  As part of a cross-functional team, the successful candidate will be responsible for the business development and Strategic Account activities for Electronics adhesive market. This position will focus on identifying new opportunities and then rapidly growing product sales to meet agreed business targets. The regional focus will be primarily South China, with support to Greater China. This position will be based in Shenzhen or Surroundings, reports to Sales Manager.  The Key Account Manager will have a broad experience and excellent relationships within the electronics industry and key accounts, along with a strong technical knowledge of the applications and materials employed. S/He must be able to articulate a clear strategy and implementation plan, and then execute to deliver sales growth in line with the agreed business plan.  Primary Duties New business development in global key account in South China: OEM (Apple, Microsoft and etc.), EMS (Pagetron Global, Foxconn Global, Quanta, inventec and etc.,) Drive sustainable sales and profit growth in line with agreed business objectives Actively manage and coordinate all aspects of the sales process and act as focal point for information flow between the company and target accounts Identify and validate new sales targets and develop pipeline of opportunities in line with agreed business objectives, develop and execute high profit promotion strategy Act as project manager throughout all phases of sales project, driving key actions, setting priorities and managing risks Partner with relevant global resources (R&D, Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, and Applications Engineering) to deliver solutions that fully meet customer’s needs and timeline. Timely accurate monthly reports, CRM database updates, project update etc., Minimum Requirements BS degree, preferably Technical/Science 5+ years key account management experience in the electronics industry or related technical field Demonstrated ability to prepare and deliver compelling technical sales presentations Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills 80+% travels expected, including domestic & international trip PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT Significant business travel across the countries responsible for. The working conditions for this position would be anticipated to be those typical to an office. There may be minimal need to visit laboratories or manufacturing sites. There is minimal physical effort required for this position other than typing. The types of hazards would be typical to those seen in an office environment. Required Skills  At H.B. Fuller, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to providing all applicants and employees with equal employment opportunity. We subscribe to the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) policy of employing and promoting individuals based on their merits, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship status, or any other protected classification.

description: We are looking for someone who would like to work for a higher purpose, hold a high level of integrity. Passionate toward life and work, and embrace teamwork.  Responsibilities (but not limited to) Qualify the new application by actively and continuously in contact with large national and multinational participants for the Top Employers certification program across the APAC region and China; Manage current participants to assist in the contractual matters; Support the HR Auditing team, for example by presenting results and benchmarking data to the HR and management teams of our participants; Become a partner in the field of HR to meet the challenges of participants through our services through our valuation approach; Provide consistent, excellent service levels to new and existing participants, building lasting relationships and maintaining a good knowledge of their business, as well as ensuring participant retention and upsells beyond the certification process; Assist the organisation by several high-end workshops, information sessions and our annual certification dinner; Acts local, but thinks global, to support the Top Employers Institute strategy to grow international contracts inside and outside local markets; Continuously feed the CRM business management in line with the highest standards of the company.  Requirements Bachelor degree (or equivalent); Minimum of 5 years working experience in services sales, HR area will be a nice to have and preferably within an international context; Multi-cultural working experience; Excellent in English (Speaking and Writing) and Chinese (Chinese Speaking is a must); Analytical, organised, resourceful, pro-active and result-oriented; You have excellent communication and presentation skills and a good sense of humor; Willingness to travel.  What do we offer Competitive remuneration (monthly salary + annual bonus); Solid benefits including pension and flexible working conditions; A dynamic, open, informal and professional business culture; Plenty of room for initiatives and own responsibility; Work in a growing organisation with colleagues from all over the world; Opportunity to interact with leading organisations regarding cutting edge HR practices; Opportunity to contribute to the development of HR standards of participating organisations and thereby impacting the experiences of their employees worldwide. Please send your cover letter and CV to the attention of Nicole Jin, email: nicole.jin@top-employers.com.

Sales Operation (PartⅠ)  Order and bidding management Sales orders and samples management control to maintain order records accuracy, shipment plan: K3 China system input/make order, order sealing and archiving, payment for goods or credit receivables follow-up, order record data maintenance Order review: including but not limited to item/price (special price /TOX bidding price)/quantity/unit/invoice and shipment information Integrating statistical sales data, updating and maintaining content of sales data base, analyzing and making sales reports accordingly Bidding management to maintain bidding data on related websites, prompt communication with sales, distributor and bidding agencies and also manages the courier of the documents to related party Sales Support Business information set up/update, including sales materials, products, team person and distributor Provide administrative support to the department according to business needs Cooperate with other departments (Marketing, Technical, Quality, Finance, Registration, other BU, etc.) to effectively support TOX business operations Assist to provide better service to customers such as shipping ,sending invoices to distributors etc Assisted TOX department to manage the sales team/distributors/end customers Collect team report, track and summarize sales progress Maintaining distributor contact list, distributor agreement and authorization records , update distributors’ PPP process. Assist Evaluation of distributor and weekly performance analysis report. Works closely with manager to inspect sales process quality and prioritize opportunities for improvement. Assists sales management in understanding process bottlenecks and inconsistencies. Facilitates an organization of continuous process improvement. Market Assistant (Part Ⅱ ) Assist in contacting translation agency , editing, assembling, printing and filing of qualifications, proposals and presentations ,which are from Global marketing department. Prepaire and reprint marketing materials, such as brochures, newsletters, etc. Assist with market research activities : signing contract with exhibition company ,arranging exhibitions and other related matters. Assist with maintaining the website, social media, blog platforms and salesforce database systems. Provide strong client support and coordination for customers Help leader working within budget and allocating marketing investment to maximize returns in terms of growth or market development Ensure all activities and behavior are in accordance with legislative employment policies, safety requirements and corporate policies Responsibilities may extend to other requirements of APAC/Country leader to support business growth. Gather and review marketing data from various channels ,Perform analysis from questionnaires to understand customer needs . Contribute ideas for improving marketing standards and processes

Due to an increase in business and strong plans for growth; we are seeking a driven and enthusiastic Business Development Manager to join our team in Hong Kong on a permanent basis.  Your key aim will include analysing market information, driving sales, market share and profitability goals. Develop, implement and manage strategies and plans for achieving these goals. Appropriately identify, develops and deploys Steelcase sales resources to optimize business results with all key audiences. Work collaboratively with Shenzhen Sales Leader and category resources to develop business. In the start phase, focus on driving sales through identified opportunities in Shenzhen. Also target, qualify and profile potential new sales  and/or client opportunities aligned to Steelcase’s strategy.   Objectives  1.    Profile, target, and qualify potential new sales opportunities with new clients.  2.    Identify and create sales opportunities  3.    Accurate forecasting, pipeline management and reporting  4.    Has ability to representing Steelcase Shenzhen at industry events and present the Steelcase  Develop and maintain strong relationships with key A&D, and Project Management firms.   6.    Use “SalesForce” to track all opportunities  7.    Regular communication and engagement with Shenzhen Sales teams – Sales Suppport, Project Management, Finance, Operations, Product Marketing  8.    Communicate success and failures across the whole team, and provide lessons learned in a proactive manner  To register your interest please follow the steps.

Gartner, Inc. (NYSE: IT), is the world’s leading research and advisory company and a member of the S&P 500. We equip business leaders with indispensable insights, advice and tools to achieve their mission-critical priorities today and build the successful organizations of tomorrow.  Our unmatched combination of expert-led, practitioner-sourced and data-driven research steers clients toward the right decisions on the issues that matter most. We’re trusted as an objective resource and critical partner by more than 15,000 organizations in more than 100 countries — across all major functions, in every industry and enterprise size.  To learn more about how we help decision makers fuel the future of business, visit gartner.com.  About this role: The Account Executive is a field sales role responsible for direct client contract value, retention and growth through contract expansion, and the introduction of new products and services. The territory for this role includes enterprise industry.  What you’ll do: • Consult with C-level executive clients to develop and implement an effective, enterprise wide strategy that maximizes the value Gartner delivers • Manage accounts with the outcome of increased customer satisfaction, retention and account growth • Master and consistently execute Gartner’s internal sales methodology • Demonstrate senior sales leadership through coaching, mentoring and developing junior sales account executives  Requirements： What you’ll need: • Bachelor’s degree is required; Masters or advanced degree a plus • 5+ years of proven consultative sales experience in B2B industry. • Ability to prospect and manage C-level and senior-level relationships within large global enterprises • Proven experience building excellent client relationships, offering value added, insightful and strategic vision into their business • Knowledge of the full life cycle of the sales process from prospecting to close Who you are: • Comfortable selling to, influencing and building trust-based, value-added relationships with senior executives • Able to solve complex problems and successfully manage ambiguity and unexpected change • Teachable and embracing of best practices and feedback as a means of continuous improvement • Consistently high achiever marked by perseverance, humility and a positive outlook in the face of challenges

Discover a world of opportunities. #HumanChemistry  See what chemistry can do for your career: careers.evonik.com  Exploring opportunities. Growing together.  VACANCY REFERENCE NUMBER 150799  Business Development Manager  Location: China : Shanghai Xinzhuang  Function: Marketing & Sales  Career Level: Experienced professionals (2-5 years)  Legal Entity: Evonik Degussa (China) Co., Ltd. Shanghai Branch  Business Line: Asia Pacific  What We Offer  You will work on exciting and challenging topics together with a team in an ultra-modern, innovative and creative environment. Intensive on-the-job training with expert colleagues guarantees you will quickly become familiar with your duties and perform them independently. Performance related pay and the opportunity for personal and professional development are of course part of the package. Since 2009 Evonik Industries AG has been certified as a family-friendly company by the German Hertie Foundation.  Click here to learn more about Evonik from our employees  PURPOSE OF POSITION  Support profitable growth and strategic development of Evonik in Asia Pacific (focus: [China]) Identify, explore & develop new growth opportunities in alignment with Businesses and Functions Monitor macroeconomic and market trends and derive opportunities and risks Support Businesses and Functions in market analyses and strategic projects (incl. M&A) Help providing key information and ideas to top management in Region  Responsibilities  Lead, individually drive, or support projects of BLs, Divisions, Region, or Group Identify new business opportunities via desktop research & customer approach (aligned with BL) Act as sales representative or coordinator for Businesses with still subcritical local presence Help launch products into new markets or specific local applications Initiate, facilitate and support cross-BL/Division, resp. cross-functional activities Support regional management (incl. BLs/Functions) to develop & implement regional growth agendas Monitor macroeconomic and market trends, competitive landscape and socio-political environment Search and identify potential M&A targets based on profound insights of local market dynamics Support advocacy approach, help build-up and maintain Evonik network with strategic stakeholders Liaise and coordinate with key stakeholders in Cluster and Region, inside and outside of Evonik Ensure alignment with Businesses and Functions to prioritize resources and maximize impact Actively share knowledge and best practices locally, regionally, and globally  Requirements  Master or PhD degree from top universities 5+ years work experience in sales/marketing/BD in chemical industry Entrepreneurship-driven, self-motivated, ambitious Willing to act beyond existing practices/boundaries and go for extra miles Willing and capable to create and implement new things and drive for the optimal results Open mindset and cultural flexibility Strong communication skills, understanding organization Collaborative, team player  Your Application  To ensure the fastest process of your application and to protect the environment, please apply online via our careers portal at https://careers.evonik.com.  VACANCY REFERENCE NUMBER 150799  Please note that Evonik will not accept any unsolicited application documents sent by staffing firms. Evonik works in conjunction with preferred service providers and will not pay any fee to staffing firms in the absence of an appropriate framework agreement. Should Evonik receive a candidate profile from a staffing firm with which it has no framework agreement, and should this candidate subsequently be considered in the recruitment process or offered employment, no claims from the staffing firm will be entertained in this regard.

description: About BHP  At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success.  About The Role  In this role you will liaise with customers and, where relevant, suppliers to support relationships and interactions following direction from the Head of Sales Liaison and Manager Port Sales, in line with agreed marketing objectives and strategies.  Core Accountabilities Demonstrates an overriding commitment to health, safety, environmental responsibility and sustainable development. Demonstrates commitment to the BHP Charter and Code of Business Conduct. Provides necessary preparatory and liaises to facilitate contract negotiations with customers and suppliers. Builds and maintains (long term) favourable relationships with suppliers, customers and other key relationships. Collects relevant market information from external interactions and exchange with relevant key internal relationship. Ensures adherence of marketing activities to external and internal policies and legislation. Represents the BHP Trading and Marketing Unit externally with customers, suppliers and partners, as needed, to create a positive external image of the Company. Assists the Head of Sales Liaison/ Manager Port Sales with projects as required. About You  Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a commercial, economic, technical and/or relevant business discipline Experience & Technical Competencies Strong communication, problem solving and risk management skills 5+ years working experience in sales/marketing roles in commodity markets Experience in the Iron Ore market particularly port sales market would be advantageous Experience with SAP application Languages Fluent Mandarin and English, both verbal and written required Supporting a Diverse Workforce  The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance based bonuses and unique BHP employee share program.  At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourage applications from all qualified applicants regardless of race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, people with disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.  We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.  BHP is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disability.

Job Description  Define and commit to the current business plan and P&L. Deliver offline sales and profit target by working with all stakeholders. Actively seek for new channel and new client opportunities. Manage and make sure that the distributor's achievement on the sales target and compliance on the sales strategy. Coordinate and arrange training for each client to ensure the store staff can well introduce product.  The Successful Applicant  More than 8 years in FMCG industry, skilled at Key Account Management. Good Knowledge of Personal Care, Baby market, Skin Cares segments. Excellent communication and good team management skills. Strong negotiation skill.  What's On Offer  Competitive annual package and team management.  Contact: Anna Yuan  Quote job ref: 4192159

You will foster client satisfaction. You will develop customer relationships through coordinating and/or attending trade shows, seminars, etc. You will provide education of Honeywell product through technical presentations, seminars and workshops. You will manage, maintain, and provide reports and opportunity status using our customer relationship management system. You will analyze competitive intelligence and market trends. You will work with Sales Inventory Operations Planning (SIOP) to strategically align sellers and customer accounts.  Key Responsibilities Attend (trade shows, seminars, events) Visit Customers Large Customer Management Campaign Management Review Customer Reports Product Training Customer Account Management YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree / equivalent, with significant experience in the field, or Master's degree / equivalent, with some experience. WE VALUE A comprehensive knowledge of (sales) Excellent team and communication skills Being completely self-motivated An ability to influence across a broader organization An ability to exercise independent judgment An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships Extensive experience in selling (industrial) products Deep technical expertise Understanding of the Honeywell value proposition as well as the competitive landscape Additional Information JOB ID: req258416 Category: Sales Location: Building 1, Lane 555, Huan Ke Road, Zhangjiang,Shanghai,SHANGHAI,201203,China Exempt Global (ALL)

description: 主要职责  1.管理客户关系并提供相关服务，根据既定的市场开发原则在指定区域开拓新的客户，并保持从现有客户获得持续的销售业绩。  2. 提供销售，活动及成本预算方面的信息，以利于销售经理做出有效的判断。  3. 在既定的客户中，根据系统的调研和沟通，最大可能的发现影响客户现在及未来的商业机会及购买决定。  4. 制定客户开发计划，并达到销售目标。  5. 随时给医疗专家提供产品技术支持。  6. 在负责的相关销售区域，了解当地的医疗市场及影响客户选择的竞争对手策略。  7. 学习以保持对公司产品、临床应用、管理法规要求的质量标准和业务政策的及时理解。  任职要求  1. 2年及以上稳定的医药产品销售经验(药品，耗材，设备均可）  2. 本科及以上学历（医学/药学/生物学等专业背景优先）；  3. 良好的沟通能力；  4. 良好的人际交往能力；  5. 良好的团队意识；  6. 良好的英文基础（CET-6，书写及口语）；  7. 可适应长短期出差；

PURPOSE Customers Development and Customer Key Contact (Territory Independent Outlets, Local Key Accounts, Distributors). Assist to develop and executes Sales strategies in meeting business goals and driving strategic, sustainable growth.  WORKING RELATIONSHIPS Internal: Trade Marketing, Marketing, Professional Affairs, Finance and Supply Chain and IT. This position will also be interacting closely with regional/ local SFE + sales analyst External: Customers, Eye Care Professionals (owners/ managers/ optometrists) and event management companies, merchandising suppliers  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES - Manages Sales performance and product portfolio of assigned accounts - Delivers against Key Call objectives (mainly in outdoor works) - Submits territory and cycle plan reports that include qualitative and quantitative information on relevant customer and market issues - Build strong relationships with accounts to develop the ongoing business - Installs and provides follow-up of marketing and trade marketing support programs in selected accounts - Might be involved in cross-functional projects - Follow credo and HCC principles in day to day execution  REQUIREMENTS - Bachelor’s degree or above - At least 3 years' sales experience is preferable( less experience will be considered) - Willing to work at outdoor, be proactive, good team player, responsible & innovative with strong commitment to drive good business result - Excellent communication and presentation skill in both English and Chinese

description: Job Description  This is a commissioned sales position to influencing and advocating Intel based products and solutions for all of Intel's Business units through a vertical oriented, solutions led approach to Business and IT. Responsible for working with a leading internet customer where deep engagements is required with thorough long term account strategy to achieve revenue and deal win target. Impact should result in both executive level and working level as trusted advisor which should drive our relevance, KPI, demands, preference and pull for our strategic focus areas to maximize Intel portfolio selling. At the same time, candidates need to have good product, technical knowledge and marketing insight, and drive customers to transit to products and explore new cooperation opportunities as soon as possible. Candidates need to have strong English writing, summary and presentation in PPT, and If candidates have market analysis ability, it is better. Candidates need to be able to work under pressure and take initiative in team work  Qualifications BS or MS degree with minimum 5 years of IT selling experience, at least 2 years of working experience in internet industry Able to build and maintain strong, long-lasting executive level customer relationships Thrives in an ambiguous environment and able to lead changes and develop creative solutions Ability to work under pressure, with multiple projects would be a great advantage Knowledge of Intel architecture, platform and general datacenter platform will be a plus Strong communication skill with internal stakeholders and external clients/partners Inside this Business Group  Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customers voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. Our teams work across the entire sales cycle, pushing ingredient products to our "billings" customers while also pulling end solutions through to "consumption". We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Be the front line seller who drives sales, identifying and generating opportunities for different kinds of customers. You will foster client satisfaction by maintaining regular customer contact and managing customer expectations. You will develop customer relationships through coordinating and/or attending trade shows, seminar, and similar events. You will provide education of Honeywell product through technical presentations. You will maintain, and provide reports and opportunity status using our customer relationship management system. You will provide competitive intelligence and market trends. You will provide forecast/demand input to Sales Inventory Operations Planning (SIOP).  Key Responsibilities Attend (trade shows, seminars, events) Visit Customers Search for New Customers Campaign Management Customer Reporting Learn the Products Customer Account Management YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree, or equivalent. Some experience in the field. WE VALUE A proficient understanding of key sales principles and best practices Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships Significant experience in selling (industrial) products Deep technical expertise Understanding of the Honeywell value proposition as well as the competitive landscape Additional Information JOB ID: HRD134558 Category: Sales Location: Building 1, Lane 555, Huan Ke Road, Zhangjiang,Shanghai,SHANGHAI,201203,China Exempt

description: Key Responsibilities主要职责： 管理客户关系并提供相关服务，根据既定的市场开发原则在指定区域开拓新的客户，并保持从现有客户获得持续的销售业绩。 提供销售，活动及成本预算方面的信息，以利于销售经理做出有效的判断。 在既定的客户中，根据系统的调研和沟通，最大可能的发现影响客户现在及未来的商业机会及购买决定。 制定客户开发计划，并达到销售目标。 随时给医疗专家提供产品技术支持。 在负责的相关销售区域，了解当地的医疗市场及影响客户选择的竞争对手策略。 学习以保持对公司产品、临床应用、管理法规要求的质量标准和业务政策的及时理解。 Professional Knowledge, Skills & Qualifications任职要求： 2年及以上稳定的医药产品销售经验 (药品，耗材，设备均可） 本科及以上学历 (医学/药学/生物学等专业背景优先） 良好的沟通能力 良好的人际交往能力 良好的团队意识 良好的英文基础（CET-6，书写及口语） 可适应长短期出差

Company Description Executive recruitment company Monroe Consulting Group China is hiring on behalf of a company which is the leading China-oriented global brand consultancy with regional operations in APAC (Shanghai, Singapore), Europe (Paris), and North America (New York, Vancouver). They drive forward the positive power of branding. Leading brands on impactful journeys, they create meaningful brand experiences by bringing together excellence in research, strategy, design and verbal identity.  Job Description  Project Excellence: Understand all of company’s intelligence systems, how to show them and how they are used by our customers – by roles within customer organizations and by end applications. Manage contract upsell negotiations to ensure maximum client value Explore all opportunities for increasing client value, pitching new content wherever possible Client Engagement: Responsible to increase business with EXISTING KEY and Growth Clients present in China To identify new prospects within existing clients & to create upsell opportunities Develop strong client relationships by deep understanding on client’s org chart, responsibilities and priorities of each divisions. Offer demo/insight sharing to all users of clients to ensure they understand the full range of content and functionality available in their subscription. Taking the opportunity to uncover client’s hidden needs and explore. Team development: To help develop new consulting opportunities in conjunction with CGBD colleague – relying on previous collaboration which can be marketed to prospective clients Provide support to clients liaising with internal colleagues as necessary   Requirements  General: Sales – orientated Excellent communication, presentation, negotiation and selling skills Strong understanding on MNCs requirements in terms of market intelligence needs. Experience in dealing with MNCs across multiple industries A high level of Word, Excel and PPT A tenacious pro-active, target-driven approach to sales Strong individual that can work in team Commercial awareness and a good knowledge of business in China Confidence in dealing with senior decision-makers Strong presentation, sales, negotiation and influencing skills.  Languages: ·       Fluency in oral and written English, and Mandarin  Research specific: At least 2-3 years’ experience of selling in market research and consulting solutions Quality acumen with an attention to details Good business research knowledge
