Be the front line seller who drives sales, identifying and generating opportunities for different kinds of customers. You will foster client satisfaction by maintaining regular customer contact and managing customer expectations. You will develop customer relationships through coordinating and/or attending trade shows, seminar, and similar events. You will provide education of Honeywell product through technical presentations. You will maintain, and provide reports and opportunity status using our customer relationship management system. You will provide competitive intelligence and market trends. You will provide forecast/demand input to Sales Inventory Operations Planning (SIOP).  Key Responsibilities Attend (trade shows, seminars, events) Visit Customers Search for New Customers Campaign Management Customer Reporting Learn the Products Customer Account Management YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree, or equivalent. Some experience in the field. WE VALUE A proficient understanding of key sales principles and best practices Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships Significant experience in selling (industrial) products Deep technical expertise Understanding of the Honeywell value proposition as well as the competitive landscape Additional Information JOB ID: HRD138093 Category: Sales Location: #1 Building, No.14 Jiu Xian Qiao Road,ChaoYang District,Beijing,BEIJING,100016,China Exempt
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Analyst, Market Development  Overview The role of Analyst - Sales within the China Acceptance & Merchant Development team will support and contribute to the overall Acceptance & Merchant priorities in China. These include: (1) Supporting relationships with key acquirers and developing tangible value and assets – elevating and deepening the overall Mastercard engagement with acquirers and acceptance stakeholders as a key customer segments (2) Expanding acceptance and development key merchants to realize the vision of a “World Beyond Cash” – growing acceptance into new and untapped categories. (3) Supporting the diversification and transformation of the CHINA acquiring landscape – addressing and building acceptance opportunities and solutions with new enablers and partners (e.g. CGIs, PSPs, Hardware providers, etc.). By developing and supporting the above priorities, the individual will need to create tangible value for the key acceptance stakeholders and key merchants, address key challenges and opportunities, as well as driving incremental business, product innovation, best practices, strategic thinking and leadership. The role holder will oversee the key acceptance & merchant initiatives as part of focused segment/channel/vertical approach. The individual will need to look at the acceptance system holistically, deal with issues and questions on the acquiring landscape, and business models and proactively identify business opportunities and solutions. The individual will work in China with Acceptance Development teams in division and globally, country managers, account managers and product teams.  Role Facilitate and accelerate introduction of new acceptance players, business models and technologies into the CHINA acquiring landscape Support the management of key acquiring relationships both from a business development (e.g. acceptance growth, close domestic gap, co-brand card and value add products) and operational perspective (e.g. rules, franchise, product delivery) Identify product synergies/sales opportunities that support relationship development and Mastercard revenue growth (i.e. value add capabilities such as marketing, product, processing, Advisors, co-branded card, digital solution, etc.) Proactively identify and address acceptance barriers and pain points – develop models and frameworks in order to create new solutions (e.g. Pricing, Franchise, non-compliance, Legal, Treasury) that can help to overcome acceptance friction Lead ad-hoc research projects, special projects, customer resolutions  All About You Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced degree or equivalent work experience applying sales leadership preferred Experience and knowledge in the payments business with exposure to acceptance, acquirer & merchant issues is preferred Sales strategy development, execution, and account management Proven track record of sales success and ability to meet sales targets Strong leadership, presentation, and sales skills Solid interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in team environment and ability to effectively coordinate with peers, and ability to work in a matrix organization  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.
industries: Financial Services, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Company Description  The Supply Chain Operations organisation with its about 800 co-workers connects our customers with IKEA products in a simple, affordable and sustainable way. We deliver excellent transport and logistic solutions today, tomorrow and over time by optimising replenishment solutions, defining physical goods flow capacity needs, managing the goods flow, sourcing & developing transport & logistics capacities and leading & securing Supply Quality.  We contribute to customer satisfaction through securing customer perceived availability, delivering lowest cost over time, leading towards sustainability and ensuring the right quality for all services.  Job Description  As a Business Developer Category Ocean & Air you are a part of the global team and report to the Business Development Manager. You are responsible for establishing strong business relationships with current and new service providers. You ensure that the development work and the daily performance secures a partnership that benefits IKEA in the long term. This includes setting clear goals and development plans, supporting both carrier and category development. You work together with other functions in and outside of the Ocean Category, such as the category analysts, trade lane teams, business, operations, and sustainability developers. You should continuously look for opportunities to improve the IKEA transport network set-up, matching the service provider’s offer with IKEA’s needs today and tomorrow in regard to capacity and sales growth, sustainability development and operational efficiency. Additionally, you contribute to the development of global sourcing procedures and methods. During tender projects you are responsible for all stages from invitation to contract implementation.  Qualifications  As a person you are business and commercially minded in addition being cost conscious as well as experienced in negotiating with business partners. You have a strong drive, desire and motivation to improve and look for better solutions. You are self-motivated and have the ability to organise, structure, and prioritise numerous tasks. We believe that you have experience in project management and change processes. We place emphasis on your personal skills; to be successful in the role it is very important that your communication and social skills are excellent, and that you are solution-oriented. Most importantly, you also have the ability to create and develop business relations. You are inspired by the IKEA culture and values. The role will require up to 20% travel throughout the year, so you must be willing to travel.  Experience Sought 5 years + shipping industry experience, preferably from a global assignment Excellent communication skills and demonstrated understanding of translating business requirements into procurement specifications in a customer centric way. With ability to maintain strong information flows back to internal stakeholders. Management experience of contract documentation, templates and processing tools experience with proven capability in negotiation, conflict resolution and stakeholder management. Experience in leading cost reduction and value improvement programs. Fact driven, strong analytical skills with ability to understand cost models, sourcing results and financial and operational impact. Ability to ensure that Direct Procurement Operations targets and metrics on supply and quality are delivered. Monitor these metrics where required, with a mind set for constant improvement. Ocean expert with broad global overview from benchmarking and analyzing best practice with proven ability to lead strategic and tactical sourcing projects and to share relevant knowledge. Awareness and understanding where Company risks and opportunities exist. Curious mind set for constant improvement. Eager to drive our ambitious sustainability and Category agenda ideally with proven project management experience.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Education Management, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: Job Description  My client is leading multinational industrial group with strong busienss growth in Asia including China. 我的客户是一家领先的跨国工业品集团， 亚洲以及中国业务处于高速发展中。  Job Responsibilities  岗位职责：  The role will be acting as a strategic busienss develper facing Japniese clients (Automotive, Aero, Energy, General industrial) in China, to establish and maintain high-level relationships with client's management adn key decision makders; The role will, on a regular basis, interact with internal stake holders in both sales and technical, as well as peers from other countries (Japan) .  该职位作为日系客户（汽车， 航空，能源，通用工业等）的战略业务拓展， 需要与客户高层以及关键决策者建立以及维护良好的商务关系。同时，内部需要与销售和技术团队， 以及跨国团队（日本）紧密配合。  Key Requirements：  关键任职条件： A degree in engineering or technological field. 工程或技术类专业毕业。 Solid and proven expereince within Japanese business loop in China, highy familiar wiht the culture. 扎实的日系客户对接经验，熟知日本商业文化。 Expereince in mechanical, machining industires. 机械、机加工行业从业经历。 Strong commercial sense, market acumen and sales skills. 很强的市场敏嗅觉，销售技巧。 Fluent Japanese, and workable English. 日语流利， 英语至少可工作使用（书面和简单的口语交流，流利最好） If you want to get more job opportunities, please reach out (如果你想了解更多的职位机会，请点击): https://www.rgf-professional.com.cn/zh/jobs
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: 工作职责: 在预算的费用内完成销售指标及目标（若法规发生变动，您同意公司有权以书面通知的形式对本项工作职责进行变更） 提供客户服务 保持市场及公司之间的双向沟通, 树立高度的公司形象及专业水准的产品品牌形象 支持如投标，价格及医保等业务相关工作 根据公司的总体方针实施销售计划及策略 建立及保持商业网络及客户关系（经销商，医院药剂科、医生、护士、技师） 协助直属经理搜集所需销售信息 组织并参加当地学术交流会议（内部/外部） 任职条件: 本科以上学历，主修医学，药学或相关专业 四年或以上的医药销售经验 基本的英语沟通能力 具有商业灵敏度，客户第一，以结果为导向 优秀的沟通、交流和协调能力 我理解岗位职责描述并接受其作为我雇佣文件的一部分。
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Financial Services

description: Ecolab is seeking a Corporate Account Manager to join its industry leading Food Retail Services team. In this position, you will provide specialized solutions and expertise to grocery stores and supermarkets, big-box stores and convenience stores to help improve food safety compliance and deliver profitable growth. You will achieve the sales and profit targets for the assigned accounts and new accounts.  What’s In It For You The opportunity to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges, helping customers achieve clean water, safe food, abundant energy and healthy environments The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives and ideas to achieve our best What You Will Do Retain existing key accounts, and look for business opportunities from potential accounts, strengthening Ecolab’s penetration to achieve annual sales and profit budget. Creatively sell Ecolab’s products and services to the accounts. Identify additional needs which can be met by Ecolab. Understand the key accounts’ needs and transmit these needs to the appropriate Ecolab personnel. Resolve problems between the corporate accounts and Ecolab. Stay informed of key accounts’ personnel and policy changes and its influence on the products and services we provide and take corresponding actions. Effectively coordinate product application, blueprint trial, on-site survey, new branch launch, contract sign and implementation, equipment installation, urge payment for goods, etc. Provide the highest standard of service to key accounts. Conduct quarterly and monthly service reviews to ensure requirements are effectively met. Actively assist other business teams within Ecolab to help introduce additional product and service to current accounts. Establish, implement and develop sales strategy for key accounts. Negotiate profitable cooperation agreement with corporate accounts, ensuring new agreements have no damage to the former price. Provide trainings on how to give the key accounts more effective service to sales staff. Understand all available Ecolab resources which can support key accounts. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor Degree 5 years sales and/or account management experience in B to B industry Fluency in English Preferred Qualifications Bachelor Degree with major in food science, marketing, business administration MBA Fluent written English, and excellent oral English communication, expression and negotiation skills. Determined to pursue for a successful and rewarding sales career. Good team player, good at project management and interpersonal communication. Demonstrated ability to develop and implement corporate account sales programs. Ability in making price and understanding the importance of price items in contract, basic ability in risk management and cost control. About Ecolab Food Retail Services  Join a team of experts that provides 23.2 million food safety and compliance observations annually through audits and training. Ecolab’s Food Retail Services division specializes in solutions and expertise that help improve food safety compliance and deliver profitable growth to grocery stores, convenience stores and supermarkets. We serve as an extension of our customers’ food safety teams throughout the world, protecting their brand reputation.  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.  In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

Job Responsibility: Build seasonal SKU-level assortment financial and illustrative Acc. plans for a retail concept that ties to the business plans and targets. Lead period analysis, including but not limited to style-level sell through to influence current and future seasons. Pre-season Build/refine a style-level plan to color based on retail strategies and opportunities; ensure plan reconciles with topline financial plan developed by the Business Planner Develop style plans aligned with power item / story placement Align plan with input and collaboration from key stakeholders including Merchandising, Business Team Partner with DP/IM to provide insights and guidance on supply chain forecast and drop process Drive Key Assortment Planning ensuring depth and breadth in the most critical styles Develop Style to color buy plans for Key Retail Moments and align with key stakeholders Merchandising, Business Team  In-season Weekly recap and analysis of best and slow sellers vs. plan and LY Recommend key actions to the Platform/Site Merchandising/Allocation team to optimize slow moving Styles and maximize opportunity on top sellers Weekly performance review of key items ST% Plan in-season markdown for slow moving lines and retail moments  Post-season Recap the performance of the assortment including sell-through, color performance, and SKU productivity Analyze and report key item contribution Provide insights and recommendations to key stakeholders Merchandising for future season planning Recap performance of KEY RETAIL MOMENTS to provide insights for future planning Plan off-season markdown   Job Qualification: Buying, Planning, Assortment Planning experience with other apparel / footwear in Digital preferred Comprehensive understanding of retail math Ability to create reports, style-level sales plans, track promotional calendar/events and pre-meeting prep Strong and demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and influence others Experience in developing an understanding of customers, competitors and retail trends; knowledge of sports apparel and footwear market preferred Ability to interpret financial sales data to make decisions and recommendations that impact the business Advanced knowledge of MS office applications; proficiency in Excel including creating spreadsheets, complex formulas, pivot tables, etc. Experience with planning software/tools and merchandise management systems is preferred Ability to work in a matrix environment with multiple business functions Strong team player and ability to work with the cross functional partners and senior management on all aspects of the business
jobFunction: Supply Chain, Project Management, and Strategy/Planning

description: Job Description As Senior Account Sales you will be responsible for sales targets. You will contribute to develop new customer and maintain current customer. You will support QC to deal with quality complaint, support CS to deal with order issue, to chase overdue You will discuss internal packaging solutions with engineering designers You will prepare quarterly meeting report Temporary tasks assigned by manager etc.. This position will be based in Dongguan, GuangDong Province, and you will report to South China Sales Manager.  Your profile Fluent English (written/verbally) At least 3 years above sales experience Minimum Bachelor’s degree in relevant area, preferably in Business Administration, Supply Chain, Engineering, Logistic or similar area Capacity & willingness to develop skills needed for leadership positions A team player with strong collaborative and networking skills Great listener and identifying customers’ and coworkers’ (spoken and unspoken) needs Enthusiastic, highly motivated and setting the bar high Strong presentation skills Strategic and growth mindset, creative problem-solving and analytical ability Self-directed being able to formulate activities and direction, and work independently to deliver results Broad view of the business & great adaptability and flexibility Excellent MS office skills Willingness to travel

Position Title: Business Development Manager  Manager: Senior Director, Corporate & Society Partnership Development  Working Location: Beijing, China  Permanent Headcount  At Wiley, we welcome you for who you are, the background you bring, and embrace people who get excited about learning whether online or by book. Learning is for everyone, and so is our workplace. Bring your experiences, your perspectives, and your passion. It’s in our differences that we empower the way the world learns. Wiley is a diverse, global organization and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.  The Business Development Manager is responsible for wining new society and publisher contracts for partner services, primarily focused on corporate advertising and projects services. Also need to keep up to date with developments and regulations in the corporate and publishing markets in China, create and to be accountable for the corporate services strategy in China, in partnership with the Senior Director of Business Development.  How will you make an impact: Understands and presents current and future market trends and associated regulations in publishing and corporates (primarily healthcare and life sciences) in China Support the Society Business Development team in networking with prospective society acquisition targets Be the face of Corporate Sales at selected society pitch meetings (acquisitions and renewals) Creates and implements, in partnership with the Senior Director of Business Development, the global corporate advertising and projects services strategy Wins deals with partner societies and publishers in China around Wiley’s corporate advertising and projects services Works with the Product team to drive a program of product development and lifecycle management around corporate advertising and projects services Works with key Wiley Editorial, Marketing and Sales groups to ensure best practice in driving revenues around corporate sales Influences and motivates people, both within and outside Wiley, to take action toward achieving higher revenues around corporate sales We are looking for people who: Experience of publishing and corporate sales, ideally within health sciences related Understand the clinician/patient/drug development interface/workflow, and how content services can be applied across this spectrum Understand how content is applied and used in healthcare organizations, and of regulatory or other limiting factors, specifically as it applies to China Have influence and collaboration skill set to work extensively with colleagues in cross-functional teams, and across units within Wiley to achieve business goals About Wiley:  We are in one of the most dynamic periods in our history as technology, globalism and economic diversity create far-reaching changes in the world. As a learning business, Wiley makes meaningful contributions to research discovery and lifelong learning by helping organizations achieve their goals and people achieve success from education through their career. We may have been founded over two centuries ago, but our secret to success remains the same: change with the times and adapt to meet the ever-evolving needs of our customers. The company’s headquarters are in Hoboken, New Jersey, with operations in the U.S., Europe, Asia, Australia, and Canada.  Location/Division:  Beijing, China  Job Requisition:  47927  Time Type:  Full Time
industries: Publishing, Information Technology and Services, and E-Learning

description: Job Summary  Identify, lead and capture business development opportunities for Indian aerospace & defense customers in line with the strategic and operational objectives of GKN Aerospace, in order to realize or contribute to the profitability, invested capital, cash conversion and growth of GKN Aerospace.  Job Responsibilities  Provides proactive internal and customer-focused capture strategies to align multiple divisions in the pursuit of new opportunities. Encompasses pricing, competition, SWOT analysis and taking responsibility for the action item over an extended capture phase to position GKN for wins.  Serves as the liaison and facilitator at all levels of the assigned customer(s) and stakeholders, to resolve issues and assure customer satisfaction. Provides the customer and stakeholder with liaison support within and across the division on existing and new business. Stays in close contact with the customer and stakeholder and the end users to ensure expeditious problem resolution to meet customer and stakeholder expectations.  Provides direction to GKN regarding future business and engineering trends by maintaining current aerospace industry and customer knowledge and forecast recommendations where future business and engineering priorities will be focused.  Develops and maintains extensive industry and stakeholders relationships at marketing and operations management levels in target market for the retention and capture of new business. Takes appropriate steps to protect and safeguard GKN intellectual property.  Identifies business development opportunities by studying competitor products, technical problems, market intelligence, and identifying trends. Pursues teaming and partnering alliances with other companies. Maintains a working knowledge of key variables affecting the marketplace and key aerospace customers.  Acts as primary consultant to management on significant customer issues. Understands how to get issues resolved at an appropriate working level and highlights inter-divisional items of commercial significance and communicates effectively with Site Leadership and Executive Management.  Job Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or equivalent. 10+ years of increasingly responsible experience in international aerospace sales, marketing or customer interaction including four or more years of high-level marketing and program management for major customers. Experience with program management and business processes and procedures, including technical and business proposal development, domestic and international customer budgeting, and acquisition processes and procedures. Ability to negotiate complex contractual deals and lead a multi–functional team of specialists and assess the key business risks and take decisions to ensure that we contract at acceptable levels of risk for different contractual scenarios. Good organizational skills, ability to multi-task and demonstrated abilities in leadership, communication and planning.
industries: Construction, Aviation & Aerospace, and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

Develop credentials and strategic POV presentations. Solution and program development. Pricing and project/ retainer negotiation. description: 工作职责:  职务描述摘要  面向客户的员工负责赢得业务 在遵循说明和工作程序的条件下，执行标准的销售任务。可以根据工作情况的变化重新安排顺序以完成任务/职责。可能负责目标客户、稳定的地区和/或中小型销售地区。  Primary Responsibilities  Financial Performance Achieve sales and orders volumes at the target prices in assigned accounts/territory. Coordinate orders and sales forecasts within the applicable sales funnel tools and reports for in their assigned territory/accounts in conjunction with Product Sales Specialist/product Specialists. Account Management Maintain relationships, develop a business strategy, and maximize business opportunities for all GE Healthcare businesses, products & services within allocated accounts/territory (or within defined care area/department scope). Represent OneGEHC in the account or care area/department and acts as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory. Provide on-going feedback to management, product teams, services and marketing. Maintain Go-to-Market plans in conjunction with Zone cross functional and multi-product teams to achieve targets and grow GE’s share of customer investments in capital, diagnostics and operational expenditures. Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through consistent high quality interactions with customer management. Build long term strategic alliance with portfolio of accounts to continue to add value, and promote Service offerings to identify and escalate commercial service needs to drive customer NPS. In cooperation with Product teams and Marketing, drive One GE Healthcare promotional events in assigned territory. Be aware of customer segmentation and promote offerings relevant to each client’s segment. Opportunity Management Prospecting for new customers and business opportunities in addition to growing and maintaining the existing customer portfolio. Prioritize new leads to create a balanced sales funnel for future sales. Lead and leverage Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialists, Care Area or Category Leaders, Service Operations and other Company resources to provide the necessary technical, clinical and business content to create a competitive differentiation. Coordinate One GE Healthcare team on assigned accounts in order to deliver solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations. Lead & coordinate multi-P&L proposals, preparing sales quotations, planning customer meetings and demonstrating equipment capabilities across diagnostic product portfolio with relevant Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialist and other sales support staff. Ensure order and configuration quality at the point of entry to ensure accuracy, configuration integrity and that all requirements are tied to documented customer inputs. Lead successful negotiation and closure of multi P&L opportunities, interfacing with all key buyer influencers. Assist Product Sales Specialists in negotiation and deal closure of single product deals as required. Promote point of sale service contracts and financing solutions and drive margin through selling value and achieving price targets. GE Product & Market awareness Develop a solid knowledge of GE product and service portfolio and competitors’ products. Develop and maintain expertise of market and technology trends in order to understand customer issues and challenges as well as educating customer on their unmet clinical and business needs. Develop and maintain deep understanding of CxO level business and clinical needs and how GE provide solutions/offerings to meet these needs differently from the competition. Compliance Adhere to and uphold highest standards of compliance to relevant international and local Regulatory and GE Healthcare Promotional Codes Adhere to all applicable GE and GE Healthcare compliance policies, codes and training requirements Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required. 任职条件:  Qualifications / Requirements Education to Bachelor Degree level or the equivalent of four years of sales experience. 2 years of strategic sales experience. 2 years experience in healthcare. Proven key account management and project planning skills. Strong customer focus and desire to continuously improve expertise Well developed listening, influencing, interpersonal and networking skills to drive collaborative culture at all levels; High level presentation skills; able to present ideas to customers in a way that produces understanding and impact. Quality Specific Goals Aware of and comply with the GEHC Quality Manual, Quality Management System, Quality Management Policy, Quality Goals, and applicable laws and regulations as they apply to this job type/position Complete all planned Quality & Compliance training within the defined deadlines Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required Knowledge and understanding of all Global Privacy and Anti-Competition Policies Knowledge and understanding of all Environmental Health Policies (including but not limited to GE Healthcare EHS Policies, GE Healthcare Fleet Rules, etc.) and operate within them to ensure that no company policy or Country / Int’l Law is broken Drive continuous improvement on all related processes, work instructions, and procedures to ensure ongoing standardization and simplification of the Quality Management System. Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

description: Our Higher Education team delivers powerful platforms, highly personalized course materials, and effective learning supplements to help students achieve their goals at every stage of their academic and professional careers.  From ALEKS to Connect to LearnSmart, the products you'll work on are used around the globe.  We have a passion for learning and believe that every student should have access to affordable, high-quality learning solutions designed to help them succeed.  With the fast-changing landscape in education and the rapid evolution to digital, McGraw Hill has an exciting opportunity as a Sales Executive to join our Beijing Higher Education team.  What is this about?  The Sales Executive will be responsible to grow our key product portfolio in China. In this role, you will own the marketing initiatives and design value proposition and compelling product messaging for key products, initiating effective go-to-market strategy, planning and executing effective marketing events/activities, integrating various market resources, and managing the key titles throughout the product life cycle to achieve annual sales target for key products.  Your Contribution To The Team Includes Develop go-to-market strategies for key products Initiate and design effective marketing activity(online/offline) for key products to raise awareness of McGraw Hill’s product Design and produce unique go-to-market strategies for key titles based on the value points to contribute to the sales growth of the key titles Provides information for management by preparing product sales forecasts and special reports and analyses Manage key products’ by analyzing product life cycle stages and formulating short- medium-, and long-term plans for the key products What can you bring to the role? Proactive sales person with effective oral and written communication skills Ability to understand the content of book and values proposition to form effective strategy and develop compelling product messaging Proven ability to manage and analyze data to derive meaningful insights and quickly diagnose and correct any problems Demonstrated passion for technology–enabled educational solutions Effective negotiation and problem resolution skills Microsoft Office Applications Proficiency (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Spirit to Win  If you can bring your dedicated passion, we can help students attain their goals and achieve their dreams. We foster a culture of helping those that want to learn, and we offer open and collaborative working environments that will enable you to succeed. Every day your individual efforts contribute to the lives of millions.  As an education innovation company, we're proud to play our part by inspiring learners around the world. If you bring your curiosity, we'll help you grow in a collaborative environment where everyone shares a passion for success.  Are you ready for a new challenge? Apply for a career at McGraw Hill and together, we'll impact the world.

Job Description  You will be part of USMNC APJ Team supporting customer Dell. Sales Operations Analyst will manage end-to-end customer supply line, act as the communication conduit between Customer, Sales, US host team and the Factory to collaborate revenue through alignment and supply commitments, to optimize supply/ demand management. You will collaborate with account team and host influencing rev forecast through data analysis, market intelligence and insightful information, trace and track business health through delivering relevant and effective business indicators and proactive liaison with stake holders. You will be responsible to drive and execute supply chain programs, to support continuous improvements of business processes and tools for effective supply chain model, to deal with various scenarios of challenges under different business models and identify issue resolutions followed by tactical executions in professional and quality manners. This position requires to build strong relationships with multiple groups cross Geos, such as internally logistics, US host teams, program teams, product supply, credit and finance and externally the customer and freight carriers which makes the role very dynamic and interactive.  Qualifications  Bachelor degree 3+ years/Master's Degree 2+ years. Experience in customer service, business operations or supply line management  Excellent communication and collaboration skills  Ability to quickly digest problems and drive solutions across a dynamic stakeholder base Proficient in SAP and Office Applications esp. Excel and Powerpoint as well as PowerBI.  Ability to synthesize complex data into a clear actionable conclusions  Flexible and ability to embrace change in a fast paced environment  Excellent analytical, organizational, influential skills, innovative, self-directed and proactive  Attentive to details, multi-tasking ability  Fluent oral and written English  Inside this Business Group  Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.

description: Job title:  Growth Specialist Reporting to: Program Director, Growth Location: Shanghai Type: Full-time  SOSV Cross-Border Internet is looking for a Growth Specialist located in Shanghai, reporting to the Program Director, Growth.  S/he will be responsible for all the marketing initiatives across SOSV Cross-Border Internet. The Growth Specialist will drive and optimize marketing around SOSV Cross-Border Internet’s digital space, spearhead marketing campaigns across different social channels to grow and improve our brand awareness, and work with both internal and external stakeholders to ensure our brand’s voice is consistent across the digital realm.  You will be accountable for: ●     Providing timely, clear communication with internal teams and startups. ●     Delivering clear, concise weekly reporting of marketing campaign metrics. ●     Analyzing the results of marketing efforts and adjusting the plan as required. ●     Achieving marketing targets on a monthly and quarterly basis. ●     Representing SOSV Cross-Border’s value-add to startups and partners.  Your responsibilities will be: ●     Leverage market insights to develop and execute marketing plans ●     Gather metrics for marketing campaign reporting. ●     Enhance brand exposure and profile on social channels. ●     Set up, plan, optimize marketing campaigns for SOSV Cross-Border ●     Provide our startups advisory support and direction on setting up, optimizing marketing campaigns.  In three months you will… ●     be familiar with SOSV, our startups and related accelerators ●     be familiar of the current annual event calendar ●     be familiar with our mentor network and partner network ●     be familiar with the current marketing assets, tools and approach for SOSV and cross-border ●     have participated in multiple meetings with startups, internally and departmentally  In six months you will… ●     have a clear plan for marketing and lead acquisition for SOSV Cross-Border startups, VCs, corporate partners and mentors ●     have completed several smaller marketing experiments to determine key tracking issues and needs ●     have a weekly marketing activity report covering key tracker metrics  In 1 year you will… ●     have completed at least one full batch cycle for both Chinaccelerator and MOX ●     have completed an annual review with your reporting manager ●     have provided support to multiple startups over multiple current and alumni batches ●     have put in place clear SOPs and strategies for marketing of SOSV and Cross-Border startups, VCs, corporate partners and mentors  We are looking for people who: ●     Use data to drive decisions ●     Prioritizes speed over perfection ●     OK doing things that do not scale ●     Active listener and communicator ●     Proactive in taking on initiatives ●     Willing to help others wherever possible and practical ●     Organized, prepared and on time ●     Highlights problems for the good of the team ●     Able to work under pressure but with a sense of humor ●     Excited by innovation, entrepreneurship and serving startups  The successful candidate has: ●     Experience working at startups is preferred but not a must. ●     Hands on experience setting up, preparing tests and optimizing campaigns. ●     Must be fluent in both Mandarin and English.  About Us  SOSV is the #1 most active angel and seed stage investor and #3 most active Venture Capital investor in the world with US$970 million assets under management. SOSV Cross-Border Internet runs both MOX and Chinaccelerator.  MOX — the Mobile Only Accelerator — helping consumer internet startups from around the world and expand to Asia and across Asia. MOX offers startups investment and free user acquisition via its smartphone ecosystem of 102 million monthly active users and direct cash investment in return for equity and revenue share to its promotion partners.  Chinaccelerator, Asia’s leading startup development program, is a mentorship-driven program helping enterprise software startups from around the world enter Asia selling to a network of over 250 multinational corporate partners, and global startups enter China and local Chinese startups expand to global markets.

Lead the distributors to explore potential customers and work with HQ to resolve the market challenges in local country; Tap the customer's requirements for smartphones and ecosystem products, collect competitors' product information, and follow up targeted customers; Working, more than three years of working experience in the same position is preferred; Effectively carry out market research, demand collection, industry development foresight, and work closely with product and R&D team to improve product optimization and sales.   Requirements: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience; Previous similar experience in consumer electronics and smartphone or IoT industry; Business strategy driven, defined objective(s), KPIs and reporting against plan; Strong Project management skills; Knowledgeable and comfortable with Agile development practices from the point of view of Product Marketing; Previous global working experience and understand the different country culture; Entrepreneurial spirit; Meticulous attention to detail; Mandarin language is a desirable.

description: Job Objective  The Sales Operations Analyst provides support to sales management by preparing statistical analysis and reports to sales leadership team to drive revenue growth and margin expansion, handling information requests, automation of tasks, and managing customer correspondence on an as-needed basis.  The Sales Operations Analyst will proficiently work under pressure at times to handle a wide variety of activities, effectively communicate across different functions, and consistently maintain confidentiality and discretion in all areas of performance.     Responsibilities:  * Gathering sales data from sales team & internal system to generate sell out report for sales management & bonus calculation. * Create standard operating procedures to make sure data accuracy. * Give training to educate business owners on navigation and interpretation of reports * Develop advanced multidimensional reporting to identify opportunities to drive sales growth * Assist in the preparation of internal and external correspondence for report preparation. Supporting sales management and the commercial sales team with data analysis and data requests * Build, Automate and design innovative tools that makes the sales team more effective and efficient. * Handle with capital contract and capital orders * Calculate capital rebate for distributors.    Requirements:  · Bachelor’s degree or above.  · With minimum 3-year work experiences in Operations and/or Sales Support role.  * Experience with a business intelligence tool and data visualization. * Experience with Power BI or Tableau or another BI tool is preferred. · Mastery of using Microsoft Office software, like Excel, Word, Outlook, PPT. Good at using Excel for data analysis.  · Good communication skills (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills  · Self-motivated. A good team player. Ability to work on own initiative and work under pressures. Have problem solving sense.

Wiredcraft helps the best brands in the world create digital products: think e-commerce mini-program for Nike, loyalty and booking mobile apps for Hilton or community on WeChat for lululemon.  You’ll lead on sales, supported by our Account Managers and Business Analysts: finding and qualifying new opportunities, engaging with and pitching to senior stakeholders (C-suite, VPs, Directors), coordinating with our team of designers, engineers and strategists to create proposals…  All of our business is inbound; you will NOT be chasing clients on LinkedIn or wasting time at networking events.  Instead, you’ll work to build long-term relationships based on trust with our clients, own our sales KPIs and collaborate on inbound marketing strategies.   Responsibilities:  Contribute to our quarterly and yearly business strategy, defining goals and creating tactical plans to achieve them. Lead the entire sales process, from answering client requests (RFI, RFP, …) to creating budget estimates and presentations for our prospective clients. Lead on presentations and key sales meetings. Contribute to our inbound marketing strategy (content and events). Surface new sales opportunities through inbound marketing, word-of-mouth marketing, referrals and personal networking (both our leaders’ and your own network). Nurture client relationships into long-term partnerships. Engage with internal and external stakeholders to define the context, goals and scope of qualified leads. Handle complex pre-sales and after-sales requests. Collaborate with the marketing team to create business opportunities. Be accountable for sales KPIs.   Requirements:  Understanding of our market (e.g. digital services and solutions). Fluent (or close to it) in Chinese and English. Previous experience as an Account Executive or similar sales/customer service role in a relevant organization (agency, consultancy, software provider…). Great at building rapport and nurturing long-term relationships. Knowledge of market research, sales and negotiating principles. Comfortable engaging with high level executives. Self-driven, reliable and detail-oriented. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficient with presentation software (Powerpoint, Keynote, Google Slides…). Bonus point for prior experience with marketing or a sales CRM (Salesforce, Hubspot, Pipedrive…).   You can read more about our culture, the rules & benefits for employees, and pretty much anything else about Wiredcraft in our playbook (http://playbook.wiredcraft.com/).

Market intelligence of responsible area and industry by establishment of database to identify new business opportunities. Develop competitor grid and benchmarking analysis. Travel and work successful/efficient with distributor partners to understand customers requirement and problems and pursue a better service. We promote an inclusive culture that accepts the diversity of people, experiences and capabilities. Join the team and connect with more than 117,000 other minds. Stay alert for possible recruitment fraud!  This can include fake websites, fake job offers, or contact from a person falsely claiming to represent BASF.

jobTitle: R3566789 Enterprise Key Account Manager - Global Clients
description: 工作职责:  Job Description Summary  Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Jobs at this level operate with some autonomy but are covered by well-defined Commercial policies or review of end results. The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (typically annual volume, margin and compliance requirements). Responsible for medium-sized sales territories.  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Position Description  Act as key account manager for overseas investment groups; foreign-invested hospital groups and clinic chains; and foreign partners of major medical institutions in China.  Drive account penetration and share gain, achieve maximum equipment pull through  Meet sales and order targets, develop long-term project and revenue pipeline  Ensure C-suite access and develop strategic partnership and preferred supplier relationships; build customer trust and engagement  Leverage GE internal resources and expertise to meet customer needs; act as matchmaker between local actors and global accounts; drive new project development  Seek new market opportunities and accounts among local and foreign investors in private healthcare institutions  Act as focal communication point for overseas healthcare institutions seeking Chinese partner; facilitate introductions and matchmaking to support GEHC sales teams, both in private and public segments  Report directly to Managing Director, Global Clients, Enterprise Team  任职条件:  Skills Required  5-7 years experience in healthcare industry sales, preferably in medical equipment or related fields.  Excellent English and Chinese language communication and presentation skills; confident and capable in C-suite interactions  Analytical and solutions development capabilities; able to understand customer viewpoints and develop innovative approaches to achieving goals  Strong ethical and moral compass; committed to compliance and GE values  Master’s degree in business, medicine or related field  Overseas Working Or Studying Experience Preferred  Background in project finance or information technology a plus  Responsive, diligent, efficient and personable working style  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

companyName: HACKL Technology Co., Ltd. - DIGITAL EXPERT
description: HACKL Technology (Suzhou) Co., Ltd. is a solution provider for AR/VR and IoT Digitalization. We are working just with the best supplier on the market. Our company is specializing in a growing market for AR Remote Mentor Systems, VR Content Development and IIoT Solutions. Therefore we created the best AR Remote Mentor Solutions for our customer.  We are looking for a Sales Consultant with Business Development activities to support us for the market in China and overseas partnerships. This is your chance to step into new digitalization technology.  Your Responsibilities ·       Evaluate and get in direct contact with potential customers according our customer list. ·       Present our AR remote solutions (online/on-site) and close deals with potential customers. ·       Identify, evaluate, and prioritize specific market opportunities in support of the broader strategy including developing and following-up on leads, structuring deal terms, and developing a negotiation strategy and lead negotiations. ·       Establish and maintain positive, beneficial and constructive relationships with key accounts and new potential clients. ·       External Partnerships: Maintain a network of relationships across the industry with partners, potential partners, competitors, investors, thought leaders, etc. Leverage relationships in opportunity identification and sales. ·       Industry Expertise: Be a professional in various industry trends like Manufacturing or Production, Logistics, AR/VR, IT and Software including competitive and market dynamics, product and technology trends. ·       Support project planning and implementation of our Systems at customer sites. ·       Establish after-sales services and cross selling opportunities.  Required Qualifications ·       at least 3 years of experience in B2B Sales, Consultant or Business Development with a high success rate ·       High interest in AR/VR and Digitalization with some experiences ·       Education: Preferably master’s degree in IT, IoT or manufacturing or MBA degree focusing on Management, Sales or Production ·       Great communication and collaboration skills ·       Passion for compliance, software solutions, and creating great customer experiences ·       Willingness to travel in China of up to 50% ·       Must have good command of spoken and written English and Chinese. Additional German would be nice but not a must.  Basic Requirements ·       Honest and Trustfully Person ·       Extroverted and good communication skills ·       Willingness and Love to learn new digital AR technology ·       Hard working to achieve our common goals ·       Good business behavior ·       Reliable and always on-time at appointments  Your Benefits ·       You will work in a very experienced and friendly tea ·       You will get internal AR/IIoT education ·       We support you to grow to get your bonuses ·       Good salary with an outstanding bonus system ·       Chance to get promoted as Director ·       Regularly trainings and mentoring for you ·       A very exciting and not standard job ·       Flexible time and home office possibility  Please apply your CV to hr@hackltech.com or through our website www.hacktech.com

description: Job Description  This is a commissioned sales position. Responsible for Influencing and advocating Intel based products and solutions for all of Intel's Business units through a vertically oriented, solutions led approach to Business and IT. Responsible for working with a few named accounts in specific industry segments or territories where deep engagements require a multi year strategy with the customer around transformation and territory engagements take the more traditional approach. Impact should result in executive level trusted advisor status which should drive our relevance, preference and pull for our strategic focus areas. This role covers both ICs AND those Managing the teams.  Qualifications 10+ years of IT/ICT Sales and business developing experience with a proven track record of delivering solid/growth result with key customers or ISV partners. Strong business acumen sense, be veteran on developing/executing account strategies, business plan and articulate the strategy and Plan to upper management concisely. Understand Cloud and Data center market and technical trend, and can illustrate the opportunities and challenges for the team. Eager to learn new industry knowledge and new technologies including (Big Data/Cloud/AI/5G/Edge Computing). Good communication both in English and Mandarin. Being self-driven, team work and winning mindset. Computer Science or equivalent BA/BS degree. Inside this Business Group  Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.  Other Locations  PRC, Beijing

jobTitle: China Business Development (BD) Lead - Performance Building Solutions
description: Description  The Shelter Solutions Business, part of DuPont Water & Protection, is comprised by the Corian® Design and Performance Building Solutions businesses, combing globally-recognized brands under one business – Styrofoam™, Tyvek®, Great Stuff™, Great Stuff Pro™, and Froth-Pak and Corian®. The business is designed to deliver solutions to both the interior and exterior of a building that enhance the performance and beautification of shelters across the globe. China Business Development (BD) Lead will be responsible for the development, promotion and sales of DuPont Shelter Performance Building Solutions (PBS). He/she is also responsible for identifying new opportunities for unmet customers’ needs, optimizing product portfolio & business model, and driving profitable business growth. Core responsibilities include RMA (rapid market assessment) to drive business strategy, identify primary focus area for existing/ new portfolio, demonstrate product value proposition and also deploy channel and pricing structure and promotion programs to enable the business development in execution level.  Responsibilities Adherence to company core values, code of conduct. Business development for global PBS solutions to capture opportunities in China construction industry. Achieve target on BD milestones, sales revenue and profitability. Development, key accounts & channel management through base business management, new demand creation, share gain and new application/product development. Build sustainable relationship with value chain to enhance brand advocacy and code influence in construction industry. Enable the selected end users/designers to succeed with solutions, resources and professional guidance. Design & execution of activities on PBS awareness enhancement together with brand/communication team. Other BD/Sales assignments as assigned by the management. Qualifications And Others Bachelor degree or above. Good written and spoken English. Minimum 6-8 years’ sales or business development experience in multinational company, business development in multi-industries or key accounts/channel management background preferred; Construction thermal insulation and/or waterproofing Industry experience is preferred. Strong business acumen, ability to innovate and sales execution capability. Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills. A strong team player with ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and in multi-cultural groups to achieve stated goals. Ability to work under pressure and willing to travel frequently. Proactive, aggressive, initiative, result oriented and strong ownership. DuPont is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search or apply for a position, please visit our Accessibility Page for Contact Information.  For US Applicants See the “Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law” poster at http //www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf  For our U.S. Affirmative Action Policy, click here.

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. description: About the company Created in 1828, Bureau Veritas is a global leader in Testing, Inspection and Certification (TIC), delivering high quality services to help clients meet the growing challenges of quality, safety, environmental protection and social responsibility. As a trusted partner, Bureau Veritas offers innovative solutions that go beyond simple compliance with regulations and standards, reducing risk, improving performance and promoting sustainable development.  Job Overview Handle enquiries of local inquiry to optimizing sales growth in line with group objectives Administrative support for business development activities Assist with the preparation of sales presentation, sales plans, forecast, monthly reports and sales visit summary. Facilitate effective co-ordination system with other departments and overseas offices. Gather and analyze market intelligence and share with the team  Responsibilities Explore business opportunity and develop new clients through phone, mail enquiries and client visits. At the target 50% of time should be spent on client contacts. Negotiate with clients including potential clients. Support sales process through research, tele-marketing, trade shows, seminar, conference and any other sales campaigns. Facilitate effective co-ordination with all interfaces throughout the sales and client retention programs. Support other Business Lines and overseas Selling Offices through client meeting and cross selling activities. Prepare sales presentations, capability statement & service proposals. Collect market intelligence on competitive analysis, customer feedback, trends & opportunities for top management’s strategic decisions. Support the team in implementing promotion and sales campaign Assist with the preparation of sales plans, forecast, monthly reports and sales visit summary. Be fully trained and familiar with the companies’ service offering and value added proposition so as to be in a position to provide value added solution to potential clients. Any other new tasks set out by the department to cope with the business needs  Skills and Qualifications Postgraduate qualification in sales, marketing, business administration or technical discipline related to consumer products or retail. Over 1 year work experience with sales related experience preferable Excellent interpersonal and communication skills of the highest caliber are required. Ability to speak fluent English, Cantonese and Mandarin and presentable to management of clientele. A team player able to cooperate with Operating Offices, Sales Offices and Customer Service teams. Customer focus and result oriented An energetic, motivated self-starter able to lead by example and deliver results under a fast paced business environment. Acute sense of market trends and customer needs.

The Account Manager builds effective relationships with entry- to mid-level client contacts. This role ensures the efficient coordination of projects from estimation to completion, and partners with the broader project team to ensure deliverables are completed on time and on budget. The Account Manager utilizes an understanding of the Company's and the client's industry, business, and products to identify opportunities to sell additional solutions to meet existing client needs.   Job Responsibilities:  •   Supports the Company’s profitability efforts by managing efficient, accurate, and timely coordination of the assigned project activities. •   Supports the Account Team in its effort to increase revenue through selling additional products and services across the business portfolio. •   Participates in the development of innovative proposals to capture both account growth and new business opportunities. •   Ensures the meeting of volume and revenue targets for each account. •   Builds new relationships and nurturing existing relationships with internal and external clients. •   Serves as the main day-to-day contact on current projects for clients, suppliers, external partners, and the Account team; provides timely responses to all inquiries. •   Participates in meetings with existing clients and internal teams to identify adequate new services/offerings to meet clients’ evolving needs as required; serves as the Subject Matter Expert on processes, capacity, timelines, etc. •   Ensures high quality standards in all client deliverables. •   Coordinates client-specific projects throughout the lifecycle, including estimate creation, selection of appropriate projects and sub-projects, assignment of resources, monitoring project progress, and generation of the client/project invoice. •   Translates client requests and requirements into detailed, and sometimes technical, instructions for project teams. •   Partners with the client, the Account Team, and project teams to resolve identified project issues. •   Ensures accurate and timely invoices are generated by maintaining correct project details and supporting evidence, including change orders and rework, throughout the project lifecycle. •   Initiates new data item requests utilizing the Master Data Management (MDM) process and guidelines to ensure accurate client, project, and financial details are available in the system. •   Partners with Client Integration and the Account Team to ensure a smooth transition for new clients; attend pre-integration and planning meetings as needed. •   Participates in cross-functional teams to develop and/or adapt processes, policies, and workflows to improve efficiency, accuracy, speed, quality, etc. •   Provides solutions for business-related issues and situations and generate specific plans that achieve objectives. •   Manages and balances marketing budgets to maximize Return on Investment (ROI) and drive incremental sales. •   Provides expertise on customer pricing and promotional planning. •   Plans, directs, and coordinates activities of employee(s) to ensure goals or objectives are accomplished. Mentors, coaches, trains and develops team. •   Additional duties as assigned.    Desired Skills and Experience:  •   Bachelor’s Degree in Sales, Marketing or related field •   Advanced degree (MBA, Master’s) preferred •   6+ years previous account management experience in a Creative Design Agency, Market Research firm or similar consulting environment; or equivalent combination of education and experience •   Prior managerial/supervisory experience preferred •   Occasional travel either locally, nationally, and/or internationally may be required. •   High degree of proficiency MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications •   Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills  •   Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning) •   Solid understanding and application of mathematical concepts •   Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients •   Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment. •   Ability to work with and influence peers and senior management •   Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting   SGK is a global packaging and brand experience company. From idea to implementation, we deliver packaging solutions and brand experiences that give brands the freedom to speak louder, scale faster and grow stronger. We simplify marketing and amplify brands to deliver value. SGK is a Matthews International company.   Matthews International endeavors to make our employment website and application process accessible to all users and applicants. In doing so, Matthews International provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation or assistance completing the application process, please contact a member of our Human Resource Team.

description: MINTEL GROUP LTD  www.mintel.com  Mintel is an independent award-winning provider of world-leading market intelligence, delivering robust information, analysis and critical recommendations. Mintel's trusted portfolio of proprietary industry solutions and products has been supporting high profile clients in key sectors such as FMCG, financial services, media, retail, leisure and education for over 40 years.  The Role  The role is aimed to be an individual contributor to driving the new business growth for South of China.  Key Responsibilities Will Include Work strategically with China Headquarters in Shanghai to ensure a healthy business growth Grow the regional portfolio by targeting and closing new clients Gather and relay market feedback information to the sales and leadership teams Set appointments and follow up marketing materials to aid in client follow up Achieve monthly Financial and Activity targets, both individually Provide weekly, accurate, sales forecasts to Management Lead-source and make new business contacts, promoting Mintel and Mintel Products/ Solutions at every point, creating conversations that uncover reasons to use research. Perform onsite demonstrations and presentation to prospects and conduct them with the intention of making a Sale at the end Frequently trips to Shanghai for sales meetings, team collaborations, and trainings. The Person  This is a very important hire for the business. The actual personality and ‘fit’ for the business will be as important as the technical skills required. The person will need to be comfortable working autonomously and without ‘day to day’ supervision.  The person will be; A self-starter and self-motivated Energetic and hungry and fast learner Enthusiastic and passionate – have a genuine interest in the product. Have the presence and ability to ‘excite’ people about the service Leaning more on the ‘quiet confidence’ as opposed to ‘brash’ sales style A consultative approach A listener and open An effective communicator – both written and ‘on his feet’ A strong presenter An effective time manager – considering the travel and size of the region to cover Supportive of peers within the business Customer focused – committed to the customer and servicing the customer Experience in FMCG and being well-connected in FMCG will be a plus Able to communicate in English SKILL & COMPETENCY SPECIFICATIONS  SELECTION CRITERIA  Qualifications Tertiary qualifications such as business, commerce, marketing etc. would be most suitable but not essential. Experience Demonstrated achievement and experience managing accounts and developing new business Managing/working with multinationals will be a plus Presenting and gaining credibility within the client base Background Over 4+ years FMCG experience or working experience Strong knowledge of the Southern China region English communication is required

Analyze problems, and provide methods to solve problems. Easy-going personality,  good communication skill  Be able to work under pressure and accept very frequent travel   AVERY DENNISON IS AN EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY PROVIDER.
