✨ ABOUT LAUNCHMETRICS Launchmetrics is the leading Brand Performance Cloud used by Fashion, Luxury and Beauty (FLB) executives to connect with the modern consumer in a constantly changing landscape. With over a decade of industry expertise, we have helped more than 1,000 customers create inspiring, impactful and measurable experiences. Our Brand Performance Cloud provides companies with the tools and intelligence they need to optimize the use of their creative assets, execute powerful brand amplification programs, and measure their brand performance. The company’s AI-driven and proprietary Media Impact Value gives customers the ability to benchmark their performance against 2,000 competitors worldwide. Launchmetrics' intelligence empowers these companies to grow their businesses and streamline their processes, bringing a sharp focus to profitability, accountability, and efficiency while enabling the type of quick decision-making required for agility. Founded in NYC and with operating headquarters in Paris, we have employees in eight markets worldwide and offer support in five languages. We have been the trusted brand performance technology to brands worldwide such as Dior, Fendi, Shiseido, NET-A-PORTER, and Adidas as well as partners like IMG, the Council of Fashion Designers of America, the British Fashion Council, and Camera Nazionale Della Moda Italiana.  💡 ABOUT THE SALES TEAM We’re a small but mighty team of Sales Leaders and Executives, Account Managers, and Business Development representatives, distributed across 10 different countries worldwide.  We work diligently to build relationships with our global prospects and customers to help them identify their challenges and needs and articulate how these can be addressed through our Brand Performance Cloud. Our mission is to showcase the great value and power our suite of products, services, and insights can bring to the marketing departments behind the world's biggest and best Fashion, Luxury, and Beauty brands.  🎯 ABOUT THE ROLE The Account Manager will be responsible for achieving new business targets and helping close new deals. As an Account Manager, you will oversee the prospect’s engagement from prospecting, demo, to close. You will also collaborate closely with Customer Success to ensure successful onboarding and positive customer engagement to ensure adoption.   Key Responsibilities:  Developing your own sales pipeline. Hunter approach to initiating conversations with prospects such as C-level executives, Head of Public Relations, Communications or Marketing Departments. Managing a portfolio of accounts. Success will mean satisfied, engaged customers that understand the value of our product offerings, high customer retention levels, and significant revenue expansion. Being commercially aligned and focused to meet monthly new business targets. Using customer data to present value of the service using clear numerical and verbal reasoning Establishing ongoing interaction with key stakeholders and decision-makers within the customer base to align current and future solutions to their strategic or tactical objectives. Developing new and existing C-level relationships within a portfolio of accounts. Creating customer advocates and references for our offering. New business growth in both MRR and services along with Improved renewal rates within assigned accounts.  🏆 ABOUT YOU  Your Profile Speak, read, and write English fluently. A big plus if you speak any of these 3 Asian languages Mandarin, Japanese or Korean High energy, self-awareness, and commitment A challenger seller with strong influencing skills Ability to work effectively as an individual as well as part of a global team Able to present confidently to an audience from all levels within a global organization Track record in reaching and exceeding goals in any fields Demonstrate an ability to cope with a complex and changing environment while projecting a positive sales attitude Strong strategic selling skills and business acumen & pipeline management skills Prior sales experience with software demonstrations is a bonus Bachelor degree or above.  You’ll be our Rockstar if if you have knowledge about the Fashion, Luxury and Beauty industry if you have passion with social media, digital landscape, or software technology if you have experience using Salesforce  💥 WHAT DO WE HAVE TO OFFER?  A fantastic opportunity to participate in the development of a disruptive international company in an incredible work environment – cool, casual, fast-paced with a passionate, driven and fun team. Our people thrive under autonomy and can easily have a strong impact on our business, customers and organization. By joining us, you will have a chance to work in a cutting edge yet established global organization with more than a decade of sustainable growth and leading investors as partners. At Launchmetrics, we care about each other and pay extra attention to things like: Work-life Balance  Flexible Working Team Building  Growth & Development Health & Wellness  Diversity & Inclusion  🤝 WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM OUR RECRUITMENT PROCESS? Step 1: People Ops. Phone Screen Step 2: Meet & Greet with direct manager Step 3: Skills Assessment (Written Assignment to prepare and present + Mock Sales Call Demonstration) Step 4: Leadership Interview Step 5: Cultural Fit Interview *Please submit your application in English.* to jobs@parklu.com

description: About Us  Riskified empowers merchants and shoppers to realize the full potential of eCommerce by making it safe, accessible, and frictionless. Our global team helps the world’s most-innovative eCommerce merchants eliminate risk and uncertainty from their business. Merchants integrate Riskified’s machine learning platform to create trusted customer relationships, driving higher sales while reducing costs. Riskified has reviewed hundreds of millions of transactions and approved billions of dollars of revenue for global brands and fast-growing businesses across industries, including Wayfair, Wish, Peloton, Gucci, and many more. As of July 29th, 2021, Riskified has begun trading on NYSE under the ticker RSKD.  About The Role This role is based in Shanghai, China Riskified’s Channels team plays a key role in executing the company’s growth strategy. We are looking for a smart and creative individual to join the team in the role of China Partnerships Manager. Their primary role is to oversee the planning and execution for establishing and growing our partnerships in China.  The ideal candidate will leverage skill sets of business development, channel management, business analysis, relationship building, and account management, and be well-versed with Management Consulting, Digital Agencies, and the Platforms and Payments ecosystems as a whole. This role is focused on creating productive partnerships to help fuel revenue generation.  We are looking for a team player with proven experience in this field and the demonstrated ability to manage complex relationships and nurture them to success through win-win deals. You will be expected to help set the standard for best-in-class partner management and will partner with the world's largest and most influential companies to drive big initiatives, build strong relationships, and fuel growth.  What You'll Be Doing Recruit, develop, and manage our Payment, Consulting, eCommerce Platform and Digital Agency partners; Identify new business opportunities, recruit partners, negotiate partner agreements, and support partner sales pipeline; Collaborate with internal teams (Product, Integration) to lead PSP and Payment Gateway integration projects; Work as part of a team with our Business Development Managers and Account Executives, and other company resources to win new clients for Riskified; Manage potential channel conflicts by fostering excellent communication internally and externally and through strict adherence to channel rules of engagement; Hold QBR meetings with partners to review/improve performance; Support product and sales training for partners' client-facing teams; Track and report key performance metrics to the Channels lead. Helping to manage and develop existing partner relationships with market leaders such as Dentsu China, Deloitte, NTT Data China, Checkout.com, Payoneer, etc. Qualifications Fluent in Mandarin and English - strong verbal and written communication skills in both languages 5-10 years of experience in partner program management, channel operations, partner sales programs, channel sales, or channel marketing-related roles. Experience partnering with leading local and international consulting companies and PSPs and payment gateways involved in cross-border e-commerce, payments and digital innovation. Proven track record of building a multi-channel pipeline and successfully moving opportunities through the sales cycle, and possessing an existing network of local payment and tech contacts. Data-driven with extensive experience navigating partner ecosystems. An independent self-starter: you thrive in fast-paced environments and feel comfortable with a high level of responsibility and ambiguity. Excellent communication skills for partner conversations, product presentations, and written proposals. Detail-oriented and thorough; able to effectively juggle multiple tasks/projects at once in a highly fluid work environment. This role is based out of Shanghai and will require travel within Mainland/Greater China (when appropriate) of up to 25%.  Life at Riskified  We are a fast-growing and dynamic tech company with 650+ team members globally. We value collaboration and innovative thinking. We’re looking for bright, driven, and passionate people to grow with us. jobTitle: Account Representative, Account ServicesCenter of Excellence, IT
description: Primary Purpose: Independently manage order book flow from order entry to shipment fulfillment to achieve business’s financial targets. Monitor and ensure product ships on time to our wholesale clients; proactively manage issues and communication to internal and external partners. Flawlessly executes all tasks to ensure profitability, productivity, and efficiency for the wholesale revenue cycle. Maintains SOX Compliance controls as it relates to auditing, approval, and revenue protection. The Wholesale account service is a liaison for the customer, Sales and Operations, Distribution, Finance, Production, and internal SOX Compliance team. The successful individual will leverage their proficiencies in Wholesale Customer Service to... Account Service Activities:  Provide accurate and timely customer service to internal and external customer contacts, through ownership of assigned accounts and demonstrated proficiency of the business model and interworking of the end to end supply chain.  Act as a customer advocate between warehouse and the account. Be the point of contact for our wholesale customers – either resolving issues independently or through working with business functions to ensure clear understanding of the ‘ask’.  Proactively and clearly communicate issues pertaining to their account – both to the customer and to the relevant internal business partners.  Partner with Account Executives / leadership to discuss and address business issues/risk to financial, as well as resolve specific service/allocation/logistical issues to address customers’ needs. Order Management/Reporting/Analysis Activities:  Review and maintain orders through the order management system (SAP) from the time of receipt to the time of shipment which includes post market activities, ownership of order status, executing order book changes based on business/customer needs and monitoring shipment flow to mitigate any risk to revenue for the month/quarter. Ensure data integrity accuracy through post analysis by comparing source data against reporting.  Independently analyze to ensure order integrity in product assortment, pricing, allocations and scheduled ship dates. Resolve any issues in partnership with Sales and the wholesale customer, including negotiating extensions, pricing, Balance To Book and returns.  Ensure orders are prepared in accordance to projected fill rate and delivery/shipping calendar; and ship on time. Work closely with shipping partners to resolve cancel date issues and routing response timeliness. Help minimize and prevent seepage that will negatively impact the Sales Margin Inventory for the current period/quarter.  Provide post shipment support including: shipping documents, Order Status Reports (OSR), Proof Of Delivery (PODs), Return Authorization (RAs), and researching/validating/negotiating shortages, overages and other chargeback claims which impact wholesale customer and company profitability  Be a strong partner and Subject Matter Expert (SME) by monitoring picks for high visibility projects, product lines or special events by partnering with Wholesale Operations. Proactively communicate order status information to wholesale customers and others as appropriate  Uphold and adhere to Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) controls as it relates to the company’s narrative on revenue protection, approvals, auditing, and claims processing.  Partner with Sales & Wholesale Operations to protect revenue by proactively reporting monthly risk/liabilities and engaging in decision making planning, including accessing if shipments need to be pulled forward to meet customers and business needs.  Review wholesale customer’s compliance guides to ensure alignment with customer requirements. Act as a project manager and partner with other departments to identify and resolve any deviations to customer facing activities/processes. Minimize chargeback and loss to the business by researching and troubleshooting chargebacks on a timely basis.  Develop & update Standard Operating Procedures; assess current business processes to identify areas of improvement.  Coordinate and lead in continuous improvement projects that help streamline processes and gain efficiencies in meeting Tapestry Service Level Agreements  Provide analysis on a weekly basis to enable business to have visibility of achieved shipped dollars versus potential risks. Provide recommendation to the business and wholesale customer to ensure a win-win outcome.  Administrative and order management tasks to support the regional businesses where necessary. The outstanding professional will possess…  Order Management experience in a rapidly changing deadline driven Sales, Order fulfillment, or Customer Service environment  Experience in wholesale or retail industry of 1-3 years  Intermediate level or above in MS office, specifically Excel  Strong analytical and problem solving skills  Good English verbal and written communication skills with the ability to establish and maintain cross-functional multi-level relationships  Ability to work on an individual level, as well as a team environment; develop and cultivate collaborative relationships with internal and external customers.  Ability to self-manage and balance work load to adjust to competing and shifting priorities and get the job done by using critical and quick thinking.  Proactively identify problems before issues occur, ability to provide correct course of action and/or creative solutions and understand the impact of those actions/solutions on the order fulfillment cycle  Demonstrate ability to utilize multiple internal systems to extract, analyze and act upon business critical data; able to recognize opportunities to improve and streamline department process and procedures  Self-motivation with a strong sense of personal accountability and ownership  Logistical & Supply Chain experience preferred  Intermediate or Advanced level MS Office  Bachelor’s degree preferred

See why Selling Power magazine has consistently ranked Ecolab as a top company to sell for! Ecolab is seeking driven B2B sales professionals to join the commercial Pest Elimination Solutions Sales team in the United States. As a Sales Development Manager you will build & grow profitable client relationships with commercial businesses to protect their brand, their facilities, and the health and safety of their employees and customers. You will drive sales and attain budget goals by leveraging prospecting, cold calling, and networking skills to target restaurants, hospitals, hotels, retailers, food and beverage plants, schools, and nursing homes to offer the most effective B2B pest elimination programs in the United States. The new accounts you acquire will be aligned to our service team which is responsible for delivering the solutions you sell.  What’s in it For You? 开拓全新业务、全面覆盖各领域包括餐饮、酒店、超市、工厂等客户； 在既定年度销售目标下， 做好目标客户计划、制定、实施新客户销售战略，以实现销售目标和业务增长； 具备良好的沟通能力，能够向客户精准传递艺康的价值以获取业务 ； 向客户的管理团队推介服务概述、推介艺康产品及服务地整体价值 随时了解客户信息、政策调整，理解此类调整对艺康产生的影响，并能就此类影响及其对艺康产生的影响具备一定的判断能力，及时与公司相关人员进行分享。 能够与部门和公司内外各层机构进行有效沟通 能够制定价格，了解价格指导标准下价格协议产生的结果，并与客户协商达成利润协议 遵守公司和部门规章流程，并完成经理指定的各项工作任务； Competitive salary and benefits with guaranteed commissions for 2 years while you learn from successful professionals Company vehicle for business and personal use Fantastic opportunity for long term, advanced career growth in sales or sales management Flexible, independent work environment where you will plan and manage your own schedule Access to world-class resources, tools, and technology Grow your income as you drive sales through commission and bonus programs What You Will Do 专科或以上学历 熟悉PCO服务流程，具有良好销售经验或致力于销售领域发展者优先 具有较熟练的谈判技巧 能熟练使用Excel、Word、PowerPoint等办公软件 严格遵守国家法规，公司和部门规章制度和法规； 良好职业道德和素养 Prospect and obtain customers to achieve annual new business sales goals Discover sales opportunities and implement sales strategies Partner with our service team, corporate account team, and inter-company partners to implement best practices to solve customer’s pest problems Build rapport and cultivate relationships with customers and co-workers through professional demeanor and strong interpersonal skills Provide outstanding customer service by leading and educating customers throughout the sales process Keep informed of Ecolab product / service offerings and industry conditions to enhance successful customer outcomes To start, you will have the advantage of Ecolab’s world class paid training program designed to provide you the tools and resources to be one of the best in your field. Our 7 week training program will include paid travel to Ecolab Corporate Headquarters in Saint Paul, Minnesota for portions of the training. About Ecolab Pest Elimination  Learn how scientifically proven protocols help eliminate pests through 3.6 million customer visits annually. Ecolab Pest Elimination provides solutions to prevent and eliminate all types of pests in commercial buildings, food processing plants, food retail, foodservice, and many other markets. By partnering with our customers in these markets, you will have the opportunity to help protect their facilities, employees, and brands at a time when it’s more important than ever.  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.  In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

jobTitle: Sales and Education Assistant Manager, Travel Retail China
description: KEY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES A. Sales-Related Responsibilities (70%)  Sales and Operations Management ●       Review retail sales targets and performance of each door (online & offline doors) on a monthly basis with ASOD ●       Analyze performance of business vs. sales objectives, sales trends and competition ●       Generate sales reports and sales commentary on a monthly basis ●       Build and work on close relationship field staff and Shop Ops team are aware of the marketing calendar, promotions etc ●       Motivate, give clear directives and instructions to field staff on how and where to focus to achieve sales objectives and targets  Marketing Initiatives ●       Coordinate and execute Newness, promotions and in-store & online programs setup in collaboration with ASOD, Store Design Visual Merchandising and Integrated Marketing team ●       Monitor product trends, performance and identify potential sales opportunities to ASOD and Marketing team ●       Ensure all go-to-market materials and promotional C. General ●       Spend minimum 70% of time in-store, working and coaching Field Staff   JOB REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS B.A degree with a minimum of 3 years relevant experience, preferably in the travel retail industry Well groomed Good organization and communication skills Good presentation skills – comfortable with virtual tools such as Zoom, Skype in addition to in-person presentations. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.  Job Description  Area Portfolio Marketer-GCA PeriOp and Prevena  Individual Accountabilities Define the Area Portfolio implementation plan in alignment with Global Portfolio strategy Application of global ‘key focus strategic” portfolios /products (invest/focus) relevant to the area Clear actions for “strategic review” portfolios /products (divest/de-emphasize) Provide Area feed-back to Division launch best practices and global resources (e.g. launch packages, assets, etc) and successful adaptation in the area as needed Provide continuous support and guidance to regions on training and education related to new product introductions Provide feedback on Region / Country needs for successful launches and sales plan attainment Own Area Material Master Data for the Business Unit e-commerce / Channel Partners SAP / Legacy systems Role Qualifications  Proven capability of portfolio management, e.g.: NPI & commercialization, product/portfolio phase in/out Competency of leading description: Manages sales of assigned application(s) accordance with business strategies.  Responsibilities  Essential Function 1: Lead to Opportunities-- Idea to Market(s) Compile/Update/Report Market database of responsible application(s) of market segments to line mgrs. Manage assigned accounts (Rolling Sales Forecast); propose sales plan for OD. Report market trends; new potentials; projects; and execute product launch. Essential Function 2: Opportunity to Order -- Market to Customer Manage and execute assigned customer interactions; provide interaction report/feedback; manage sales forecast. Manage technical/commercial offering; negotiate / revise offering; close deal. Manage and conduct post sales follow-up; customer satisfactory. Essential Function 3: Order to Cash -- Customer to Cash Manage and collect customer survey; propose solution of unmet needs of customers. Manage and collect payments. Manage and resolve claims (QNS). Essential Function 4: Sales Target Management Propose and manage annual sales target in line with OD. Manage and execute yearly Sales KPIs (Sales; Margin; Trade Receivable; NWC etc...). Report business status and proposals to line manager(s) in regular basis. Essential Function 5: Manage people / Self-management Manage and execute assigned annual individual targets/projects Actively participate MS/BU/ Corp. project(s). Adapt Clariant Corporate Values Requirements  Bachelor degree; Technical; Chemistry; Chemical Engineering Degree preferred. Master degree as plus.  At least 5 years of experience in sales and/or marketing. Rich commercial and negotiation skills; Strategic Skills  Balanced sense of commercial aspects, marketing and technology. Capacible in English communication.  Our Offer  Clariant is a focused, sustainable and innovative specialty chemical company based near Basel in Switzerland. Last year the company recorded CHF 4.4 billion in sales for its continuing businesses, harnessing the talents of its 14 000 employees across 50+ countries. Clariant’s portfolio is optimized for future growth, with a focus in three business areas: Care Chemicals, Catalysis and Natural Resources. We believe that our growth is all about our customers and their success. Investment in innovation capabilities and developing an inspiring environment for courageous and determined minds are therefore key to reaching our goal. Join us and help create sustainable value through chemistry for customers all over the globe. jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Dalian
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, (Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

description: 说明  Product Development Team Leader responsible for finding, filtering and winning new product designs from opportunity identification through first product shipment. The BDM will be acting as a hunter and bring in new customer opportunities along with combing our customer base to identify target markets and products to strategically engage with our sales teams. The BDM will have a global responsibility and manage new opportunities from all parts of the globe along with some domestic and international travel to help win new designs.  What You Will Do In Your Role  1  Be mindful of customer priorities during the New Product Development Process. Communicate the Voice of the Customer to the organization with reference to the Project. Be responsive and timely to customer’s request for information and deliverables. Manage the customer to ensure that Molex meets our Project Plan and the Customer Expectations are met. Present new Product Development requests by filtering for the right type of projects and gather VOC information from the customer and sales teams for the busbar development team 2  Be the Team Organizer. Report barriers clearly and concisely to gain management action. Facilitate win-win scenarios between team members for the overall project benefit. Drive and focus the team on the execution of the Project Plan. Work efficiently and effectively with team members and their functional managers. Responsible to achieve the Project Plan requirements for Cost, Quality and Timing. Make sure the Molex New Product Development process and procedures are followed. 3  Perform Business Development function. Make use of Product Management methodologies such as Action Item Lists, Team meetings, Change Control, Timelines, etc. to manage the team through execution of the Project Plan. Execute professional, informative and timely Project Phase Reviews. Working globally with our customers and Molex team members from around the world 4  Perform Risk Management to protect the Project Plan. Work with product development team to identify potential risks to plan execution and identify appropriate Mitigation or Contingency Plans. Get management support for proactive activities to meet the Project Plan. 5  Achieve Financial performance by meeting the goals set forth in the Project Plan for capital expenditure (PARs), Cost Justification performance and expense budget. Document Annual Budget for open Project Plans. 6  Work directly with Suppliers to ensure that they meet Molex’s expectation for timing, cost and quality in support of the Project Plan.  7  Supports Molex TQM program by following approved policies and procedures.  8  Performs other related duties as assigned by management.  The Experience You Will Bring  Requirements Bachelors Degree 3 years of sales experience working directly with customers and sales teams 2 or more years of experience in sales activities New Product Development Team experience such as roles in engineering, product management, etc. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Interpersonal skills to effectively work with co-workers and external contacts to respond positively to situations Strong presentation skills that show the ability to prepare and deliver concise and effective presentations to customers and Molex management Organizational skills to anticipate, plan, prioritize and self-monitor workload. Effective written and oral communication skills that demonstrate the ability to express ideas, exchange information clearly and concisely, and deliver concise and effective presentations to customers and Molex personnel. Must be sensitive to the customer’s needs and show a sense of urgency to address customer issues Strong team leadership skills to anticipate, plan, prioritize and self-monitor workload What Will Put You Ahead Bachelors Degree in business or engineering. Five or more years of experience in sales or product development activities Experience in the connector industry Experience working directly with external Customers Experience in Advance Quality Planning procedures (FMEA, SPC, etc.) Proficient in MS Project Proficient in Salesforce Proficient in SAP/RPM/BW Working with quality personnel and quality functions Other Must be self motivated and goal oriented. The candidate/incumbent must be proactive rather than reactive and must be able to demonstrate personal initiative. Travel to customers/plants as needed (up to 25%)

description: Komaspec is a high-quality contract manufacturer for Brands, OEM & ODM. Our manufacturing operation enable innovative companies to develop and market new products using Komaspec manufacturing capabilities for complex plastic and metal assemblies. We are looking for Sales Coordinator.  Main Responsibilities:     1. Communicate with existing customers to coordinate shipping, invoicing, and other sales operational issues. 2. Cooperation with engineering department on the execution of product or packaging changes, especially in how they relate to or affect ongoing or new production (ECR management). 3. Assuring overall customer satisfaction and smooth communication 4. Purchase order booking 5. Production and shipment monitoring 6. Answering various customer inquiries (technical, delivery schedule, payments) 7. Coordinating company internal sales process inside the company (production, logistics, and finance) and providing timely feedback to the relevant account or sales manager in case of issues 8. Weekly production status tracking & reporting Qualification:   1. College degree 2. Must be able to communicate smoothly with foreign customers and use English in daily working environment. CET 6 or equivalent preferred 3. Order management, sales assistant, etc. experience，electrical, hardware, plastic and other manufacturing industries are preferred 4. Good coordination, organization and communication skills

About Stryker  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. We offer innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical, and Neurotechnology and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes. We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine. Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com  Position Summary  This position is responsible for achieving assigned sales quotas and increasing Stryker‘s presence in the market through leveraging resources in the assigned territory.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities: (Detailed Description) Implement sales activities to achieve budgeted sales and profitability goal. Support Business director / Sales Manager to formulate the sales plan and acitivites in accordance with local strategy, and identify market-specific needs, trends and opportunities for business growh. Maintain the network of cooperative relationship with business partners (dealers) and customers Prepare regular sales performance analysis, forecasts, and identify critical issues. Explore new accounts/business opportunities to build Strykers‘customer pool Prepare reports on market trends, consumer habits, competitor information on a monthly basis Compile customers‘feedback to drive high quality service and to expand business portfolio Education & Experience Degree holder in medicine or medical, or sales and marketing related area At least 3 years‘ relevant experience in medical devices or healthcare industry Prefer experience in, or direct exposure to, the healthcare product or medical device industry. Proven record in channel management Physical & Mental Requirements Excellent problem solving & interpersonal skills Results-oriented with good negotiation &communications skill Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to build and maintain key business relationships internally and externally. Demonstrated ability to work both collaboratively and independently in a cross-functional and team-oriented environment Know someone at Stryker?  Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program.

description: Responsibility: - Identify, develop and secure business opportunities for the respective OBU; generate qualified leads to meet BDE KPIs and to support BDM in meeting BU budgets. Follow up leads, assist BDM, PD’s and OBUGM’s to submit proposals and win projects. ▪ Work with the respective BDM to develop marketing strategies to achieve business leads and project wins to create sufficient business income to meet the objectives of the Business Plan. ▪ Identify strategies to promote Colliers PjM further within the markets in line with the Business Plan. ▪ In conjunction with the BDM, identify the QLF, create the proposals and achieve the wins to gain the income from the projects according budget plan with the support of BDM and PDs; direct, guide and motivate the BD Interns to identify new clients and support the BD team to achieve the business plan targets. - Understand Colliers PjM’s capability, have good sense of customer demand, and then work with operations and BD team to develop project management solution for customers; deliver effective presentations to maintain customer attention, leave a powerful impression and to manage their expectations with the aim of building Colliers PjM’s trustworthy professional image. - Identify and develop potential clients and client relationships by attracting, retaining and enhancing the relationship through proactive CRM to form a base of committed clients. - Establish and develop BD channels; Assess the effectiveness of channels and ensure that efforts are focused on using the appropriate channels for the agreed BU targets, whether they are in terms of secured income or strategic development. - Assist BU General Manager and BDM to develop business plans, strategies and BD materials in line with customer requirements, including proposals, responses to RFP’s, pre-qualifications, tender documents, presentations, charts, project sheets, slides, reports, CVs etc as required. - Organize and/or support the BDM in promotional activities to build Colliers PjM’s company brand and enhance sales growth with assigned BU; these activities includes seminars, workshops, conferences, industry fairs etc. - Proactively participate in periodic BD meetings as required from time to time to ensure common approaches across teams / offices, liaison and coordination with others in the company in respect of active clients and opportunities, adoption. - Coordinate with BDM and BD Interns in the updating and management of the database to ensure accurate information at all times.  Competency: - Marketing, business development or business related major. Engineering or construction related training is highly encouraged. - Full professional use of English, knowledge of other languages is suggested. - 2 years’ working experience in business development or a related sector. Sales or marketing background/experience preferable. - High degree of computer literacy in all aspects of Microsoft Office including Word, Outlook, Access, Excel and PowerPoint. - Proven team player who can also work on own initiative to plan and manage own workload. - Business understanding is beneficial.    What’s on offer A competitive base salary and benefits structure. Opportunity to work in an enterprising environment where you can accelerate you career growth. Future opportunities for both domestic and international opportunities. A global culture, with a strong focus on learning and development.

description: Provide leadership and direction regarding all Abbott interactions with strategic accounts – acting as a trusted advisor Lead and coach in a matrix management environment, e.g. lead a team through persuasion and personal influence that will deliver innovative solutions, high quality, that meet customer needs Follow and flawlessly execute strategic account management (SAM) process. Establish and build deep understanding of account needs, stakeholders and competitive situation Build and lead internal cross functional selling team to execute account strategies Analyze impact of market trends and factors on customers Develop strategic account plans for achieving goals including sales and margin Identify new business opportunities by initiating, developing or delivering unique solutions that result in improved outcomes for customer and company Negotiate long term contracts Oversee progress of cross-functional implementation team (post-sale) Identify new business opportunities to expand current Core Diagnostics share Requirement Bachelor degree or above in clinical/medical 3-5 years’ experience in healthcare / diagnostics industry (preferred) Strong solution selling and relationship building skills by individual Strong people sense of key stakeholders and customer dynamics Extensive experience managing strategic accounts/key accounts Experience working with senior level executives Ability to influence team member activities (without direct reporting relationship) Superior communication skills Good learning agility Be open to accept new concept/selling model

Donaldson is committed to solving the world’ s most complex filtration challenges. Employing innovation and breakthrough solutions, we are advancing filtration for a cleaner world. We look for the best people to help us succeed, offering opportunities to learn, effect change, and make meaningful contributions at work and in our communities. This is a place where you can make a world of difference.  Follow Us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/donaldson/  Job Purpose  New segment business development manager, responsible for IAF business development in Li-battery, Polysilicon and Pharmaceutical segments , need to define business strategy, win the breakthrough, accumulate application expertise and set up scalability in target segments .  Key Accountability Be responsible for IAF business development in Li-battery, Polysilicon and Pharmaceutical segments. Study and work out the whole process maps, application opportunities, customer requirements and key pain points in filtration. Drive new product development, build up solution offering and value story to meet customer expectation. Win the key breakthroughs in target application and ensure successfully commissioning, drive the team to accumulate industrial expertise and segment know-how. Work out segment story(PPT), be responsible for the segment branding, participate promotion events and exhibitions, as well as industry conferences; Build up cooperation and relationship with key players in target segments: key End Users, key OEMs, key Design Institutes, General Contractors and key Dealers; Work out the selling tools in focused segments, including segment PPT, brochures, success stories, application PPT, playbook… Conduct internal segment training to EQT and AFM sales to ensure the opportunities can be followed up effectively. Build up business scalability in targeted segments. Define segment business strategy and plan, drive and monitor business progress as segment business leader. Key Qualifications & Requirements Bachelor’s degree or above, majored in Engineering and Science Great communication and presentation skills, expert level interpersonal skills; Strong business sense, Systematic thinking, outstanding planning and execution skills; Proven success working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment Good time-management skills Detail oriented, result oriented, customer oriented, ambitious and aggressive Open-minded and continuous learning Keen to business opportunities, eager to win >5 years’ technical experience in Li-battery, Polysilicon or Pharmaceutical industries. Or >5 years on-hand sales experience in filtration industry. A plus for good relationships with potential customer; Able to read and write English and Chinese ~30% domestic travel Come make a World of Difference! description: JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT The Commercial Analyst will support the Commercial Leaders to lead our global and regional projects and initiatives on commercial excellence capabilities, including rolling out Cargill’s Commercial Excellence(CE) program on strategic pricing, sales enablement, route to market for various enterprises in line with their “Go-To-Market “ strategies. We seek a professional who will collaborate with senior team members to analyze and translate insight into strategies and tactics  and be a key resource on commercial excellence initiatives .  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES Provide analytics support to deliver commercial excellence projects to internal/external business clients by supporting the roadmap and the implementation timeline. Help implement core processes for diagnostics, hypothesis development & testing, development of business recommendations and implementation of core capabilities Build visual analytics dashboards in Tableau/Power BI to support the commercial excellence initiatives Analyze data and survey results to contribute to making the CE Center of Excellence team truly cross functional, with solid and unchallengeableanalysis Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience Minimum of two years of related work experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English Demonstrated ability to problem solve and use analytical thinking Strong proficiency across Microsoft Office products (PowerPoint, Teams, Excel…etc). Demonstrated ability to work effectively and confidentially with various levels of organization and potentially customers  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS MBA preferred Minimum 2-4 years’ experience in one of the following: Sales, Commercial Management, FP&A, Trading, Business Development, Demand Planning, Modeling Ability to travel regionally post pandemic – 20-30% Demonstrated strong analytical capabilities –Ability to blend data using Alteryx or similar tools and visualize and analyze it using tools like Tableau/Power BI Commercial mindset, and strong business acumen Ability to quickly understand system architecture Ability to translate business need to technical/functional design for Business Intelligence Language requirements: Excellent verbal and written communication skills in  English. (Other language could be plus but not required)

description: This position will be responsible to drive sales growth of building solutions at selected enterprise accounts within the Commercial Real Estate vertical market ( including Developers, Facilities Management Companies and Hospitality ) while leveraging the broad building business units (HVAC, Building Automation, Fire and Security, Energy Performance Solutions).  Key Responsibilities Develop strategic growth plans to facilitate building systems, solutions and services sales. Drive collaboration across business unit sales organizations to execute comprehensive account growth strategies and increase sales at enterprise accounts Gain access to senior customer decision-makers including VP level decision makers in Construction, Operations, Facility Management, and Procurement. Build and strengthen key customer relationships with senior decision makers Drive and support strategic marketing efforts in target vertical market: assess market opportunities, evaluate customer needs and competitor offerings, identify potential building solutions and services for customers, engage customers with a strong value proposition and help execute marketing plans Collaborate with the engineering organization to identify, develop and deliver a suite of building solutions and services to customers. Work with the engineering and development team to identify, qualify, and gain customer commitment around solution opportunities which will provide significant market differentiation in focus vertical domain Key Requirements Bachelor’s degree and above in engineering or related field with demonstrated sales and marketing experience Proven experience developing and managing Commercial developing and managing Commercial Real Estate, Integrated Facility Management, Developer, and Owners Proven experience in navigating and managing complex networks of decision-makers, stakeholders, and project team members across various construction project delivery models inclusive of programming, design, construction, and commissioning project phases Ability to gain access to and engage with senior executives and create demand for new solutions Proven experience and ability to develop and execute consultative sales strategies that drive value growth for customers About The Client  A world-known HVAC solution provider.

Sales or marketing background/experience is preferable.  4. Proven team player who can also work on own initiative to plan and manage own workload. What’s In It For You Access to best in class resources, tools, and technology while supporting a world class sales organization Opportunity for advanced career path options in sales, corporate accounts or management Eligible to enroll in benefits from day one – no waiting period for coverage What You Will Do Maintain key relationships with customers and internal departments to build degree and above 3 years of administrative support experience Intermediate proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) No Immigration Sponsorship available for this Join our technology driven Sales Team  Our Digital Solutions business provides intelligent, connected technologies to monitor and control our energy extraction assets. We provide customers with the peace of mind needed to reliably and efficiently improve their operations. Our team identifies new customers and collaborates with cross-functional teams to provide technical guidance and direction for our innovative technology solutions.  Partner with the best  As Lead Sales Specialist, you’ll be involved in long-term planning and development to the overall sales strategy of your team. In a high-impact, fast-paced environment you will work with an exciting, exclusive product line. As a trusted leader, you’ll find joy in delivering successful outcomes for customers through innovation, strategic solutions, strong relationships and thorough business understanding.  As a Lead Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for:  Responsible for selling x-ray system in China. Responsible for preparing technical materials and performing commercial & technical discussions with potential clients. Responsible for making bid documents, bid opening and bid clarification. Be good at working with channels. Deliver on all internal targets: i.e. orders, convertible orders, revenue and margin Provide an accurate sales forecast of each Q, build up strong pipelines for every year. Boundless support to other BHGE product lines by sharing and expanding opportunities in the same customers as much as possible; Be knowledgeable and sensible in economic market, competitive threat and NPI effects; Ensure successful implementation of Sales Strategy and develop work model for proactive selling and prospecting.  Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will have:  Bachelor degree or above in Engineering, preferably in NDT. At least 3 years work experience in Technical Sales. background Customer centricity with result-oriented mindset Strong communication skills; Strong reading and written skills in English, common level of oral English above Level 4. description: Company Summary  IHS Markit (NASDAQ: INFO) is the leading source of information and insight in pivotal areas that shape today's business landscape: Finance, energy, economics, geopolitical risk, sustainability and supply chain management. Businesses and governments around the globe rely on our comprehensive content, expert independent analysis and flexible delivery methods to make high-impact decisions and develop strategies with speed and confidence. IHS Markit is headquartered in London. Trusted by clients for more than 50 years, IHS Markit employs more than 8,000 people in 31 countries. We serve 80 percent of the Global Fortune 500 as well as businesses and governments in 165 countries.  General Job Duties Establish and maintain senior level relationships in major functional areas of the customer organization. Utilize the relationships to develop strong revenue growth initiatives for all Auto products as well as retain our existing business within the account. However, the main focus of this position will be to generate new business through the Supplier business. Follow and execute a structured solution sales process for revenue growth and prospecting. Able to uncover new revenue opportunities within an account based on the understanding of the works flows and strategies being deployed within the accounts. Develop knowledge and thorough understanding of all IHS Markit Automotive products and services and apply knowledge to provide appropriate recommendations/solutions that meets their business requirements. Achieve net new revenue growth targets and maximize retention capabilities within accounts. Introduce new IHS Markit Automotive products and services with the accounts. Generate and deliver compelling sales proposals to customers. Observation and understanding of customer workflows and processes, tailor solutions to enhance overall Insight value to customer organization. Specific Job Duties New business generation will be a must in this role. The ability to generate and identify potential customers as well as understand the customers workflow to identify a client's needs will be essential. Manage renewal sales process for existing customer base, including setting of expectations, changing needs assessments, negotiating contracts and processing of contracts via relevant internal systems. Prepare and execute strategic account plan. Review with Line manager on a weekly/monthly basis. Follow up on all inbound client inquiries, webinars, workshops, events to uncover new and expanding opportunities. Maintain consistent and ongoing contact with end-users and decision makers. Prospect, present to, and close on new sales opportunities within client base. Accurately forecast expected sales and cancellations to Line Manager on a daily/weekly/monthly basis. Provide ongoing product feedback from clients to Line Manager and Product Managers. Maintain awareness of, and participate in all relevant training for, new products and capabilities, and market them to account base/prospects. Maintain salesforce, contracting process and all related sales administration work. Required Education Bachelor's degree in science, engineering, or auto industry-related fields required. Any equivalent combination of experience and education could be considered. Required Experience 6-8 years sales experience in automotive related business is required. Required Skills Excellent communication skills with customer and internal organization verbally and written is essential. Result-oriented. Understand key sales/procurement process and account management. Connect customer values and products/services. Self-driven and motivated for learning new things. Can work under high pressure. Frequent travel is required. 3-4 days per week. Native Mandarin and fluent English. Line Manager Sales Director, North Asia, Automotive Location Shanghai, China. description: 国际销售工程师 岗位职责  找到客户，达成订单 客户维护，深度娃聚客户需求 参与制定销售策略和销售方案 产品销售资料的制定 竞争对手分析，挖掘产品的竞争力 区域：国际范围的市场  任职要求： 1. 生物、生物技术、检验医学等相关专业，本科以上学历 2. 好的英文沟通交流能力，听说读写无障碍； 3. 相关工作经验优先考虑；海外生活经验优先考虑 4. 团队合作精神，喜欢单打独斗的勿投 5. 责任感强，具备良好的方案策划能力和执行力，较强的人际沟通交往能力，结果导向。

Position Description  To capitalize the business opportunities from mainland clients’ investments in overseas financial products (such as securities, futures, unit trust/mutual funds, structured products, etc). Provide customer service and conduct marketing activities to clients (account managers and direct clients).  Promote brokerage business with a view to acquire new wealth management clients and achieve synergies within group companies.  Key Areas of Responsibilities  Maintain good relationship with the existing HNW & Corporate clients Develop business for wealth management clients in generating revenue through secondary and primary broking activities. Scope of work includes account opening, CDD&KYC, product roadshow, project pitching, clients visit in greater China as well as ad-hoc projects. Provide trading and dealing services, including HK and overseas equities, fixed income, futures, commodities and enlisted 3rd party products, also provide post-trade review and data analysis to key clients Participate in internal and external business development activities, discover innovative and popular financial product and raise request to product team. Support Wealth Management team to promote company’s professional image Possess strong integrity, compliance sense, willingness to learn and progress Participate internal and external business development activities Support Wealth Management team to increase company’s brand, product awareness among different clients and market share and penetration Handle ad-hoc projects as required.   Requirements  Degree holder or above in Business / Finance discipline Minimum 3 years of working experience (e.g. front-line sales and customer service) in the financial industry Attained relevant SFC licenses for carrying out Type 1 & Type 2 regulated activities. Result-oriented with strong initiative and drive to succeed. Customer-focused and able to work under pressure Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with local sales representatives experience in providing witness services for account opening Strong capabilities of client’s order handling and trading Good knowledge in financial planning and wealth products Possess strong business network in China and have good connections with clients who are interested in investing in overseas financial products Excellent communication, interpersonal and relationship skills Good command of written and spoken English and Cantonese and Mandarin  Work Locations : Hong Kong \ Beijing \ Shanghai \ Shenzhen \ Qingdao \ Hangzhou    If you are seeking a dynamic environment in which to build your career in CLSA, please send your resume to recruitment@clsa.com. Kindly specify the position title in the email subject for job application.  CLSA may collect personal data from you for purposes relating to your engagement with the Company, including human resource management and other business and internal / external compliance purposes. Any personal information and /or data collected and held by the Company may be used by the Company or transferred (whether within/ outside Hong Kong) to any other parties within the Company, subsidiaries and affiliates of the Company, internal or external service providers, or any other relevant parties including governmental or regulatory authorities, for the above purposes.

description: Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges  工作职责: 面向电子、汽车、家电、机械加工等行业客户，负责工业互联网+智能制造领域解决方案和产品的市场拓展和销售，独立负责客户开发、项目落地、内外部协调、验收回款等全栈业务工作，完成公司要求的销售目标 熟悉工业企业的生产制造、采购和供应链等业务流程，作为顾问式销售，深入挖掘客户需求和痛点，与SA及产研团队配合，制定有针对性的解决方案，并根据客户需求进行方案的讲解和演示 全程参与客户项目的招投标，与SA团队配合完成项目的前期方案规划、标的应答、现场述标，对项目招投标的结果负责 根据智能制造软件产品和解决方案、客户需求及相关行业业态，聚合上下游产业资源，打造健康、可持续发展的产业生态 收集并研究电子 汽车 家电 机械加工等行业的发展方向，以及行业趋势、价值和商业模式，为客户提供创新的业务场景、商业模式实施建议 配合公司不定期组织市场活动，扩大品牌影响力  职责要求: 统招全日制本科及以上学历，5年以上项目销售经验；具备软件产品直销经验，从事过工业控制，制造执行，生产管理软件（MES、MOM、SCADA、PCS、WMS等）SRM产品直销经验优先 熟悉大型企业及行业的业务运作模式，具备3年以上综合信息化解决方案或软件产品销售经验，有500万金额以上独立运作项目经验，在大型集团性企业或行业有客户资源 熟悉工业互联网、MES、ERP、大数据等相关领域的技术，能够根据客户的实际情况，快速构建符合乃至超越用户预期整体解决方案，并且能够在客户实践中沉淀行业打法，在行业或者区域快速复制 具备良好的市场规划、销售过程管理、内外部资源整合、协同实施推进及生态拓展能力 熟练应用各类办公软件，具备良好的逻辑分析及语言表达能力 敢于接受挑战，抗压能力强；具备较强团队合作精神，为人正直，作风严谨，具有高度的责任感及职业操守 熟悉规模以上工业企业客户，有大型项目实施成功案例者优先 具备独立运作地方工业互联网项目落地能力的优先 Additional Information JOB ID: req297668 Category: Sales Location: Building 1, Lane 555, Huan Ke Road, Zhangjiang,Shanghai,SHANGHAI,201203,China Exempt Global (ALL)

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

description: The Opportunities  Unity Technologies is looking for a hardworking, upbeat Sales Account Executive to join our growing team. You will help drive success with our strategic customers and prospective customers in China. You will work under the Sales, Director and connect with other key internal & external partners for strategies to drive adoption of the technical Unity platform, solutions, services and build deep and lasting customer partnerships.  What You’ll Be Doing  Identify new strategic partnership opportunities within the vertical Structure, negotiate and close partnerships in order to meet or exceed objectives Responsible for driving revenue and consistently meeting quarterly sales targets Develop a proven pipeline by defining opportunities and market potential, identifying sales leads, and working with internal teams to close accounts Creatively thinking and crafting our strategy around the industries and region, including pricing, products, and market strategies Work with various divisions (including Development, Marketing, Support, Finance and Legal) to gain support for key initiatives and deals What We’re Looking For  Direct sales/business development experience with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding exciting individual revenue targets Comfortable representing a technology company and partnering with CEOs, CTOs, engineers, or other technical staff to build solutions, and at the same time able to structure, develop and execute strategic agreements on the commercial side Strong understanding of potential applications for real-time 3D technology in various industries Life at Unity  Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.  The company’s 1,800+ person research and development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than five billion times per month in 2020. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.  Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, disability, gender, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.  Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.  #SEN

description: The ideal candidate will lead initiatives to generate and engage with business partners to build new facility management business for the company. This candidate will be focused and have strong communication skills. They should be able to think critically when making plans and have a demonstrated ability to execute a particular strategy.   Responsibilities To negotiate and successfully close sales opportunities to meet and exceed agreed sales targets within the target markets agreed by the Head of Sales and Managing Director. To develop and build long-term professional customer relationships with existing, new and potential clients. Maintain excellent relationships and after sales support to build mutual confidence in line with the agreed business strategy. Take complete ownership of, develop and deliver exceptional sales and tender documents and presentations, in line with Company standards. Generate tenders and relevant document preparation, using the specialist support functions, Operational and Sales Leadership team. Ensuring at all times that the Knowledge Base contains the highest quality and most up to date examples of "what good looks like". Full ownership of the pricing and solution of new tender and rebid opportunities Ensure that appropriate sign-offs and governance processes are understood and adhered to when leading new business opportunities. Work close with company IT teams to build up innovation profitable business. Ensure the accuracy and quality of all sales reporting. Raise the company and business profile by representing Prime IFM at industry events, high level networking and promoting an image of professionalism at all times. Keep up-to-date with industry developments, maintaining awareness of competitor activity and market trends. Maintain the relevant contract documentation in the support of tenders and re-bids for the Business utilising the Knowledge Base Take full ownership of all re-bids within their division.  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience 3 - 4 years' prior facilities management business development experience Strong communication and interpersonal skills Proven knowledge and execution of successful development strategies Focused and goal-oriented

ClarkMorgan is a small but impactful Corporate Training company that delivers some of the best training in the world. We are extremely lucky to have access to an amazing selection of trainers that deliver a wide selection of trainings from Presentation Skills training to Strategic Change Management. We provide a fun and supportive working environment that empowers you to take initiative and to learn continuously With office in Shanghai, Beijing, Hong Kong, Bangkok and London, we work with some of the best trainers in the world to deliver truly transformational training. We are looking for energetic, dynamic individuals to add to our team.   Responsibilities  Manage and develop a selection of MNC clients to deliver trainings that have a real impact Develop new contacts and build relationships with HR managers and trainers Promote our regular free training events to our HR clients and create a buzz in the market Develop an excellent understanding of our training services and trainers to ensure the right fit between client and training Attend regular business and training networking events to develop a greater understanding of our industry Communicate across the organisation to seek the help you need to deliver the best training experiences possible  Employee requestments 3 years+ of sales experience or customer relationship management preferred Proficient spoken and written English Proactive, open-minded, positive, willing to learn and team-work oriented  Able to connect and build relationships with the team, HR clients and trainers  Salary  Basic salary: 8K-10K/month +commission   How do you apply for the position: Please send your resume to admin@clarkmorgan.com
