The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

description: Company Description  TeamViewer is a leading global technology company that provides a connectivity platform to remotely access, control, manage, monitor, and repair devices of any kind – from laptops and mobile phones to industrial machines and robots. TeamViewer proactively shapes digital transformation and continuously innovates in the fields of Augmented Reality, Internet of Things or Artificial Intelligence. Since the company’s foundation in 2005, TeamViewer’s software has been installed on more than 2.2 billion devices around the world. The company is headquartered in Goppingen, Germany, and employs more than 1,000 people globally.  Job Description  Identify and onboard potential key partners active in the Enterprise business (System Integrators, Consulting firms, Independent Software Vendors, VARs) Facilitate business development with these partners, assisting them in developing a long-term successful strategy for achieving their business goals Align on a revenue commitment based on the partner program Manage the sales forecast, drive pipeline and registration/escalation process for your region Work closely with the distribution partner to qualify new opportunities and position the best partner, to help build the best offer, and to apply unified approach with partners Work with marketing to execute sales strategy and promote product enhancements and new product features Recruit new partners, build business plan, customer mapping & objectives Develop and implement the sales, certification & technical enablement of partner teams Promote TeamViewer Enterprise products & strategy through product demos, participation in marketing events, developing brand awareness, developing co-marketing with partners in collaboration with TeamViewer marketing team Qualifications  Proven channel sales and account management experience in OT/IT industry including relationship building for 5 years or longer Responsible for the China market Experience selling software/SaaS platform products to enterprise or large organizations via partners is preferable. Experience in managing channel partners for a SaaS vendor Business level English skills plus Mandarin or Cantonese skills Motivated to work with leading-edge technologies and applying those to drive business value to partners Customer focused with the willingness to go the extra mile to exceed partner expectations Ability to work independently and thrive in a fast paced environment Ability to manage multiple tasks and work with different departmental teams Flexibility, adaptability and quick to learn new skills Desire and commitment to do what it takes to be successful in sales Positive outlook and a strong ability to take responsibility and being accountable for own actions and decisions Additional Information  We truly live and celebrate our cultural diversity: our colleagues come from from more than 60 countries and speak more than 40 languages. "If I were CEO, I would..." Say what you're thinking! We live an open-door policy and our managing directors are always open to feedback and suggestions. We work hard, and play harder! Look forward to company celebrations, team events and other social gathering TeamViewer is used even in Space. What else can we achieve with your help? Do you want to work where you can see the results of your contribution - immediately? If you are motivated by excellence; like to get things done; are full of energy and seek opportunities with huge growth potential then you are a perfect fit for TeamViewer.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Have we got a job for you?!  China Business Partner, Shanghai  Build Your Career | Have Fun | Make a Difference  About Payoneer  Payoneer’s mission is to empower businesses to go beyond – beyond borders, limits and expectations. In today’s digital world, Payoneer enables any business of any size from anywhere to access new economic opportunities by making it possible to transact as easily globally as they do locally.  Payoneer’s digital platform streamlines global commerce for millions of small businesses, marketplaces and enterprises from 200 countries and territories. Leveraging its robust technology, compliance, operations and banking infrastructure, Payoneer delivers a suite of services that includes cross-border payments, working capital, tax solutions and risk management. Powering growth for customers ranging from aspiring entrepreneurs in emerging markets to the world’s leading digital brands like Airbnb, Amazon, Google and Upwork, Payoneer makes global commerce easy and secure.  Payoneer Has Accumulated Numerous Prestigious Accolades, Including But Not Limited To  Payoneer is a leading fintech company built to disrupt today’s way of commerce.  Payoneer - one world, one platform, endless opportunities.  About Payoneer China  Ever since its inception, Payoneer China has grown at a blistering speed with 250+ employees serving hundreds of thousands of customers. Payoneer China currently is the market leader in cross border payments for ecommerce, B2B trade, and mobile applications. We are also well positioned to grow our business into other business verticals, delivering a portfolio of products and services.  This is a unique opportunity for talents to participate in a fast moving environment to provide disruptive products and solutions that solve real commercial challenges. It is also a great opportunity to super charge your career and to amplify professional growth, business acumen, and cross industry experience.  We’re looking for  An Operations Business Partner that works intensively with both business and operations teams to improve customer experience and to attain business goals. The primary responsibility of the Business Partner is to work with the various teams in China to identify business / operation gaps, align on solutions, and to manage projects to implement solutions.  What’s the job?  The Ideal Candidate Will Need The Following Competencies To Succeed  Strong knowledge of online payments is a requirement. Experience with cross-border payments and ecommerce is preferred. User Orientation - this role will have a strong focus on metrics which track user-experience dynamics and identifies / anticipates changing opportunities for improvement. They will have very strong user insight in terms of what their requirements and pain points to translate hard consumer data to identify underlying user behavior in order to put together compelling business cases / proposals to align the business and operations teams. Strategic and Analytical Skills - successful proposals should align with the company’s business strategy hence the individual must be well versed in understanding not only the vision and strategy but also key underlying drivers to get there. Fintech innovations are complex and require big picture perspective as well as logical and strong problem-solving mind-set. Ability to understand and leverage user and system data is also an important skill. Results Orientation - This is very important since outstanding candidates must have a strong drive and commitment to deliver impactful proposals. Such success metrics are not easy to define, therefore the successful candidate must be able to define appropriate KPIs which he/she and his/her team will be measured against. A strong candidate also has exceptional project management knowhow to orchestrate large development efforts and constantly provide support, feedback and push the project forward. Collaboration and Influencing - He/she has the ability to spot areas that need change and champion the case across the organization. He/she also must have the ability to work proactively across different business units teams is a must. Typical proposals require large teams from cross functional areas such as technology, marketing, sales, finance, in addition to the leadership team and colleagues in China and back in the HQ. The candidate compromises for the ‘greater good’ when necessary but can also influence decision making in a sophisticated manner to ensure necessary resources for own operations.   Have you done this kind of stuff? 8+ years of project / program management experience 3+ years as an account manager or operations expert Demonstrable knowledge of managing multiple concurrent projects through the full lifecycle Strong understanding of e-commerce, social media, retail inventory management, search engine marketing, and web analytics. Energetic self-starter, entrepreneurial spirit. Experience starting and leading new initiatives. Excellent communication skills Must enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic, and fluid environment, and be able to think strategically and independently. Ability to work with and indirectly lead a spectrum of teams from operations to marketing to sales. Added Plus – experience in Fintech or Financial Services Willing to be based in Shanghai and travel as needed. Fluency in English & Chinese a must (spoken & written). Unquestioned work ethics and personal and professional judgment.

ClarkMorgan is a small but impactful Corporate Training company that delivers some of the best training in the world. We are extremely lucky to have access to an amazing selection of trainers that deliver a wide selection of trainings from Presentation Skills training to Strategic Change Management. We provide a fun and supportive working environment that empowers you to take initiative and to learn continuously With office in Shanghai, Beijing, Hong Kong, Bangkok and London, we work with some of the best trainers in the world to deliver truly transformational training. We are looking for energetic, dynamic individuals to add to our team.   Responsibilities  Manage and develop a selection of MNC clients to deliver trainings that have a real impact Develop new contacts and build relationships with HR managers and trainers Promote our regular free training events to our HR clients and create a buzz in the market Develop an excellent understanding of our training services and trainers to ensure the right fit between client and training Attend regular business and training networking events to develop a greater understanding of our industry Communicate across the organisation to seek the help you need to deliver the best training experiences possible  Employee requestments 3 years+ of sales experience or customer relationship management preferred Proficient spoken and written English Proactive, open-minded, positive, willing to learn and team-work oriented  Able to connect and build relationships with the team, HR clients and trainers  Salary  Basic salary: 8K-10K/month +commission   How do you apply for the position: Please send your resume to admin@clarkmorgan.com

jobTitle: Assistant Manager, Sales, East & North of China, Personal Care Solution
description: BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With large production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, as well as a global and regional research and development hub in Shanghai, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry. BASF posted sales of approximately €8.5 billion in 2020 to customers in Greater China and employed 8,948 people as of the end of the year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en.  Objectives Follow sales strategies and tactics to achieve sales target and KPI Lead, challenge and support distribution, marketing, technical and customer service to realize the sales plan together. Main Tasks Responsible for the day-to-day sales management in the respective area. Solicit new business and retain, penetrate existing business to drive growth. Meet or exceed operational requirements: analytical reporting, cost initiatives, reviews. Increase efficiency and effectiveness. Strengthen customer relationship management. Maintain knowledge of market trends, competitive actions, product needs, and customer base. Create sales plans and deliver accordingly. Manage sales within OTC framework, responsible for accurate sales forecasting. Realize the yearly budgeted results in terms of volumes and market profit. Requirements Education: Bachelor’s or above degree in Chemical related major and/or Business Administration or related discipline Working Experience: Minimum 5 years’ relevant working experience of sales, experience in technical service and/or marketing is plus. Solid selling skills with a proven track record of problem solving and decision-making ability Result and customer oriented. Professional appearance with a can-do attitude. Excellent command in English is plus

Acting as the main contact point between the company (Advantest) and assigned customers; Building and maintaining strong and long-term relationships with assigned customers at all levels (from engineers to department managers); Communicating and presenting Advantest' products, solutions and capabilities to the customers, as well as identifying and communicating the customer's technology, commercial and production needs to the company. Obtaining market and competition intelligence, customer organisational structures, product lines and road maps, and feedback to internal departments. Developing and executing sales plans to win new businesses from the customers Preparing pricing quotations; negotiating to final price and submitting documents to book orders. Working together with other internal functions to ensure timely and successful delivery of Advantest products, solutions and services to customers and/or theirs subcontractors. Coordinating and working with other internal functions to provide customer support (including customers' subcontractors) to ensure customer satisfactions. Developing and executing account management plans, Other related account management and sales activities. Requirements Minimum 2 years of relevant sales/account management experience in semiconductor industry. Demonstrated ability to communicate with and present to internal and external stakeholders at all levels. Excellent verbal and written communications skills in both Chinese and English. Bachelors or Master Degree in EE or MBA or equivalent

description: About  About Us 作为销售主任，您需要能够完成以下工作内容： 工作概述﹣(职位概述) 参与销售工作和活动来协助销售经理成功的完成客房收入和其它创收方面的预算。 主要职责﹣(职务的主要工作) 与销售经理一起计划并执行销售策略，完成预算。 销售酒店的所有设施，并跨酒店销售其它洲际酒店。 通过制定和执行工作方案来开发新业务客戶，维护现有业务客戶。 转化销售线索。 与高职位员工一起处理客户或可能成为客户的业务。 根据建立起来的监测数据接收和拒绝业务。 执行使客人熟悉环境的现场考察活动。 保持定期的电话销售模式。 监测同档次酒店并与经理就策略的更改进行交流。 参加例会。 招待潜在客户和现有重要客户以获得业务和创造更多销售额。 按要求汇报销售工作和战绩。 参加客户拜访。 与所在区域内的洲际酒店集团成员和区域预订办公室保持定期联系。 监测竞争对手的工作。 在市场上创造声誉。 协助销售经理分发宣传品和直邮广告。 与业务供应方，会展策划人，游客或会展旅行代理，旅行社，航空公司，公司，政府部门及其它与酒店业务密切相关方建立和保持联系。 依照业务需求开展工作。  Your day to day 除了以上职位描述中我们阐述的岗位要求外，您还要符合以下条件： 技能要求 具有代表酒店，品牌和公司与顾客，员工和第三方交往的能力。 具有解决问题和组织能力。 精通微软办公软件 良好的写作技能 学历 最好具有市场营销，酒店管理，商业管理或相关领域的大专学历或职业证书。 经验 1年相关工作经验，或与此相当的教育与工作经验结合的背景。  Apply

Intro: At 评价达人 we are looking for Sales Managers who take pride on delivering high quality work in the influencers marketing space. If you are outstanding at developing impactful relationships with brand managers, promotion managers and their agencies in the digital and social media landscapes by creating seamless strategies to drive impact and growth, then we’d love to hear from you.   Key Responsibilities: Identify relevant leads and locate contact information Contact target partners to make initial introduction of 评价达人 services in order to secure phone calls and meetings  Close new businesses Collaborate with the rest of the account management team to strategize new ways to present solutions based on 评价达人 competitive advantages Elaborate keynotes and proposals   Skills & Knowledge: Experience in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs  Creative thinker and resourceful problem solver Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills Self-motivated and able to thrive in a results-driven environment Understanding of digital marketing, measurement, analytics and internet technology Strong Excel and PowerPoint/Keynote skills 1+years of relevant experience in Corporate Business Development with agency background desirable Proficient in Chinese and English (Verbal and Written)  If you are up to this position, don't hesitate to send us your resume and cover letter at talent@pjdaren.com

Manage local NPD (New Product Development)/communication taskforce to ensure appropriate rollout of commercial initiatives Manage local social network community in accordance with platform approved digital strategy and leveraging the CMS (Content Management System) for digital assets Coordinate with Sales and CIBA (Consumer Insight and Business Analysis) to lead the segment analysis the planning of consumer and trade promotions for assigned segment, brand, or project Identify shopper insights and translate them into actionable plans to win at the POS (Point of Sales) for assigned category Required Skills/Experience/Competencies Bachelor’s degree and above 5 years and above experience combined with Marketing/Sales, expertise in commercializing initiatives with excellence Job Requirements Full time work SC Johnson Asia has been recognized as the Best Multinational Workplace by Great Place to Work®! Our platform empowers advertisers to connect with over 1 billion monthly active users through value exchange advertising that drives awareness, engagement, and the metrics that matter most to their overall growth. description: About Stryker  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. We offer innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical, and Neurotechnology and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes. We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine. Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com  Position Summary  This position is responsible for achieving assigned sales quotas and increasing Stryker‘s presence in the market through leveraging resources in the assigned territory.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities: (Detailed Description) Implement sales activities to achieve budgeted sales and profitability goal. Support Business director / Sales Manager to formulate the sales plan and acitivites in accordance with local strategy, and identify market-specific needs, trends and opportunities for business growh. Maintain the network of cooperative relationship with business partners (dealers) and customers Prepare regular sales performance analysis, forecasts, and identify critical issues. Explore new accounts/business opportunities to build Strykers‘customer pool Prepare reports on market trends, consumer habits, competitor information on a monthly basis Compile customers‘feedback to drive high quality service and to expand business portfolio Education & Experience Degree holder in medicine or medical, or sales and marketing related area At least 3 years‘ relevant experience in medical devices or healthcare industry Prefer experience in, or direct exposure to, the healthcare product or medical device industry. Proven record in channel management Physical & Mental Requirements Excellent problem solving & interpersonal skills Results-oriented with good negotiation &communications skill Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to build and maintain key business relationships internally and externally. Demonstrated ability to work both collaboratively and independently in a cross-functional and team-oriented environment Know someone at Stryker?  Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program.

Participate to plan and implement sales activities to achieve defined targets and support key account  business strategies, including GE, Philips etc; Take on complete customer management responsibility, including sales forecast, supply planning and delivery, order handling and payment to enhance customer satisfaction and profitability; Visit customers to understand their development needs, strengthen customer relations and develop new business opportunity; Manage A/R, understand their capital and held stock status, discover the risk in time and provide valued suggestion to line manager; Keep good communication with related departments, lead and organize engineer and Manufacture unit handle  complaint responsively to ensure satisfaction of customer; Actively explore new sales opportunities to continuously broaden the business platform.

该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibility Level  Responsible to develop, implement and track OEM projects with specific car manufacturer and key account customers. Develop and enhance the relationship with OEM project and drive the program development across departments.  Typical Duties Responsible for identifying and implementing profitable business opportunities with all relevant customers Develop and maintain OEM customers according to company's strategy, market plan and positioning to ensure a long-term partnership. Establish agents if necessary to assist achieve sales target. Support strategic sales planning, annual budget and the monthly forecasts and ensure the implementation. Establish a trusting relationship with all direct customer for purposes of anticipating customer needs, maintaining existing and generating new business opportunities to achieve the sales target. Follow up customer’s service requirements of order and delivery, sales forecast, co-ordinate among various departments to ensure the stable supplying and reasonable safety stock for customers. Prepares and conducts quotations and price negotiations and in consultation with superior to prepare and implement all appropriate contracts. Ensures timely and qualified response to all customers’ inquiries, concerns and requests to achieve the highest degree of customer satisfaction. Support and coordinate technical assessment request from customers. Prepares and provides annual business plans, forecasts and other standard performance reports Collect and report marketing information. Requirements Bachelor's degree or above in Engineering or relevant subjects Min.7 years' experience in automotive engineering or account management field Project management skills Min.5 years' experience in OE business sales experience Strong skills in problem solving and negotiation Good command of MS Office (PowerPoint, excel, etc.) Fluent local and English language This position is from our group company: Tunap international trading company

Qualifications Bachelor’s degree from a reputable institution; advanced degree preferred 10+ years of experience in a multinational bank or consulting firm and spent time in a management role Experience in strategic project planning, business process revamp, pricing control, retail/SEM/private banking sales or service transformation (including frontline rollout), digitalization will be highly preferred Extensive experience in rolling out and managing large-scale implementation projects Superior problem solving and analytical skills Strong people skills and ability to engage all levels of the organization Strong, persuasive written and verbal communication skills in Mandarin and English Comfort with extensive travel (4-5 days a week)  What You'll Do  You will work in small teams with colleagues and clients to build the strategies, capabilities, systems and processes needed to deliver bottom-line results and ensure those results will be sustained.  In this role, you will manage projects and progress by tracking metrics, handling complex analyses and preparing communications to report back to client and internal leadership. You'll develop practical recommendations and contribute to team discussions on implications of analysis, identifying implementation challenges. You'll work alongside the client’s staff on each project, assisting with implementation tasks such as facilitating working sessions with front-line and supervisors, connecting with and motivating the client team, or developing skills of McKinsey or client team members when appropriate, principally through coaching. You'll also solicit feedback from team members to develop your own skills.  WHO YOU'LL WORK WITHYou’ll be working with McKinsey Implementation – a rapidly growing capability for our firm – in our Shanghai, Beijing, Shenzhen, Hong Kong or Taipei office. You’ll work closely with our client project teams, providing end-to-end support to ensure that the clients are able to deliver and sustain the full benefits of McKinsey’s recommended change in their business.

description: BeiGene continues to grow at a rapid pace with challenging and exciting opportunities for experienced professionals. When considering candidates, we look for scientific and business professionals who are highly motivated, collaborative, and most importantly, share our passionate interest in fighting cancer.  Job Description  Essential Functions of the job:  Training Needs Analysis and Program Design Conduct organization diagnosis to identify the competency gap and training needs Develop training strategies and plans based on the needs to ensure the sales team is fully competent to achieve an excellent level of sales performance. Training Delivery and Effectiveness tracking Train and coach sales team to upgrade their sales competence, including but not limited to selling skills, KOL engagement, territory management, field coaching…. Ensure the sales team has superior product and disease knowledge and well applied in their daily sales call. Strongly support stakeholder to customize the region program and cascade the central project. Partner with marketing team to ensure the marketing strategy is fully understood and well executed by the sales team. Conduct field coaching to follow the behavior change of Sales Rep and Area Sales Managers and help them get continuously competency improvement Evaluate training effectiveness and collect feedback from attendees and supervisors Make training records Sales Promotion Evaluation and People Development Program Implementation In charge of the sales promotion process, evaluate the behavior and competency based on the promotion criteria Provide feedback in terms of the evaluation result to Qualification Required  Qualifications and Competencies: 4-5 years sales training experience in MNC pharma company 1 year+ Sales management experience at DSM or higher level Competitive spirit; Excellent team work spirit Strong interpersonal skills Quick learner Well-developed planning skills; Strong communication skills; Able to work under pressure; Follow Us on MoSeeker!
industries: Biotechnology, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Our fast-growing business is seeking to hire a Sales Manager who will oversee organizational growth by developing business plans, meeting planned goals, and coordinating with our marketing department on lead generation. You will also be tasked with tracking sales goals, setting individual sales targets, and driving growth.  Duties and responsibilities  Oversee China-wide sales for all sectors Planning and directing the hiring and training of future Sales Reps Directing and coordinating all sales activities locally and regionally Preparing sales budgets and projections and approving expenditures Tracking and analysing sales statistics based on key quantitative metrics Handling and resolving customer complaints regarding a product or service Setting discount rates and determining price schedules Set and achieve quarterly sales targets Identify, contact, meet, and present to potential clients Advising distributors and vendors on policies and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) Report to the Managing Director Contribute to weekly meetings and monthly board meetings  Skills and experience required  Results – Driven , Ability to set sales targets and achieve them effectively Excellent interpersonal, customer service and communication skills Experience using CRM to manage the sales process and forecast sales Strong analytical skills to identify trends and sales patterns Ability to design and implement a successful sales strategy Team sprit , Ability to guide and mentor sales representatives Planning, organization, and problem-solving skills Advanced time management skills Advanced knowledge in our product range and the culture behind it Self-motivated and passionate about food Excellent IT skills Strong culinary sales and business development background preferred For foreign applicants you MUST obtain a work permit  Candidates meeting the following criteria will be given preference: Experience working in an F&B sales role Fluent spoken and written Chinese & English Currently Based in Shanghai  Additional info & Applications ·     Applications: CV and cover letter (stating your expected salary) to Andrew Brown_ andrew.brown@breakfastchampion.cn ·     Please note that applications without a cover letter will not be considered

description: Responsibilities: Responsible to achieve design-win, revenue and margin targets (as agreed with sales management) for assigned territory. Define and execute customer sales strategies, working closely with FAE partner, sales management and marketing team. Value based selling, leveraging Navitas products with critical focus on high-efficiency, high-power density, and new form-factor power conversion. Develop strong customer relationships in support of the sales strategy. Determine if any strategic price programs are required and discuss & align with sales management. Determine and win over customers’ key decision makers. Responsible for distributor recruitment, training, management, monitoring, support, co-marketing. Gather customer inputs and market data and provide input to align the Company’s product roadmap with customer / market needs。 Support Marcom activities in-country, e.g., press tours, seminars, exhibitions, and local social media  Requirements: Have at least3 years sales work experience in the semiconductor industry. Bachelor degree in Electronic Engineering or equivalent is preferred. Good interpersonal & communication skill for business propositions. Self-driven and ability to work under pressure. Proficient in both oral and written English.  If you are a high energy person who is ready to make a big impact in a small but fast growing company, this is an opportunity that you do not want to miss!

Frameo is a Danish producer of photo software minded for WiFi photo frames. Our company is developing and changing at a rapid pace. Therefore, we are looking for an Overseas Sales Manager based in Shenzhen to further develop our sales of the Frameo product to brands in the consumer electronic industry. You will be working closely with the team based in our head office in Denmark and our current China Sales Managers also based in Shenzhen. It is imperative that you are proactive and flexible as a person, and capable of working in a structured way. In Frameo, we have a team-based culture with employee participation on all levels. We believe close cooperation across business units results in better outcomes and better products for our customers.  Areas of Responsibility: Growing Frameo’s business towards brands in the consumer electronics industry Collaborating with Danish HQ on the execution of the sales strategy for the global market Maintaining business relationships with current customers, which includes promoting further sales Collaborating with the China Sales Managers to teach the manufacturers salespeople how to sell the concept to the manufacturers overseas customers Tracking sales opportunities and providing after-sales support in collaboration with Danish HQ Participate in yearly trade shows and fairs like CES, IFA and HKTDC Weekly feedback on the global market and knowledge sharing to align sales processes Insure business transparency for the Danish HQ  Qualifications: Minimum 5 years sales experience within consumer electronics or IT/software Has a broad knowledge and experience with brands within the consumer electronics industry globally (e.g. the European, American or other markets) Bachelor’s degree or above within the commercial/technical field A fast-learner, who is quickly able to familiarize with Frameo’s technology and convey the advantages to the customer Strong sales skills Excellent oral and written communication skills in English  Personal characteristics: Extrovert with a strong commercial and entrepreneurial mindset Strong communicative abilities with both internal and external stakeholders A team player, but self-driven and enterprising in your daily work Deeply engaged and professional in cooperation with colleagues and manufacturers/partners Structured and good at creating an overview of activities Willingness to travel  DI-Asia Base Business Services Ltd. has been entrusted to assist with the recruitment on behalf of Frameo and applications are now being accepted. If you fit the profile, please send us: your motivational essay and CV (in English), expected salary level and availability by e-mail to Andy.Kang@Frameo.net ﻿(quoting reference: “Overseas Sales Manager + "your name" ”) as soon as possible. All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.  About the Frameo Frameo is a license-based software platform used for OEM WiFi photo frames as well as a free app for your smartphone. With the Frameo App you can easily capture and share your best moments with your loved ones. Take a photo, select who you want to send it to, add a fitting caption and send. It's that simple! With a Frameo social photo frame you are ready to receive photos from your friends and family. Simply add the people you wish to receive photos from and sit back and enjoy their moments! Read more at: www.frameo.net
industries: Computer Software, Consumer Electronics, and Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing

Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. Live the Safety stand, adhere to the safety responsibilities Provide leadership in safe working practices, promoting safety awareness and performance for self and others in all areas of responsibility to achieve full compliance with site and company standards and guidelines  Lead and support safety initiatives and processes in the team to drive towards zero recordable injuries.  Live the Safety Stand, adhere to the safety responsibilities Draft a personal safety action plan and deliver on all commitments  Metrics ·      Implement a personal safety action plan ·      Safety metrics –first aids, near misses  2.    Knowing Our Customers Lead by having an intimate business insight and knowledge of customers, their businesses, what is necessary for the customer to be successful, and the differential value that our current and future products, programs and deliver to the customers.  ·     Explore sales opportunities ·      Analyze market, competition and customer situation to find the opportunity ·      Make good use of company resources to provide solution to customers ·      Contribute to the development of the strategy for both near and long-term which is realistic and will deliver the stated objectives ·      Develop existing customers with new solution ·      Promote developed products to potential customers ·      Work independently and aggressively to reach the target ·      Set up regional team at a proper timing and lead team to reach more achievements.  ·    Manage key accounts ·      Develop comprehensive sales plans for key accounts ·      Generate and develop relationships with various functional people in key accounts ·      Create prospect list for sales opportunities in key accounts ·      Qualify, follow up and close opportunities for key accounts ·      Coordinate and communicate cross-regional information with global & regional sales team  Metrics ·      Recognized sales record in volume and GM ·      Quantity of new customers developed ·      Quantity of long term relationship customers ·      Execute sales plan (budgeted volumes/commercial conditions) at key accounts ·      Remain aggressive gross margin and improve customer satisfaction rate  3.    Directing Operations ·    Contracting   ·      Quotation handling ·      Ensure proper Supply Agreements are in place for businesses ·      Customer Master data gathering, ·      Enable the Perfect Order process, ·      Support Finance in solid credit management,  ·    After sales ·      Manage proper complaint handling follow up, ·      Customer satisfaction measurement, ·      Manage and assess the distributors operating in designated area ·      Steer after sales customer service activities  Metrics ·      Effective agreement/contract/order acceptable by company and customer ·      Control of over-due receivable ·      Solution to customer complaint ·      Customer satisfaction    Job Requirements  Experience: 1.    Minimum of 3 years of commercial experience in the related field such as composites, materials and chemical industry 2.    Experience in negotiating complex deals with various functional people to reach an expected sales model 3.    Bachelor’s degree in business, management, chemical or a related field 4.    Solid background in Thermosets/Thermoplastics is preferred  Knowledge and Abilities: 1.    Basic understanding of Business Administration (knowledge of marketing, finance, technical and legal aspects of a business) 2.    In knowledge of industrial marketplace e.g. economic situation, customer requirements, technological developments 3.    Good at communicating and negotiating 4.    Creative 5.    Contract management and negotiation 6.    Good at enhancing sales margin 7.    Strong capability in value selling and identifying needs on customer side 8.    Key Account Management Capability  Personal Characteristics: 1.    Having passion on the business 2.    Gets the whole customer thing – has a strong customer-focused inclination 3.    Achieves results fast, individually and through teams – can synthesize data and multiple points of view quickly and creatively to arrive at balanced solutions. Has a strong bias for action 4.    Takes business risks, grows from failures and celebrates success 5.    Intelligent and conducts himself/herself with the highest ethical   6.    Strong commercial acumen 7.    Aggressive to reach target 8.    Leading results effectively/collaboratively through others especially those who do not report directly in the business and other functions. 9.    Being part of creating and accelerating a high performance organization 10. Attracting, developing and retaining outstanding talent in the team 11. Assessing the environment and successfully identifying opportunities and closing gaps to accelerate business performance 12. Measuring and assessing performance including developing and implementing metrics and operating reporting Results Oriented - Energetic, resourceful, with strong service orientation and positive can-do attitude. Fully committed to the job and to deliver outstanding work. Never satisfied with status-quo, continually striving for excellence.

description: Company Description  OUR COMPANY  Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a portfolio of lifestyle brands including Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, Hollister, and Gilly Hicks. Reaching customers across 120+ countries, we strive to create customer-centric, omni-channel experiences for our global customer base.  OUR VALUES  How do we do it? Every day, our associates show up and empower one another to stay curious and think big. As a team of relentless innovators, we aren’t afraid to dream boldly. We are accountable and aim to the highest caliber to understand, push boundaries and embrace change. We coach, mentor, care, and bring our best selves every day because we are in this together. Whether you lead yourself, a team, or the company, everyone is a leader at A&F.  Job Description  This individual will work as part of the APAC Brands team to develop local product strategy and support for the Hollister Co. brand (Male). They will drive product strategy across all channels (local websites, Tmall marketplace and retail stores). They will work directly with the global product team to create the local version of our brand aesthetic. Success in this role will be highly dependent upon building and maintaining exceptional relationships with internal and external teams in both China and the US.  What will you be doing? Within a business division, act as owner for a full merchandise department (either Tops or Bottoms / Other) for the Hollister brand in APAC region Lead merchandise buys and distortions for relevant department, leveraging regional customer preferences and advancing regional business strategy while preserving brand identity and priorities Create the high-level architecture for an APAC-exclusive product assortment (expected to be 10-20% of total APAC assortment by SKUs) Ensure assortments are consistent with overall brand strategy and identity Item-level execution of APAC-exclusive assortment will be handled centrally by Home Office Design and Merchandise teams APAC-exclusive product assortment is expected to play a key role in sales growth Be the expert in current selling analysis and historical selling knowledge for the region Leverage financial and strategic capabilities to influence promotions, pricing, product placement, etc. as well as product development and assortments Intimately understand regional customers’ preferences and interests by observing shopping patterns, regularly shopping competitors, and monitoring media platforms Execute against key milestones / seasonal processes: Following each season, execute a detailed hindsight / strategic line review process at the department level to inform future strategy and identify line list needs for design Present weekly selling / business updates as part of a regular Monday review process, evaluating performance, proposing tactical improvements, and consolidating results into a summary to be shared with the Home Office Participate in central assortment reviews on a seasonal basis, contributing ideas, identifying top items, and preparing for seasonal buys Participate in monthly Chase / Buy / Cut reviews to provide a regional perspective on key products and fine-tune assortments Participate in monthly MPC meetings, working with team to identify upsides and risks to the plan Connect remotely and in-person with Home Office Visual Merchandising teams to coordinate floorsets Partner with Home Office teams to ensure APAC-exclusive assortment is on track throughout the product development process, carrying out consistent updates and communicating effectively both remotely and in-person Travel regularly to Columbus, Ohio to participate in key milestone meetings What will you need to bring? Bachelor’s or undergraduate University degree equivalent 3-4 years of Merchandising or Buying experience, preferably in apparel Proven leadership experience and ability to thrive in team-based settings Passion for the merchant role, fashion retail, customer research, and the Hollister Co. brand Desire to take ownership for a portion of a multi-billion-dollar business An acute eye for product and trend A deep understanding of sales analysis and financial metrics that relate to your business Strong presentation skills and the ability to communicate confidently to leadership Willingness to travel domestically and internationally as needed by the department A high comfort-level with analytical sales tools and proficiency in Microsoft Office applications A collaborative approach to working with cross-functional partners to achieve the vision of the brand Additional Information  ABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

jobTitle: Senior Business Development Manager, Professional Services
description: Mintel is the world’s leading market intelligence agency, the “Experts in What Consumers Want and Why”. With the global footprints and local views, we gain in-depth understanding of consumers in different aspects and from various angles, which allows us to offer our clients a unique perspective on the future of the consumer landscape and a clear roadmap to navigate it with.  Our Business Development team focuses on expanding our client base across the Greater China market. We are looking for an accomplished and results-driven sales professional with established relationships and experience in selling solutions, to the retail industry in particular.  This individual will join a fun and diverse team in our Shanghai office. The role requires a hungry and motivated salesperson who is driven to hit sales targets and nicely rewarded via a lucrative uncapped commission plan.  What You Will Be Doing Source and meet new prospects to bring them to the current portfolio Closing the deals. Prepare for proposals with the suitable Mintel solutions and at the right prices, based on the understanding of prospects’ needs Implement all necessary strategies and skills to demonstrate and secure Mintel’s value Needs finding. Identify, understand and match prospects’ needs with Mintel’s solutions, and make sure the opportunities are renewable Plan and manage the pipeline for the next 3 months for consistent target delivery Ensure healthy and accurate forecast from your territory, and deliver to the Commercial Country Manager on time Presenting and demonstration. Leveraging excellent knowledge of Mintel products and services, and deep understanding of latest CPG trends, to be able to confidently present to audiences from either internal or external Develop and maintain relationships with prospects’ decision makers and major influencers Who We Are Looking For Client-Obsessed: You actively joins your team’s client meetings to speak with and listen to clients, and consistently have clients talk to the company about what is and is not working. You network at the highest possible levels within clients to help your team to ensure there is appropriate executive engagement. Commercially-minded: You have a proven track record of delivering return on investment and achieving sales targets both individually and when leading a team Great communicator: You have extremely polished verbal and written communication skills, and can adapt your communication style to suit each client, your team and across teams. Short and long-term focused: You have an understanding of the immediacy of winning this month’s team sales results, while making the appropriate adjustments to ensure the same for the next 6-12 months Creative problem-solver: You are able to identify complex problems based on a broad range of factors. You also are able to develop & implement optimal solutions. You establish key results, you track learnings and you embrace continuous improvement A Practitioner: You should have at least 4-6 years of individual sales success, with focus on new business development, a track record of selling consultancy solutions to the C-suite, as well as rooted connection within retail sector. You possess and apply practical and technical skills, knowledge, and experience related to sales and customer services.

Have we got a job for you?!  Business Development Manager – Gaming & APP– Shanghai  Build Your Career | Have Fun | Make a Difference  About Payoneer  Payoneer’s mission is to empower businesses to go beyond – beyond borders, limits and expectations. In today’s digital world, Payoneer enables any business of any size from anywhere to access new economic opportunities by making it possible to transact as easily globally as they do locally.  Payoneer’s digital platform streamlines global commerce for millions of small businesses, marketplaces and enterprises from 200 countries and territories. Leveraging its robust technology, compliance, operations and banking infrastructure, Payoneer delivers a suite of services that includes cross-border payments, working capital, tax solutions and risk management. Powering growth for customers ranging from aspiring entrepreneurs in emerging markets to the world’s leading digital brands like Airbnb, Amazon, Google and Upwork, Payoneer makes global commerce easy and secure.  Payoneer - one world, one platform, endless opportunities.  About Payoneer China  Ever since its inception, Payoneer China has grown at a blistering speed with 250+ employees serving hundreds of thousands of customers. Payoneer China currently is the market leader in cross border payments for ecommerce, B2B trade, and mobile applications. We are also well positioned to grow our business into other business verticals, delivering a portfolio of products and services.  This is a unique opportunity for talents to participate in a fast-moving environment to provide disruptive products and solutions that solve real commercial challenges. It is also a great opportunity to super charge your career and to amplify professional growth, business acumen, and cross industry experience.  If you’re an experienced leader, manages operations in the Fintech industry, loves to get things done, collaborates with colleagues all over the world and is interested in joining a fast-growing global company that is trusted by the world’s top digital brands and truly cares for its customers, join us at Payoneer!  With over 1200 employees globally, fast processing and delivery of payments is at the heart of our success. Our customers rely on us to make fast and cost effective worldwide international payments. The Payoneer team is dedicated to overcoming the complexities associated with cross-border commerce. We believe in being hi-tech hi-touch, developing the most cutting-edge solutions while remaining friendly and approachable    What Will You Do... Execute company’s business development plan by acquiring new customers and accomplishing regional sales target; Support and present at marketing events organized by Marketing Department and Business Development Department and attend likewise events in mobile industry. Identify opportunities for short to mid-term revenue growth across the business development team to drive forecast and vertical growth priorities Identify and build sustainable and strategic relationship with leading Gaming and APP clients and Industry Partners (including C-level) Requirements Bachelor’s degree and above 3 + years’ experience in sales, business development, marketing or consulting Solid experience in gaming & app, advertising and / or internet industry, familiar with cross-border business model Access to industry related resources is a must Excellent in Chinese, professional in English writing and speaking skills Excellent organizational, analytical, problem-solving and influencing skills Willing to travel, abilities to work independently with highly self-motivated and innovative mind

工作职责:  Job Description Summary  As a Senior Account Sales, you will develop & implement One GE Healthcare sales strategy by maintaining commercial relationships/alliances with Accounts at zone level, e.g. hospitals, hospital groups, government bodies or Group Purchasing Organizations. It's a role that will be responsible for maintaining a detailed understanding of assigned accounts’ business and keeping GE Healthcare Zone, Region & Product management informed and appropriately involved. You will be expected to lead & close multimodality and single product deals in their assigned accounts.  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Primary Responsibilities  Financial Performance Achieve sales and orders volumes at the target prices in assigned accounts/territory. Coordinate orders and sales forecasts within the applicable sales funnel tools and reports for in their assigned territory/accounts in conjunction with Product Sales Specialist/product Specialists. Account Management Maintain relationships, develop a business strategy, and maximize business opportunities for all GE Healthcare businesses, products & services within allocated accounts/territory (or within defined care area/department scope). Represent OneGEHC in the account or care area/department and acts as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory. Provide on-going feedback to management, product teams, services and marketing. Maintain Go-to-Market plans in conjunction with Zone cross functional and multi-product teams to achieve targets and grow GE’s share of customer investments in capital, diagnostics and operational expenditures. Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through consistent high quality interactions with customer management. Build long term strategic alliance with portfolio of accounts to continue to add value, and promote Service offerings to identify and escalate commercial service needs to drive customer NPS. In cooperation with Product teams and Marketing, drive One GE Healthcare promotional events in assigned territory. Be aware of customer segmentation and promote offerings relevant to each client’s segment. Opportunity Management Prospecting for new customers and business opportunities in addition to growing and maintaining the existing customer portfolio. Prioritize new leads to create a balanced sales funnel for future sales. Lead and leverage Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialists, Care Area or Category Leaders, Service Operations and other Company resources to provide the necessary technical, clinical and business content to create a competitive differentiation. Coordinate One GE Healthcare team on assigned accounts in order to deliver solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations. Lead & coordinate multi-P&L proposals, preparing sales quotations, planning customer meetings and demonstrating equipment capabilities across diagnostic product portfolio with relevant Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialist and other sales support staff. Ensure order and configuration quality at the point of entry to ensure accuracy, configuration integrity and that all requirements are tied to documented customer inputs. Lead successful negotiation and closure of multi P&L opportunities, interfacing with all key buyer influencers. Assist Product Sales Specialists in negotiation and deal closure of single product deals as required. Promote point of sale service contracts and financing solutions and drive margin through selling value and achieving price targets. GE Product & Market awareness Develop a solid knowledge of GE product and service portfolio and competitors’ products. Develop and maintain expertise of market and technology trends in order to understand customer issues and challenges as well as educating customer on their unmet clinical and business needs. Develop and maintain deep understanding of CxO level business and clinical needs and how GE provide solutions/offerings to meet these needs differently from the competition. Compliance Adhere to and uphold highest standards of compliance to relevant international and local Regulatory and GE Healthcare Promotional Codes Adhere to all applicable GE and GE Healthcare compliance policies, codes and training requirements Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required. 任职条件:  Qualifications / Requirements Education to Bachelor Degree level or the equivalent of four years of sales experience. 2 years of strategic sales experience. 2 years experience in healthcare. Proven key account management and project planning skills. Strong customer focus and desire to continuously improve expertise Well developed listening, influencing, interpersonal and networking skills to drive collaborative culture at all levels; High level presentation skills; able to present ideas to customers in a way that produces understanding and impact. Quality Specific Goals Aware of and comply with the GEHC Quality Manual, Quality Management System, Quality Management Policy, Quality Goals, and applicable laws and regulations as they apply to this job type/position Complete all planned Quality & Compliance training within the defined deadlines Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required Knowledge and understanding of all Global Privacy and Anti-Competition Policies Knowledge and understanding of all Environmental Health Policies (including but not limited to GE Healthcare EHS Policies, GE Healthcare Fleet Rules, etc.) and operate within them to ensure that no company policy or Country / Int’l Law is broken Drive continuous improvement on all related processes, work instructions, and procedures to ensure ongoing standardization and simplification of the Quality Management System. Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

description: Job Purpose and Impact  销售代表 III 将专注于我们在指定地理区域或市场内的少数大型或非常复杂的客户。我们寻求一位经验丰富的专业人士，负责处理我们的关键或复杂产品，这些产品需要优秀的客户关系技能，以保持竞争定位。  Key Accountabilities 制定建立和维护客户关系并实现个人销售目标的计划。 为每个帐户构建业务计划。 协调资源（如技术、广告）的使用，为账户提供增值服务。 建立强大的客户关系，为规划产品、价格和服务策略提供重要投入。 支持主管和其他销售专业人员在指定地区或市场开发新的市场机会。 独立处理复杂问题，监督最少，同时仅将最复杂的问题上报给适当的工作人员。 分配的其他职责 Qualifications  最低资格 至少四年相关工作经验 其他最低资格可能适用 关键行为 开发和提供多模式通信，传达对不同受众独特需求的清晰理解。 与不同群体公开而舒适地联系。 了解完成工作的最有效和高效的流程，专注于持续改进。
industries: Chemicals, Food & Beverages, and Food Production

Retail, consumer goods, and luxury industry preferred Result oriented and ability to work well with all levels of management and build relationship Good analytical mind and problem-solving skills Excellent people management and communication skills Team player with positive mindset and excellent work ethics Ability to handle customer complaint Flexible and able to work under pressure Proactive, organized and detail-minded Able to exercise independent judgment and take action Understanding of financial statement and retail metrics Experience in handling wholesale operation Ability to travel up to 20% of time Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese

该职位来源于猎聘  International Sales & Business Development Manager  About ForwardX  ForwardX Robotics is a developer of AI-empowered mobile robotics for the manufacturing, logistics, and retail industries. Offering a wide range of vision-first Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs) and intelligent fleet management software, ForwardX’s solutions help supply chain operations automate material handling tasks in their facilities, from warehouses to production floors. Developer of the most intelligent AMRs on the market, ForwardX’s core competencies include computer vision, machine learning, and advanced robotics. With a huge need in the market for our solutions and massive market potential, ForwardX is looking for a go-getter to join our team as International Sales & Business Development Manager.  About The Job  Responsibilities: Perform competitive and SWOT analyses to gain a deeper understanding of the market and target industries Define, execute and effectively communicate ForwardX’s sales and business development strategy and operational plans. Initiate and develop relationships with key sales & business development prospects to identify and meet their business needs Draft and review contracts for prospective customers and partners Analyze and evaluate potential partnership deals and opportunities Manage sales and business development pipelines and set targets Manage key partner accounts and serve as their main point of contact to deliver project success Create and deliver tailored business proposals and presentations Identify new commercial opportunities to increase revenues on a global market Provide outstanding customer service through prompt and accurate support and advice Track, trace, and communicate regular updates on key performance indicators to business-wide stakeholders Cultivate an in-depth knowledge of our business products and value propositions within the context of the European & North American markets About You  Qualifications required: Bachelor’s degree required; MBA preferred Fluent written & spoken English & Chinese 5+ years of sales or business development experience within industrial robotics, logistics, or manufacturing industries in Japan Demonstrated track record overseeing sales & business development as evidenced by contributions to organization revenue and growth Values Required Entrepreneurial You are always looking for ways to solve problems and appreciate that it is up to us to go out and make things happen. Analytical You are adept at conducting research to better understand and evaluate the business, its position in the market, and the viability of potential opportunities. Adaptable You are able to adapt your communication style and express your thoughts in a way that is easily understood by those around you. Organized & Accountable You take responsibility for your work and identify and manage stakeholders internally and externally Positive You understand that a deal can always be made and that it is up to you to find a way to make that happen. Strategic You have experience developing and implementing successful expansion strategies and understand the various areas of business development Relationship-focused You understand how to build, manage, and leverage relationships inside and outside of your immediate network. Motivated You are able to self-motivate and motivate those around you to meet the high expectations you set for yourself and others. Composed You are experienced in and excel when working to time-bound targets and actively seek to meet and exceed the targets set.
负责重庆市场，维护重点客户，提高销量。 开发目标区域，协作客户各项工作，挖掘潜在需求。 经销商的管理及开发，构建良好的合作关系。 结合学术要求，配合市场活动有效分配资源，推动学术推广。 执行公司下达的政策和任务，定期缴交各项报表。

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
