description: 概述  Bruker Corporation businesses are leading worldwide manufacturers of analytical measurement systems for the life sciences. For more than 50 years Bruker has followed a single idea: to deliver the best technological solution for every analytical task. Today, more than 6000 employees at over 90 locations worldwide are working toward this challenge.  We are looking for a motivated Technical Sales Representative with a strong science background and bilingual (English and Chinese) language skills for Bruker Daltonics’ Life Science Mass Spectrometry (LSMS) in Shanghai.  职责   Achieve the assigned sales target for Bruker Life Science Mass Spectrometry products in the assigned region.   Set up strategic sales plan in his/her assigned territory, actively manage the sales pipeline and forecast through both direct channels and distributors.   Work closely with the application, marketing and service functional departments to meet the need of existing customers in the assigned territory.  资质   BSc (minimum), preferably MSc or PhD in Chemistry, Biology, Medicine or Pharmacy or relevant Science fields.   Strong sales and marketing experience with 1 – 5 years of experience in the field of scientific instrument or laboratory products, knowledge of mass spectrometry is preferred.   Must have excellent communication skills in both English and Chinese. Must be able to read scientific literatures. Communication in English verbally and written essential.   Must have good learning attitude and ability to learn mass spectrometry applications and give clear presentation to academic customers on mass spectrometry products, solutions and applications.   Good time and territory management skills and must be able to work independently; goal oriented with good organization skills, able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Chemicals

description: About Us  At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.  We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!  About The Department  Account Executives, Channel Account Managers, Business Development Representatives, Solution Engineers, Customer Success, and Sales Operations - all working together help our customers adopt Cloudflare and create great Internet-enabled experiences. The sales team at Cloudflare helps customers solve real, technical problems while creating the revenue streams that help the company provide free service to millions in our community.  Based in Beijing, you will drive sales into large enterprise/strategic accounts across China for Cloudflare’s solutions. Large enterprise accounts include, but are not limited to, MNC’s, G2000/CAC 40 companies, hyper-growth companies, and other organisations that have substantial requirements for Cloudflare solutions. Your strategic selling activities will include "hunter" type activities to proactively penetrate target named large accounts, detailed account planning, focused relationship building and leading effective sales campaigns to successful closure.  The ideal candidate will possess both a major account sales background in technology solutions, primarily software based, that enables them to drive engagement with senior level decision makers within Cloudflare’s target customers. Industry experience selling into Finance, Retail, Manufacturing and other Enterprise verticals along with Service Provider is desired in this role.  As a Major Account Executive, you'll be responsible for developing and executing against a Sales strategy/plan for Strategic accounts, as well as driving large account sales into China markets to achieve revenue targets. Therefore, you must have a strong network of contacts with decision makers in large enterprise accounts across the region, and have experience selling complex solutions to these accounts. You will have an intuitive understanding and experience with the key business and technical needs of these and large accounts and will create and deliver compelling value propositions to them for Cloudflare solutions.  Additional Responsibilities Will Include Manage contract negotiations Maintain a robust sales pipeline Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts < 50% travel Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience Bachelor's degree required Fluent in both English and Mandarin language Relevant direct experience, track record, and relationships within largest corporate enterprise accounts in the China market 10-20+ years of direct B2B selling experience, 5-10+ years selling to large enterprise/strategic accounts Direct experience selling network security and/or CDN solutions and services preferred Prior experience being part of an early sales team helping drive traction in the China market for a US-based SaaS company highly preferred Experience managing longer, complex sales cycles Basic understanding of computer networking and “how the internet works” Aptitude for learning technical concepts/terms (Technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus) Strong interpersonal communication (verbal and written) and organizational skills Self-motivated; entrepreneurial spirit Comfortable working in a fast paced dynamic environment What Makes Cloudflare Special?  We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.  Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.  Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.  Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.  1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!  This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.  Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.  Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Internet, and Computer & Network Security

description: Reports to: Sales & Business Development Director Location:  Responsibilities   1.    Business Development Ø Pro-actively seek and establish relationships with target Key and VIP potential companies and manage end to end sales process from initial contact through client on-boarding and on-going relationship development. Ø Support on-boarding of new Standard/low potential accounts and facilitate transfer to Client Support team for on- going management. Ø Respond to inbound leads from website enquiries, requests for quotation and client referrals. Ø Work with colleagues within sales and marketing teams both internally and group partners to engage with high potential accounts which span geographical regions and company scope. Ø Assist colleagues to support new prospects which cover multiple regions. Ø Support for the different organizations within the corporate group   2.    Existing Account Development Ø Take ownership of relationships for Key and VIP accounts to ensure maximization of potential business with those clients. Ø Ensure clear handover of information for Standard (low potential accounts) which shall be self-managed by Online system and Client Support team. Additional support may be required to provide for Standard accounts on a case-by-case basis. Ø Liaise with colleagues internally to seek information to answer to Key and VIP account questions, feedback, or complaints in a timely and professional manner. Ø Regularly meeting and communicating with key and VIP clients face to face and by phone ensuring adherence to client follow up policies. Ø Revive dormant / unresponsive clients and work with Client Support team to reduce client churn. Ø In the event of claims and complaints from Key and VIP accounts assist in the negotiation to reduce impact to client relationship and seek to establish a reasonable solution with the client while limiting cost impact to the company.   3.    Marketing Ø Provide insights and input to overall and regional sales and marketing strategy. Ø Assist marketing department activities to develop new content for marketing campaigns.   4.    Administration Ø Maintaining CRM records for owned accounts including, but not limited to ensuring opening opportunities related to RFQ’s, logging sales activities (meetings, calls, etc) and updating contact information. Ø Follow up creditors on significantly overdue invoices in line with Accounts Receivable policy.     Requirements: Ø 4-5 year’s sales experience in Trading, logistics 3rd-party Inspection, Testing industry. Ø Bachelor’s degree or above, major in Marketing, Sales. Ø Strong communication and interpersonal skill, a good sense of teamwork. Ø Solid proven sales track record & achievement. Ø Proficient in MS Office software such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, outlook. Ø Fluency in English, Spanish is a must for this role. Portuguese desirable. Ø Strong sense of responsibility, team spirit, integrity, able to work under pressure and customer and result oriented. Ø Occasional travel is needed.   Career Developing Path: Ø Start from: Sales & Business Development Executive Ø 8 to 12 months: Senior Executive Ø 12 to 24 months: Business Development Manager for good performance Ø 24 to 36 months: Sr. Business Development Manager for higher performance

jobTitle: Regional Sales Team Lead - TOP MNC Publishing Company
description: TOP brand in publishing industry, steady growth in China market Oversee national market, good opportunity to expand business scope and leadershi  About Our Client  Our client is an TOP brand in publishing industry focusing on science and research development with steady business growth in China.  Job Description  The Regional Sales Team Lead is responsible for the current year and long-term growth of overall business in Corporate and Engineering fields. 1 - Achieve revenue and growth objectives * Responsible for total business in territory (country strategy, market Intel, planning, local marketing, execution), in alignment with business & strategic objectives * Key link between sales and rest of organization * Leads key consortium negotiations * Effective use of company resources 2 - Develop an effective regional sales organization * Effectively hire, coach and develop and retain sales talent * Lead by example; manage change (effectively implement and embed global initiatives in region) * Fully understand and utilize sales tools (e.g. sales compensation plan, pipeline dashboards, etc) to drive sales behavior * Ensures the right level of account management (holistic company value aligned with customer strategy) through coaching, role-modeling * Optimize different sales channels - e.g. both direct, inside sales and use of agents  The Successful Applicant  The requirements for ideal candidate are:  Must to have: 1) Minimum 10 years Corporate clients sales experiences 2) Cheerful leaders with skills of stakeholder alignment and management experience. At least 3 years proven success of people manager experience(hire, coach, develop talent) with target achievement 3) Experienced in working in an international matrix organization 4) Experienced at least one focused industry(CCEE/PBT/Engineering/Chemicals) 5) Proven success as a mature sales. Candidate need to master value-based selling, skills of account planning, driving active engagement with customers in its territory 6) Candidate should have cloud-base product selling experience(SaaS experiences) 7) CXO communication skill, presentation skills, fluency in English 8) Integrity/honesty, willing to learn/Proactive/Team Collaboration, positive, responsible, problems soling capabilities, etc.  Nice to have: 1) prefer if candidate has experience to work with/in research institution 2) growth mindset, proven success to explorer new market and cook deals； 3) equipped with mutual selling methodology 4) experience in resource allocation  What's On Offer  The company provides the followings for canidate: - National business scope - Leadership training and balanced working environment - Competitive salary  Contact: Kexin Gao  Quote job ref: 4199734
industries: Events Services, Financial Services, and Facilities Services

description: Job Description  This is a commissioned sales position. We are looking to recruit an energetic and dynamic Account Executive who is reported to vertical sales manager into the position focused on driving Intel's business and raising our relevance in targeted Enterprise accounts, include FSI, Energy, TRANS, Retail and MFG. The successful candidate should build deep relationships with senior customer executives and ecosystem partners, understand customer business problems. Also helps position Intel as a Trusted Advisor and technology Thought Leader in solving challenging business problems through the innovative application of technology, the deployment of Intel-based solutions. Engages business leaders, technical decision makers, industry influencers, policy makers to drive awareness and adoption of Intel technologies and products in customers' cloud journey especially for public cloud service adoption. Candidates should have a thorough understanding of mainstream solutions in the public cloud [IaaS and PaaS], and cloud industry players and partners, and how Enterprise accounts choose Public cloud service from business and technical perspective. Responsibilities will include: Leading the adoption and sale of Intel products and solutions in targeted Enterprise accounts; Providing executive presence and thought leadership within targeted accounts, build deep relationships with senior customer executives and ecosystem partners; Exploring the new innovation business and technology opportunities with covered Enterprise accounts by help customers solving their problems through the deployment of Intel-based cloud services; Candidates will be part of an account team that will refine our cloud value proposition and sales practices for enterprise accounts and Intel's cloud partner community. Acting as the sector voice back to Intel to ensure our strategies and solutions are designed to tackle the industry's major business problems and opportunities; Strong collaborative approach and ability to work with multiple stakeholders and delivery to tight deadlines.  Qualifications  Solutions sales/BDM with minimum 6 years experience in one or more industry of FSI, Energy, TRANS, Retail and MFG, working with a leading consulting firm, SI/ISV or global IT Company and a successful track record delivering business results. - Experienced in supporting large enterprise account decision making on 3rd party cloud solution provider platforms. (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure, Ali, Tencent etc.). - Deep industry knowledge and cloud domain expertise, especially Public cloud for Enterprise insight. - Understand vertical ecosystem like cloud service provider and ISV partner. - Account management and customer executive handling skills required. - Strong communication skills with internal stakeholders and external clients/partners. - Good sense of humor, flexibility and can-do spirit. Willingness to travel frequently. - Excellent verbal and written communication skills. - Good oral and written English skill. - College graduate (Computer Science/Electrical Engineering or business). Master is a plus.  Inside this Business Group  Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.  Other Locations  PRC, Shanghai
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: WHY DUPONT ELECTRONICS & INDUSTRIAL (E&I)?  There’s never been a more exciting time to join us. It's a time of incredible progress at DuPont — a time of momentum. It's the time for change makers, for the doers and pioneers, to create essential innovations the world needs. We pursue new technologies and performance materials that enable your designs to be smaller, more complex and more powerful than you could ever imagine.  DuPont is a technology leader, serving the semiconductor, circuit board, display, digital and flexographic printing, healthcare, aerospace, industrial and transportation industries. Why wait for a better future? Invent a better n ow. Build the next thing that changes everything!  Job Description Responsible for overall demand forecast accuracy, customer needs, problems and troubleshooting, interests, competitor activities, and positive/negative potential for existing or new products and services. Achieve agreed upon sales targets and key project milestones within schedule. Present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers. Responsible for developing and maintaining relationships through all management levels with key customers Manage the balance between price, customer value, and cost to achieve the company’s profitability objectives. Proactively alert potential supply risk and co-work with supply chain for issue resolution. Effectively work with functional teams within DuPont to drive satisfaction both within DuPont and at customers. Teams include Quality, Demand/Supply chain, R&D, manufacture and marketing, etc. Responsible for making deals, negotiating contracts, managing conflicts, and tackling problems. Resolve customer complaints by investigating problems; developing solutions; preparing reports; making recommendations to management. Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, competitor’s activities, sample delivery schedule and result. Introducing the product offering and customer value proposition to customers Distributor management JOB QUALIFICATION More than 5 year of successful experience in display industry for Sales and Field Service. Experience in OLED is plus. Knowledge in OLED material, panel manufacture, processes and value chain or general consumer electronics. Experience working directly with China OLED panel makers is highly desirable. Proven work experience as a sales representative or field/customer service role. Experience on distributor management is preferred. Excellent selling, communication, time management and negotiation skills. Good interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to quickly and effectively build relationships, interact, and communicate information with internal and external stakeholders. Good strategic thinking, an influencer, communicator, problem-solver with strong customer-orientation, and execution. Highly self-motivated and target driven. Good team player. Degree in Business/Marketing/Engineering/Material science or related fields Demonstrated ability to build relationships and communicate across the organization Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to travel up to 50% of the time Location Beijing, Chengdu, Wuhan, Shanghai Fluent English skills. Korean is plus DuPont is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search or apply for a position, please visit our Accessibility Page for Contact Information.  For US Applicants See the “Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law” poster at http //www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf  For our U.S. Affirmative Action Policy, click here.

Responsibilities 1.      Developing the market business, set up effective promotional plan, and achieve sales target; 2.      Developing trust relationships with a portfolio of major clients wholesalers/retailers; 3.      Acquiring a thorough understanding of key customer needs and requirements, focus smartphones and ecosystem products; 4.      Expanding the relationships with existing customers by continuously proposing solutions that meet their targets; 5.      Assist in formulating the overall go-to-market strategy (price, product positioning, promotion and channel strategy) of the company; 6.      Prepare regular reports of progress and forecasts to internal and external stakeholders using key account metrics; 7.      Follow up and analysis of the sell-through/sell-out data of wholesalers/retailers;    8.      Effectively carry out market research, demand collection, industry development foresight and work closely with product and HQ team to improve product optimization.   Qualifications 1.      Fluent in English, marketing related major, bachelor’s degree or above; 2.      Working in smartphone domain (or high-tech hardware industry) is preferred, 3-5 years of working experience in the similar position is preferred; 3.      Extensive connections in consumer electronics and smartphone industry; 4.      Strong communication and interpersonal skills; 5.      Excellent organizational skills; 6.      Passionate, strong sense of teamwork.
industries: Internet, Consumer Electronics, and Consumer Goods

convention planners, visitors/Convention Bureau travel agents, tour operators, airlines, corporate accounts, Government Departments and other producers closely allied to Hotel Business employees and third parties that reflects highly on the hotel, the brand and the Company. 具有代表酒店，品牌和公司与顾客，员工和第三方交往的能力。 Problem solving and organizational abilities. 具有解决问题和组织能力。 Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office 精通微软办公软件 Good writing skills 良好的写作技能 Qualifications – 学历 Diploma or Vocational Certificate in Sales & Marketing, Hotel Management, Business Administration, or related field preferred. 最好具有市场营销，酒店管理，商业管理或相关领域的大专学历或职业证书。 Experience – 经验 1 year related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience 1年相关工作经验，或与此相当的教育与工作经验结合的背景。 Apply

Partner Sales Manager Location: Beijing  Main duties: Delivers agreed revenue and recruitment targets into all Study Group Higher Education programmes. Develops the customer value proposition for Study Group’s Central China based agents Identifies opportunities to grow key accounts into higher value tier.  Ensures maximum levels of competitor and market awareness Effectively operates in a commercial, cost focused environment Monitors the sales pipeline and forecast accurate future sales opportunities across team. Positively engages with and contributes to the HE Brand, Agent and APD teams and to the wider Global Sales and Marketing team Supports the leadership of a best in class sales team through setting and communicating high standards of performance and behaviour  Essential Criteria: Educated to Degree standard or compensating industry experience Experience of working in account sales planning and implementation. (such experience does not have to be from the higher education sector) Experience of working in a sales matrix team, both in-office and remotely (virtually) Minimum of two years’ experience of working in the higher education sector Experience of developing and implementing recruitment strategies IT literate with a good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Experience of face to face sales An ability to deal professionally with all staff, clients, partners and students A quick learner able to understand and action effectively new tasks Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail Ability to work flexibly and independently with limited supervision and remote management. Ability to set own targets and strategies Ability to present to large groups in a confident and persuasive manner Ability to research and analyse market trends and produce reports Excellent bi-lingual skills in Chinese and English both written and verbal Excellent interpersonal skills Self-motivated, enthusiastic and a positive attitude  Desirable Criteria: Bachelor’s degree and above /or overseas study experience Experience of International student recruitment within a Higher Education sector Experience of writing/designing promotional campaigns Experience of channel sales (i.e. through agent network or similar)  About Study Group We are a global pathway provider in International Education, working collaboratively with a number of Top Tier Universities. Voted as the 2017, 2018 and 2020 Global Pathway Provider of the year, our people are united with the shared ambition of providing a world-class UK education to talented students from across the globe.   Organisational Compliance Study Group is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of its students, and expects all staff and volunteers to share the same dedication. Applicants will be required to undergo child protection screening appropriate to the role, including checks with past employers, an Enhanced Check from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) and overseas criminal records if appropriate. Study Group processes your information in line with data protection regulations. Please see our Privacy Policy
industries: Higher Education, E-Learning, and Education Management

Role purpose:  Our Business Assurance business is a recognised, world-leading professional assurance services organisation. We specialise in management systems compliance & expert advice across a broad spectrum of standards, schemes & business improvement services to include customised training & assurance.  This role will be accountable for delivering profitable sales that meet or exceed agreed targets, supporting the Area sales team’s success and the overall growth plans for the BA business.  Key Responsibilities:  As an Outbound Sales Development Representative, your main responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):  Follow up all company generated leads in a timely manner, ensuring the correct level of customer discovery, to maximize the sales opportunities  Enthusiastically working on outbound activities, representing the company in a highly professional manner.  Proactively work on prospecting and networking to develop self-generated leads to enable the correct level of sales pipeline and sales to achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual targets  Maintain comprehensive, up to date records on the company’s CRM system, including records of all calls, emails, meetings, proposals, etc. and the use of task management to set appropriate follow up actions and next steps  Work closely with marketing colleagues to ensure the correct level of sales activity to follow up on local campaigns and other marketing initiatives  Maintain competence to produce accurate proposals based on certification requirements for each product you are authorised to sell  Stay abreast of business activity in your sector(s) of sales operation, to ensure you can support customer requirements and develop new sales opportunities through this knowledge.  Develop and enhance LR’s profile within the target markets through the strategic relationships and alliances with the relevant regulatory, industry and technical organisations.  Provide accurate and timely sales and business report forecasts and action plans as required  Work closely with SD and SDS colleagues to ensure that your account KPI’s are met in full, raising issues or risks in the appropriate way that enables resolution.  Key Health & Safety Responsibilities:  Eliminate or minimise employee's exposure to risks by reviewing, regularly, the health and safety risk register, applying appropriate controls, communicating results of risk assessment, and ensuring health and safety is considered in the planning and execution of all LR activities.  Manage your own and your team's compliance with health and safety rules, instructions, systems and legal requirements, ensuring employees are suitably trained and adequate resources are available to work safely.  Manage your own and your team's compliance with health and safety rules, instructions, systems and legal requirements, ensuring employees are suitably trained and adequate resources are available to work safely.  Role Dimensions:  Number of direct reports:  N/A  Geographic area of impact:  China  Size of budget responsible for:  N/A  Key stakeholders:  Area Sales Manager  Marketing Team  Service Delivery and Service Delivery Support colleagues  Technical / Professional Qualifications / Requirements:  Essential - Demonstrable of selling products and/or services in a comparable role in a B2B environment  Essential - Proven track record in achieving sales targets and pipeline development to ensure coverage  Essential - Demonstrable experience in managing quotations, bids, and proposals, including working to set pricing models to achieve required margin  Essential - Good oral and written communication skills, active listener and able to work under own initiative to prioritise and deliver work on time  Essential - Knowledge of standard IT programmes, Salesforce and comfortable in using proprietary software for business processes  Essential - experience in preparing and delivering proposal presentations to senior managers in a customer environment  Desirable - knowledge of the business assurance sector
industries: Public Safety, Maritime, and Nonprofit Organization Management

description: 工作职责: Responsible for AOP for all products and projects of one customer line. Minimum 8 years working experience, with more than 5 years of proven success in Automobile Parts company. Above 3 years sales experience in OE accounts and a track record of working with a wide range of business partners Fluent English both in oral and written An understanding of Auto industry and products would be a distinct advantage

工作职责： 提供快速、有效率地日常销售支持，解决并协调销售在业务过程中遇到的各种问题，保证业务正常运行； 客户主数据、价格维护的申请与管理； 参与日常订单的审核处理及发货事宜的协调工作； 异常情况的跟进与处理（例如信用锁单、加单、坏账等）； 退货/冲红管理； 资产/免费设备/样品的管理； 分析、汇总各类数据并制作相关报表； 销售及客户需求信息动向的信息掌握和分享传递； 新项目系统相关支持及管理。 任职要求：  1， 大学本科及以上学历，具备5年或以上销售支持相关工作经验；  2， 逻辑思维清晰严密，能快速发现问题并具备独立解决问题的能力；  2， 具备良好的中英文书面能力；  3， 熟练使用office办公软件。具备数据分析能力，按销售要求提供各类汇总数据以及销售趋势分析；  4， 高度的责任心，优秀的团队合作精神及沟通技巧；  5， 良好的适应能力与灵活性，积极主动的工作态度，优秀的执行力与学习能力；  6， 优秀的组织、分析、问题解决能力。  post code: 001,  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.  In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Dalian
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, (Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

description: 3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.  Job Description  Position Description  This is a portfolio position for non-structure adhesive as area portfolio marketer. The key responsibilities including:  Portfolio Management Pricing strategies design and execution Market intelligence management Market research on new applications, new product development, market trends and seek new market opportunities Competition market study and regular data update New Product Development and commercialization Integrated Business Plan execution (IBP) Operational Marketing for selected Market Segments Create product content and selling tools to sales team  Qualifications And Experience  Bachelor degree or above, MBA preferred More than 5 year working experience as marketing and at least 3 year sound working experience as portfolio market. Sales experience preferred Working experience in tape and adhesive industry is preferred Good business acumen, insight on market information search and screening Good listening and questioning skill and data analysis skill Business development experience and skill is a plus Time driven & self-motivation Able to work Independently Good communication and interpersonal skill, a team player. description: Location: SHANGHAI, CHINA  Who We Are  Brinc is a venture capital firm on a mission to discover and back the world’s most talented entrepreneurs, help them create successful companies at scale, and build thriving global ecosystems. We are one of the most active venture capital firms in the world.  Since its inception in Hong Kong, Brinc has invested in over 200+ companies via its 12 accelerator programs and offices in 6 countries. Its 65+ team members are located in 9 countries around the world in order to support the Brinc global portfolio of investments which spans more than 36 countries.  Brinc also works with the world’s largest and most innovative corporations. We help multinationals source startups, engage with growth-stage businesses and invest in promising companies. Some of our past engagements include partnerships with Manulife, Schneider Electric, Puma, Huawei and many others.  Who You Are  You are the most well-organized person you know! When you see a problem you roll-up your sleeves and fix it. You are a team player and a self-starter who is able to adapt to change and work independently. You are passionate about corporate innovation, consulting and change management.  You are also self-driven, smart, humble, and are excited at the prospect of joining our Brinc family of #GameChangers and helping us execute our vision to build thriving tech ecosystems around the world.  What You Will Do  You are the most organised project manager you know! You should be a naturally curious and cool-tempered professional who is able to handle stress. We expect you to have an organised and analytical mind, and you believe in First Principles. You have strong analytical and communication skills. If you are also confident in your client interfacing skills and project management abilities, we’d like to meet you.  Your goal will be to deliver successful corporate engagements and grow the business.  When you see a problem you roll up your sleeves and fix it. Setting up and implementing processes is second nature to you. You are a self-starter who is able to adapt to change and work independently. You are passionate about the Startup Ecosystem globally and clearly understand how to solve problems.  You are also self-driven, smart, humble, and are excited at the prospect of joining our Brinc family of #GameChangers and helping us execute our vision to build thriving tech ecosystems around the world.  You will spend time meeting new potential partners and clients. Most importantly, you will be responsible for delivering and executing any existing corporate innovation engagement.  Example Projects Research exciting and growing startups in a number of verticals Manage sourcing engagements with corporate partners Support engagement between corporates and startups Design and lead innovation workshops  Roles & Responsibilities: Support with end-to-end execution and delivery of corporate innovation projects across Shanghai and support Hong Kong projects. This will involve working closely with our corporate partners to understand their innovation objectives, scouting for relevant startups and making recommendations on the best models for engagement. Support our Shanghai and Hong Kong business development team as we strive to establish ourselves as market leaders in corporate innovation. This entails identifying new partnership opportunities, cultivating strong client relationships, driving business expansion and developing proposals tailored to the needs of prospective customers. Maintain an understanding of key industry, technology and regional trends that are relevant for our corporate customers. Work with experts from across the organization to develop hypotheses, conduct primary research, perform targeted data analysis, synthesize market insights and publish thought leadership pieces. Provide support on a range of ad hoc projects that may include targeted market research, investment thesis definition for new markets, new product creation, accelerator program and marketing analytics, and operational improvement initiatives. This role is highly dynamic and collaborative. To execute your responsibilities, you will be working with cross-functional teams with members from different divisions and geographies  Requirements  Ideal Experience 4-6 years of client-facing experience in a relevant field (startup, consulting, finance, technology, corporate strategy, etc.) Passionate about technology, startups, innovation or a particular industry First-principles thinker and creative problem solver that is able to adapt to unexpected situations Detail-oriented, highly organized, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment Self-motivated and the ability to flourish with minimal guidance or supervision Proven track record in managing and delivering projects from concept to execution Comfortable building relationships with corporate clients and startup founders Proficient in data analysis and presentation development Native English verbal and written communication skills. Native Mandarin verbal and written communication skills.  Nice To Have MSc/MA in Strategy, Business Administration or a related discipline Management Consulting experience (e.g. Deloitte, PwC, EY, etc) Sales experience and P&L responsibility  Interview Process  At Brinc we believe in getting the right talent on board. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Our process is objective and we have all candidates go through the same experience by completing the Bryq assessment which is a 20-minute online bias-free assessment, enabling us to screen candidates only on the job and company requirements. Once completed our team will reach out to inform you about the potential next steps of the process.  Benefits  A full-time position based at Brinc in Shanghai. A competitive salary, plus carried interest in your portfolio (when applicable) The opportunity to join a growing venture investor at an early stage and to make a significant impact in its development Work in an inspiring environment and receive ongoing training to develop your technical, leadership, and interpersonal skills Option to travel within the Brinc office ecosystem for work stints (Hong Kong, China, Barcelona, Dubai, Bahrain, Singapore, Sydney, India, Poland, and more...) Work for a purpose-driven organization that uses an ESG investment framework in order to help solve the world's most pressing issues by backing and supporting game-changing entrepreneurs
industries: Internet, Venture Capital & Private Equity, and Financial Services

description: The opportunity  Please note – For this role it is essential that candidates have full right to work in China. We are unable to provide Sponsorship. Candidates must be fluent in Mandarin and English  An exciting opportunity has arisen working with our APAC Sales Team. We are currently recruiting for a highly motivated, strategic and target driven Business Development Manager to join our Shanghai office, and grow our business in key China enterprise businesses, and to play a key role in our continued growth in China. Reporting into our VP of Sales for APAC, this role will be focussing on growing our market share in key targeted emerging markets in China, which is a critically important region for us.  The Business Development Manager will be responsible for the subscription sales of mining and metals data into key Chinese enterprises and their overseas subsidiaries. This includes active follow-ups from client visits, marketing, and event efforts, generating and closing interest for the company’s products and services. As a Business Development Manager, you will need to think strategically on ways to grow our business  Once appointed, the Business Development Manager will become part of a dynamic, supportive, successful, and truly international team. As you develop your career at CRU, you will gain knowledge on our clients, our best-in-class product portfolio and be a part of a significant growth story. Financially you will be rewarded - our Business Development Managers receive a basic annual salary, country specific benefits, and are eligible to participate in the Company’s commission plan.  Candidates need to have previous solid sales experience, with a strong track record of managing a portfolio and establishing a network. Experience in the price data subscription sales environment within the Chinese industry is essential and will be key to the success of this role. You will need to have the ability to partner with colleagues in marketing, management, research & analysis, and sales operations to strengthen your own sales initiatives, internal collaboration will be a contributing factor to the success of this role.  As a global Company we work across multiple time zones, so a degree of flexibility will be needed. The role will also require a level of international and local travel (pandemic travel restrictions dependant), so candidates will need to be comfortable with this  Responsibilities & Accountabilities will include:  Establish and maintain senior level relationships in major functional areas of the customer organization. Utilize the relationships to develop strong revenue growth initiatives for all CRU products as well as retain our existing business within the account Generate new business through account-based marketing, whitespace analysis, industry networks and deep relationships Follow and execute a structured solution sales process for revenue growth and prospecting. Able to uncover new revenue opportunities within an account based on the understanding of the works flows and strategies being deployed within the account Quickly develop a strong understanding of the unique CRU value proposition Inform and execute a comprehensive sales strategy to ensure they meet/exceed monthly and yearly sales targets Maintain record of client contract and sales pipeline management using Salesforce Quickly penetrate, build presence and pipeline in China’s emerging regions and internationally focused companies New business generation will be a must in this role. The ability to generate and identify potential customers as well as understand the customers workflow to identify a client's needs will be essential Manage renewal sales process for existing customer base, including setting of expectations, changing needs assessments, negotiating contracts and processing of contracts via relevant internal systems Prepare and execute strategic account plan Follow up on all inbound client inquiries, webinars, workshops, events to uncover new and expanding opportunities Maintain consistent and ongoing contact with end-users and decision makers Prospect, present to, and close on new sales opportunities within client base Provide ongoing product feedback from clients to Line Manager and Product Managers Maintain awareness of, and participate in all relevant training for, new products and capabilities, and market them to account base/prospects  About you – What skills and experience are we looking for?  Excellent communication skills with customer and internal organization verbally and written is essential Connect customer values and products/services Interest and work experience in a client facing role in commodities or subscription type service provider Established relationships in state owned enterprises, institutions, associations, and academia is desired Strong negotiation skills Ability to build rapport with customers, and be customer centric at all times Excellent written and verbal communication skills Be comfortable working with clients from different cultures and time zones Ability to work smart, and meet targets within agreed timescales Be comfortable using a CRM system for workload and KPI management Be comfortable working to strict targets Comfortable using Salesforce for recording customer interaction and tasks

COMPANY BACKGROUND  DATALOGIC得利捷是唯一一家专注在自动数据采集及工业自动化领域的全球领先供应商。作为世界级整体解决方案供应商，DATALOGIC得利捷的领先技术涵盖条码阅读器、数据采集移动终端、传感、测量与安全、视觉系统及激光标记系统等领域。 积极了解和及时响应所有客户需求，以及持续创新和高品质的产品供应，是Datalogic得利捷40多年来取得成功的基础。DATALOGIC得利捷为零售业、运输与物流业、制造业及医疗卫生业等各行业的全方位应用提供创新高效的整体解决方案。 得利捷（深圳）工业自动化有限公司（隶属于Datalogic S.p.A) 的产品被大多数超市和POS、主要机场、顶级运输和邮政服务以及全球最大的医院所采用，DATALOGIC为客户提供涵盖所有市场需求的全系列产品，其技术是数十年专业技术积累的最终成果。 DATALOGIC得利捷有45年的发展历史，在全球拥有超过1200项专利及专利申请，11个研发中心（意大利，美国，中国和越南）和遍布五大洲的成千上万的知名合作伙伴与客户。多年来，DATALOGIC得利捷始终以满足客户需求作为产品质量的核心，凭借此奉献精神，和在研究开发方面付出的大量投资，以及高瞻远瞩的管理层的大力支持，公司业务和规模得以飞速发展和壮大。 DATALOGIC得利捷于1972年成立，总部位于意大利博洛尼亚市，于2001年在意大利证券交易所上市（代码DAL.MI）。目前，DATALOGIC得利捷集团在全球30多个国家拥有约2900名员工，在美国、巴西、意大利、斯洛伐克、匈牙利和越南设有制造工厂。   职位：市场部实习生 •协助支持大中华区（中国、香港、台湾）的市场推广，以产生更多销售线索以及提高品牌知名度。包括： •协助本地化公司官方网站、电子邮件、视频、宣传册和其他市场部资料。 •协助本地化公司内部和外部的新产品相关文件。 •协助支持区域需求内的渠道营销计划，执行并确保符合公司品牌和视觉标准。 •协助CRM系统中的销售线索跟踪，评估和提高每个市场活动的有效性。 •协助支持市场活动，如路演、研讨会、展会、合作伙伴会议等。 •与整体市场营销策略保持一致，协助支持其他市场相关活动 •接听销售热线电话并按要求把客户的信息记录下来并分配给对应的销售同事（入职后会有培训）； •将客户询价信息录入CRM系统 •其他相关市场部相关事务 任职要求： •本科在读，每周至少3-4天 •乐观开朗，愿意往市场营销方向发展 •良好的沟通能力，包括口头和书面技能

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

description: About The Role Key account (AbGenius) team focus on deep service and support KOLs to drive key accounts revenue that deliver Abcam’s strategic goals and objectives. These efforts will utilize our broad capabilities to position Abcam as the partner of cutting-edge scientists in Academic/bio-industry/hospital market. Working across the multi-channels, we aim to position the full scope of Abcam’s innovative technology platforms and expertise to serve scientists and capture downstream revenue opportunities. Most importantly, we are working hand-in-hand with these scientists to achieve their research better, to get their discoveries beyond research faster. Roles & Responsibilities Establish account plans, objectives and forecasts for each key account and update plans monthly. Serves as a consultant to the target accounts, tracking the shopping list of Accounts and identification of key influencer, decision maker and end user Work with channel manager and distributor sales team to drive the technical aspects of pre-sales and post-sales activities Leverage available resources to meet customer needs and work effectively with cross-functional team of supplier and internal resources Introduce Abcam’s cutting-edge product portfolio based on PI’s latest research/next step Develop strong relationships at the Key accounts to build a strong partnership for expanding the business opportunities. Keep abreast on market and customer research to provide knowledge about market and industry to internal and external customers Inform on product tactics, providing customer insights to the marketing/portfolio team. About You Master’s above Degree, Ph.D preferred, majors in molecular biology or biotechnology, Proven experience (1-3 years) in sales skills and key account management in life science industry. Solid knowledge of the cutting-edge in life science research/bioindustry is preferred. Has very strong convincing and influencing skills. Dynamic personality, team player with open communication style. Great customer facing skills. If this sounds like you and you’d like to be a part of a fast-paced, growing business with the vision to become the most influential company and best-loved brand in life sciences, please apply now!  Pay & Benefits  In addition to competitive salaries, we offer an attractive and flexible benefits package, a culture focused on well-being and opportunities for growth and development, and a highly flexible working environment.  About Us  An idea conceived in a University of Cambridge laboratory in 1998, Abcam plc (www.abcamplc.com) began life as an innovative and entrepreneurial start-up, spearheaded by like-minded individuals who shared a common purpose of providing the scientific community with quality antibody reagents, as well as trustworthy and up-to-date information about their uses and limitations. Abcam has now grown to become a leading supplier of protein research tools to life scientists, whilst always maintaining the core collaborative values assumed at its inception.  Abcam now supports life science researchers in their quest to understand the cause of disease and ultimately offer improvements to diagnoses and treatments. To achieve this outcome, the company both develops and manufactures its own products in specialist facilities across the globe, and sources from over 400 partners, offering scientists the newest, most innovative and highest quality research tools available globally, regardless of source. With a customer base of research scientists who require high performance products with detailed technical specifications, 64% of global researchers use Abcam products.  Inclusion & Diversity  Abcam is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes all employment decisions without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Primary Location  CN-CN-Shanghai  Work Locations  Shanghai  Job  Customer Service  Organization  Shanghai  Schedule  Regular  Shift  Standard  Job Type  Full-time  Travel  Yes, 50 % of the Time  Job Posting  Sep 15, 2021, 12:55:24 AM

该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibilities Pre-sales activity will include delivery of technical expertise during the sales process including presentations, seminars, individual consultation, and hands-on demo experiments if needed. Executes technical and application based presentations on illumina’s sequencing and microarray platforms, applications and/or workflows. Post-sales activity includes working with post-installation customers providing additional workflow or applications training in strategically important labs. Supporting/assisting customers with sequencing assay design to accelerate adoption of targeted sequencing on illumina’s platforms. Attendance at tradeshows/conferences in relevant fields. Be the point person for dedicated illumina User Group Meetings in collaboration with field marketing and support team to provide sample to data workflow training Assists sales and field marketing on new strategic initiatives requiring both technical and market knowledge Works collaboratively with territory account managers, marketing, service and support teams to ensure effective account/customer management and communication through pre-sales, during and- post-sales cycle, including review and meeting account pull through targets and goals Escalates technical issues to Technical Support for possible resolution for strategically important labs. Develops and maintain positive relationships with customers in assigned territory Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.  Preferred Requirements Life science industry experience preferred Applied Market Knowledge is a plus Extensive experience and understanding of leading genetics technologies and how they can be applied. Detailed knowledge of technological developments and trends in the sequencing markets Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills in Mandarin and English. Strong negotiation skills and ability to persuade Ability to travel within region to carry out primary responsibilities. All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Preferred Experience/Education Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience; or equivalent work experience. 岗位概述  Responsibilities 售前活动将包括销售过程中的技术知识演讲，如介绍演讲、研讨会、个别咨询等，在必要时，进行演示实验。 对因美纳测序和微阵列平台的应用或工作流程进行技术层面和应用层面的介绍。 售后活动包括与安装产品后的客户的协调，提供在具有重要战略意义的实验室中所需的工作流程或应用培训 支持/辅助客户的相关测序阵列设计，加快在客户因美纳平台上目标测序进程。 参加相关领域的展览会/大会。 作为与现场营销和支持团队合作的专项人员参加因美纳用户组会议，提供样品数据工作流程培训。 提供销售或现场营销新战略项目时所需有关技术和市场知识。 与区域客户经理、营销、服务和支持团队合作工作，保证有效的大客户/客户管理以及负责售前、售中和售后过程的沟通，包括回访和会面已经取得成果或达成目标的客户。 作为技术支持提供技术升级，为具有重要战略意义的实验室提供可能的解决方案。 提升和维护责任区域内客户的良好关系。 以上所列的任务和职责是本岗位的基本功能。然而，各种商务条件下可能需要完成额外的任务和职责。  Preferred Requirements 有生命科学行业经验者优先 有应用市场知识者加分 具有领先的遗传学技术及其应用方面的丰富经验和充分理解 具有技术发展和测序市场趋势的详细知识 优秀的中文普通话和英文口头和书面交流和介绍演讲技能 良好的谈判技巧和说服能力 能在负责区域内出差并完成主要职责 Preferred Experience/Education 科学学科的硕士以上学历（分子生物学、遗传学、或基因组学和/或生物信息学优先）

Job Summary  Reporting to the VP of Sales, the Sales Leader China is directly responsible for managing and developing the team in China in order to grow the TSI business in China. This position is responsible for channel development, cultivating key account relationships with customers, and identifying and developing new opportunities in the region. In addition to sales management and coaching, this position is to oversee business development, implement global go to market plans, and the development/implementation of regional sales and marketing initiatives. This position will also have dotted line responsibility to the administrative functions of our China operation.Reporting to the VP of Sales, the Regional Managing Director is directly responsible for managing and developing the team in China in order to grow the TSI business in China. This position is responsible for channel development, cultivating key account relationships with customers, and identifying and developing new opportunities in the region. In addition to sales management and coaching, this position is to oversee business development, implement global go to market plans, and the development/implementation of regional sales and marketing initiatives. This position will also have dotted line responsibility to the administrative functions of our China operation.  Job Responsibilities Directly responsible for transforming the China operation to sustainable business growth with strong commercial infrastructure and professional business management. Has overall control of planning, staffing, budgeting, managing expense priorities, and recommending and implementing changes to methods. Responsible for developing the overall China business strategy including sales, vertical segment targets, go to market, business development and business operation. Articulate the timeline of this development and the necessary resources requirements with qualified justification. Builds a world-class commercial organization through recruiting, developing, managing and coaching the team. Provides leadership for the China organization that aligns with TSI’s corporate vision, mission and behaviors to inspire exceptional performance. Directs resources of China operation to maximize return for TSI and provide high quality experience for China customers. Makes decisions on administrative or operational matters and ensures operations’ effective achievement of objectives. At all times, represents the company in a professional and ethical manner. Directly addresses performance shortfalls in China organization – including assessment of non-performance, action plan for resolution, clarification of goals and consequences for continued non-performance. Directly assists high value customer accounts to facilitate stable ongoing business partnerships. Provides input on new market opportunities to TSI corporate personnel. Ensures that customers are fully satisfied with their interaction with TSI and are eager to enter into future transactions with TSI. Maintains strong relationship with positive references and ensure that any references given are supportive of company and product. Controls and resolves issues arising from non-optimal performance of TSI products and supports the development of corrective action processes Completes other assignments and special projects as requested. Supervisory Responsibilities  Manage the sales, application support and administrative functions in China.  Job Requirements Education Required Relevant Technical or Business Degree Desired M.B.A Experience Minimum of 15 years of progressive working experience and at least 8 years with people management Have direct and indirect and sub-distribution sales channel management experience in China. Experience in starting up a performance organization and developing solid business plan Knowledge of: Required Chinese business practices and solid management skills Desired Market experience in one or more of the following: Government, Academic Research, Pharmaceutical, Semi-conductor, Construction, Occupational Health & Safety, Indoor Air Quality Core Competencies: Strong leadership and communications skills – English (and Chinese) Proficient in assessing different market segments and developing business plan Highly experienced manager with well-developed inter-personal skills – must be able to drive high-level performance from a commercial team over an extended time period Ability to drive regional business strategies and implement associated tactical plans Well-developed commercial and technical skills including strategic account management, sales process management, negotiation, etc. Self-motivated and directed. Highly motivated and successful individual who can attract talented additions to the China TSI team, and build and maintain a positive, challenging and dynamic work environment for their reports Ability to effectively resolve organizational and interpersonal conflicts Ability to monitor and control numerous concurrent tasks in tandem. Strong technical knowledge of the markets that TSI sells in to, government, university, automobile, pharmaceutical, HVAC, public health will be highly desirable. Proven ability to excel in a cross-functional team environment.

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
