description: Position Title: Account Manager (Academic)  Manager: Associate Director, Institutional Sales  Working Location: Beijing/Shanghai, China  Permanent Headcount  At Wiley, we welcome you for who you are, the background you bring, and embrace people who get excited about learning whether online or by book. Learning is for everyone, and so is our workplace. Bring your experiences, your perspectives, and your passion. It’s in our differences that we empower the way the world learns. Wiley is a diverse, global organization and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.  The Account Manager is responsible for generating revenue growth of institutional sales by developing subscriptions. Be responsible for WOL renewal business in 5-6 regions of China mainland. Maintain close and good relations with current customers. Convince potential customers to recognize Wiley portfolio. Achieve individual sales annual target as expectation.  How will you make an impact:  Corporate Responsibilities Follow all company policies & procedures in completing and implementation of tasks. Use initiative in performing duties & continually review current work practices with a view to recommend efficiency improvement. Sales Management Working with the Institutional Sales Team to develop and implement a sales plan to maintain and develop new business for China. In consultation with Senior Manager, Institutional Sales to develop sales proposals based on customer’s needs and requirement to further increase the revenue of Wiley products. Working with the Institutional Sales team to continuously develop new business and enhance current business relationships in China. Consistently monitor and track sales performance against sales targets, provide regular reporting on status of licensing negotiations and other sales activities, forecast sales results for the fiscal year in China Marketing & Market Analysis Management including Account Development Work closely with Channel Marketing Group to plan, develop and implement marketing strategies in China. Working closely with Channel Marketing Group to identify low usage customers, and assist to develop, plan and implement usage marketing plan in China. Work with marketing and editorial colleagues to identify marketing requirements for new products, services and initiatives in China. Consistently provide and communicate competitive market intelligence to Senior Manager, Institutional Sales and Management. As needed, present recommendation to adapt our existing policy and business terms to Management and/or Legal Counsel and manage approval process. Maintain an analysis of customer usage/revenue data to provide Marketing and Management recommendations for product, features and policy development. Business Development Management Work with Account Manager, Business Development to develop and implement new pricing model in China. Identify and exploit new business with existing products, new products, and/or re-purposing of existing content to new market segment. Leadership Management Active participation in the communications of various department including not limited to Marketing, Customer Services and Sales Support to further improve workflow and efficiency Ensure that sales initiatives are aligned with and leverage other organizational initiatives by acting as the sales champion and liaison cross functionally. We are looking for people who: Bachelor’s degree in Majoring in other related profession areas At least 4 years of related sales experience Adequate knowledge of publishing business and industry. Self-motivated, business-oriented, good communication and negotiation skills. Excellent interpersonal skills. Ability to influence other colleagues without direct authority. Builds and delivers solutions that meet customer expectations Establishes and maintains effective customer relationships Works cooperatively with others across the organization to achieve shared objectives Represents own interests while being fair to others and their areas Gains trust and support of others About Wiley:  We are in one of the most dynamic periods in our history as technology, globalism and economic diversity create far-reaching changes in the world. As a learning business, Wiley makes meaningful contributions to research discovery and lifelong learning by helping organizations achieve their goals and people achieve success from education through their career. We may have been founded over two centuries ago, but our secret to success remains the same: change with the times and adapt to meet the ever-evolving needs of our customers. The company’s headquarters are in Hoboken, New Jersey, with operations in the U.S., Europe, Asia, Australia, and Canada.  Location/Division:  Beijing, China  Job Requisition:  47869  Time Type:  Full Time

Company Description  Third Bridge was founded on the belief that human insights drive intelligent investment decisions.  To make the right investment decisions, our clients require access to the most relevant experts and their insights – we enable this through private consultations and exclusive content drawn from expert interviews.  Our clients consist of some of the largest private equity funds, hedge funds, mutual funds and management consulting firms, who are serviced by a team of over 900 employees located across eight global offices.  Third Bridge operates in a global, multi-billion-dollar market with double digit annual growth and has consistently received accolades for Great Places to Work and the top 100 fastest growing companies.  Job Description  The Sales Executive is responsible for prospecting, lead qualification, building relationships with prospective clients and delivering on the sales process. The position will have new business quota responsibilities.  Responsibilities Demonstrate Third Bridge’s value proposition across the entire suite of primary research services Execute end to end sales cycle for potential clients; from lead generation, managing trial accounts to the closing of new business deals Prospect potential clients who fit on-boarding criteria, develop relationships to better understand their broader research needs and explore cross-selling opportunities Nurture and track accounts to identify additional opportunities such as up-selling and cross-selling Successfully transition new accounts to account management team including onboarding handoff, introduction to key client stakeholders, etc. Collaborate with the entire global sales team (US, Europe, Asia) to help achieve firm revenue / sales targets Skills Experience or knowledge in selling directly in a B2B company. Experience with private equity, public equity and/or credit firms preferred Customer-centric attitude, and excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Proven experience in communicating effectively and building relationships quickly over the phone Demonstrable ability to create leads effectively with excellent networking skills A self-starter, who can establish and organize daily sales activities with minimal supervision Ability to manage pipeline and forecast accuracy on a monthly/quarterly/annual basis Qualifications 2-4yrs of sales experience Bachelor's Degree Proven track record of quota attainment Additional Information  What you can expect Private Medical Insurance Study support 15 days annual leave (increasing with tenure) 2 days’ off per year for community/corporate responsibility activity The successful candidate must, by the start of the employment, have permission to work in the country they are applying.  We know that to be truly innovative, we need to have a diverse team around us. That is why Third Bridge is committed to creating an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you are not 100% sure if you are right for the role, please apply anyway and we will be happy to consider your application.

description: Position Summary  Business development analyst (BDA) will support BDM activities in most tactical analysis, reports, and business updates; The BDA will be responsible for issue-focused business analysis, compiling and ensuring accuracy, consistency, and congruency for the information. The BDA will also be responsible for assisting the commercial team to capture the promo effectiveness review and ROI to guide future investment and optimization.  Essential Job Functions Routine reporting management: ensure the data accuracy and consistency Daily/ weekly/ monthly sales data update. Forecasting and rolling estimate (shipment, depletion, inventory). Tracking execution KPIs (AO, VPO, 3P execution, etc.). Commercial insights development: Provide analysis and interpretation of internal/external data to identify business opportunities. Develop issue-focused analysis with guidance from BDM. VPO tracking and detailed analysis. Work with regional commercial team to capture and record the key promo program, pilot recap to improve efficiency, multiply success and guide future investment. Business intelligence: Business intelligence (competition, industry dynamics, etc.) Maintain the Operating Unit market factbook Up-keep by channel by OU trade economics and value chain down to GP level Competitor product fact sheet update Project management support: Support BDM on 3rd party execution tracking projects, including vendor management, process optimization, data quality check, and deliverable optimization. Prepare special reports for management as requested. Perform other duties as assigned. Position Requirements Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in business, management, or a related field preferred. Equivalent related experience may be substituted for educational requirements. MBA or graduate degree in a business-related discipline is a strong plus. Fluent in English. Previous experience working in FMCG companies in a sales/marketing capacity is a strong plus. Prior experience with Power BI is a strong plus. Strong computer skills familiarity with Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Strong verbal and written communications skills and presentation skills. Strong analytical skills. Strong math, time management, and customer service skills. Demonstrated appreciation for the value of attention to detail and accuracy in completing tasks. Self-motivated and young potential Team player.

description: Job Description  THIS IS AN 18 MONTH FIXED TERM CONTRACT.  The Programmable Solutions Group is proud to serve more than thousands of customers with our leading technology in FPGAs, Power and structured ASIC products. In order to make sure that our Field Sales team and FAEs can spend as much time as possible with the customers, the Sales Operations Specialist team is here to make sure that the machinery in the background is working smoothly. We are the first point of contact and we know the ins and outs for almost any question, and if we don't know it, we find it out or get hold of the right person. We are working closely with teams across the globe who support us in our daily endeavours. Manages the sales operation process, performs forecasting, budgeting, planning, quoting, and analysis activities for sales operations. Acts as the communication conduit between the Customer, Sales, Business Unit, and the Factory to optimize revenue and achieve mutual objectives. Manages the customer's supply chain requirements, product demand and the company's supply strategies. Evaluates pricing structures to ensure fit with company objectives. Approves and executes pricing exceptions. Develops, implements and manages the underlying business processes running the sales operations functions. Determines CRM, other sales enablement, and sales operations system requirements to support the business processes, working with IT. Manages sales data operations and view of performance to critical business indicators. Strong ability on systematizing reports and business analysis, he/she is able to manage the data with multiple criteria, provide a clear picture of business trend and its impact. Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint Ability to regularly perform independent analysis, development, and implementation of solution to complex problems in business management and operations. Ability to Work both regionally and globally, flexibility in working hours to support other time zone This Job Might Be For You If  You enjoy solving problems. Taking on a challenge is something you like and finding a creative solution is your speciality. Finding the answer and not giving up is a strength of yours.  You like helping people. You go above and beyond and you not only do what you're asked to do, you look one step ahead and do that little extra - with a smile.  You pay attention to details. When you do something you do it thoroughly and well. You're organized and well prepared. Being able to prioritize and re-prioritize during the day is not a problem.  You communicate clearly. English is the corporate language and you can both speak and write it fluently. Listening to understand is also a given, and you ask clarifying questions to make sure.  You are motivated and driven. Working independently and taking a task and work on it from start to finish, involving the people who can help you when needed. If you see something that can be improved, you raise your voice and present your proposal.  You like working in a team and you are comfortable sharing both success and mistakes, as you learn from both. You support your team during holidays and leaves and you can also rely on your peers when you need their help.  Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or other relevant third level qualification Supply chain, program management, order management, planning or related experience in a semiconductor or high-tech company. Hands on experience with order management systems like SAP, Salesforce Experience with MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, MS Office A typical day as a Sales Operations Specialist might look like this: Work in Salesforce with the newly submitted Design Registrations from our distributors and ensure that criteria's and guidelines are met before approval. Meet with your Sales Representative with the Distributor FAE team to review the current Design Pipeline and help move the designs forward Review the Quote requests in Siebel that our distributors have submitted and make sure that all details are in place before assigning it to our Business Management team for approval Prepare for and drive an important call with a customer to work on a critical delivery situation that has been escalated to you together with our Customer Operations team. Our distributor Asset team is also involved and you are orchestrating this on behalf of Intel. Monitor and ensure that the Opportunity Pipeline Health criteria's are met and take necessary actions, for example alert the Sales team about some opportunities that are approaching the decision date soon. Arrange a sample order for a customer who need parts urgently for a prototype build Support your Sales Representative with necessary information for forecasting purposes, you find the information easily in Power Bi or BOBJ. Track and trace a piece of business that was designed by the Sales Team in Finland and that has started to ship in Malaysia, in order to bring back the revenue to the region. Answer emails from your distributor partners related to leadtime questions, access to our portal and pricing queries. Help a customer to renew a license for software and consult our team in Penang if there are questions you cannot answer Take the advanced Excel training via the O'Reilly platform that your peer recommended. Inside this Business Group  The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.

Siradel, an Engie group company, is providing over the world 3D digital twins of cities, collaborative and 3D visualization platforms with simulation smart city solutions to make cities more sustainable, connected, and resilient.  In strong growth for the development of 5G network design solutions and smart city projects, SIRADEL is strengthening its sales teams and opening several positions.  Why join us?  SIRADEL's smart cities solutions (data, software, expertise) contribute to the zero-carbon energy transition of cities and industries, the raison d'être of the ENGIE group.  Joining a team of experts in an agile, human-size company (160 people based in Rennes, Paris, Nice Lyon, Toronto, Dallas, Hong-Kong, Shanghai), you will be given the opportunity to work on innovative projects with the ambition to support Engie Group in its zero-carbon energy transition strategy.    JOB DESCRIPTION  Reporting to VP Sales Europe & APAC, the candidate will be responsible for developing and growing sales activities along with specific key accounts within territory of China (including Hong Kong, Macao and Tai Wan).  As Sales Manager you will be responsible to meet or exceed the assigned sales targets. You will have a track record of successful sales of telecom products, services and solutions similar to the Siradel portfolio and will have sold these successfully into the designated Chinese territory. You will have trusted C-level and Director-Level relationships with mobile operators, telcos vendors, telco regulators and have easy access to decision makers. You will have good knowledge of Telecom technologies and systems especially those in RF network planning (4/5G, Wifi), Radio propagation and IoT domains. You will be responsible to architect and execute a sales strategy for the assigned accounts which both successfully manages Siradel’s current business and succeeds to enable key growth initiatives.  You will succeed by having a keen understanding of the customer’s key business challenges and you will work with the client to develop solutions which deliver real value. You will thrive under your own initiative. Your customer base will expect you to know their business – frequent travel to them will form a large part of your work.  You will be an effective internal communicator and collaborator working successfully with all appropriate Siradel business functions. You will be responsible to adhere to appropriate sales approval and reporting processes.  As Sales Account Manager you will have clear business development and sales responsibilities for the Siradel connectivity portfolio of Products, Services and Solutions.  This will involve the following main responsibilities :  Progress and achieve the annual and quarterly business sales target for Chinese Telecom Market Develop and support new and existing business and technical partnerships across Mainland China, Hong Kong, Tai wan and Macao Prospection, follow up and develop new sales opportunities in China Build company and product line brand awareness in China Build, negotiate and close sales offer Participate in customer presentations, exhibitions, seminars and marketing activities   QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS  Minimum 5 years B2B sales experience in Chinese Telecom Market  BS/MS Degree level in Telecom, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent. Consistent achievement of Sales Targets Good commercial awareness, skill in communication and customer relationship maintenance, well spoken, confident and outgoing Team player who is driven by achievement and success Strong internal leader and collaborator Knowledge market : mobile Telecom, GIS, ITS, smart city. Fluent english is essential and the mastering of French is prioritized. Availability to travel frequently, for short time period.   PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS  Customer service orientation – a strong sense of customer service is required towards both internal and external customers Communication – clearly express ideas, listen, adjust language or terminology to suit the needs of the audience Initiative – the ability to perform duties before being told to do so. This will require a self-starter who is proactive in trying to achieve business unit goals Sense of urgency – react quickly to customer requests Teamwork – work effectively within the Siradel team structure    STATUS  Location: Shanghai, China Status: Full-Time. Compensation: package (fix + commission) based on experience and qualifications   CONTACT  CV and cover letter to jobs@siradel.com Reference SALES/LZ/02-2021

A. Purpose /Role of the job： Supports the global/regional key account business/transplants in East China. Maintain key account sales & service within the territory. Business develop in Key accounts, explore new business opportunity; develop Electronics & Household customers and new applications to achieve even beyond the existing sales target.  B. Environment/Context/Complexity of the job: •  Internal: Account managers, CSO, Plant QC, R&D, Technical Managers, RHQ •   External: Customers, compounding service providers, distributors, test centers, Associations  C. Responsibilities/ Accountabilities of the job: •  Key Result Areas : East China Key account business activity Major Activities : - Operational actions for E&H EC and global key account local support. - Develops & reviews contractual agreements, supply chain & product flow concepts & service - partner management for E&H business. Outcome : Deliver annual target CM1 result at premium margins and direct/guide local E&H key account managers.  • Key Result Areas : Maintain existing business (East China) Major Activities : - Communication with existing customers and regular visit to ensure order collection - follow customers’ inquires - Maintain all technical and service record and case history on customer sales. - Maintain good relationship with customer related key persons to stable business share Outcome : Achieve target of sales volume and profit  •  Key Result Areas : Business Development (East China) Major Activities : - Work with Key account managers to scout the market trend to seek new business chances both for customers and Styrolution. - Coordinate customers' seminars to promote new products and solutions from Styrolution. - Contact related industry associations to collect market and industry information - Identify and visit potential customers and lead the development process until business achieved Outcome : Open up new business successfully  •   Key Result Areas : Technical consultant     Major Activities : - Verify the customers’ complaint on site, and contact internal and external related parties to lead the whole process until problems solved.       - Serve customers’ concern such as material selection, process optimization, mould optimization, etc. - Manage local compounding service providers in the region to ensure them delivering qualified service and products to end customers  Outcome : Solve customers’ technical related issues and achieve sales target  •    Key Result Areas : Reporting Major Activities : - Obtain, update and evaluate market of responsible customer/industry - on time sales activity report, forecast or any requested report accurately and punctually - GKA business support and reporting. Outcome : Make management understanding market / customers for decision making   D. Required profile:  Level of education & Knowledge: Bachelor degree, preferably Polymer Science and Engineering  Experience in general: Min. 5 years in plastics industry related technical service, business development etc. Preferably having work experience in an international company  Technical skills: Fundamental knowledge about polymers and polymerization process Plastics processing trouble shooting. Fluent in English and Chinese, both writing and speaking  Competencies, Behavioral skills: Strong customer focus Very good negotiation skills Good interpersonal and presentation skills

Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Aug 23, 2021 Travel: No

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

description: The ideal candidate will be responsible for supporting our sales time activities. You will be a key contributor to our sales team’s success by providing outstanding customer service. Qualifications Required   Bachelor degree in International Trade, Business Administration, Commercial English, or related.  1-2 years export sales experience is preferred, fresh graduate is also welcomed.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems.  Good English reading & writing skill, as well as oral English capabilities.  Well-organized, have great time management skills and ability to multi-task.  Excellent communication skill, stable, patient and detailed.

PureLiving’s Qlear.io cloud is software as a service (SaaS) that creates value for businesses by bringing building data to life, through providing real-time analysis and display of indoor environmental quality (IEQ).  IEQ data is collected by monitoring hardware, streamed to the cloud, and instantly accessed via smart phone, tablet, laptop, desktop, or any other device with an internet connection. Qlear is the trusted data provider for 30% of Fortune 500 companies, who are leaders in their respective industries.   The Qlear International Sales Manager works to improve PureLiving’s Qlear software market position and achieve financial growth. This person defines long term strategic sales goals, builds key customer relationships, identifies business opportunities, negotiates and closes business deals and maintains extensive knowledge of current market conditions. To achieve this, you find potential new customers or partners, present to them, to ultimately convert them into clients, and continue to grow business in the future.  You see the bigger picture and love to find win-win, innovative solutions. You are a connector, known for brokering great relationships. You possess high IQ and EQ. You can effectively influence senior executives and junior operation executers alike. You may well have been a consultant or business development lead in the past.   业务拓展经理的工作是提高境纯的市场地位，实现财务增长。业务拓展经理需要定义长期的组织战略目标，建立关键客户关系，确定商业机会，谈判并完成商业交易，保持对当前市场环境的广泛了解。  你着眼于大局，寻找双赢、创新的解决方案。你是一个联系人，善于协调良好的关系。你有很高的智商和情商。你可以有效地影响高管和初级运营执行人。你曾经很可能是一名咨询师或业务开发主管。  业务开发经理在公司内部担任高级销售职务。你的工作是与客户经理、内部职能团队、营销人员和其他经理合作，以增加销售机会，从而最大限度地提高公司收益。为了实现这一点，你需要找到潜在的新客户或合作伙伴，与客户经理一起或独自呈现给他们，最终将他们转化为客户，并在未来继续发展业务。  Responsibilities ·       Prospecting new clients to ensure a robust pipeline opportunity ·       Creating and maintaining strong relationships with key contacts in new accounts, as well as existing customers to develop new opportunities ·       Strategic planning and implementation of new business development initiatives ·       Understanding competitor offerings and sharing relevant industry insights within teams ·       Meeting the agreed sales target for the position ·       Ongoing point of contact for key house accounts and oversight of long term account management ·       专注于寻找新客户，以确保一个庞大的渠道机会，并与客户服务团队合作，将这些转化为增加的业务。 ·       与新客户中的关键联系人以及现有未分配的客户建立并保持良好的关系，以开发新的机会。 ·       新业务发展计划的战略规划和实施。 ·       展示公司资质，并与潜在客户讨论潜在简报。 ·       作为一个团队，为整体战略做出贡献，在有机会的时候赢得客户。 ·       了解竞争对手的产品，并在团队内部分享相关行业见解。 ·       完成该职位商定的销售目标，包括但不限于产生直接收入或以项目平均利润率将渠道业务重新定向给客户经理，签署合作框架，推广展示厅项目等。   Qualifications ·       Over 3 years of sales and/or marketing experience or minimum 3 years of work experience related to business development ·       3-5年以上销售或市场经验 ·       或至少3年与业务发展相关的工作经验·        ·       A passion for executing live brand experiences ·       Self-motivation, a hunter who likes taking on challenges ·       Strong network and ability to leverage network ·       Strategic thinking, problem solving, communication & negotiation skills ·       Excellent presentation skills, ability to make sensible presentations which trigger sales opportunity ·       Excellent teamwork skills, time management and organization skills ·       Chinese passport or current (foreign) residents only ·       Proficient in English and Chinese ·       Qualifications in business management, environmental science, or HVAC are a plus ·       热爱推广和建设品牌 ·       自我激励，像猎人一样喜欢接受挑战 ·       有较强的人际关系和利用人际关系的能力 ·       战略思维、解决问题、沟通和谈判技巧 ·       优秀的演示技巧，能够做出合理的演示，从而激发销售机会 ·       优秀的团队合作能力，时间管理和组织能力 ·       仅限中国护照或目前居住在中国的（外国）居民 ·       精通英语和汉语 ·       商业管理、环境科学或暖通空调的资格证书拥有者优先考虑

description: Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. description: WHY DUPONT ELECTRONICS & INDUSTRIAL (E&I)?  There’s never been a more exciting time to join us. It's a time of incredible progress at DuPont — a time of momentum. It's the time for change makers, for the doers and pioneers, to create essential innovations the world needs. We pursue new technologies and performance materials that enable your designs to be smaller, more complex and more powerful than you could ever imagine.  DuPont is a technology leader, serving the semiconductor, circuit board, display, digital and flexographic printing, healthcare, aerospace, industrial and transportation industries. Why wait for a better future? Invent a better n ow. Build the next thing that changes everything! Teams include Quality, Demand/Supply chain, R&D, manufacture and marketing, etc. Responsible for making deals, negotiating contracts, managing conflicts, and tackling problems. Introducing the product offering and customer value proposition to customers Distributor management JOB QUALIFICATION More than 5 year of successful experience in display industry for Sales and Field Service. Good strategic thinking, an influencer, communicator, problem-solver with strong customer-orientation, and execution. Highly self-motivated and target driven. Good team player. jobTitle: Strategic Medical Partnerships Manager , GCA & Asia
description: 3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.  Job Description  As Strategic Medical Partnerships Manager, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:  Consulting with Area division leadership to set medium- to long-term medical strategic direction and operating plans for engagement with and development of Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs), HCPs, and PMSOs, and leveraging these relationships to capture valuable VOC. Demonstrate expertise in industry trends, customer requirements, and business objectives to define processes and guidelines. Decisions are independently executed and limited by the objectives/ guidelines of the business. Consulting on Area strategy and tactics. This role has a significant business impact on the organization due to scope of responsibility and complexity of duties, including contributing to decisions that will likely impact multiple functional areas of the business in assigned Area (s). Contribution to the annual budget development process for the Area based on business priorities and company strategy. Responsible for monitoring spend month to month and quarter to quarter. Reports outcome to SMP leader to inform global budget and spend reports. Leading strategic planning and execution of grant and fellowship support including oversight of grant committee function for the Area. Provides input and updates to the Global SMP grant program manager for grants and implements new policies and procedures as developed by HCBG at the direction of the Global SMP grant program manager. Leading Voice of Customer (VOC) activity in partnership with internal teams according to Global and Area strategic plans and in accordance with Health Care Compliance policies. Leading the effort to identify HCPs and KOLs to support the needs of the business in the assigned Area (s). Responsible for the Annual Needs Assessment to determine need and on-board HCP/KOL consultants and speakers. Responsible for the end to end contracting process and company relationship with HCPs/KOLs. Identification and relationship management with Professional Medical Societies and Organizations (PMSOs) at the Global and Area levels.  Required Skills And Expertise  To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications: A Bachelor level university/college degree in a related field is required. A Master level degree is preferred. Minimum of 6 years of relevant working experience is normally required. 3+ years of Medical Affairs/Professional Affairs/Professional Relations experience in Medical Device field is preferred. Expert/master knowledge and experience with the most current theories and practices in medical affairs and a thorough knowledge of more than one related discipline, such as medical education, medical publications, sales, or marketing. High degree of interpersonal skills and cross-cultural awareness. Is effective working and influencing in a matrix environment Strong project management skills, a bias towards action, and a focus on continuous improvement. Communication: Ability to communicate in written and spoken English and Mandarin. Knowledge of standard office computer programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Proven ability to establish a shared vision and inspire others to work towards it. Uses leadership and supervisory skills necessary for managing people such as knowledge of employment law, knowledge of corporate/location policies and procedures, effective communications, performance appraisal procedures, performance management, hiring and interviewing, documentation, interpersonal skills, coaching skills, change management, conflict resolution, delegation, goal setting, motivation, emotional intelligence, strategic planning.  Preferred Qualifications  Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:  Demonstrated strong project management skills High degree of interpersonal skills and cross-cultural awareness. Is effective working and influencing in a matrix environment Knowledge of corporate systems relevant to assigned area of responsibility is preferred (Financial systems such as Oracle and SAP, HCP and event management systems). Ability to communicate in additional written and spoken languages relevant to the assigned Areas  Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.  Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.  3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement  Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.  Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibilities Pre-sales activity will include delivery of technical expertise during the sales process including presentations, seminars, individual consultation, and hands-on demo experiments if needed. Executes technical and application based presentations on illumina’s sequencing and microarray platforms, applications and/or workflows. Post-sales activity includes working with post-installation customers providing additional workflow or applications training in strategically important labs. Supporting/assisting customers with sequencing assay design to accelerate adoption of targeted sequencing on illumina’s platforms. Attendance at tradeshows/conferences in relevant fields. Be the point person for dedicated illumina User Group Meetings in collaboration with field marketing and support team to provide sample to data workflow training Assists sales and field marketing on new strategic initiatives requiring both technical and market knowledge Works collaboratively with territory account managers, marketing, service and support teams to ensure effective account/customer management and communication through pre-sales, during and- post-sales cycle, including review and meeting account pull through targets and goals Escalates technical issues to Technical Support for possible resolution for strategically important labs. Develops and maintain positive relationships with customers in assigned territory Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.  Preferred Requirements Life science industry experience preferred Applied Market Knowledge is a plus Extensive experience and understanding of leading genetics technologies and how they can be applied. Detailed knowledge of technological developments and trends in the sequencing markets Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills in Mandarin and English. Strong negotiation skills and ability to persuade Ability to travel within region to carry out primary responsibilities. All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Preferred Experience/Education Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience; or equivalent work experience. 岗位概述  Responsibilities 售前活动将包括销售过程中的技术知识演讲，如介绍演讲、研讨会、个别咨询等，在必要时，进行演示实验。 对因美纳测序和微阵列平台的应用或工作流程进行技术层面和应用层面的介绍。 售后活动包括与安装产品后的客户的协调，提供在具有重要战略意义的实验室中所需的工作流程或应用培训 支持/辅助客户的相关测序阵列设计，加快在客户因美纳平台上目标测序进程。 参加相关领域的展览会/大会。 作为与现场营销和支持团队合作的专项人员参加因美纳用户组会议，提供样品数据工作流程培训。 提供销售或现场营销新战略项目时所需有关技术和市场知识。 与区域客户经理、营销、服务和支持团队合作工作，保证有效的大客户/客户管理以及负责售前、售中和售后过程的沟通，包括回访和会面已经取得成果或达成目标的客户。 作为技术支持提供技术升级，为具有重要战略意义的实验室提供可能的解决方案。 提升和维护责任区域内客户的良好关系。 以上所列的任务和职责是本岗位的基本功能。然而，各种商务条件下可能需要完成额外的任务和职责。  Preferred Requirements 有生命科学行业经验者优先 有应用市场知识者加分 具有领先的遗传学技术及其应用方面的丰富经验和充分理解 具有技术发展和测序市场趋势的详细知识 优秀的中文普通话和英文口头和书面交流和介绍演讲技能 良好的谈判技巧和说服能力 能在负责区域内出差并完成主要职责 Preferred Experience/Education 科学学科的硕士以上学历（分子生物学、遗传学、或基因组学和/或生物信息学优先）

jobTitle: Associate Market Development Manager - Global Premium Winery
description: Worldwide Wine Group, China is the most potential market Promising career path, Business has great room for growth  About Our Client  The largest family owned winery in the world, with its established portfolio of wines sold in over 100 countries worldwide, our client is one the most prestigious and renowned producers of US wines globally and has been building its business in Greater China over past 15 years. Active in HK, Shanghai & Guangzhou, they are now looking to expand their business in to the North China market, having recently secured an agreement with a leading local distributor.  Job Description  Working remotely, you will lead the expansion of our clients wholesale business in North China and enable the successful performance of appointed third party distributor(s) or designated Wholesalers by providing marketing support, product and brand education across the China market. Develop and deliver effective marketing presentations to distributor management in partnership Works with distributor management to understand performance expectations and establish necessary sales goals, priorities and incentives.  The Successful Applicant  Experience in beverage (alcohol or non alcohol is highly desirable but not essential. What is essential however, is the ability to demonstrate a track record in building a network of distribution partners serving retailers and a consumer product background. You will be able to showcase your work with Distributors and wholesalers to develop the growth of your product portfolio. Bachelor's degree plus 4-5 years of Sales experience within the consumer products sector or alcohol beverage distributor focused on building brands in the North China market. Established relationships with specialist channels such as On Premise, Premium & E-Retailers. Skilled in positioning high end Premium product to brand appropriate customers. MUST be fluent in English & Mandarin.  What's On Offer  This a wonderful opportunity to work a business steeped in history. You will be joining a company that prides itself on treating its people equitably. As the first person in the North China region, you will have the rare opportunity to build a business that is yours. Our client has the ambition, appetite and resources to continue investing. This means you will have the chance to continue growing with the business. As you grow the business, you will be able to grow your career and continue developing.  Contact: untitled_design.pngCecilia Gong  Quote job ref: 4198631

Qualifications Bachelor’s degree from a reputable institution; advanced degree preferred 10+ years of experience in a multinational bank or consulting firm and spent time in a management role Experience in strategic project planning, business process revamp, pricing control, retail/SEM/private banking sales or service transformation (including frontline rollout), digitalization will be highly preferred Extensive experience in rolling out and managing large-scale implementation projects Superior problem solving and analytical skills Strong people skills and ability to engage all levels of the organization Strong, persuasive written and verbal communication skills in Mandarin and English Comfort with extensive travel (4-5 days a week) What You'll Do  You will work in small teams with colleagues and clients to build the strategies, capabilities, systems and processes needed to deliver bottom-line results and ensure those results will be sustained.  In this role, you will manage projects and progress by tracking metrics, handling complex analyses and preparing communications to report back to client and internal leadership. You'll develop practical recommendations and contribute to team discussions on implications of analysis, identifying implementation challenges. You'll work alongside the client’s staff on each project, assisting with implementation tasks such as facilitating working sessions with front-line and supervisors, connecting with and motivating the client team, or developing skills of McKinsey or client team members when appropriate, principally through coaching. You'll also solicit feedback from team members to develop your own skills.  Who You'll Work With  You’ll be working with McKinsey Implementation – a rapidly growing capability for our firm – in our Shanghai, Beijing, Shenzhen, Hong Kong or Taipei office. You’ll work closely with our client project teams, providing end-to-end support to ensure that the clients are able to deliver and sustain the full benefits of McKinsey’s recommended change in their business.

Description  You Will Be Part of Growing Team  The Key Initiative Leader will report to the Marketing Director and support all product categories in Greater China region. This person will work closely with both internal cross function teams and external 3rd parties to drive synergy and win-win solution for the business.  Your Challenge  Accountabilities (includes but not limited to) Define 3rd parties licensing (3PL) business strategy with Marketing leader for both licensing in and licensing out. Co-own the annual business target and share the responsibilities with product and sales teams on the annual business results of out-licensing and in-licensing projects. Work with cross functions to align business criteria for project classification and identify proper process to manage business risk and improve agility. Lead the cross functionally effort for 3PL on delivery against aligned KPIs. Identify key business partners of 3rd parties for strategic business growth through out-licensing and in-licensing based on aligned destinated-portfolio needs by Crop. Develop joint business plan with the strategic 3rd parties to seek multi-levels’ cooperation with business effectiveness and operational efficiencies. Work with cross functions to deep understand and update movements of potential business opportunities of new AI, tech and formulation cooperation in China. Support 3rd parties’ product development and launches in coordination with the concerned brand and product managers. Monitoring and providing guidance to the Sales team of large accounts and corporate customers by working closely with them. Ensure coordination between the key 3rd parties and relevant internal stakeholders. Qualifications  To Grow What Matters, You Will Need: Bachelor’s degree above, education background in Agriculture, Crop Protection related majors is a plus. Experienced and resourceful in agrichemical industry with product knowledge is desired. Understanding of industry specifics in Greater China region. Self-motivated and eager to learn personality. Team player with good interpersonal, communication, negotiation skills. Strong analytical, and strategic thinking skills.

工作职责:  Job Description Summary  As a Senior Account Sales, you will develop & implement One GE Healthcare sales strategy by maintaining commercial relationships/alliances with Accounts at zone level, e.g. hospitals, hospital groups, government bodies or Group Purchasing Organizations. It's a role that will be responsible for maintaining a detailed understanding of assigned accounts’ business and keeping GE Healthcare Zone, Region & Product management informed and appropriately involved. You will be expected to lead & close multimodality and single product deals in their assigned accounts.  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Primary Responsibilities  Financial Performance Achieve sales and orders volumes at the target prices in assigned accounts/territory. Coordinate orders and sales forecasts within the applicable sales funnel tools and reports for in their assigned territory/accounts in conjunction with Product Sales Specialist/product Specialists. Account Management Maintain relationships, develop a business strategy, and maximize business opportunities for all GE Healthcare businesses, products & services within allocated accounts/territory (or within defined care area/department scope). Represent OneGEHC in the account or care area/department and acts as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory. Provide on-going feedback to management, product teams, services and marketing. Maintain Go-to-Market plans in conjunction with Zone cross functional and multi-product teams to achieve targets and grow GE’s share of customer investments in capital, diagnostics and operational expenditures. Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through consistent high quality interactions with customer management. Build long term strategic alliance with portfolio of accounts to continue to add value, and promote Service offerings to identify and escalate commercial service needs to drive customer NPS. In cooperation with Product teams and Marketing, drive One GE Healthcare promotional events in assigned territory. Be aware of customer segmentation and promote offerings relevant to each client’s segment. Opportunity Management Prospecting for new customers and business opportunities in addition to growing and maintaining the existing customer portfolio. Prioritize new leads to create a balanced sales funnel for future sales. Lead and leverage Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialists, Care Area or Category Leaders, Service Operations and other Company resources to provide the necessary technical, clinical and business content to create a competitive differentiation. Coordinate One GE Healthcare team on assigned accounts in order to deliver solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations. Lead & coordinate multi-P&L proposals, preparing sales quotations, planning customer meetings and demonstrating equipment capabilities across diagnostic product portfolio with relevant Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialist and other sales support staff. Ensure order and configuration quality at the point of entry to ensure accuracy, configuration integrity and that all requirements are tied to documented customer inputs. Lead successful negotiation and closure of multi P&L opportunities, interfacing with all key buyer influencers. Assist Product Sales Specialists in negotiation and deal closure of single product deals as required. Promote point of sale service contracts and financing solutions and drive margin through selling value and achieving price targets. GE Product & Market awareness Develop a solid knowledge of GE product and service portfolio and competitors’ products. Develop and maintain expertise of market and technology trends in order to understand customer issues and challenges as well as educating customer on their unmet clinical and business needs. Develop and maintain deep understanding of CxO level business and clinical needs and how GE provide solutions/offerings to meet these needs differently from the competition. Compliance Adhere to and uphold highest standards of compliance to relevant international and local Regulatory and GE Healthcare Promotional Codes Adhere to all applicable GE and GE Healthcare compliance policies, codes and training requirements Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required. 任职条件:  Qualifications / Requirements Education to Bachelor Degree level or the equivalent of four years of sales experience. 2 years of strategic sales experience. 2 years experience in healthcare. Proven key account management and project planning skills. Strong customer focus and desire to continuously improve expertise Well developed listening, influencing, interpersonal and networking skills to drive collaborative culture at all levels; High level presentation skills; able to present ideas to customers in a way that produces understanding and impact. Quality Specific Goals Aware of and comply with the GEHC Quality Manual, Quality Management System, Quality Management Policy, Quality Goals, and applicable laws and regulations as they apply to this job type/position Complete all planned Quality & Compliance training within the defined deadlines Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required Knowledge and understanding of all Global Privacy and Anti-Competition Policies Knowledge and understanding of all Environmental Health Policies (including but not limited to GE Healthcare EHS Policies, GE Healthcare Fleet Rules, etc.) and operate within them to ensure that no company policy or Country / Int’l Law is broken Drive continuous improvement on all related processes, work instructions, and procedures to ensure ongoing standardization and simplification of the Quality Management System. Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

Business management to exist and potential customers Well organize customer management and identify new business gain and penetrate into new market to expand FW market share under the guidance of sales manager. Here, you can make an impact and make a difference. Come join us.  Huntsman is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identification, sexual orientation and/or expression or any other characteristic protected by law in every location in which we have facilities national or local.  Please refer to https : // www . huntsman . com / privacy / online-privacy-notice for Company’s Data Privacy and Protection information.  All unsolicited resumes presented by recruitment agencies are treated as pro bono information or service.  Huntsman is aware of a scam involving fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that emails from Huntsman always end in “@huntsman.com” and that any job offer that requires payment or requires you to deposit a check is likely a scam. About VERITAS  Veritas solves what no one else can. With an industry-leading product portfolio, we offer proven, modern, and integrated technology that brings together availability, protection, and insights. Our Veritas Enterprise Data Services Platform addresses current and future data issues end-to-end – keeping mission-critical workloads highly available, protecting data everywhere, and providing insights to optimize costs and maintain regulatory readiness.  Veritas supports 500+ data sources, 150+ storage targets, 50+ clouds, and any deployment model imaginable. We serve 99% of the Fortune 100, 90% of the Fortune 500, and are the market leader in Software-defined Storage, Data Protection, and Archiving.  Veritas’ Worldwide Field Operations (WFO) propels company growth by driving all aspects of new business and channel sales and includes global sales operations and global sales enablement for all new business and renewal sales.  Responsibilities The Sales Account Manager is distinguished by their deep knowledge of the IT industry and Veritas’ Information Management Portfolio. This industry expert will be assigned to large, complex, high visibility, strategic, named accounts. Sells Veritas’ entire information management portfolio (backup/recovery, high availability, clustering, archiving, eDiscovery, etc.) and maintains relationships with existing named accounts that are of substantial strategic importance to the organization. Develops strategies and orchestrates company resources to maximize sales volume and profit goals within assigned accounts. The territory is comprised of accounts that are strategic to the long-term success of the organization. The candidate is expected to cultivate and maintain executive level relationships in IT and various Lines of Business (LOB), focusing on the strategic nature of the relationship. Represents Veritas to the customer and the customer to Veritas. Responsible for expanding Veritas’ footprint in the assigned territory and ensuring ongoing customer satisfaction. Primary point-of-contact sales manager for account regardless of account’s geographic location. Meeting and/or exceeding sales quota and customer satisfaction metrics. Assigned to large, complex, high visibility, strategic, or tactically important accounts. Ability to collaborate with extended Veritas and partner teams but also to work independently to accomplish required tasks. Interface with all levels of management. Negotiating and influencing to build consensus. Present programs internally and externally. Work is focused on operational plans in support of strategic goals. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. 4+ years’ sales and/or account management experience in IT software/hardware sales. TS/SCI clearance may be required. Strong, documented track record of achievement against quota. Current contacts/relationships and working business knowledge of assigned customers. Strong business and executive level sales acumen. Tangible examples required. Excellent time management, presentation, written and oral skills. At Veritas, we care about the causes close to your heart and enable you to volunteer, donate, and do good. We also value uniqueness and know that a more diverse and inclusive workforce makes a winning team, so come as you are! Interested? Then apply and find out more about #TeamVTAS!

About Us:  Epicor Software Corporation is a global technology leader dedicated to helping businesses drive growth for more than 45 years. Our modern, industry-specific software helps customers boost efficiency and productivity by simplifying and automating everyday processes. We have a stellar team of nearly 4,000 worldwide employees who are passionate about building exceptional products and solutions through teamwork, constant innovation, and integrity. We strive to hire and reward star players who inspire one another and drive results for the business and our customers.  About the Role:  Your job will be to generate interest in our suite of visionary ERP software solutions. As a Business Development Representative at Epicor, you’ll begin to learn the ropes immediately. In your first weeks and months, you’ll focus on training and gaining as much knowledge as possible around Epicor and our products. As you learn, you’ll begin reaching out to prospects and building relationships with key stakeholders in your industry.  You’ll want to have the spirit, positivity and personality to enjoy the challenge of a new career in business development. Persistence and resourcefulness are also important if you’re to reach and engage busy people. If you’re looking for a role with a ton of opportunity to gain new skills, win new customers and become part of an outstanding global team, it’s time to talk to Epicor.  What You’ll Do: Create inroads with key decision makers in businesses across NA to generate interest in Epicor products Hit the pipeline hard to grow and nurture opportunities for the sales organization Keep on top of market research to share with your field territory manager so we can stay on top of the game Call, e-mail, DM, smoke signal the top and middle-size discrete manufacturers in your territory and build trust-based relationships Always. Be. Learning. From Epicor products, focused industry to our value proposition, to the many applications for our software, make sure you know the latest What You Need to Succeed: You are goal oriented and highly self-motivated for success, with a proven track record of achieving set goals You are adaptable and thrive in situations where you can think quick on your feet. Previous experience in IT industry: Business Development, B2B Sales, Call Center/Telemarketing, Customer Service. Bachelor’s degree preferred Additional Skills That Could Set You Apart: Sales or tele sales experience in ERP or MES vendor from local or foreigner (such as Kingdee, Yonyou or Digiwin software) Experience with discrete manufacturing Experience with CRM Software (e.g. Salesforce) Understanding of China Market especially in discrete manufacturing Evidence of hitting/smashing targets Self driven Self motivated Working under pressure Both language of Mandarin and Cantonese jobs.epicor.com

description: About The Role  Responsible for managing and supporting Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs) needs in key academic and commercial accounts.  Meets and overdelivers revenue and margin goals for target accounts through multi-channels collaborations.  Identify new opportunities to develop commercial relationships with key accounts in Academic/Biotech/Pharma/Clinical Labs spaces.  The AbGenius Team focuses on a tailored approach and customer service supporting KOLs to drive key accounts revenue to deliver Abcam’s strategic goals and objectives. These efforts will utilize our broad capabilities to position Abcam as the partner for cutting-edge scientists in the Academic/bio-industry/hospital markets.  Working across multiple channels, we aim to position the full scope of Abcam’s innovative technology platforms and expertise to serve scientists while capturing downstream revenue opportunities. Most importantly, we are constantly working hand-in-hand with these scientists to help them achieve better research outcomes and to accelerate their discoveries’ lead time.  Roles & Responsibilities Establish strategic plans, objectives and forecasts for each key account and update plans monthly. Serves as a consultant to the target accounts, tracking the shopping list of Accounts and identification of key influencers, decision makers and end users. Work with Channel Managers and distributor sales teams to drive the technical aspects of pre-sales and post-sales activities Leverage available resources to meet customer needs and work effectively with cross-functional teams of suppliers and internal resources Introduce Abcam’s cutting-edge product portfolio based on Principle Investigators’ (PI)latest research and discoveries Develop strong relationships and partnerships with Key Accounts with the aim to expand business opportunities. Keep abreast of market and customer research thereby providing expertise and insights t into specific markets and industries to internal and external customers Stay informed of product tactics as well as provide customer feedback to the marketing/portfolio team About You Master’s Degree, Ph.D preferred, majors in molecular biology or/and biotechnology, Proven experience (1-3 years) in sales and key account management within the life science industry. Solid knowledge of cutting-edge life science research advancements and bioindustry technologies is preferred. Strong communication and presentation skills. Self-starter drives actions with passion. Has strong negotiation and influencing skills. Ability to implement and deliver on specific Account strategy plans. Performs other duties as assigned by the Key Account Management Head. Interpersonal Skills Dynamic personality, team player with an open communication style. Great customer facing skills. Able to work autonomously and effectively in a matrixed, flexible working environment. Results focused. Flexible to meet the demands of the role. Willing to travel throughout China, traveling time is likely to be more than 50% High level of integrity and ethics. If this sounds like you and you’d like to be a part of a fast-paced, growing business with the vision to become the most influential company and best-loved brand in life sciences, please apply now!  Pay and Benefits  In addition to competitive salaries, we offer an attractive and flexible benefits package, a culture focused on well-being and opportunities for growth and development, and a highly flexible working environment.  About Us  An idea conceived in a University of Cambridge laboratory in 1998, Abcam plc (www.abcamplc.com) began life as an innovative and entrepreneurial start-up, spearheaded by like-minded individuals who shared a common purpose of providing the scientific community with quality antibody reagents, as well as trustworthy and up-to-date information about their uses and limitations. Abcam has now grown to become a leading supplier of protein research tools to life scientists, whilst always maintaining the core collaborative values assumed at its inception.  Abcam now supports life science researchers in their quest to understand the cause of disease and ultimately offer improvements to diagnoses and treatments. To achieve this outcome, the company both develops and manufactures its own products in specialist facilities across the globe, and sources from over 400 partners, offering scientists the newest, most innovative and highest quality research tools available globally, regardless of source. With a customer base of research scientists who require high performance products with detailed technical specifications, 64% of global researchers use Abcam products.  Inclusion & Diversity  Abcam is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes all employment decisions without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Primary Location  CN-CN-Shanghai  Work Locations  Shanghai  Job  Customer Service  Organization  Shanghai  Schedule  Regular  Shift  Standard  Job Type  Full-time  Travel  Yes, 50 % of the Time  Job Posting  Sep 1, 2021, 12:52:55 AM

description: Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Aug 23, 2021 Travel: No
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With large production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, as well as a global and regional research and development hub in Shanghai, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry. BASF posted sales of approximately €8.5 billion in 2020 to customers in Greater China and employed 8,948 people as of the end of the year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en.  Objectives Conduct and coordinate Hygiene products sales and key account management activities in south of China Develop new business in south of China in line with China sales team frameworks Manage the contact matrix ensuring that all potential points of contact and influence are being served appropriately Main Tasks Ability to understand and anticipate area customer’s needs in depth and communicate this within team and own organization for account strategy development Plan, develop and implement area market and account strategies in line with China sales team frameworks, marketing and business concepts as well as product and service portfolios for the accounts Formulate or implement the operative pricing policy and plan the sales volume. Negotiate prices and terms Manage the interfaces between product management team, supply chain team and BYC team as required, ensure account satisfaction to the largest extent Leading/ support the new business development in south of China to expand the customers base and deliver solid business results Conduct sales forecast (incl. imports and local production). Monitor inventories and ensure timely collection of receivables Provide area market investigation and short & long term area business development strategy suggestion to China sales management team Drive decision making process for growth achievement with a focus on volume & cCM1 Cooperate with technical service team to serve and development products as customers’ needs, and solve the customer problems Requirements Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in chemistry, business or related discipline Working Experience: Minimum 5 years’ relevant working experience in account management, technical service preferably in hygiene industry Strong understanding of the hygiene industry Fluent in English and excellent presentation skills Primary Location  CN-Guangdong-Guangzhou  Other Locations  CN-Shanghai-Shanghai  Job  Sales / Technical Sales  Ongoing  For BASF, diversity is one of the essential keys to business success and the well-being of our employees. We promote an inclusive culture that accepts the diversity of people, experiences and capabilities. Join the team and connect with more than 117,000 other minds. Stay alert for possible recruitment fraud!  This can include fake websites, fake job offers, or contact from a person falsely claiming to represent BASF.
