Role: Partnerships Manager East Asia  Location: Hong Kong, China  Salary: Competitive NGO rate  Position: Full time  About The Climate Bonds Initiative (CBI)  The Climate Bonds Initiative (CBI) started in 2009 as a project of the Network for Sustainable Financial Markets (NSFM), an international network of finance sector professionals, academics and others dedicated to improving financial market integrity and efficiency. CBI is now the world’s leading organization working to mobilize the largest capital market of all, the $100 trillion global bond market, for climate change solutions. It is an investor-focused, not-for-profit organisation, whose outputs are an open source public good.  Our primary work streams include green bonds standard and certification, green bond data and market analysis, and policy advisory. We have been providing support for green bond market development in various regions/countries including Europe, US, China, India, Brazil and Mexico, in collaboration with UNEP Inquiry, European Commission, and OECD, etc. Climate Bonds Initiative is a special member of the Green Finance Committee in China, playing an advisory role in proceedings.  The Role  We are looking for a Partnerships Manager to join us in Hong Kong to: Formulate business development strategies in the East Asian region (including China) Client origination, acquisition, conversion Proposal drafting, presentation, conversion and contract drafting Client onboarding in coordination with relevant CBI teams Client relationship management Responsible for existing client relationships, ensuring client upgrading and long-term retention Originating and seizing up selling opportunities for all sponsorship projects. Develop and deliver client content (e.g. education; awareness and briefing sessions, speeches, oral or written interviews / op-eds, etc) Work with the Partnerships team on the implementation of strategies and processes Accurately tracking correspondence with partners through the SalesForce medium and maintaining administrative systems Develop funding opportunities with local partners and supporters  Requirements  Qualification and Experience  Essential Graduate’s degree in Marketing, Business or Economics, (Climate) Finance or related fields 7 years+ of experience in working with key relationships, marketing communications, or relevant experience in communications and project management Experience and confidence dealing with high-level stakeholders and senior management Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills Flexible and self-motivated, with capacity to multitask and prioritise, managing multiple projects with different teams and/or partners, meet tight deadlines and work under pressure in a high-paced environment High degree of autonomy and independent judgement with excellent troubleshooting and follow-through skills Proficiency in both Chinese and English.  Desirable Fluency in any other languages than Chinese and English are highly welcome Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite Experience or affinity with database management (e.g. SalesForce) Knowledge and experience in environmental issues, climate change, climate finance and sustainability.  Climate Bonds is a small team of people driven by a big mission. Every person assists the other work streams from time to time. We seek a passionate individual who is intuitive, flexible and readily able to prioritise and manage a multitude of tasks. In return you will be working within an organisation leading the development of innovative international climate finance solutions with global stakeholders including governments, investors, large companies and NGOs.  If you are interested in this role, please submit your Cover Letter and a CV (in English)  Benefits  25 days holiday
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Nonprofit Organization Management, and Financial Services

This is an exciting opportunity for candidates with beauty care experience to join fast growing California company Amyris. The role has a higher purpose - We are leading the way to a more sustainable future in the beauty category with high-performing premium ingredients. The ideal candidate would have experience in marketing, sales and product development and be an effective internal coordinator (lining up various in-house functional expertise such as R&D, compliance, Marcom/ marketing, etc)  Amyris is a leading biotechnology company that was started with a grant from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation to make anti-malarial drugs more affordable. Today we use the same fermentation technology to deliver high-performance ingredient alternatives to petroleum, plant and animal-based products across a wide range of industry segments to reduce environmental impact. Amyris beauty care ingredients (Aprinnova) are found globally in thousands of world’s top brands. Amyris also owns and operates a family of consumer brands that have been built around our Clean Beauty - No Compromise promise. Amyris is headquartered in San Francisco Bay Area and listed in NASDAQ.  Apprinova is the leading supplier of sugarcane-derived ingredients, Neossance Squalane and Neossance Hemisqualane, paving the way for clean and non-toxic cosmetics around the globe. As a joint venture between Amyris Inc. and Nikkol Group, Aprinnova utilizes cutting edge biotechnology capability and 70 years of cosmetic industry expertise to deliver a new standard that makes sustainability a competitive advantage. We are committed to Clean Beauty offering ingredients that are safe for the consumer and the environment without compromising product performance.  We have been successfully selling Neossance Squalane emollient to beauty brands in China. We are now preparing to launch more ingredients and looking for a product manager with passion for beauty care, sustainability and growth to help us build the business in China.  Responsibilities Drive accelerated growth of the Amyris beauty ingredients business in China. Support distributor sales teams in winning new customers. Build Amyris beauty ingredients awareness and image to attract new customers. Create communication materials to convert beauty brands to our new ingredients. Work closely with HQ marketing and technical teams.  Qualifications University degree in business and Chemistry/Biology. 10+ years of marketing experience in beauty care. Experience working in a multinational company. B2B experience would be ideal, but not a must. Proven ability to collaborate with sales teams and distributors. Digitally savvy, understanding of social media platforms, eye for beautiful visuals. Ability to convert scientific concepts and terminology into compelling selling stories. Strong communication skills and confidence to present to large audiences. Driven, entrepreneurial, curious, passion for sustainability, integrity. Experience in establishing distribution channels Bilingual with Chinese  At Amyris, we believe that diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) is essential to our core values. We embrace and encourage an equity-minded work culture, knowing that it is the driving force of innovation that positively impacts our employees, consumers, and communities. And for Amyris, a sense of belonging is what drives our mission forward and is the foundation of everything we do, ensuring a healthier, more sustainable future for us all.  Make Good, No Compromise .  Amyris, a leader in industrial synthetic biology, uses its innovative bioscience solutions to achieve renewable products by converting plant sugars into hydrocarbon molecules. Amyris’ molecules are used in wide range of specialty & performance chemicals, flavors & fragrances and in applications ranging from cosmetics to biofuels. Learn more at www.amyris.com .  Under the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 (“CCPA”), Amyris is required to inform California residents who are our job applicants (“Applicants”) about the personal information we collect about you when you apply to a job on this site.  As an Applicant, you have the right to know and understand the categories of personal information we collect about you, and the purposes for which the categories of personal information shall be used, pursuant to the CCPA. If you have any questions regarding this information, please contact Amyris at privacy@amyris.com  As a VEVRAA Federal Contractor, Amyris is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Amyris complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. Job Profile Summary Supports the implementation of marketing, brand and comms programmes for the business. Supports the development, management and delivery of strategic programmes for the marketing team and adopts and adapts global brand offers, leveraging consumer & customer insights to drive innovation, defining country plans by brand and managing brand guidelines and policy.  Job Advert Key Results/ Accountabilities Expected From Role CVO Insight / Intelligence Build internal and external global and local networks to keep track of market trends and valuable insights to develop in CVO Strategy and annual Marketing Plan 4P Integrated Offer Product --- Handle CVO portfolio and portfolio pricing including ongoing review to identify gaps and build portfolio pipeline Activate new product launches including management of product introduction process (with OMS, Product Quality & Compliance accountabilities elements) internal/external communication and integrated launch activities. Place (Channel Offer) --- Develop / deploy valuable & pioneering channel offer by articulating China PU local channel / customer insight & opportunities and working closely with Global S&M Truck Team. Promotion --- Monitor implementation of programmes as per marketing plans to ensure on time, within budget delivery and adequate return on investments. Innovation & Digitalization --- Build enduring innovation & digital capability in self & works with digital professionals internally & externally to drive digital marketing activities. Marketing Plan Support Line Manager to develop the annual CVO marketing plan, align with sales and trade support teams, and work closely with them to execute the marketing activation plans to support delivery of distribution, volume, turnover, gross margin and market share targets. Plan and implement CVO ASP by key channel and key activities, improve ROI and supervise actual spending on track with ASP phasing plan according to monthly ASP review. Challenges faced on the role Operating in a global and local environment Anticipating market trends to ensure the continued competitiveness of Castrol’s lubricant business The incumbent will need to have digital marketing capability Ability to work in a matrix organization & influencing skills Any Other Relevant Information Critical role in ensuring full compliance with relevant processes (such as Picasso, streamline, pricing) To build strong working relationship with key global contacts Experience & Expertise University degree. Minimum of 3 years working in Auto related industries with B2B2C and B2B marketing experience (having both product marketing & channel marketing experience and have marketing experience in commercial vehicle sector will be a plus) Fast learner with good potential / flexibility Strong communication and analytical skills Proficient in English and Mandarin Good computer and presentation skills Experience in collaborating and influencing sales and functional organizations Self-motivated, high level of passion and drive HSSE Accountabilities Provide leadership in HSSE, consistent with BP values and the code of conduct. Understand and follow BP policies, standards and regulations relating to HSSE. Utilise the HSSE systems, processes and tools necessary to follow HSSE policies, plans and standards relevant to the role. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  Entity Customers & Products  Job Family Group Marketing Group  Relocation available No  Travel Required No  Time Type Full time  Country China  About BP CUSTOMER AND PRODUCTS We’re gearing up for the future. At bp our goal for C&P is to deliver the future of mobility, energy and services for our customers by innovating with new business models and service platforms.  C&P will become a hub, housing our midstream, lubricants, aviation, sale of chemicals, mobility and convenience, marketing and our next-generation businesses, making it a highly integrated and interconnected organisation. And with safety being our core value, our commitment to safe and reliable operations will never change.  Want to join the team? This means: being customer-centric, agile and responsive to changing customer needs and dynamic markets focusing on growth and development of customer offers optimising the chemicals and fuels value chains to maximise integrated value contributing to the reduction of carbon intensity of the products we create, and sell, by 50% by 2050 or sooner creating strategic partnerships that drive long-term value for C&P being digitally enabled and empowered by customer insights and data to deliver solutions. Experience Level Intermediate

Sales Development Engineer is a full-time role within Sales focused on qualifying sales leads as well as driving new growth through identification of new business opportunities for NI. You will also be accountable for qualifying inbound customer demand and helping shape the future of prospecting initiatives by partnering with Account Managers, Corporate and Regional Marketing, and our evolving Partner Indirect Channel. We are seeking individuals who are driven and passionate, eager and able to build significant new business for NI, and motivated to maintain a high level of impact and activity.  This role offers a fantastic opportunity to shape the future of Sales Development in NI. Customer engagement is key for this position, alongside an ability to utilize industry and application insight to build pipeline, generate growth, and maximize customer relationships by following through on transactional business. Maximizing sales and revenue opportunities through B2B relationship building will be a new focus within the position. Applicants will demonstrate resilience and a passion to excel. The successful applicant will demonstrate confidence in sharing new ideas and strive to keep updated with market developments, competitors, customer demand, and new product lines to develop their business acumen, customer understanding, and soft skills.  Key Responsibilities Deliver best in class customer experience as the primary NI representative for any customer engagement Grow sales pipeline by qualifying inbound sales and marketing demand Generate new demand and connect contacts to NI from outbound prospecting activities Streamline transactional business by providing technical assistance and customer service Demonstrate leadership and regular feedback to scale best practices and behaviors Continuously learn from customers on latest industry trends and applications Partnership with cross functional peers(both local and global) to achieve organization goals You will have an opportunity to: Learn from the industry’s most complex applications and business demand behind Talk NI’s value and your opinion with accounts leading the industry Accelerate pace in developing B2B relationship and sales career Explore diverse values and cultures working at a global scale Voice feedback to improve operational process and productivity Work with the best and brightest talents to win as one team  Basic Requirements BS or MS Degree in EE, Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or similar Excellent business and technical proficiency in English Strong desire to pursue a long-term career in sales Solid engineering knowledge and skills Time/task management capability prioritized on practical needs

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Key Responsibilities  The HCI Global Sales Leader, Chemicals will have a broad set of responsibilities that will encompass the following: Align HCI to SCA Clients priorities: Align Honeywell’s Connected offering to the client’s strategic and tactical business goals and objectives in the area of Digital Transformation and by doing so creating sales opportunities. Business Improvement: Identify business improvement opportunities within the client’s operation(s) where Honeywell Connected solutions can add business value and turn these into sales opportunities. SCA Customer Relationship: Work in partnership with the HPS & UOP SCA Account manager to develop and sustain strategic relationships with clients at the appropriate levels, such that Honeywell’s Connected solutions become, and are recognized as, strategic to the client. Strategic Partners: Develop mutually beneficial solution, and go-to-market regional partners for effective value proposition and market reach. Solution Selling and Education: Ensure that the value of Honeywell’s Connected solutions are clearly understood and effectively communicated to all appropriate executives and personnel in the client organization. Enterprise Sales: Ensure that business opportunities are converted into closed business. Meet and Beat the HCI Sales quota. KNOWLEDGE; SKILLS & EXPERIENCE Education Required Educated to a minimum of University Degree level or equivalent Postgraduate Business Qualification is advantageous Work Experience Required Customer engagement at senior levels; building long-term strategic and executive relationships Cross selling and consultative selling - experience with collaborating across both client and own organization to drive a One-Honeywell approach Commercial expertise and experience. Technical Skills & Specific Knowledge Required Confirmed and proven Industry & SW expertise in the Chemicals (Batch, Continuous, Specialty Chemicals) industry Establishing and building credibility Strong ability to develop and sustain customer relationships Clearly articulate value Compelling presentation and communication skills Closing the sale Execute effective negotiation strategies and plans Motivate others; high energy individual Be optimistic and tenacious at the same time; while applying experience, and a positive attitude consistently to deliver bottom line results for Honeywell. Prioritize and focus efforts on best opportunities (short and long term) based on business needs. Push self and others to achieve bottom line results Follow through See ahead clearly; can anticipate future trends accurately; learn quickly and think independently to adapt as required Overall Qualifications & Experience required: Energetic Sales Expert - motivated by results and ultimately long-term customer satisfaction At least 8 years of proven direct sales and business development experience for engineering and operations Software in Chemicals Experience in Mass Mid Segment of Chemicals market in China preferred Advanced degree required (preferably in Engineering disciplines) Excellent communicator capable of maintaining relationships with existing accounts at all management levels while also generating new business Capable of quickly translating business requirements into actions by defining "who does what by when" to ensure plans are executed. Remain aware of advances and current thinking in their fields and look for ways to apply the latest technologies and methods to their work. Recognize that the business needs to think differently in order to grow and that the customer is the cornerstone of our success. Motivated, self-organized individual who likes to serve customers & who is passionate about sales Mobility is required, given that the candidate will travel regularly to customer sites
industries: Medical Devices, Computer Software, and Semiconductors

Position Summary  The Promotions Manager will be responsible for managing POSM orders, working with MEC HQ team to ensure timely production and leading communication between Monster Energy and Coca-Cola bottler system throughout China. In addition, this person will be responsible for streamlining communication of apparel, dealer loader and promotional orders from local market to HQ. The ideal candidate will possess superior organizational and communication skills.  Essential Job Functions The Promotions Manager will provide oversight and guidance to ensure the production of quality Monster Energy POS items within China that adhere to the Monster brand guidelines and maintain Monster brand image in marketplace. Management and communication of flat art files, vetting Coca-Cola POS vendors and conducting audits on produced and in-market materials are all essential responsibilities. The Promotions Manager will be responsible for timely and accurate communication between Monster Energy Headquarters, Monster Energy China Sales & Marketing teams and the Coca-Cola China bottler network. Facilitating ease and speed of quality production for POS materials to support current Monster Energy China markets and future roll-out markets within China is a requirement. The Promotions Manager will work collaboratively with the Monster Energy HQ POS team to develop tools to help obtain maximum visibility for Monster Energy Company POS orders, order fulfillment and identify areas of opportunity to support the China retail store environment. The department will be responsible for the development and management of a system for POS accessibility to Bottlers and MEC Field Sales teams in all markets throughout China. They will support new market launches throughout China by taking lead in managing and submitting launch market POS and premium needs. They will distribute promotional paper goods to bottlers as well as work closely with Monster HQ to develop and oversee the manufacturing of retail marketing equipment (coolers and racks). This person will work closely with the Monster China Marketing, MEC Sales and MEC HQ and appropriate departments within the Coca-Cola China organization. Work closely with the Monster Energy Marketing and Sales Teams to develop retail marketing tools that will obtain maximum visibility for Monster Energy company products. Work closely with the Sales Team and Bottling System to develop a plan for efficient distribution of POS materials to Coca-Cola. Develop an understanding of how to best integrate Monster Energy POS items into the Coca-Cola China system and how to best utilize existing Coca-Cola vendors to ensure quality POS items are being produced. Ensure all new POSM creative materials are reviewed and approved through required levels of Monster Energy Marketing prior to bottler / vendor production (VP of International Marketing; Sr. VP of International Marketing) Conduct occasional audits of Monster POS items produced by Coca-Cola China bottlers to ensure quality, integrity and creative is within brand guidelines and company standards. Manage approved vendor list and improve formal vendor documentation. Vet new vendors through MEC HQ process. Track annual POS budgets by category to ensure senior management can review expenditures. Manage product launch equipment and POSM needs and ensure timely production of items to support successful market launches. Position Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, or Supply chain 2+ years of experience in retail marketing, accounting or supply chain management Proficient in Microsoft Office suite: Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint as well as Adobe Illustrator Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational skills Ability to work across multiple functions within the Monster Energy and Coca-Cola system (Sales, Marketing, Sales Managers, Trade Development Managers, etc)
industries: Food & Beverages, Consumer Goods, and Retail

sales 增加当地餐饮和宴会的销售。 Manages key accounts 管理大客户。 Oversees the selling and servicing of group business 监管团组业务的销售和服务。 Co-ordinates the development of all promotional material 协调所有促销材料的制作。 Provides description: Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Sep 6, 2021 Travel: Yes, < 50 % of the Time
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Req ID: 69796  Region: Asia  Country: China  State/Province: Shanghai  City: Shanghai  Detailed Description  Work requires application of in-depth knowledge of professional standards, practices and precedents in area of specialty. Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires and in-depth evaluation of various factors. Incumbents are accountable for quality of work delivered. Incumbents have decision-making authority and autonomy to deliver on goals of team and require considerable judgment to interpret policy in planning and implementing major projects or work assignments. Influences others outside of team to ensure goals are met and resolves conflicts in an effective manner. Erroneous decisions or failure to achieve goals results reduced profitability and/or serious delays in overall schedules. May lead a multi-functional work group or project team consisting of one or more support staff and/or tech/professional staff, or may provide advice and guidance in area of specialty. May determine new methods and procedures. Seeks out new avenues for building internal and external relationships; maintains contacts with existing relationships. Interfaces with senior managers on issues related to the area of expertise. Interacts with and influences management and/or customers on significant issues.  Performs tasks such as, but not limited to, the following:  Positions may have direct revenue accountability (personal sales quota).  Technical Sales & Business Development activity within the area of specialization (Memory, Power, Design, Plastics, etc.). Assists in the technical aspects of the strategy, tactics and value proposition development. Collects, reviews and analyzes customer data and market intelligence from all sources. Provides technical support and guidance to the Sales, Business Development and Operations Teams by making technical presentations and interfacing with customer’s technical decision makers. Acts as a key resource to the account team to ensure that Celestica wins and grown business. Integrates Celestica design, repair, DFM, DFx, DFT, agency approvals, safety backplanes, system assembly or other services into new customer projects. Leverages Celestica experience and services of worldwide locations to provide customer/CLS profitable mfg. options. Develops relationship with design services to grow partnership. Participates in and supports customer audits and visits. Provides technical support for customer audits and visits to Celestica. Provides technical assistance to the account's Sr. Business Development team in contract negotiation. May provide operational team guidance on the administration of the technical terms and conditions of contracts. Analyzes business opportunities to determine whether resources should be expended to pursue opportunities and determines which manufacturing locations should be utilized. Participates in Celestica’s win/loss reviews.  Knowledge/Skills/Competencies: Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) Strong business analysis skills Strong interpersonal skills Strong time management/multitasking skills Strong teamwork skills Ability to work with and influence other individuals in a non-confrontational manner. Strong administration, prioritization, and logistics/coordination skills. High level of proficiency with word processing, spreadsheets and presentation software. Some background in complex problem management and resolution. Ability to simultaneously work as a member of several virtual teams. High level of knowledge within area of specialization. Complex customer relationship management abilities Knowledge/skills in service sales (rather than product sales). Physical Demands: Duties of this position are performed in a normal office environment. Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law). At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them.  Company Overview  Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world’s best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development – from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud.  Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.  Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.  Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.

POSITION SUMMARY:  To maximize business opportunities in the assigned region across product portfolios by effectively developing, managing and supporting distribution partners. Lead field sales force to grow the sales of Cepheid product portfolios and provide direct and efficient sales service to increase customer’s satisfaction and loyalty.  ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:  * Develop and manage regional business by providing dynamic leadership for the Sales organization and distributors in the assigned region to ensure that revenue targets are well achieved. * Develop the distribution network to cover the different areas in depth in order to maximize the sales from each area. * Define clear sales objectives and clear performance indicators for the distributors to follow and monitor and report the progress of each distributor on a regular basis. * Plan, manage, and support the distributors to apply a reasonable patient charge and reimbursement for GeneXpert assays in the assigned territories. * Work with marketing team to provide training, academic programs, sales tools, and scientific support to the distributors in order to help them achieve the quarterly and annual sales objectives. * Work closely with the team to search new sales opportunities, input sales opportunities into Funnel Management system in time and review the funnel in a regular way to drive development of new accounts * Drive instrument sales funnel and evaluate related KPIs in order to expand the installation base. * Build the sales team and provide coaching on managing the distributors and the key accounts in their areas. * MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:  Education or Experience (in years):  * Bachelor’s degree, preferably in molecular biology, microbiology, or related life science major. * At least 2 years sales management experience in IVD, medical device or pharmaceutical industry with team leading experience. MNC’s background preferred * 5+ years sales experience in hospitals, clinical laboratories, and/or life science markets Knowledge and skills:  * Excellent understanding of hospital customers and/or Govt. department purchasing process * Good knowledge of the Cepheid product portfolio and the related market * Excellent professional selling skills to laboratory doctors, clinicians and healthcare professionals. * Track record in meeting sales targets, distribution development and team management * Strong interpersonal communication and organizational skills and planning ability. * Strong execution ability in the field and is willing to accept frequent travels * Good team player with open mind, self-motivation. Creative but result oriented, and can work under pressure with optimistic. * Proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint applications * Proficient in Mandarin and acceptable working level of English Physical requirements/abilities:  * Need to afford extensive travels (70% of working time) to see customers, distributors and attend company meetings.

Qualifications Bachelor’s degree from a top-tier university with consistent outstanding academic record; advanced degree or MBA is preferred 4-8 years of experience within a leading company; preferably including 1-3 years in a leadership role within the business Solid functional knowledge, including but not limited to strategy, business development, manufacturing, supply chain, product development, project management, marketing and sales, etc. Strong quantitative, analytical and conceptual problem-solving skills combined with outstanding business acumen Proven ability to lead teams, motivate others, communicate complex ideas clearly, gain the respect of clients and colleagues, and work collaboratively Fluency in English and Mandarin is required What You'll Do  You will be responsible for developing, defining and implementing strategies to help our clients around the world solve their most critical problems.  You will work as a client-facing consultant, a consultant to other client teams, and as a forward-thinking knowledge builder across industries. Our projects cover a wide range of topics, from strategy to operations. In a typical project, you will own a work stream to deliver the end recommendation with help from the McKinsey leadership.  Working closely with clients on-site, you'll perform analysis of the particular problems as defined for your work stream – identifying and prioritizing issues for further analysis, and synthesizing the insights from the analyses. You'll also develop recommendations based on the synthesis, and create plans to implement the recommendation.  Who You'll Work With  You will join our Shenzhen office to work in teams and directly with our clients.  When you join McKinsey as a consultant, you are joining a firm that will challenge you and invest in your professional development. In this role you will work on the best teams to help the best organizations in the world – in private, public, and social sectors – solve their most difficult problems. You will also work with many experts, from data scientists and researchers to software and app designers.

description: Position: Sales Consultant is an entrepreneurial person interested in a unique opportunity to be a pivotal force in bringing world class sales and business development expertise to our Beijing office. The position will manage key relationships and and follow-up on business leads. In this position you will greet prospective clients interested in leasing office spaces. A successful candidate should be capable of generating new business, as well as managing communications with our clients until projects are successfully completed. Experience in all aspects of business development, sales as well as an interest in design and construction are desirable.  We are looking for an individual who’s passionate about joining us for the journey from good to great. A sales consultant needs to achieve high credibility within our organization, have advanced interpersonal skills, be experienced in winning business from international as well as local companies. The candidate should know how to understand our target customer and how their buying decisions are made.   Background:   WTL Design (http://www.wtldesign.com) is an interior design company, headquartered in Beijing that offers turnkey solutions from first layout to construction completion. Over the past 20 years, we have built a solid client base that consists of about 80% international clients - covering industries from automotive and advertising to engineering and oil. Our main business is office spaces, but we are well versed in other fields, such as retail, brand experience centers, showrooms and private clubs. Since our founding, the WTL team has continued to grow and counts over 100 people to date.   Key Responsibilities:   Business development Sales Account management  Be the resident expert on our customers’ wants and needs   Job Requirements:  To be successful in this role, you need to have an international mindset while being deeply knowledgeable about the Chinese market. Your communication in Chinese is outstanding. You have are well adverse in selling and business development techniques and strategies and have applied your knowledge.   Qualifications and Key Competencies:  You are a master communicator at all levels within a team or an organization.  You are not scared to get in amongst the weeds to help your customers achieve their desired results.  You are excellent in sales, and have a track record of generating new business.  Desirable Assets:  Experience in office leasing  Fluency in English  Well traveled  Enjoys, philosophy, literature, art  Likes adventure  Compensation:   To be negotiated, WTL Design offers excellent benefits and competitive compensation in accordance to experience and potential contribution.   Location:  Shanghai  Application:  All qualified applicants are encouraged to email eric@wtldesign.com with their inquiries. Highly qualified applicants are not expected to have a resume, though we wish they would contact us immediately to setup a time and discuss a possible fit.  **Note: This position will not be filled until after a reasonable number of qualified applicants have been reviewed.

jobTitle: Key Account Manager, Electronics, South China
description: Guangzhou, China; Remote;  H.B. Fuller is a leading global adhesives provider focusing on perfecting adhesives, sealants and other specialty chemicals across all industries throughout the world. While our products are virtually invisible, they play a vital role in ensuring the quality of modern life and we are committed to connecting what matters to solve some of the world's biggest adhesion challenges.  Position Overview  As part of a cross-functional team, the successful candidate will be responsible for the business development and Strategic Account activities for Electronics adhesive market. This position will focus on identifying new opportunities and then rapidly growing product sales to meet agreed business targets. The regional focus will be primarily South China, with support to Greater China. This position will be based in Shenzhen or Surroundings, reports to Sales Manager.  The Key Account Manager will have a broad experience and excellent relationships within the electronics industry and key accounts, along with a strong technical knowledge of the applications and materials employed. S/He must be able to articulate a clear strategy and implementation plan, and then execute to deliver sales growth in line with the agreed business plan.  Primary Duties New business development in global key account in South China: OEM (Apple, Google, Amazon and etc.), EMS (Foxconn Global and etc.,) Drive sustainable sales and profit growth in line with agreed business objectives. Actively manage and coordinate all aspects of the sales process and act as focal point for information flow between the company and target accounts. Identify and validate new sales targets and develop pipeline of opportunities in line with agreed business objectives, develop and execute high profit promotion strategy. Act as project manager throughout all phases of sales project, driving key actions, setting priorities and managing risks. Partner with relevant global resources (R&D, Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, and Applications. Engineering) to deliver solutions that fully meet customer’s needs and timeline. Timely accurate monthly reports, CRM database updates, project update etc., Minimum Requirements BS degree, preferably Technical/Science. 5+ years key account management experience in the electronics industry or related technical field. Demonstrated ability to prepare and deliver compelling technical sales presentations. Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills. 80+% travels expected, including domestic & international trip. PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT Significant business travel across the countries responsible for. The working conditions for this position would be anticipated to be those typical to an office. There may be minimal need to visit laboratories or manufacturing sites. There is minimal physical effort required for this position other than typing. The types of hazards would be typical to those seen in an office environment. At H.B. Fuller, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to providing all applicants and employees with equal employment opportunity. We subscribe to the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) policy of employing and promoting individuals based on their merits, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship status, or any other protected classification.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Human Resources, and Retail

description: The Automotive Director of Business Development will lead our Automotive strategy and business development in China. Synopsys solutions for Automotive span semiconductor design & verification, automotive-certified IP and software cybersecurity and quality across the entire Automotive supply chain from semiconductor companies to Tier 1s and OEMs.   Primary Responsibilities: Develop and drive the global Synopsys Automotive strategy with the Automotive team, working closely with our Business Units, sales and executives. Identify and drive potential partnerships and business development activities to expand and strengthen Synopsys solutions in China Automotive Be a spokesperson for Synopsys Automotive, presenting to customers and at industry conferences Work closely with China sales and our Business Units to orchestrate key customer engagements Develop and nurture relationships with sales, field marketing, and key Automotive customers and partners Part of an existing cross-functional Automotive core team that orchestrates Automotive activities across our Business Units ·   Experience developing programs and promotions for high technology products and services to both partners and customers in a multi-channel sales model organization Motivated, innovative self-starter, with proven experience in influencing without authority within a cross functional, international and multi-cultural organization ·   Experience working with OEMs and Tier1s ·   Detailed understanding of emerging automotive technologies such as Autonomous Cars, Electric Vehicles, Driver Awareness Systems, Sensor Fusion, Connectivity, and Machine Learning   Qualifications: At least five years of Automotive market experience, with a focus on new applications (AD, ADAS, next generation infotainment, connectivity services) previous experience at and/or working with semiconductor companies, Tier 1s and OEMs Sufficient technical background to be able to understand customer needs on EDA, IP and Software Quality & Security solutions Organizationally savvy and collaborative; comfortable in a matrixed, international, team orientated environment with multiple stakeholders Bachelor’s degree in Engineering is required, a graduate degree in engineering or business is desired

Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Jul 29, 2021 Travel: Yes, < 75 % of the Time

BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With larger production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry, and operates the Innovation Campus Shanghai, a global and regional research and development hub. BASF posted sales of over €7.3 billion in 2018 to customers in Greater China and employed 9,317 people as of the end of that year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en  Objectives Develop and promote the performance materials business in China Semiconductor Provide technical support to the sales team to establish joint development projects Drive projects to be commercialized. Make good use of resource to ensure priority and balance for all projects. Provide technical service to meet customer application needs. Responsible for technical and engineering qualification of performance materials. Co-with TW Technical Sales/CoE team/ Application lab to drive projects as one team. To actively contribute KAM to realize key account strategy Main Tasks Develop strategic positioning of products for respective market segments, brand positioning and marketing materials to support sales and ensure achievement of business targets Create customer mapping to identify the industry trend Work with technical sales team to clearly understand business potential of the performance materials product portfolio Define the target applications and Work with sales team to define the target customers Adapt Marketing materials to meet local promotion needs and understanding; improve effectiveness of presentation of technical information to customers Establish effective working relationships with sales team to work out concrete customer concept Key Account support to KAM and local sales (together with technical adviser) to increase penetration via appropriate strategies. Coordinating technical activities through regular exchange and sharing within technical and production community in AP and global to optimize the resources Provide technical support to sales team at customer on-line testing Implement training programs for both internal and external stakeholders; lead and improve training programs to elevate overall technical competencies of sales team Support the customer project until be commercialized Requirements Education: Bachelor of Science in Chemistry or above; bachelor of microelectronic material or above Working Experience: Minimum 5 years’ technical experience in semi-conductor industry (thin film and wet cleaning at back-end process of Semiconductor) Technical & Professional Knowledge: application know-how in semi-conductor industry Primary Location  CN-Shanghai-Shanghai  Job  Sales / Technical Sales  Ongoing  For BASF, diversity is one of the essential keys to business success and the well-being of our employees. We promote an inclusive culture that accepts the diversity of people, experiences and capabilities. Join the team and connect with more than 120,000 other minds. Stay alert for possible recruitment fraud!  This can include fake websites, fake job offers, or contact from a person falsely claiming to represent BASF.

description: Huntsman’s PU Elastomers Division is now searching for a Sales Account Manager at Guangzhou. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving business on the aggressive growth path, penetrate and expand market share of footwear in PU and TPU, Strengthen stakeholder connection in casual and safety shoes field. This role is an individual contributor.  As The Sales Account Manager, You Will  The jobholder is responsible for delivering the budgeted volume and contribution margin for his/her accounts, located in China. He/She would also be responsible for basic technical service to customers.  This Includes Lead and drive account plans, budgets and forecasts which deliver the agreed strategic objectives of value and profit generation from the region, with a strong focus on volume growth in the footwear segment. Timely and effectively report activities using the tools used by the business (e.g. C4C and visit reports) Maintain and review the view on the opportunities by using the tools provided by the business (e.g. C4C and opportunity funnel) Proactively strengthen relationships with molders, shoe makers and brand offices in order to identify new opportunities and projects in a timely fashion. Emphasis on new customers in China Work closely with colleagues in other regions (GA) for transfer customers/projects from China to GA or vice versa. Gather relevant market information for the Footwear team which provides the basis to recommend strategies for action / growth in the strategic markets consistent with delivering the agreed strategic positioning. Establish a high standard of Market Intelligence for Footwear in his region, in market shares, penetration of all Huntsman Footwear products in target markets and relative competitive positions with alternative competition. Support Marketing and Communication in the development of a plan aiming at increasing brand awareness and value proposition of relevant Footwear brands in the region. Take an active interest in the EHS standards at all customers. Act personally all times in a safe manner including adherence to the Safe Drive policy. Skills And Experiences Required The jobholder is required to act and communicate effectively across functional, cultural and international boundaries and therefore needs to demonstrate strong interpersonal skills and well-developed thinking and influencing competencies. He/she will need to act and take decisions independently whereby keeping alignment to the overall business strategies. The jobholder also must possess excellent tact and diplomacy to effectively interact with senior personnel internally and externally and must demonstrate self-managing and initiative competencies to maintain effectiveness under pressure. The job holder needs to be a professional combining a university degree in chemistry (or similar through experience) with a minimum of 5 to 7 years of sound professional experience in sales functions and possess a good understanding of the Specialty Polymer Market and a deep and broad value chain understanding, particularly in the Footwear industry. Detailed knowledge of PU/TPU application technology, the Footwear industry and Footwear value chain customer needs is essential. Basic technical service to customers is also expected. A sound social and psychological approach and the ability to work in different cultures is a key requirement. Fluency in English and/or Chinese, both written and spoken, is essential. Willingness to travel frequently within China and occasionally to Greater Asia is essential. Huntsman offers unsurpassed opportunities to build a successful future. Our diverse portfolio creates a range of career fields including manufacturing, research and development, technical services, sales and marketing, customer service – and the list goes on.  Here, you can make an impact and make a difference. Come join us.  Huntsman is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identification, sexual orientation and/or expression or any other characteristic protected by law in every location in which we have facilities national or local.  Please refer to https : // www . huntsman . com / privacy / online-privacy-notice for Company’s Data Privacy and Protection information.  All unsolicited resumes presented by recruitment agencies are treated as pro bono information or service.  Huntsman is aware of a scam involving fraudulent job offers. Huntsman does not make job offers until after a candidate has submitted a job application and has participated in a face-to-face interview. Please be advised that emails from Huntsman always end in “@huntsman.com” and that any job offer that requires payment or requires you to deposit a check is likely a scam. description: Position:  Inside Sales Specialist  Job Description:  What You’ll Be Doing  Setting direction, coping with change, listening, coaching and motivating the team. Serves as an escalation point for Arrow’s internal departments, vendor resources and customers. Serves as the customer contact for handling all elements of the returns and maintenance termination process, entering the Service Request and RMA in the business system, sending the return/cancellation request for management approval and ensuring customers are credited for the return. Responsible for receiving, confirming and tracking customer orders and other related tasks in the order processing and post sales flow to include: order entry; material procurement; coordination with the vendor, integration facilities and shippers to identify and track delivery schedules; creation and update order status reports; resolution of incoming invoices and denied claims. Order Processing: Processes customer orders accurately and timely by reviewing customer purchase orders for accuracy, freight terms, transportation methods, pricing, technical specifications, part numbers and any other unique customer requirements ; resolving any discrepancies with customer prior to order entry; entering sales orders accurately and quickly into the Arrow ERP system, working with shared services teams to resolve more complex issues on orders or customer requests. Places purchase orders with the vendors and anticipates additional requirements or obstacles for orders and works toward a solution proactively. Research and resolve vendor invoice variances and warehouse receipt discrepancies caused by price, quantity, goods/services receipts, freight and tax code discrepancies. Works with the warehouse team to ensure that all inventory purchase orders are received in full. Research and resolve vendor denied claims or variances caused by program requirements, price, quantity and point of sale reporting. Processes any shipment variances or damages with the vendors for resolution and updates the Oracle ERP system accordingly. Work with suppliers, sales teams and shared services teams to troubleshoot and resolve invoice and claims exceptions within defined service level agreements. Takes ownership of issues and sees that they are fully resolved. Monitors inventory to identify slow moving, aging and non-sellable product to determine the proper disposition. Negotiates special pricing, returns, programs and other exceptions with the vendor. Ensures that our SMI (slow moving inventory), obsolescence and write-offs are within our established financial goals. Proactively resolves problem situations, often complex, with our suppliers and Arrow departments related to selection of source, price, delivery, etc while remaining within inventory guidelines. Mentors and assists in training of team members. Analyzes training needs of team members and develops and provides input for a solution. Acts as the backup for the manager for assigned responsibilities.  What We Are Looking For  Bachelor's Degree or above Minimum 2 years’ client-facing working experience Fluent in English and Mandarin Candidates with electronic industry experience is a plus Strong communication skills and interpersonal skills Highly self-driven and able to work under pressure and independently.  What’s In It For You  At Arrow, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. That’s why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package.  Location:  CN-Shanghai, China (Far East Intl Plaza) RFPD  Time Type:  Full time  Job Category:  Business Support

description: About Us  Gore is a materials science company focused on improving lives through discovery, product innovation and rewarding careers for our Associates.  About The Industry  Saving lives and improving the quality of life for patients is at the core of everything we do. This meaningful work gives purpose to our lives and inspires us to create solutions that make a difference in the lives of others. Learn more at gore.com/products/industries  About The Role  We are looking for a Field Sales Associate to join our Medical Product Division Sale Team in Hangzhou, Zhejiang who will be accountable for meeting or exceeding the sales forecast in Zhejiang, Fujian & Anhui provinces.  Responsibilities: Develop profitable sales opportunities, proactively make sales calls Develop new business to align with Gore business needs Ensure the KOL management, market data collection, etc., are effective, builds, maintains and defends long-term customer relationships Ensure the cooperation with other product specialists are active and constructive, to achieve team goals and objectives Implement value pricing principle, be a value seller, skilled in the use of premise-based forecasting techniques Implement Gore’s product strategy, understands the needs of the customer  Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in medical or medicine Proven sales background, preferably with a minimum of 5 years in the medical devices sales area Will have worked in or able to demonstrate an understanding of the imperatives of a business environment Clinical background in interventional areas or sales experience to this environment Strong communication and interpersonal skills A high level of self-motivation and passion, ensuring the ability to work under minimal supervision Commercial acumen High integrity Ability to travel extensively up to 60% and attend weekend conferences as required  What We Offer  At Gore, we want our Associates to have fulfilling careers driven by curiosity and commitment. In return, we commit to our Associates by offering comprehensive, competitive rewards in the form of compensation, benefits, an Associate stock ownership-type plan, and opportunities for growth and development. Learn more at gore.com/careers  We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and inclusive work environment. In support of our values and continued success we are proud of Associates around the world who support an inclusive work environment, strive to reflect the diversity of the communities where we operate, and ensure all Associates and external partners are treated with fairness, dignity and respect.  Our Talent Acquisition Team welcomes your questions via email at AP_TA@wlgore.com  Job  Sales  Primary Location  Asia-Pacific-CN-ZJ-Hangzhou  Travel%  60%  Shift  Day  Schedule  Full-time

This position is to perform Field Marketing Manager to major focus on vertical marketing initiative and Lead management optimize.  Key Responsibilities Build market intelligence of the segment: overall trends, eco-system, segmentation and size, customer and buyer types & their journey, competitors and our positioning Define the Go-To-Market strategy and contribute to In-China-For-China strategy, assess the execution in your segment. Manage the end-to-end lead process, constantly looking at ways to improve the intake and conversion of the lead funnel by e.g. developing nurturing process to turns prospects into customers and upsell or cross sell existing customers on new solutions & services. Create a differentiating segment portfolio with its value propositions, across hardware, software & services, based upon customer problems/needs and Barco right to play and win. Identify the key target audience for the value propositions. Provide insights of personas. Be a driver to create roadmaps and business cases for new value proposition in your segment Collaborate closely with Corporate Segment Marketing and China Sales team, sharing information and best practices. Work closely with Field Marketing colleagues in building targeted strong marketing campaigns and messaging, support on events, conferences and trade shows.  Competences Bachelor’s degree required Master’s degree/MBA preferred + 10 years of experience in Segment or Strategic Marketing MNC or Consultant firm background are preferred Fast thinker with solid strategic insights Strong business acumen; customer- and market driven orientation Excellent verbal, written and presentation communication skills Pragmatic, energetic, self-starting leader and highly motivated achiever Eagerness to learn and understand market Natural team player, working together with stakeholders from across the company Drive and confidence to converge to aligned strategy and winning value propositions Drive, passion and enthusiasm to rally the troops Market problems definition, sizing & segmentation. End-user and Buyer persona and journey mapping. Strategy setting, upstream marketing and value propositions

About The Job  Check out our short presentation  bit.ly/JoinCoachHub_Sales  Is the topic of digitisation close to your heart? SaaS exactly your thing? Do you want to support people and companies in the phase of digital transformation? Then CoachHub is the right place for you! In just 2,5 years we have built a passionate team of over +300 people, all on the same mission to democratise coaching to employees at all levels. Come and join one of LinkedIn's top 10 Startups and make your mark!  We are looking for a new team member for our APAC Sales Team. As Enterprise Account Executive at CoachHub you will play a key role in our growth in the Asia Pacific market and as brand ambassador you will represent our mission of professional coaching for everyone. You take over the customers acquired by the Sales Development Representative and accompany them through the closing process. Make phone calls, web demos, on-site appointments, negotiations, and presentations to turn prospects into customers. You will support our clients as a consultant and maintain a constant contact with them You develop long-term customer relationships and build up a trusting and efficient cooperation You take part with the team in fairs & events to strengthen your network and represent our company professionally. You work closely with our Customer Success Managers and Sales Development Representatives You support the optimization of processes, content and success reporting YOUR PROFILE You have successfully completed your studies or training and have gained at least +7 years experience in enterprise sales. You have experience with closing deals in the 6-7 figure range ($) You convince through your professional and self-confident appearance as well as through your engaging communication skills. You stand out due to your exceptionally high motivation and enthusiasm. You distinguish yourself through your solution orientation and your independent work style. You speak Korean and English at native-level. A third language is a plus You bring a willingness to travel (up to 20%) What We Offer The opportunity to be part of a fast-growing start-up company from the beginning and to participate significantly in a global success story together Top business customer contacts, including leading top tier and tech groups and communication at management level Direct cooperation with our founders/managing directors Diverse learning and training opportunities and personal coaching from experienced entrepreneurs Your own personal business coach Regular Team Events Fun in a highly motivated team & a High Growth Company A job with Purpose Conveniently from your location (Shanghai, remote) Apply now and explore your talent at CoachHub!  About CoachHub  CoachHub is the leading global talent development platform that enables organizations to create a personalized, measurable and scalable coaching program for the entire workforce, regardless of department and seniority level.  Listed in LinkedIn’s Top 10 StartUps for 2020, CoachHub is incredibly proud of its reputation as an outstanding place to work. Its vision to ‘help organisations to unleash their people’s full potential’ attracts people from all corners of the globe, with its 400 ‘CoachHubbers’ hailing from 45+ countries worldwide. CoachHub is consistently recognized on Glassdoor for its impact-driven work and thriving company culture.  CoachHub is backed by the world's leading tech investors, including Draper Esprit, HV Capital, Partech, RTP Global, Signals VC and Speedinvest.

Qualifications Undergraduate degree with outstanding record of academic achievement is required 4+ years of work experience in eCommerce operation, Omni-channel & New retail, etc.. In-depth knowledge of customer insights from any business sector (e.g., consumer, retail, B2B, eCommerce platforms or 3rd party service providers (TP), etc.) Demonstrated aptitude for analytics Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and the local office language(s) What You'll Do  You will work as a typical McKinsey consultant, with a strong passion for digital and eCommerce/digital commerce/new retail topics (e.g., design Omni-channel model, social & commerce initiatives, digital-enabled business operation)  In a team of typically ~3-5 consultants, you will shape and drive end-to-end digital transformations across business, technology, process and people, creating value by reinventing the core of our client's businesses. This work includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.  You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from your team. This support includes a Partner assigned to you to help guide your career as well as formal training throughout your McKinsey career. Additionally, you'll receive guidance and support from our Partners and professional development team in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.  Who You'll Work With  Being based in one of our locations in Greater China region, you will be part of the consultant community of Digital McKinsey Asia, across 12 locations. Digital McKinsey, formed from the merge of McKinsey's Business Technology Office, McKinsey Digital Labs and more, comprises of 3,000 consultants and experts across 60 offices globally.  As a Digital McKinsey consultant specialized in eCommerce/Digital Commerce/New Retail, you will work with clients in a wide range of sectors and industries (e.g. Internet, TMT, Consumer, Auto) to help them define or re-shape their business in new retail era. You may have the chance to directly work with senior digital leaders to generate insights to transform the industry not only from brand’s perspectives, but also from eCommerce platform / internet giant’s perspectives. Moreover, besides deep diving into eCommerce topics, you can also mix your digital focus with broader consulting work (e.g., operations, organization, strategy, corporate finance, marketing and sales, etc.) to generate broader understanding of the End-to-end value chain of digital business.

description: About Vandemoortele 关于Vandemoortele公司  Vandemoortele is a leading European food group that manufactures and sells high-quality food products. Vandemoortele has two business lines; one in frozen bakery products and one in margarines, culinary oils and fats. Vandemoortele为欧洲食品业领航公司，生产和营销体系丰富的优质食品类产品。Vandemoortele有两个业务部门：分别是烘焙产品和油脂产品（人造黄油，烹饪油和油脂）。 In 2019, Vandemoortele realized a turnover of ca 1,4 billion euro. The Group is present in 12 European countries plus USA and Asia with 5,200 employees. The Vandemoortele headquarters are located in Ghent, Belgium. 2019年，Vandemoortele公司总营业额为14亿欧元。集团公司在欧洲12国、美国及亚洲共有员工5200人。Vandemoortele公司总部位于比利时根特市。 Working at Vandemoortele, you will get all the chances to grow within a people oriented and value driven environment, where cooperation, respect and ambition are key. With headquarters based in Belgium you will be part of an international company having a dynamic, driven, ambitious and collegial atmosphere. We believe a more organic, flexible culture leads to a healthier work-life balance, motivates employees and ensures that we can work well together towards even better outcomes. Vandemoortele公司以人为本，公司的核心文化是互助分享，相互尊重和志向远大。你会和公司比利时总部及其他区域和部门的同事交流合作，成为我们这个积极向上，团结合作的大集体中的一员。我们崇尚工作中自主灵活，致力于让员工劳逸结合，保持工作上的耐心和动力，保证团队协同合作并促进个人能力发展。我们的目的是让公司和员工能够长远并可持续地取得好的成果。 You will participate is a culture built on trust, empowerment, self-management and shared leadership, a culture where we all share the same sense of responsibility to getting the job done. 加入我们的公司，你也参与互助信任，员工授权，关爱分享的领导团队中。在这样的公司文化氛围中，我们用于承担责任，乐于完成既定的任务。  Your role你的任务: You will be responsible for the business development and the actual customer portfolio for Vandemoortele’s business line of Bakery Products. 你会负责公司烘焙业务部的市场拓展，发展和管理相关的客户群体。 Your primary objective will be to meet the volume and margin sales objectives in your region while managing direct customers (retail) and distributors (foodservice, bakery).你的首要任务是完成你区域内的销售量和利润目标，同时管理直接客户（零售）和分销商（餐饮和烘焙连锁）。  Your key responsibilities and challenges are你的责任和挑战: Development of sales and achieve the KPI发展业务并完成KPI指标 Exploring and studying markets in terms of customers’ needs/strategies, products, service, pricing, environment, …potential partners. 了解客户需求，协助业务发展经理制定市场战略规划，规划产品，服务，价格并关注各种宏微观环境变化，以及寻求潜在合作伙伴等 Assist the BD manager China to make the development of custom-made solutions or concepts in close cooperation with R&D and other departments   协助业务发展经理与研发和其他部门合作，发展定制性产品方案和概念 Enhancing the customer service level in close cooperation with the back-office team (forecasts, transit time, etc.) 与销售服务部门同事合作（就生产和库存预报，交易时间等），提升客户服务质量 Analysis of the sales results in relation to objectives budgeted 根据提交的销售预算指标，分析和跟踪销售结果 Assuring proper payments in collaboration with the credit controller 与财务部同事合作，确保指定优化的账期和付款方式。 Following up (local) competitors’ activities and related sales issues 跟进跟踪当地竞争者动向 相关销售活动跟进（寄样品/样品跟进/产品烘焙基础知识的快速掌握与学习能力/ 组织烘焙活动等）  About you关于你 You hold a Master’s or Bachelor’s degree with at least 4-5years of relevant experience in B2B sales. Experience in the food industry is an added value. （bakery industry experience will be priority ） 你有硕士或学士学位，并由至少4-5年以上B2B销售经验。有食品行业经验更优(烘焙行业的经验者优先) You have an entrepreneurial, result oriented and hunter’s spirit, with a real curiosity for new markets and segments. 你具有创业开拓意识，有猎人精神并能以目标为导向，对新（细分）市场有好奇心，善学习和钻研新领域。 Due to your interpersonal skills you can work effectively with people from different cultures but also at different levels. 你具有良好的沟通能力，能够和不同文化和不同类别的人有效合作。 You are happy to contribute to our excellent team spirit by your open communication and willingness to share knowledge amongst colleagues. 你思想开通，善于团队合作，并能和同事们分享交流。 You are flexible and prepared to travel often. 你的时间灵活，可适应经常出差。 You are a well-organized, structured and autonomous worker. 你善于规划和计划，能够自主有效地独立工作。  You are based in China, speak English fluently and have Chinese as your mother tongue. 你居住在中国，英语流利，同时中文为母语水平。  What’s in for you你能从这个工作中获得什么?  We offer you challenging work with a great purpose in an international company having a dynamic, driven and ambitious culture and a collegial atmosphere. With headquarters based in Belgium, you will have a real impact on the business. You will get all chances to grow within a people oriented and value driven environment, where cooperation, respect and ambition are key. You will receive an attractive salary and will enjoy all fitting extralegal advantages. 我们提供给你充满挑战又能成长的工作机会：你在我们这个国际公司大家庭中，一同分享并贡献热情向上，动力十足，志向远大，合作互助的公司文化。公司位于比利时总部，你和全球各地各部门同事将用你们自己的所作所为，一同为公司的长远发展添砖加瓦。在我们合作互助，相互尊重和理想远大的核心文化中，你会得到锻炼成长。你会得到符合你个人能力的薪酬并获得长远的发展机会。  Interested in this exciting job opportunity对这份工作感兴趣？ please send your English & Chinese CV to？请投您的中英文简历投递至boling.huang@vandemoortele.com

description: 工作职责:  Role Summary/Purpose  负责管理和开展公司指定区域指定产品线的分销商关系，完善渠道和区域管理，同时达到市场占有份额目标，以完成规定的区域和客户的销售指标和利润目标。  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Essential Responsibilities 在指定的区域内完成公司下达的销售指标； 执行公司的市场策略和销售政策； 为分销商提供产品支持，协助分销商达成销售指标； 在指定的区域开发/建立并维护良好的分销经营渠道； 建立和维护客户的长期关系，提高客户的满意度； 利用销售工具收集/分析所在区域的市场情况，寻找潜在的机会，提供准确的市场预测； 开展和组织所负责区域的市场推广和销售活动； 任职条件:  Qualifications/Requirements 大学本科或以上学历，医学，临床背景优先； 3年以上医疗器械/耗材分销商管理经验或直接销售经验； 高度诚信和敬业精神，遵守公司相关规定； 较强的市场开拓和沟通能力及优秀的谈判技巧； 能用英语阅读专业资料并写作，熟练操作电脑； 卓越的对内对外沟通技能； 团队工作的技能（包括寻找和利用各种资源达成目标的能力） 良好的演讲技能 能够承受相应压力，并拥有自我学习的意愿和能力。 Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.
