description: Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. description: Promoting sales & marketing activities with prime focus and development on airfreight and worldwide trade land. To follow and take action on the sales targets given by company ensuring achievement and maximum returns. To successfully negotiate rates internally with operational counterparts, in order to achieve competitive rates to support our aggressive targets. To do continuous targeting and to develop high profit key account in line with direction given by the Team Manager,as well as maintaining contact to existing. To communicate with overseas counterparts to enhance communication and co-operation on key targets and tradelanes.  Special Knowledge Mandarin and English Language proficiency Computer literate Good interpersonal skills able to communicate well with both internal and external parties Team player,open minded,customer oriented and good communication skills Familiar with local freight and logistics market Personal Qualification Sales-oriented Self-confident Self-motivated Positive attitude Loyal, serious, dedicated and responsible Good teamwork spirit Good manners and appearance Motivating / Self-Motivating Willingness and ability to travel Willing to work under pressure and taking challenge  Company Introduction  cargo-partner is a privately owned full-range info-logistics provider offering a comprehensive portfolio of air, sea, land transport and warehousing services, with special expertise in information technology and supply chain optimization. The company operates over 130 offices in 40 countries around the world to create fast and efficient solutions for a wide range of industries. As a family-owned business, we are very employee-oriented and want to work with you to develop your career and personal goals. Take a look at our Mission & Vision.  If you are looking for a challenging position in an innovative and dynamic international company, we want to get to know you!  Privacy Policy  Apply now! It will only take a minute, we promise!

description: Our Company: If you are looking to join a team where your opinion is valued, your contributions are noticed, and enjoy working with fun and talented people from all over the world then this is the place for you. If you have a desire to work in an organization that is: Passionate about its people Focused on delivering the very best tech to our customers Offering the flexibility to work how and where you are most successful Obsessed with our customer’s success The leading SaaS platform to automate partnerships - affiliate, influencer, technology partners, and more! Entrepreneurial in spirit with a culture that rewards collaboration and curiosity Obsessed with making a difference in business and to the wider community    Impact is the global leader in Partnership Automation, working with innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi’s, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage their online affiliate, influencer, brand to brand, and content partnerships. The Impact Partnership Cloud covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across Europe, the United States, Africa, and Asia so there is plenty of opportunity for growth and advancement.  Your Role at Impact: As a Partner Development Executive, you will be responsible for business growth through building relationships, data and solution driven thinking. You will drive a world-class partner experience that builds trust, retention and loyalty. Your role is pivotal to ensure adoption and engagement of our product with our partners, enable partnerships between partners and brands, accelerating their growth and helping them win!  You will need to manage a portfolio of partner accounts, including those who are identified as key partners in the Greater China region, and global partners who can bring growth of revenue to brands in the Greater China region. You will be responsible for managing day-to-day interactions with the portfolio of partner accounts at Impact.  You will also need to acquire new Elite Referral Partners (i.e. strategic publishers and brands monetizing through partnerships) when you can, through selling SaaS and Services to Elite Referral Partners’ direct advertiser partnerships.  Key performance indicators for the Partner Development Executive are: increased earning of managed partners, increased brand revenue that is realized through partnership enablement, partner referred brands pipeline in Salesforce, strategic new partner engagements, engagements with elite partners who want technology and services from Impact, and an efficient support to Sales and CSM teams during client prospecting and onboarding. This role is also responsible, in certain cases, for duties from the Channel Partnership team.  This role reports to the Partner Manager of Greater China.  What You'll Do: Managing key partners, build good relationship with the partners, keep regular engagement with them and make sure their earnings grow steadily. Enabling the partnerships between brands and partners through smart and scalable methods. Keep your results monitored and reported Sourcing new brand leads from creating world-class partner experience Recruiting new strategic partners to Impact that can form B2B relationships Selling Elite License to partners when you can Constantly learning the Impact products, and train partners with the newest feature Providing partner insights to sales, CSM, Marketing and Revenue enablement Teams Always thinking of efficient and scalable ways for business Growth   What You Have: Previous working experience in global market of 1-3 years Previous experience supporting cloud based SaaS products (1-2 years) Moderate experience in Digital Marketing (1-2 years) Strong communicator: communicate effectively with partners and internal team members Influential: be persuasive and command respect, by being a leader and expert in your knowledge of our company and products Data-driven: accurately measure the effectiveness of programs and efforts, use findings to improve processes Prioritization: prioritize effectively based on activities that will receive higher return for all audiences Visionary: be able to diagnose potential issues before they arise Agile: be able to adapt quickly to changes and adopt new strategies Self-Motivated, Attention to Detail, Passion for Learning, Team player A strong understanding of the Impact offering Incredible interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills across a variety of audiences Ability to read, write and speak with internal and external stakeholders in a highly professional manner Passionate about improving our partners experience and success with our products Extensive knowledge and experience with Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Slides ) Knowledge of the partnership ecosystem- from influencer to affiliate to strategic Moderate to Advanced experience using Salesforce or similar Sales CRM and ticketing tools like Jira, Freshdesk or similar Keen attention to detail, organization, and ability to drive projects to completion Experience in working independently as well as part of a team in an energetic environment  Benefits/Perks: Medical, Dental and Vision insurance Unlimited PTO Flexible work hours An employee-led culture team that plans our happy hours, parties, and other events to celebrate our many successes An established company with a cool, high velocity work ethos, where each person can make a difference!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  #LI-RL1

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibilities Pre-sales activity will include delivery of technical expertise during the sales process including presentations, seminars, individual consultation, and hands-on demo experiments if needed. Executes technical and application based presentations on illumina’s sequencing and microarray platforms, applications and/or workflows. Post-sales activity includes working with post-installation customers providing additional workflow or applications training in strategically important labs. Supporting/assisting customers with sequencing assay design to accelerate adoption of targeted sequencing on illumina’s platforms. Attendance at tradeshows/conferences in relevant fields. Be the point person for dedicated illumina User Group Meetings in collaboration with field marketing and support team to provide sample to data workflow training Assists sales and field marketing on new strategic initiatives requiring both technical and market knowledge Works collaboratively with territory account managers, marketing, service and support teams to ensure effective account/customer management and communication through pre-sales, during and- post-sales cycle, including review and meeting account pull through targets and goals Escalates technical issues to Technical Support for possible resolution for strategically important labs. Develops and maintain positive relationships with customers in assigned territory Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.  Preferred Requirements Life science industry experience preferred Applied Market Knowledge is a plus Extensive experience and understanding of leading genetics technologies and how they can be applied. Detailed knowledge of technological developments and trends in the sequencing markets Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills in Mandarin and English. Strong negotiation skills and ability to persuade Ability to travel within region to carry out primary responsibilities. All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Preferred Experience/Education Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience; or equivalent work experience. 岗位概述  Responsibilities 售前活动将包括销售过程中的技术知识演讲，如介绍演讲、研讨会、个别咨询等，在必要时，进行演示实验。 对因美纳测序和微阵列平台的应用或工作流程进行技术层面和应用层面的介绍。 售后活动包括与安装产品后的客户的协调，提供在具有重要战略意义的实验室中所需的工作流程或应用培训 支持/辅助客户的相关测序阵列设计，加快在客户因美纳平台上目标测序进程。 参加相关领域的展览会/大会。 作为与现场营销和支持团队合作的专项人员参加因美纳用户组会议，提供样品数据工作流程培训。 提供销售或现场营销新战略项目时所需有关技术和市场知识。 与区域客户经理、营销、服务和支持团队合作工作，保证有效的大客户/客户管理以及负责售前、售中和售后过程的沟通，包括回访和会面已经取得成果或达成目标的客户。 作为技术支持提供技术升级，为具有重要战略意义的实验室提供可能的解决方案。 提升和维护责任区域内客户的良好关系。 以上所列的任务和职责是本岗位的基本功能。然而，各种商务条件下可能需要完成额外的任务和职责。  Preferred Requirements 有生命科学行业经验者优先 有应用市场知识者加分 具有领先的遗传学技术及其应用方面的丰富经验和充分理解 具有技术发展和测序市场趋势的详细知识 优秀的中文普通话和英文口头和书面交流和介绍演讲技能 良好的谈判技巧和说服能力 能在负责区域内出差并完成主要职责 Preferred Experience/Education 科学学科的硕士以上学历（分子生物学、遗传学、或基因组学和/或生物信息学优先）

该职位来源于猎聘  Main Responsibilities And Key Activities 1.负责完成并完成销售目标 2.开拓传统市场之外的新业务 3.追求、谈判和构建适当的销售条款，并通过与公司和区域计划相一致的竞争策略最大化销售渗透。确保在展会、用户大会等市场活动后系统地跟进销售线索 4.与组织内的跨部门团队合作，直接与客户或战略合作伙伴制定行之有效的销售策略，以推动增长 5.与其他部门团队合作，计划和组织促销活动 6.完成销售活动，订单开发，价格策略，付款 7.通过内部SFDC系统生成销售方案，并确保数据库更新，熟练使用SFDC系统来帮助管理日常销售工作 8.通过每周回顾和更新潜在客户名单，确保销售预测的准确性。通过适当的销售、谈判和收尾技巧，共同努力缩短销售预测实现周期 9.及时向经理提交有意义的销售拜访报告 10.与财务信用控制部门协调跟进客户逾期付款 Qualifications And Professional Knowledge 1.至少3 -5年销售经验，具备销售和谈判技巧 2.至少1年以上软件销售经验 3.敏锐的商业嗅觉，能够在销售谈判和结束中运用实用的商业方法 4.系统地跟进线索并完成 5.良好的人际关系技巧，能够处理多层次关系 6.有丰富的包装行业销售经验尤佳

Develop and implement an annual business plan supporting attainment of quota and market share growth, and update on a quarterly basis, but not limited to opportunity development, competitive strategies and targets Maintain identified business to support a balanced sales funnel and accurate profile of customer assets, including keeping track of key decision makers. maintain customer contact records in the relevant CRM tools Develop and maintain a high level of product knowledge of Cytiva and competitive products Develop account penetration strategies for key target accounts and provide management with a quarterly report of progress Develop and maintain consultative sales relationships with all key buying influences in each account, including multiple levels within the customer's organization including front desk person, office manager, administrator, directors, CFO, CIO, CEO. jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Dalian
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, (Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

Market Development - Develop business plan & strategy for assigned market verticals - In-depth / forward looking knowledge of markets and competitors, closely track related market trends - Understand customer business, pain points and logistics processes, link existing solutions to pain points - Conduct market research - Identify Gaps - Identify subsystem, module and product gaps required for best-in-class logistics solutions - Assist in timely development, alliance or acquisition of gaps - Interface with BD-DI, other regional MDD and Global Product Development - Sales & Mkt Support - Initial targeted vertical marketing campaigns to assist sales to access target account prospects and nurture them into opportunities - Coach sales team with market vertical knowledge, develop related sales tools to support sales in customer meetings & presentations. - Develop and present reports to Regional and DI management(monthly VMVR score cards, individual vertical market reports, quarterly lead reports - Follow the KION synergy opportunities (Linde, Dematic, Egemin) and big opportunity projects with sales team, update the status periodically.What we offer: Career Development  We are here to support you for the entirety of your Dematic career. Employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by Dematic, or (c) consistent with Dematic’s legal duty to furnish information.  Global Opportunities  As a global company, our employees are exposed to different ideas and perspectives from around the world. Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/  Tasks And Qualifications Bachelor's degree, major in business management or equivalent ; 5 years related experience in multinational company; Self-motivated, independent; Customer and Results-Oriented; Systematic and structured working style; Fluent in English writing, speaking and listening; Strong presentation, communication and interpersonal skills.

Our Company  If you are looking to join a team where your opinion is valued, your contributions are noticed, and enjoy working with fun and talented people from all over the world then this is the place for you.  If you have a desire to work in an organisation that is: Passionate about its people Focused on delivering the very best tech to our customers Offering the flexibility to work how and where you are most successful Obsessed with our customer’s success The leading SaaS platform to automate partnerships - affiliate, influencer, technology partners, and more! Entrepreneurial in spirit with a culture that rewards collaboration and curiosity Obsessed with making a difference in business and to the wider community Impact is the global leader in Partnership Automation, working with innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi’s, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage their online affiliate, influencer, brand to brand, and content partnerships. The Impact Partnership Cloud covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across Europe, the United States, Africa, and Asia so there is plenty of opportunity for growth and advancement.  Your Role At Impact  The Account Executive, through a clear understanding of the assigned IR product, prospects, educates and secures operationally viable advertisers on one of three product lines to support client growth and achieve a targeted revenue goal through a specific list of pre-assigned accounts.  We are growing our Greater China business to accommodate the increasing demand for our solution. We are looking for an experienced and dynamic sales person to own one of our top territories in Greater China. You will have the opportunity to grow rapidly and gain exposure to new marketing technologies as we progress! As a Senior Account Executive, you will be responsible for driving the sales process with prospective customers. Strong consultative and analytical skills are important for successful navigation from solution demo, definition of the scope and final contract. Be the face and name of Impact to some of the most well known brands worldwide. This role will be based in our Greater China headquarter office in Shanghai.  What You'll Do Build revenue and surpass assigned quarterly & annual quotas Accurately assess pipeline to forecast performance to sales leadership Convey advantages through online or in-person demo of the platform Educate prospects on IR products, associated benefits, and build a business case Collaborate within and outside of sales team to ensure successful client onboarding Actively prospect new business to fulfill pipeline obligations Accurately report pipeline performance and velocity to direct manager through proper documentation via Salesforce Ensure customers are prepared to enter operational and onboarding queue for successful implementation Constantly build knowledge and understanding of marketing ecosystem and how IR product plays a role Maintain positive attitude, highlighted by persistence and curiosity Be an expert in your product line and industry ecosystem Continually improve win close rate (~20% of all open opportunities) Maintain forward momentum through deal stage velocity Sell the product to the appropriate accounts and manage towards hitting a preset revenue target Generate pipeline by proactively sourcing opportunities within the designated territory Build 5X of quarterly quota in pipeline phase through prospecting and diagnostic calls Prepare & deliver world class demos and value-based presentations Answer prospects’ questions about product value, uses, integrations, and implementation Pro-actively drive the process with prospective clients from initial prospecting to signed contract and internal handoff Drive active engagement by all internal and external stakeholders necessary to close a deal Update SFDC daily with all relevant details needed to reflect business reality What You Have Digital marketing particularly performance marketing and affiliate marketing ecosystem knowledge required Experience running with excel and powerpoint Experience with outbound communication tools a + (salesloft .) 3-4 years in a client facing role Excellent verbal and written communication skills Experience in presentation and powerpoint Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s degree a plus in Information Technology, business and marketing 4-7 years sales experience, preferably SaaS Must be a true hunter! Independent person with the desire to excel in a competitive and highly rewarding industry Strong communication, effective problem-solving, networking and presentation skills Proven track record of building territories and addressing client needs Experience handling objections at multiple levels of enterprise organizations. Good understanding of the Greater China ecommerce space, and working knowledge of working with top brands in China Comfortable in relationship development with top level executives in Chinese global companies Fluent in English and Chinese Benefits/Perks Unlimited PTO policy - take the time off that you need. We are truly committed to a positive work-life balance, recognising that it is important to be happy and fulfilled in both Training & Development - learning the advanced partnership automation products Flexible work hours Private Health Insurance Internet Allowance Casual work environment Impact is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey! As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners. You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met. The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential. 主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws. No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

About Gartner Gartner, Inc. (NYSE: IT) is the world’s leading information technology research and advisory company. We deliver the technology-related insight necessary for our clients to make the right decisions, every day. We work with every client to research, analyze and interpret the business of IT within the context of their individual role. Founded in 1979, Gartner is headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, U.S.A. Visit gartner.com to learn more.  Why Executive Programs (ExP) A Gartner Executive Partner (EP) is an indispensable tool for every digital leader. ExP is an exclusive, membership-based organization serving over 7,000 CIOs and senior IT leaders across 87 countries. Our program has seen double digital growth YoY with 54% of members signing multi-year contracts. These members (including Fortune 500 companies & Governments around the world) benefit from the convenience of a single source of knowledge and insight focused on CIO-level challenges, service delivery in their context, the shared knowledge of the world's largest community of CIOs, and the assurance of Gartner objectivity and independence. Gartner’s Executive Partners act as coaches, content-providers and business advisors to Executive Programs members, and partner with colleagues across the organization to deliver service solutions utilizing Gartner products and services.  What You’ll Do  Manage a portfolio of 30+ member relationships  Leverage subject matter expertise to create service solutions for clients utilizing all ExP products  Define and deliver innovative solutions by assessing member Mission Critical Priorities (MCPs) and developing a customized service plan  Conduct on-site briefings, including workshops, research analyst visits, roundtables and webinars  Present or facilitate at local ExP events  Build a strong partnership with Gartner’s Sales organization and collaborate with them to ensure member engagement and renewal of ExP business  Who You Are Our most successful Executive Partners have the ability to adopt best practices, follow established processes, and embrace feedback with a mindset of continuous improvement. Gartner Executive Partners have natural curiosity and share their knowledge and expertise with Executive Programs members. They understand their members’ mission critical priorities and build trust by delivering value and leveraging key internal partnerships to drive results.   Consulting and/or CIO/CDO/CTO roles with 20+ years of progressive digital technology exposure (AI, BI, ML, Digital Transformation, Block Chain, Big Data, CLOUD, etc.)  Financial Services or Manufacturing Industry focus with cross industry exposure  The ideal candidate(s) should be able to demonstrate exposure to large E2E transformative initiatives having led/co-led large critical programs  Extensive knowledge of a CIO’s focus areas and an in-depth understanding of the IT industry (including Leadership, IT Operations Management, strategy and trends, use of metrics, etc.) and priorities such as the challenges of “today’s” CIO’s and how Gartner ExP can make the difference as an advisory organization  Advanced critical thinking and structured problem solving skills  High tolerance and an advanced ability to lead and manage ambiguous situations  Excellent relationship building and collaboration skills  Superior verbal, written, facilitation and presentation skills both in English and Chinese  Strong Executive Presence  Demonstrable sales and/or business development experience with CXO level executives  Expert skills at managing multiple priorities  Curious and hungry to learn  Committed to making others successful  Collaborative  Gravitas and confidence  Active listening skills Job Requisition ID:G22459 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence. Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Main Responsibilities And Key Activities 1.负责完成并完成销售目标 2.开拓传统市场之外的新业务 3.追求、谈判和构建适当的销售条款，并通过与公司和区域计划相一致的竞争策略最大化销售渗透。确保在展会、用户大会等市场活动后系统地跟进销售线索 4.与组织内的跨部门团队合作，直接与客户或战略合作伙伴制定行之有效的销售策略，以推动增长 5.与其他部门团队合作，计划和组织促销活动 6.完成销售活动，订单开发，价格策略，付款 7.通过内部SFDC系统生成销售方案，并确保数据库更新，熟练使用SFDC系统来帮助管理日常销售工作 8.通过每周回顾和更新潜在客户名单，确保销售预测的准确性。通过适当的销售、谈判和收尾技巧，共同努力缩短销售预测实现周期 9.及时向经理提交有意义的销售拜访报告 10.与财务信用控制部门协调跟进客户逾期付款 Qualifications And Professional Knowledge 1.至少3 -5年销售经验，具备销售和谈判技巧 2.至少1年以上软件销售经验 3.敏锐的商业嗅觉，能够在销售谈判和结束中运用实用的商业方法 4.系统地跟进线索并完成 5.良好的人际关系技巧，能够处理多层次关系 6.有丰富的包装行业销售经验尤佳

description: Why work at Entegris?  Lead. Inspire. Innovate. Define Your Future.  Not everyone who works for a global company shares the same background, experiences and perspectives. We leverage the differences of our employees to bring new ideas to the table. Every employee throughout the company is encouraged to share input on projects and initiatives. Our decision making process is truly a collaborative effort as we realize there are leaders at every level of the organization. We put our values at the core of how we operate as an organization — not just when it’s convenient, but in a lasting and meaningful way. We want the time and energy you spend here to have a positive impact on your life inside and outside of the office.  Entegris is a values-driven culture and our employees rally around our core PACE values:  P eople  A ccountability  C reativity  E xcellence  The Role  Entegris, a leading materials innovator, is growing rapidly in multiple industrial markets and is seeking an Account Manager in Xi'an to join an empowered team leading our growth. In applying knowledge and passion around semiconductor materials, the role offers the opportunity to lead a key growth objective at Entegris. Serving as the primary engagement point for the entire Entegris products into Samsung China, the role will be responsible for developing, maintaining and growing productive, long-term, win-win relationships with customers enabling Entegris to meet revenue, profitability and market share objectives in our target markets  In this role you will  The position will have primary responsibility for growing Entegris’ Samsung China account.  Significant career growth is available within the position with considerable growth potential in existing products and new opportunities to take on additional product lines.  The Position Develops and maintains productive relationships, at multiple levels, between Entegris and our customers, typically through a combination of frequent face-to-face meetings at customers sites and through telephone/conference calls Develops and executes account and opportunity plans for key customers and prospects Understands and communicates customer needs and positions Entegris products and solutions to meet those needs Manages ongoing engagements, interfacing with numerous functions internally to ensure adequate and timely completion of deliverables, and guiding opportunities through a sales funnel, ultimately to achieve the expected outcomes in terms of revenue, profitability and market share growth. Traits we believe make a strong candidate 10+ years of experience in Semiconductor field, with some portion of this experience in a sales or customer facing role. Experience with the markets, technology and products Entegris has or similar products is highly desirable Good account management skills, ideally with experience successfully managing client relationships between multi-nationals including Demonstrated success at developing and executing account strategies An ability to engage at multiple levels and across multiple functions within client organizations Strong influence, leadership and teamwork skills to collaborate internally in order to meet Entegris and customer business goals Excellent, value-based sales skills in a Semiconductor market with a demonstrated ability to close sales opportunities. Familiarity with developing cost of ownership models and value-based selling provides the best fit for the role. Coupled with an ability and willingness to drive action at a detailed level, a successful incumbent will also have demonstrated an ability to develop and execute a market engagement strategy The position will have significant interactions overseas and therefore a demonstrated ability to work across cultures is needed. The position requires proficiency in written and spoken English and Korean. Chinese ability is a plus. A Bachelor’s degree in Material Science, Engineering or related technical degree, or relevant experience in a Semiconductor market, will provide the candidate with the fundamentals needed to interact with customers and teammates. Your success will be measured by  Success in the role will primarily be defined by growing product line revenues, profitability and market share. Additional objectives will include positioning Entegris to generate revenue growth at new accounts and/or new locations and applications with existing accounts, ultimately closing these new sales opportunities.  What We Offer  Our total rewards package goes above and beyond just a paycheck. Whether you’re looking to build your career, improve your health, or protect your wealth, we offer generous benefits to help you achieve your goals. Very Competitive total compensation plans. A 401(K) plan to help you plan for your future with an impressive employer match that’s all yours- no vesting! Great health, dental and vision insurance packages to fit your needs to ensure you’re happy and healthy. A progressive PTO policy that empowers our employees to take the time they need to recharge! At Entegris we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants. Our policy is to recruit, hire, train, and reward employees for their individual abilities, achievements and experience without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, marital or military status.

Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: May 24, 2021 Travel: No
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: About Switch Switch is the world’s first workspace on-demand platform. Switch unlocks productivity by unlocking workspace all over the city. With two taps in the Switch app, Switch Members can check in and out of workspaces on a pay-per-minute basis. On the demand side, large corporations and individual consumers use Switch to ‘Work From Anywhere’ and ‘Work Near Home’. On the supply side, space partners such as coworking-spaces, serviced offices, traditional offices, shopping malls, hotels and co-living operators offer four types of workspaces: hot desks, meeting rooms, private offices, and smart work booths. Switch enables both individual and enterprise users to work from anywhere with improved productivity, privacy, and flexibility. Users can pay only for what they use (by minutes) and skip any monthly memberships or day-passes.  The Switch team has a proven track record in inventing and commercializing technologies and business models in the real estate industry and marketplace businesses. Led by the former leadership and team members of WeWork China Technology team, the Switch team is based in offices across Singapore, Shanghai, Taipei and Melbourne. The team is comprised of experienced veterans from both tech and real estate industries including WeWork, CapitaLand, KE Holdings, Google, Uber, Airbnb, Bytedance, Microsoft, Autodesk, and other leading firms.  Switch is backed by four of the largest property companies in Asia. For more information, please visit www.switch.site  Location of this position China (open to Shanghai & Beijing)  What This Position Does to Help Switch Succeed? This is a unique opportunity for a highly motivated sales professional with successful track record of making deals with commercial real estate landlords or operators. It would be a major plus if you have retail real estate experience.  The ideal candidate has strong business development experience as well as deep understanding of retail real estate business operations. Responsible for the entire sales process, you skillfully prospect, align business outcomes, build consensus, handle objections, negotiate deals and successfully close on time.  What Makes This Job Awesome? Join one of the most innovative companies at the intersection of the technology and real estate worlds! Identify new business opportunities (business districts /malls /transportation hubs etc.), work out the feasibility study and develop the strategic business plan to expand Switch’s booths coverage. Build a pipeline by prospecting new business with landlord or developer decision makers within retail and commercial real estate industry. Confidently negotiate pricing and sales contracts running point on legal and contract reviews Translate discovery insights and desired business outcomes into compelling sales strategies that win new booth placement and partnership deals, upsell and extend the existing deals. Work closely with booth deployment, professional services and customer support teams to address client requirements and ensure successful implementation and continued use Represent Switch at in-market events, industry groups, and CRE specific initiatives networking and building relationships with target prospects.  What Makes You A Great Fit? 3 - 5+ years working experience in sales roles related with retail real estate industry or retail brand business development with proven track record. Experiences in the technology or marketplace businesses is a plus. Demonstrated history of handling business deals between retail landlords and merchants. A deal winner with deep understanding of the retail real estate BD & operations and strong insight on consumer retail trends in your market Skilled at building new pipeline and strong in building process-oriented action plans to win accounts. Negotiate independently with Landlord for all the contracts, including new opening /renewal /termination as well as Popups, and ensure on-time signing Identify new business opportunities (new cities /malls / retail channels, etc.), work out and execute Work as key bridge between Landlord and Switch, support internal departments (Marketing, PR, Finance, etc.) for communication/negotiation with Landlord and help to solve the issues Go-getter attitude Liaise closely with Go-to-market (GTM) team in order to maximize team results and brand synergy Creative thinker, highly organized and efficient in managing multiple projects at once Native or fluent in Mandarin; Strong English communication skills

Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. To gain market share in the Cardiac Rhythm Heart Failure (CRHF) business by promoting, selling, and servicing Medtronic's Pacing products within assigned territory. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. description: 工作职责:  At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 39,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.  Program Description  Lilly China is seeking candidates who are committed to an initial assignment in their country of origin which provides the foundational platform to learn the industry and understand our customers (patients, payers, and providers). MBAs will leverage and develop their leadership skills in their home affiliate as part of a global culture dedicated to employee development.  Our Lilly Leadership Development Program (LLDP) is designed to engage, develop and motivate highly talented and innovative MBA graduates. Its purpose is to recruit and accelerate development of those who possess true leadership qualities.  Open functions 2021 Sales & Marketing Finance IT Required Qualifications Currently still enrolled in an MBA program Graduate by August 2022 3 to 7 years working experience with clear career progression Language fluency in both English and Mandarin Additional Preferences 5+ years working experience is highly preferred Commercial background is highly preferred for Marketing Functions Healthcare or consumer goods experience is preferred People management/cross-regional experiences are highly preferred Skills Demonstrated leadership Strong problem solving Excellent teamwork Flexibility and adaptability Strong leaning agility Eli Lilly and Company, Lilly USA, LLC and our wholly owned subsidiaries (collectively “Lilly”) are committed to help individuals with disabilities to participate in the workforce and ensure equal opportunity to compete for jobs. If you require an accommodation to submit a resume for positions at Lilly, please email Lilly Human Resources ( Lilly_Recruiting_Compliance@lists.lilly.com ) for further assistance. Please note This email address is intended for use only to request an accommodation as part of the application process. Any other correspondence will not receive a response.  Lilly does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.  任职条件:  详情请见职位描述

description: JOB SUMMARY The Buyer will be responsible for leading on buying and assorting merchandise for Retail Stores in China, in accordance with corporate guidance and providing on-going feedback around merchandise needs on a specific category. He or she is required to establish strategic merchandise plans for sales, markdowns, inventory, and growth opportunity.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: BUYING Responsible for the buying of a specific category Assist in formulating the buying strategy and the buying process to make sure each buy is done properly (quantity and styles) by assorting the line, analyzing history, and identifying volume drivers to maximize sales for each season with guidance and collaboration with the Corporate Buying function Work closely with Marketing team (PR, Retail Marketing and Digital) to incorporate Product Launch, Key theme push, store events and etc. Work closely with VM for the in-store display and windows to maintain a global image and also drive sales Be responsible for the merchandise distribution, stock allocation and merchandise reordering management  PROVIDE FEEDBACK ON LOCAL MARKETS NEEDS On-going communication with Merchandising Team in U.S. on local market needs and specific country requests, that include but not limited to special products, new stores opening and new initiatives of the region In touch with local industry trends and competitor awareness in pricing, trend, quality and products offers                                                                                                                                                                                     POINT PERSON FOR REGIONAL MERCHANDISING STRATEGY Key communicator of the assigned categories’ seasonal merchandising strategy to local Retail teams Responsible for the Seasonal Product training to the local Retail teams Conduct product training when season kick off to retail staff to ensure they possess good knowledge Provide the specific training (trendy Information, key item focus, regional delivery timetable) to retail staff and tracking their performance Support and work with training team regarding to product knowledge and in-store activity to enhance training throughout the season Translate the relevant materials on product knowledge  SALES DRIVER AND OWNERSHIP Run varies sales reports and analyze data weekly to identify current sales trend, inventory situation, and opportunities, recommending action plan weekly on ground in order to drive sales: Sales/EOH by season, concept, class, style, stores Action Plan on Best Seller and Slow Mover Recommend Markdowns/Promotions Call out any Initial Product delivery issues and/or Propose Replenishment Co-ordinate Bi- Weekly local products transfer/consolidation Event planning and coordination merchandising related Support local retail team on merchandising related such as defective products, system retail price error, store product request etc.  LOCAL MARKET EXPERT Competitor analysis, pricing research, product research, consumer research Collecting market trends, successes/opportunities and the end consumer behavior, and then come out how to influence and improve the future collections for the country Support any Marketing/PR tie ups, events, exclusive opportunities merchandising related  EDUCATION & PRIOR EXPERIENCE NEEDED A minimum of 5 years fashion retail merchandising experience. Previous buying experience in luxury fashion industry Strong team worker, retail driven mindset, communication and presentation skills Sound business acumen and retail numerical sense, detailed mind with strong analytical skills Proficiency in MS Office Applications and advanced in Excel Excellent command in English & Chinese

jobTitle: Account Executive (Sales/BD), China 硬件业务经理 - 中国深圳（销售/业务拓展）
description: 硬件业务经理 - 深圳（销售/业务拓展）  深圳，中国  销售 - Indiegogo中国项目部  INDIEGOGO 是一个先于主流发掘巧妙设计与创新科技的地方。每周都有包括巧妙技术和匠心设计在内的多项项目上线，成千上万的产品从我们的平台上走向世界。  作为全世界最大的众筹和产品首发平台之一，INDIEGOGO在中国市场的设计与消费科技领域正经历爆炸式增长。我们有意在深圳寻找一位有业务拓展工作经验人才来帮助建立和扩大我们的中国区业务。在这一职位上，您将负责在大中华区寻找优质产品，帮助其通过Indiegogo在国际范围内开展众筹，并建立紧密合作关系，确保他们的产品成功发布。您将定期参与活动和各项沟通交流，推进大中华区Indiegogo品牌发展。  理想的候选人熟悉电子消费产品圈，并热衷于更新中国品牌在国际平台发布趋势。该候选人应具备中文母语水平，并应达到商务英文水平。  优先考虑可在深圳工作的候选人；对于特别优秀的候选人，北京、上海、杭州也可给予考虑为录用地点。  更多关于Indiegogo目前与中国创业者合作信息请参见：Indiegogo中国项目出海绿色通道  工作职责 达成短线与长线销售目标 发现并锁定高质量项目与合作伙伴关系，从而推进企业与垂直领域的发展 善于调配资源，并为众筹项目方提供优质咨询服务以确保其完成众筹目标 拓展INDIEGOGO中国业务。通过关系拓展、社会活动、媒体发布等方式建立关键性社会联系和商业机会，以此提高INDIEGOGO品牌影响力 与国际营销策略顾问合作共同推进项目发展 积极并准确反馈项目进度与各项表现 任职资格 3-5年以上客户服务经验，销售方向优先考虑 中文 （普通话）母语水平，商务英文读写流利 能够远端独立工作，並且在正常工作时间之外工作，以便与美国团队进行沟通 具备消费电子产品硬件、设计和技术空间之内的纵向产品知识、个人经验、优良口碑和社会网络；深刻理解中国硬件生态系统。主要能力包括： 销售：具备开发与完成高质量的众筹项目能力  咨询：能够跟客户和未来客户建立良好、以信任为基础的关系，为其提供营销策略指导与推广支持  客户发展：新客户的锁定到长期战略关系建立的“端对端”客户发展管理的实际经验 具备有限时间内高压环境下分优先级处理多项任务的能力 有说服力、积极与自信的工作态度，优秀的领导力，并有能给出建议并接受建议的能力 卓越的人际沟通和表达能力 加分条件 众筹经验 对硬件/技术产品设计有深刻理解与个人经验 流利的书面和口头英文 消费电子产品硬件、设计和技术空间具备现有资源和关系网 Indiegogo is the place to discover clever and unique innovations in tech and design before they go mainstream, including hundreds of products shipping right away. With thousands of projects launching every week, there’s ingenious tech, creative design, and much more around every corner.  Indiegogo is experiencing explosive growth in our Technology and Design vertical. We're looking for someone to help build and grow that business based in Shenzhen, China. Within this role, you'll source quality products in Greater China to help launch internationally via Indiegogo and will work with these clients to ensure their launches are successful. You'll regularly attend events, network, and speak to grow the Indiegogo brand in Greater China.  The ideal candidate understands product development and is passionate about changing how Chinese brands launch internationally, with native fluency in Mandarin Chinese and good command in business-level English.  The ideal candidate would be based in Shenzhen, China; however, Beijing, Shanghai, or Hangzhou may be considered as alternative hiring locations for particularly outstanding candidates.  Learn more about what Indiegogo is doing with entrepreneurs in China  You Will Achieve near and long-term sales targets. Identify, target, pitch, and close high-quality campaigns and partnerships that will advance our business overall, as well as in specific verticals Marshall cross-functional resources and provide high-impact consultative input to campaigners to help ensure they reach their goals Grow Indiegogo outreach in China by identifying key relationships and business opportunities, whether through networking, speaking engagements, events, press, or other opportunities, to successfully grow Indiegogo’s presence Work with U.S.-based campaign strategist team to aid the development of campaigns Actively and accurately report pipeline and performance  Qualifications 3-5 years of client-facing experience, emphasis on sales highly preferred Chinese (Mandarin) fluency and English proficiency Willing to travel in Greater China region and work flexible hours to accommodate coordination with U.S. headquarters Product vertical knowledge, experience, reputation, and network within the consumer hardware, design, and technology space; and familiarity with the Chinese hardware ecosystem. Core capabilities include: Sales: Ability to source and close high-quality campaigns Consultative: Ability to build strong, trust-based high impact relationships with clients and prospects, and educate them on innovative techniques Client development: Hands-on experience managing the end-to-end client development process, from securing initial engagements at new clients, to successfully growing long-term strategic accounts Experience and demonstrated ability to prioritize and multitask in a deadline-driven, high-pressure environment Persuasive, positive and confident disposition with strong leadership skills and ability to provide and receive constructive criticism Superior communication and public speaking skills.  Bonus Points Past professional or personal experience with crowdfunding Past professional or personal experience with, and a deep understanding of hardware/technology product design Fluency in English, written and verbal, is a plus! Existing strong network in hardware, design and consumer technology Indiegogo is committed to respecting your privacy as a job applicant. Please visit our Job Applicant Privacy Statement in our Privacy Portal for more information on your privacy rights and how Indiegogo processes your personal information.

description: Do you want to be on the ground floor of a profitable, high growth, SaaS business scaling its enterprise sales team?  Do you have the ambition to accelerate your career growth and build something from the ground up?  Do you thrive when you're contributing to a high-performing, humble team?  Amazing, then you’re the type of person we’re looking for!  At Jungle Scout, we are on a mission to empower entrepreneurs and brands to grow successful e-commerce businesses, and we provide the industry-leading data, powerful tools, and resources they need.  We’re growing and we are looking to add an Account Executive to our Sales Team.   Interested in learning more? Let’s get into the details:    You will be doing:  Be responsible for selling the Jungle Scout Cobalt Market Insights platform and Downstream to top consumer brands and product manufacturers; Identify and develop account opportunities Asisa-Pacific region; Own the client relationship throughout the sales process and manage the transition process to the Customer Success team after close. Work closely with colleagues to develop and execute account and sales strategies; Be able to successfully connect with, and sell to, multiple levels within an organization; Focus on moving the needle with respect to the client’s KPIs and showcase the value of the Jungle Scout Cobalt Market Insights platform through personalized presentations, demonstrations and business case development; Close collaboration with Jungle Scout’s Content & Communications team to create data-heavy examples for key client pitches; Manage and communicate pipeline progress to Jungle Scout management; Work closely with the Product team to ensure closed-loop feedback from enterprise customers. Who you are:  3+ years of successful quota-carrying SaaS sales experience, you’re consistently the top performer on your team & exceed every revenue goal; Courageous, confident, and self-driven. You know how to persevere through challenges and remain calm but focused in a fast-paced, high pressure, dynamic environment. You run through new challenges - not around them; Proven success in managing relationships, up to C-level, within large enterprise organizations Experience developing proposals, business cases, and other content; Ability to learn complex business concepts very quickly, define problems accurately while paying attention to detail, then craft the appropriate solution; Ability to develop relationships with clients and internal teams built on trust and credibility; Exceptional written and oral communications skills, with a strong emphasis on active listening Expertise with Salesforce; Experience selling into the heads of eCommerce at consumer product manufacturers is highly desirable, but not a requirement; Experience working with a SaaS provider in the eCommerce ecosystem or within the sales or marketing organization of a consumer brand； Good communication skills in English and Mandarine. Bonus:  Deep knowledge of Amazon Seller Central and/or Amazon Vendor Central

Highly appreciate Company culture and value. Strong communication and customer service experience required. Exceptional self-management and self-learning ability. During the probationary period, including not limited to transfer, promotion, etc., are not considered to pass the probationary period and the employee is required to pass the probationary period. Valid driver’s license with a clean driving history and proficient driving skills. 主要职责 保证最佳客户体验：接待所有进店客人，回答问题，热情地为客户和特斯拉粉丝介绍电动汽车的优点,普及电动车知识。 通过良好的沟通，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态，明确特斯拉的发展前景并鼓励顾客试驾，并通过良好的试驾体验使潜在客户向亲朋好友宣传特斯拉。 收集潜在客户，参加市场活动，探索客户购买需求、激发客户需求，配合销售主管完成门店的销售目标。 对现有特斯拉车主提供高质量客户服务。 沟通最新公司讯息，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态。 认真学习了解公司及产品的相关知识，及时了解最新行业发展和最佳实践。 建立良好的客户关系，并在试驾过程中提供完美的客户体验使潜在客户向亲朋好友传递良好特斯拉口碑。 通过公司安排的内部测试，包括但不限于课程培训及测试、驾驶技术测试、店内测试、角色扮演、能力认证、试用期评估等，以达到正式员工的标准和要求。 和外部客户、外部人员，保持清晰、准确、职业、礼貌的沟通, 和内部同事保持良好的沟通和团队协作（包括同部门、跨部门；同门店、跨门店；同地区、跨地区之间）。 保持库存充足和整洁（如适用）。 员工在试用期期间发生的任何职位变更，包括并不限于调岗、晋升等，均不可视为通过试用期，员工需要通过试用期评估。 其他职责：根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作。 职位要求 应届毕业生或1到2年零售、行业销售、以及大客户销售经验或服务经验； 对企业文化高度认可。 出色的沟通能力和客户服务意识。 良好的自我管理能力及自我学习能力，积极热情地参与改变个人交通行业的变革。 深刻理解并传递业务问题和技术概念。 优秀的团队意识，是可靠的团队成员。 能够接受零售业的工作时间，需要晚上和周末工作；有销售经验优先。 持有有效中国驾照，熟练驾驶，且无不良行驶记录。

About Us  Gore is a materials science company focused on improving lives through discovery, product innovation and rewarding careers for our Associates.  About The Industry  Saving lives and improving the quality of life for patients is at the core of everything we do. This meaningful work gives purpose to our lives and inspires us to create solutions that make a difference in the lives of others. Learn more at gore.com/products/industries  About The Role  We are looking for a Field Sales Associate to join our Medical Product Division Sale Team in Beijing who will be accountable for Peripheral Vascular medical device business development or exceeding the sales forecast in specific geographic in North China area.  Responsibilities: Develop profitable sales opportunities, proactively make sales calls Develop new business to align with Gore business needs Ensure the KOL management, market data collection, etc., are effective, build, maintain and defend long-term customer relationships Ensure the cooperation with other product specialists are active and constructive, to achieve team goals and objectives Implement value pricing principle, be a value seller, be skilled in the use of premise-based forecasting techniques Implement Gore’s product strategy, understand the needs of the customer  Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in medical or medicine Proven sales background, preferably with a minimum of 5 years' experience in the medical devices sales area Will have worked in or able to demonstrate an understanding of the imperatives of a business environment Clinical background in interventional areas or sales experience to this environment Strong communication and interpersonal skills A high level of self-motivation and passion, ensuring the ability to work under minimal supervision Commercial acumen High integrity Ability to travel extensively up to 60% and attend weekend conferences as required  What We Offer  At Gore, we want our Associates to have fulfilling careers driven by curiosity and commitment. In return, we commit to our Associates by offering comprehensive, competitive rewards in the form of compensation, benefits, an Associate stock ownership-type plan, and opportunities for growth and development. Learn more at gore.com/careers  We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and inclusive work environment. In support of our values and continued success we are proud of Associates around the world who support an inclusive work environment, strive to reflect the diversity of the communities where we operate, and ensure all Associates and external partners are treated with fairness, dignity and respect.  Our Talent Acquisition Team welcomes your questions via email at AP_TA@wlgore.com  Job  Sales  Primary Location  Asia-Pacific-CN-BJ-Chaoyang  Travel%  60%  Shift  Day  Schedule  Full-time

Job Description  As the Strategy & Operation lead, you will provide high-level operation & strategic support to MSBU commercialization activities, support BU head to drive strategic objective, sales operation, performance acceleration and work with internal and external partners for priority projects.  Accountability Support on designing MSBU portfolio strategy and work out operation goals MSBU operation strategic analysis, incl. concrete business analysis, internal & external data analysis, sales analysis, work out suggestions/solutions, initiate follow up as needed Lead task force on BU level priority initiatives to support business optimization, portfolio integration, performance acceleration. Initiate and drive MS digital strategy & implementation to accelerate MS portfolio presence and reach in digital channels. Lead and manage BU sales operation process incl. KPI setting & tracking, launch readiness, business operation review; Effectively collaborates with x-functional teams to identify, mitigate & solve potential business operation issues Support BU head for business strategy development and reporting, BU governance and leadership team meeting management Ethical and compliance champion for MSBU Qualifications Bachelor’s degree (or above) in medicine, pharmacy, life science or related field Strong performance mindset with proven record in pharm sales or marketing, 8 years industry experience is typical Strategic project management skill with ability to lead, plan, collaborate and drive execution of business strategy and tactics Deep understanding of pharm market and solid experience in driving digital projects Strong team player, self-starter and high learning agility Strong inter-personal communication skills, influence and manage w/o authority Adapt to change and work in VUCA environment Bi-lingual sufficiency, both Chinese and English Excellent PPT and Excel skills Highest ethical standard Additional Information  As the global leader in MS, Biogen has accumulated more than 30 years of clinical experience in MS treatment, built widest portfolio in MS and served more than half of MS patients worldwide. Looking forward, Biogen continue to explore new medicine, device and data solution to support MS patients to conquer the disease.  The Strategy & Operation lead, will support BU head and work closely with x-functional teams to launch MS portfolio in China. He/She will work with different types of players to design and implement innovative go-to-market models to bring our portfolio to benefit Chinese MS patients.

Description  KEY ACCOUNT MANAGER  Location: Shenzhen, China Type of Employee: Full Time  Power Integrations, Inc. is a Silicon Valley-based supplier of high-performance electronic components used in high-voltage power-conversion systems. Our integrated circuits and diodes enable compact, energy-efficient AC-DC power supplies for a vast range of electronic products including mobile devices, TVs, PCs, appliances, smart utility meters and LED lights. Our SCALE™ IGBT drivers enhance the efficiency, reliability and cost of high-power applications such as industrial motor drives, solar and wind energy systems, electric vehicles and high-voltage DC transmission. Since its introduction in 1998, Power Integrations' EcoSmart® energy-efficiency technology has prevented billions of dollars' worth of energy waste and millions of tons of carbon emissions. Reflecting the environmental benefits of our products, Power Integrations' stock is a member of clean-technology stock indices sponsored byCleantech Group LLCandClean Edge. Visit ourGreen Roomfor a comprehensive guide to energy-efficiency standards around the world.  He or she will be responsible for providing the technical support to the existing OEM customers with the responsibility of developing and growing revenue . The position also requires a deep understanding of the customers design requirements for AC/DC power conversion. The individual will report to the Director of Sales in Shenzhen.  Responsibility Revenue goal setting and achieve for China automotive goal Establish, maintain and develop business in key OEMs and tier-1 suppliers Drive automotive design wins by qualifying customer and opportunities, moving pipelines forward Develop account strategy and lead high level negotiation. Work closely with production lines and local support team to win key projects Develop& maintain the good relationship with customers. Qualifications/Requirements BSEE or equivalent as a minimum, automotive related preferred 8+ years of sales/marketing experience in automotive MSEE degree with 6+ years of sales/marketing experience in automotive Self-driven, active communication, focus and ownership Fluent in English. German is a plus. Familiar with automotive OEMs, BAIC, SAIC, FAW, Geeley, Chery, JAC; and Tier-1 automotive suppliers, UTEC, Visteon, Falio, etc. Have basic knowledge of automotive power train and auxiliary powers

description: If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process. Job ID  22479  Posted  12-Apr-2021  Areas of Interest  Administrative  Location(s)  Shanghai - Shanghai - China  Job Title: Divisional Commercial Manager  Location: Shanghai, China  Division: Data Center Solutions  Reports To: Divisional Commercial Director  Role Statement  To support the Business by educating, influencing and advising key stakeholders on commercial best practice in order to contribute to long-term growth and profitability.  Overview  Regional commercial role dedicated to DCS in APAC to support new and existing business and growth together with providing day-to-day support to the DCS team and accounts. Be the subject matter expert on the DCS commercial agreements, including but not limited to: commercial terms, areas of risk and reward, operational compliance, cost control, financial responsibilities and liabilities, milestone obligations. Work with the business subject matter experts (SMEs) and legal team to support the DCS business.  Take the lead on the commercial position of the accounts, including attending regular customer meetings, review meetings, reporting and rolling out commercial training as well as developing bespoke training for the large accounts as required.  Support the transition of new wins, including the education and influence of the operational and procurement teams in managing, mitigating and flowing down risk, managing change on the accounts, supporting change and sharing best practice.  Key Responsibilities  1 – Commercial Negotiation and Agreement of Contracts  To agree contracts on a timely basis to the mutual satisfaction of both parties. Involved with the sales, tender or re-tender process Adopting and agreeing the best negotiation strategy with internal stakeholders Leading the commercial negotiation Achieving a signed contract document Influencing internal and external stakeholders Complying with the GWS contracting standards and policies Success Criteria CBRE wins new contracts Signed Contract on best possible terms and compliant with GWS governance Clearly defined scope and obligations Good Customer Relationship 2 – Commercial Policy/Procedure Compliance.  To promote compliance with policy and procedures. Attending Business Unit, Account, Contract or Project Reviews to promote best practice Providing and maintaining standard documentation Checking processes for compliance Success Criteria Risks mitigated and offset Profits maximised Promotes positive behaviours Reduction in disputes and issues 3 – Educate and advise on commercial best practice  To develop internal stakeholders’ commercial awareness. Advising on contractual obligations Running commercial training courses Providing commercial guidance at tender stage and through the contract life cycle Presenting at Company, Divisional and BU management meetings Staying abreast of changes in relevant laws and commercial practice Success Criteria Practical and useful contract summaries/abstracts/deliverables (terms, pricing and scope) Contractual compliance Commercially astute colleagues Good account/contract/project management Minimise claims/disputes/issues 4 – Providing commercial solutions To provide commercial solutions to minimise risk and maximise opportunities. Analysing the circumstances Articulating the options and potential outcomes Influence and motivate stakeholders to take the best commercial solution Building key customer contacts to strengthen CBRE’s position in the development of long term customer relationships Considering innovative solutions Taking the lead on business issues which could lead to high risk or litigation/disputes – co-ordinating with the operators and legal team as required Success Criteria Achieving the most commercially advantageous outcome Avoid margin erosion Customer acceptance Agreed Change Control, Contract extension and/or renewal Avoid formal disputes 5 – Promote Best Practice Supplier Engagement To promote best practice in the appointment of suppliers. Timely and contractually robust order placement Transferring risk by back to back obligations Supporting the negotiation of Supplier agreements Success Criteria Dispute avoidance Meets CBRE contract requirements Protects and promotes CBRE’s service Job Requirements, Knowledge, Skills & Experience Degree qualified (or higher) or equivalent in a relevant discipline. At least five years relevant experience in a commercial role – i.e. relevant contract management experience in facilities management service providers, or trained legal & law background Sales focused negotiation skills Able to work independently with experience of working in a regional or global organization Self-motivated individual experienced and comfortable with complex problem solving and providing solutions-based advice and guidance to multiple stakeholders Customer focused approach Proven track record of working with, educating and influencing a broad range of internal and external stakeholders at all levels Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written with fluency in English & local language - Chinese (role will be based in China). Strong understanding of local laws & legalities in the relevant field Thrive on fast-pace working in a regional and global business Able to understand and anticipate business needs. Flexible approach, diligent, discrete, compliant with company policies and responsive to key business objectives Strong commercial acumen and understanding of business impact and risk mitigation in relation to contract terms and operations Proficient analytical skills and a measured approach to decision making Experienced and comfortable with the operation of industry standard forms of contract (as applicable) Experience in Data Centre sector / Facilities Management Service Provider is beneficial Qualification / training in contract law desirable
