jobTitle: R3560438 Service Win Back Account Sales Manager
description: 工作职责: 向合作伙伴和分销商销售或通过其进行销售。可能包括渠道销售支持和渠道开发职责。 对销售区域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群有深入的了解。利用先前的经验和获得的商业专业知识来执行政策/策略。 深入理解关键业务驱动力；用这种理解来完成自己的工作。深入了解自己团队的工作如何与其他团队融合并为该领域做出贡献。 大多数决策都在规定的框架内，但是对于项目、产品线、市场、销售过程或客户的最终决策具有一定的自主权。利用先前的经验和在职培训来解决简单的任务。拥有解决问题所需的技术技能和分析思维。可以使用自己团队以外的多个内部资源来做出决定。 此级别的职位可能由个人贡献者担任，且其具有成熟的人际交往能力。向直接相关的同事和业务部门传达所提供的设计和协调服务。为新团队成员提供非正式指导。在简单的情况下向其他人解释复杂的信息。 任职条件:  基本资格 该岗位要求在领域具有较丰富的工作经验。 学历水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历） 所需特性 优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够影响他人并领导小型团队。领导中等范围和影响的计划。能够同时协调多个项目。有效的问题识别和解决技能。可靠的分析和组织能力。

About Direct HR  Direct HR is a Top 10 China-focused recruitment firm serving over 1,200 foreign and Chinese clients from multinationals to small SMEs by getting the right leadership and talent for their organizations.   Shanghai Office Address  Tian An Center 338 West Nanjing Road Shanghai, China   Responsibilities  Prospecting and networking with top executives of prospect companies, identify sales opportunities, reaping the rewards of negotiating contracts to a successful close. At least 5 years working experience based inside China.  At least 5+ years working experience in a foreign service provider focusing on the China market in a Sales / Business Development (BD) / Client Management or Account Management capacity – experience having had regular contact with client’s top decision makers is required.  Regularly speaking to client contact persons and key stakeholders, understanding their company’s situation and able to advise on solutions.  Recruitment experience preferred, but not a must have.  Language: Fluent English, written and spoken required.  Language: Native German / Danish / Swedish / Norwegian speaker preferred.  Language: Chinese preferred, but not a must.  Articulate and well accustomed to a client facing role.  Structured, process driven.  Intercultural awareness to speak and work with clients and colleagues with different cultural backgrounds.  Willingness and ability to travel.

About VERITAS  Veritas solves what no one else can. With an industry-leading product portfolio, we offer proven, modern, and integrated technology that brings together availability, protection, and insights. Our Veritas Enterprise Data Services Platform addresses current and future data issues end-to-end – keeping mission-critical workloads highly available, protecting data everywhere, and providing insights to optimize costs and maintain regulatory readiness.  Veritas supports 500+ data sources, 150+ storage targets, 50+ clouds, and any deployment model imaginable. We serve 99% of the Fortune 100, 90% of the Fortune 500, and are the market leader in Software-defined Storage, Data Protection, and Archiving.  Veritas’ Worldwide Field Operations (WFO) propels company growth by driving all aspects of new business and channel sales and includes global sales operations and global sales enablement for all new business and renewal sales.  Responsibilities The Sales Account Manager is distinguished by their deep knowledge of the IT industry and Veritas’ Information Management Portfolio. This industry expert will be assigned to large, complex, high visibility, strategic, named accounts. Sells Veritas’ entire information management portfolio (backup/recovery, high availability, clustering, archiving, eDiscovery, etc.) and maintains relationships with existing named accounts that are of substantial strategic importance to the organization. Develops strategies and orchestrates company resources to maximize sales volume and profit goals within assigned accounts. The territory is comprised of accounts that are strategic to the long-term success of the organization. The candidate is expected to cultivate and maintain executive level relationships in IT and various Lines of Business (LOB), focusing on the strategic nature of the relationship. Represents Veritas to the customer and the customer to Veritas. Responsible for expanding Veritas’ footprint in the assigned territory and ensuring ongoing customer satisfaction. Primary point-of-contact sales manager for account regardless of account’s geographic location. Meeting and/or exceeding sales quota and customer satisfaction metrics. Assigned to large, complex, high visibility, strategic, or tactically important accounts. Ability to collaborate with extended Veritas and partner teams but also to work independently to accomplish required tasks. Interface with all levels of management. Negotiating and influencing to build consensus. Present programs internally and externally. Work is focused on operational plans in support of strategic goals. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. 4+ years’ sales and/or account management experience in IT software/hardware sales. TS/SCI clearance may be required. Strong, documented track record of achievement against quota. Current contacts/relationships and working business knowledge of assigned customers. Strong business and executive level sales acumen. Tangible examples required. Excellent time management, presentation, written and oral skills. At Veritas, we care about the causes close to your heart and enable you to volunteer, donate, and do good. We also value uniqueness and know that a more diverse and inclusive workforce makes a winning team, so come as you are! Interested? Then apply and find out more about #TeamVTAS!

description: Job Summary:  This position will be responsible for assisting the manager in co-leading the digital customer relationship management (CRM) and membership operations for the Shanghai Disneyland Annual Pass program in order to drive sales conversion and achieve sales and revenue goals. This position reports directly to the Marketing manager. The specific day-to-day responsibilities of this position include developing strategies and plans for digital CRM and membership operations for the Annual Pass program, analyzing and delivering effective business and membership operations strategies based on consumer insights and data analysis, and collaborating across departments to drive the full chain of consumer marketing and operations for the Annual Pass program. This position will be a core member of the resort's digital customer data platform built for digital precision marketing.  Responsibilities:  Assist the line manager in establishing strategies and plans for digital customer relationship management and membership operations for the annual card program; Lead and plan various interactive marketing programs to maintain digital customer relationships for the Annual Card program; Work with a cross-departmental team to execute full-chain consumer marketing and operations based on annual card users, and lead follow-up performance tracking and analysis; Maintain all digital platforms related to the Annual Card program, including the Annual Card applet; Assist the line manager in the planning and execution of the Annual Card subscription program. Collaborate with consumer insights and other departments to understand consumer trends, identify new business opportunities and develop specific mechanisms and go-live plans for the Annual Card subscription program; Assist the line manager in the planning and execution of the annual card exclusive service center program, including building the service content and workflow of the annual card exclusive service center through close cooperation and communication with Operations and other related departments; Maintain a keen understanding of the latest consumer insights, stay ahead of consumer trends in marketing communications and identify new opportunities through collaboration with the consumer insight team; Communicate and collaborate effectively with various company departments and business partners, including Revenue Management and Analysis, Sales, E-business, Operations, Public Affairs and other departments and teams.  Basic Qualifications:  3-5 years of business, brand management or membership management and operations-related work experience with a 4-year bachelor's degree; Understanding of insights into the Chinese consumer and the ability to translate such insights into an effective marketing model; Good team player who can work closely with a team to solve complex and diverse business challenges; Good project management skills; ability to maintain a high-level of attention to detail at all times in a fast-paced work environment and to deliver quality work within the required time frame; Fluent in oral and written English and Chinese.  Preferred Qualifications:  Required Education  Preferred Education  Additional Information:  We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best – welcome and entertain millions of guests each year from across the country and around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require all newly-hired employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their onboarding dates.  postingchannel:wechat  Keyword: SHDRprofessional  828270BR

description: Job Purpose:  This front line telesales position within the Direct Sales team focused on achieving student number and revenue targets across the full portfolio of Study Group Higher Education programmes in the UK, Europe, Australia and USA. The successful candidate will be required to sell over the phone and deliver outstanding customer service to students across China.  Key Responsibilities: Manage a sales pipeline from initial enquiry through to arrival in Centre within the Direct Sales Process To provide sector leading education counselling that helps students choose a Study Group Higher Education pathway programme Effective and impactful management of student data using Salesforce CRM to drive increased sales conversion Manage workload to maintain 100% compliance with Key Performance Indicators and Service Level Agreements Geographical Scope China & NSSA (North Asia, South Asia & South East Asia)  Selection Criteria: Qualifications & Training: Higher Diploma to Bachelor’s Degree level (any discipline) Sufficient in written and spoken English Fluency in written and spoken Mandarin Desirable Requirements: Knowledge of overseas education systems (UK,AU,NZ,USA) 1-year-experience working in an overseas education agency as student recruiter/counselor or 2-years-experience in sales with a demonstrable track record of achieving targets Experience of identifying a customer’s business drivers and influencing their buying behaviour in line with a customer value proposition CRM knowledge and experience of pipeline management, preferably salesforce.com Attributes: Enthusiasm and confidence for selling and dealing with objections Target driven and results orientated with the ability to successfully deliver sales Outstanding customer-service orientated Ability to deal with a fast-paced working environment and adapt to change Brings positive attitude and energy to all things they do Relationship builder and excellent communicator both with students/parents and colleagues Ability to work independently as well as part of a team  Study Group is the leading provider of international education, driving success for our students and partners. We believe in a better world through education, and work with universities which are as motivated by driving student success and outcomes as we are. Voted as the 2017 and 2018 Global Pathway Provider of the year, our people are united with the shared ambition of providing a world-class UK education to talented students from across the globe. ORGANISATIONAL COMPLIANCE Study Group is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of its students, and expects all staff and volunteers to share the same dedication. Applicants will be required to undergo child protection screening appropriate to the role, including checks with past employers, an Enhanced Check from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) and overseas criminal records if appropriate. Study Group processes your information in line with data protection regulations. Please see our Privacy Policy

description: About Us  Gore is a materials science company focused on improving lives through discovery, product innovation and rewarding careers for our Associates.  About The Industry  Saving lives and improving the quality of life for patients is at the core of everything we do. This meaningful work gives purpose to our lives and inspires us to create solutions that make a difference in the lives of others. Learn more at gore.com/products/industries  About The Role  We are looking for a Field Sales Associate to join our Medical Product Division Sale Team in Beijing who will be accountable for meeting or exceeding the sales forecast in specific geographic area.  Responsibilities: Develop profitable sales opportunities, proactively make sales calls Develop new business to align with Gore business needs Ensure the KOL management, market data collection, etc., are effective, build, maintain and defend long-term customer relationships Ensure the cooperation with other product specialists are active and constructive, to achieve team goals and objectives Implement value pricing principle, be a value seller, be skilled in the use of premise-based forecasting techniques Implement Gore’s product strategy, understand the needs of the customer  Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in medical or medicine Proven sales background, preferably with a minimum of 5 years' experience in the medical devices sales area Will have worked in or able to demonstrate an understanding of the imperatives of a business environment Clinical background in interventional areas or sales experience to this environment Strong communication and interpersonal skills A high level of self-motivation and passion, ensuring the ability to work under minimal supervision Commercial acumen High integrity Ability to travel extensively up to 60% and attend weekend conferences as required  What We Offer  At Gore, we want our Associates to have fulfilling careers driven by curiosity and commitment. In return, we commit to our Associates by offering comprehensive, competitive rewards in the form of compensation, benefits, an Associate stock ownership-type plan, and opportunities for growth and development. Learn more at gore.com/careers  We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and inclusive work environment. In support of our values and continued success we are proud of Associates around the world who support an inclusive work environment, strive to reflect the diversity of the communities where we operate, and ensure all Associates and external partners are treated with fairness, dignity and respect.  Our Talent Acquisition Team welcomes your questions via email at AP_TA@wlgore.com  Job  Sales  Primary Location  Asia-Pacific-CN-BJ-Chaoyang  Travel%  60%  Shift  Day  Schedule  Full-time

Senior Sales Job Duties: 工作责任： (1) Achieves sales objectives & monthly GP target     实现销售目标和每月GP目标 (2) Identifies trends in sales, performance and cost effectiveness     确定销售，性能和成本效益的趋势 (3) Follow up inside / outside sales activities     跟踪内部/外部销售活动 (4) Capable to explore new business and customer connection.     能够探索新的业务和客户关系。 (5) Build up strong team work spirit & high productivity     建立强大的团队合作精神和高生产率 (6) Able to access staff capability & provide proper training     能够利用员工的能力并提供适当的培训 (7) Report sales activities timely     及时报告销售活动 Requirements: 要求： (1) Bachelor's degree of Electronic Engineering / Marketing or equivalent is a MUST.     电子工程/市场营销学士学位或同等学历是必须的。 (2)Knowledge of company product lines, active and passive electronic components distribution industry. 公司产品线知识，有源和无源电子元器件分销行业。 (3)2 to 5 years MINIMUM Priors Sales experience in selling electronic components to OEM and EMS factories (existing relationships is a MUST)  2至5年的最低优先级将电子部件销售给OEM和EMS工厂的销售经验（必须保持现有关系） (4)good leadership, analytical, interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills     良好的领导，分析，人际关系，沟通和谈判能力 (5)Good interpersonal and communication skills with fluent English     良好的人际沟通能力，英语流利 (6)Aggressive & task oriented.     积极进取且以任务为导向。 （7)Must be willing to work hard and be motivated by HIGH commission package    必须愿意努力工作并受到HIGH佣金方案的激励   公司福利待遇： 提供极具竞争力的提成制度；  享有国家法定节假日，社保及五险一金，五天8小时工作制；  季度奖金，生日Party,年度体检，周末双休，带薪年假，出差补贴，公司旅游；  Interest parties please send your resume (both in Chinese and English), brief introduction of your former companies nature of business, current & expected salary, contact telephone to email We offer good benefits including commission.

Job Function  Sales  Why SoftwareONE?  SoftwareONE is a leading global provider of end-to-end software and cloud technology solutions, headquartered in Switzerland. With an IP and technology-driven services portfolio, it enables companies to holistically develop and implement their commercial, technology and digital transformation strategies. This is achieved by modernizing applications and migrating critical workloads on public clouds, while simultaneously managing and optimizing the related software and cloud assets and licensing. SoftwareONE’s offerings are connected by PyraCloud, its proprietary digital platform, which provides customers with data-driven, actionable intelligence. With around 8,300 employees and sales and service delivery capabilities in 90 countries, SoftwareONE provides around 65,000 business customers with software and cloud solutions from over 7,500 publishers. SoftwareONE’s shares (SWON) are listed on SIX Swiss Exchange. For more information, please visit https://www.softwareone.com/e.  SoftwareONE Holding AG, Riedenmatt 4, CH-6370 Stans  The role Achieve and exceed revenue targets on a quarterly basis in a rapidly changing and highly competitive marketplace. Focused on achievement of sales strategies and targets through targeting key clients in the Large Enterprise commercial sector, identifying key decision makers and leverage opportunities to promote and sell products and services. Drive revenue generation and deliver significant value to clients through identifying opportunities within clients' organizations, and gaining an in-depth understanding of client needs Leads negotiations, coordinates complex decision-making process, and overcomes objections to capture new business opportunities Effectively build and optimize long term, sustainable and profitable relationships with clients Identify opportunities, present and sell products and services which are key for clients' success Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products Provides training to customers and partners regarding software publisher contracts and optimal usage of agreements post-mortem. Facilitates all communications, order processing, and reporting of customer and partner transactions in territory Evaluates software contract spend and utilization in a given organization. Must be able to optimize spending patterns, technology usage, and implementation strategies. High level of knowledge of internal organization workings, Information Technology trends. Develops strong knowledge of leading industry trends such as electronic commerce, spend management, and technology initiatives by developing proactive professional relationships with software publisher representatives in assigned territory. Be the field resource to customers and partners for leading industry volume license offerings from top publishers. Submits accurate and timely forecasts that are aligned with assigned sales quotas. Forecast sales revenue on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis. Provides leadership and licensing knowledge to customers, maintains appropriate presence in the software industry community. Generates opportunities for meetings with key decision makers to drive sales process What We Need To See From You Bachelor’s Degree from four year college or university preferred Minimum 7 years professional sales experience in high-tech or service-related industry with preferred successful software sales / software licensing experience Experience in Solution Selling with emphasis on strong account/territory management Experienced selling into large enterprise customers Demonstrated experience in selling enterprise software products/services/solutions is a strong advantage Proven track record of consistently exceeding corporate objectives and quotas Ability to build relationships and quickly develop trust with C-level executives Highly motivated and results oriented Strong presentation, communication, organization, multitasking, time management skills Solid problem solving and consultative skills required Ability to work in a fast-paced team sales environment with minimum supervision Travel 60% Proficient with Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Sales certification exams passed such as MCP, VSP, and SAM preferred. What You Should Really Know About Us.  Strip away everything. Strip away our brand, strip away our buildings, strip away our offices. What are we left with? Our people. This is what makes SoftwareONE successful.  Passionate people who live and breathe our values every day, who delight our customers, every day, and who go above and beyond, every day. Our culture is unique, and I believe that having the right people, and empowering them to succeed, is the absolute key to our success.  Patrick Winter, Founder.  What We Expect From Our Employees  Success at SoftwareONE is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you.  SoftwareONE employees are energized, agile and are laser focused on delivering world class Customer Satisfaction and results. Our leaders motivate and inspire their teams and provide a working environment that delivers incredible levels of Employee Satisfaction. We are Humble, have a very high degree of Integrity and are simply not interested in politics.  Our leaders operate with a high levels of Discipline but are able to work at Speed manage change in a global economy.  “SoftwareONE is an equal opportunity employer. With employee satisfaction as one of our core values, we are passionate about diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our employees. We want every employee to have the greatest experience of their career.”

description: 工作职责: Works in direct collaboration with the Product Management organization to identify, develop and launch market development programs. Gathers market intelligence, interfaces with external stakeholders and collaborates with UL Product Managers, Marketing, and Operational teams in engineering, sales, and field engineering services, with the intent of driving demand for UL’s products and services. Develops account strategies by working with product and sales for regional and vertical markets to support growth of new services and deepen penetration of core services. Focuses on organic growth, share gain, customer experience, product/service demand creation and profitability. Improves adoption rate for new and core recurring businesses, and tracks success metrics (i.e.: win ratio, revenue). Leads team to increase revenue driven by demand drivers (vs. customer push-through). Leads development of success metrics, demand driver target account establishment, and tracking methods to measure success with existing customers and new customers created by demand driver activity. Champions an engaged, inclusive and attractive work environment for UL employees with a winning culture. 任职条件:  Technical Capabilities Business and financial acumen Ability to drive growth through various business models (TIC and SaaS) Ability to effectively execute in a matrix organization Ability to drive demand in non-established (new) industries and services In-depth knowledge of TIC markets and stakeholders within Engineered Materials industries Industry savvy – can foresee the impact of industry trends on UL, product/service, and customers Demonstrated ability to establish new relationships with new accounts/influencers Experience with complex customer interactions, products, and services Experience selling into major accounts both deeper into the account and wider across functions within the account Track record of building strong teams Global experience (culture, market, business practices, etc.) Required Experience University Degree (Equivalent to Bachelor's degree) in Sales, Business, Engineering or a related discipline or related, equivalent experience. 5+ years of technical or business experience Wire & Cable and Plastics and Materials 5+ years of related experience or demonstrated competency in sales or stakeholder engagement Working with remote teams is highly valued.

Proactive sales of the whole product portfolio/solution offers /new products by both in-person and remote interaction to assigned accounts, ensure customer centric selling approach Develop business plans/rolling forecast for assigned account sites Analyze customer needs and present/demonstrate our products/solutions/value proposition as well as create quotations, negotiation and closing the deal with the customer Drive critical after-sales activities and facilitate things moving forward with acceptable time and quality Facilitate internal resources allocation to satisfy customer needs Build and maintain a strategic customer relationship management Propose strategic customer collaborations for potential accounts to support the long-term business growth Use CRM to share customer’s requests and status along the selling process Explore new business opportunities or cross-selling points via the interaction with customersQualifications & Skills: Graduate qualification in a discipline or equivalent experience in biopharma industry 5+ years sales experience in the biopharma industry is preferred Proactive, result driven and collaborative attitude Good negotiation skills Economical and financial know how Good analytical and presentation skills Good interpersonal and communication skills in dealing with people of different levels Flexible and willing to travel Project management Facilitation skill Fluent mandarin required, basic oral English , and solid English reading & writing Ability to travel up to 60% (Adjusted based on Sales region) 任职条件:  Same as above

Job Title:    Retail Operation Executive Reports to: Associate Retail Operation Manager - China Outlets Division:     Retail Operation Location:    Shanghai  MAIN JOB OBJECTIVE Retail Operations Executive will act as a focal point in retail store operation, new store opening and communication. This position will partner with cross-function teams in ensuring operational excellence and plays a critical role in efficient communication between head office and retail stores.  ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Store Operations: ·   Support the implementation of Retail Excellence. Continuously explore new areas of improvement. ·   Oversee all kinds of store expenses including store supplies, cleaning, interior maintenance and etc. Strive to control operational cost. ·   Manage staff uniform applications and keep track of the budget and inventory. ·   Monitor duty roster to make sure it is strictly in line with company’s guideline and to eliminate unnecessary OT. ·   Collect training needs, support in training sessions, and consolidate training results and feedback. ·   Being self-motivated as a team member and do considerable thinking to better support retail team by improving operation tools accordingly.  Data Analysis: ·   Regularly analyze store’s operational performance. Conduct analysis on store KPIs and individual targets’ setting. ·   Provide accurate ad-hoc reports. Routine update retail report for management team and stores. ·   Optimize existing reporting system through coordinating with other functions.  New Store Opening: ·   Set up new store opening work flow. ·   Plan specific new store opening schedule on the basis of business development plan in a timely manner. ·   Partner with cross-function teams to ensure appropriate assortment of store supplies being delivered on time. ·   Closely monitor new store opening status to ensure successful opening.  WORK EXPERIENCE  ·  Bachelor degree and above, preferred major in marketing, math, statistics ·  At least 1-2 years’ work experience in retail industry; luxury is a plus ·  Exhibit proficiency in computer programs used by the Company including: Word, Excel, PPT ·  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills ·  Hands on experience in operation, merchandising or visual and sales training ·  Ability to organize, prioritize and multitask effectively ·  Thrive in a fast paced on-time deliverable environment ·  Energetic, open, and forthcoming attitude ·  Work under pressure ·  Entrepreneurial; ability to drive forward with goals independently ·  Fluent in Mandarin and English

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. description: Company: FedEx Express APAC  Job Title: Account Executive - Associate/Account Executive/Account Executive - Senior  Job Requisition Number: RC396805  Locations:  QUANZHOU, Beijing China  Job Category: Sales/Solutions  Time Type: Full Time  Job Type: Fixed Term  Specialty Sales, Field Sales, GSP Management, Field/ Territory Sales, Supply Chain, Domestic/ Local Coverage for EG/ ER, Sales Calls, Customer Acquisition & Retention, Pre-Sales, Customer Proposal Creation, Pricing Proposal, Account Activation, Post-Sales, Competition Monitoring  What makes FedEx one of the most admired companies in the world? YOU!  As an Account Executive with FedEx, you will be part of a learning and agile organization that constantly explore innovative ways to add value. You will be part of a dynamic team that  respect and support each other, and work effectively together to achieve success and results that are consistent with our Purple promise to make every FedEx experience outstanding.  How will you contribute to the success of FedEx?  You will contribute to business success by identifying and developing customer relationships, as well as perform an accomplished level of sales responsibilities with the objectives of building the customer base, achieving revenue targets, and ensuring customer satisfaction. You will be eligible to receive related commission as sales targets are achieved.  Do you have what it takes? Bachelor’s degree or equivalent At least two (2) years of work experience in commercial or industrial sales A self-starter with excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills, including fluency in English and the local language (verbal and written) Strong influencing, persuasion, and networking skills What can you expect as a FedEx team member? Career Mobility and Development: When you join FedEx, you’re joining a team with possibilities that literally span the world—from opportunities for advancement and location transfer, to training and leadership programs. Attractive Compensation and Benefits Package: We want to keep our employees for a long time, so we offer competitive benefits, opportunities for flexible work arrangements, and programs to support well-being At FedEx Express, we believe that a connected world is a better world. We connect people and possibilities with our diverse portfolio of transportation, e-commerce, and business solutions. Today, our networks reach more than 220 countries and territories, linking more than 99 percent of the world’s GDP. FedEx is consistently recognized as one of the most admired brands in the world and one of the best places to work. Our people are the foundation of our success and the key to our future. At FedEx, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We leverage our diverse talents, experiences and ideas to be more responsive to customer challenges, spark creative solutions, and adapt to change. FedEx is an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer (minorities/females/disability/veterans) committed to a diverse workforce.  What can you expect as a FedEx team member? Career Mobility and Development: When you join FedEx, you’re joining a team with possibilities that literally span the world—from opportunities for advancement and location transfer, to training and leadership programs. Total Compensation and Benefits Package: We want to keep our employees for a long time, so we offer competitive benefits, opportunities for flexible work arrangements, and programs to support well-being.

description: 工作职责:  Job Description Summary  Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Jobs at this level operate with some autonomy but are covered by well-defined Commercial policies or review of end results. The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (typically annual volume, margin and compliance requirements). Responsible for medium-sized sales territories.  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  角色与职责 向指定客户销售时，新增客户通常很少，并且通常需要经过审查。包括单个业务组/P&L 中的关键客户 利用自身和他人的销售领域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群的深入知识，并运用分析思维和商业经验来执行政策/策略。 具有最佳实践知识以及了解自己的领域如何与他人融合；了解竞争以及在市场上与众不同的因素 运用判断力，并具有在设定参数之外提出不同解决方案的能力，以解决项目、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户的更复杂的日常问题。为决策制定信息优先级的能力。利用技术经验和分析思维。使用多种内部资源和自身团队之外有限的外部资源来帮助做出决定。 这些销售职位将主要由个人贡献者担任。 此级别的职位需要强大的人际交往能力。充当经验较少的同事的资源。可能会领导具有低风险和资源需求的小型项目。说明信息；培养使团队成员就领域的话题达成共识的技能。传达绩效期望，并可以处理敏感问题。  任职条件:  基本资格 该岗位要求在领域具有较丰富的工作经验。学力水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历） 所需特性 优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够影响他人并领导小型团队。领导中等范围和影响的计划。能够同时协调多个项目。有效的问题识别和解决技能。可靠的分析和组织能力。 Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Total Rewards Statement  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

regional business strategy, including innovated the inter-activities with customers Set up the team goal to meet business target Transfer the sales team to meet dynamic and customer-oriented market description: Job Duties and Responsibilities: Assisting Sales director with the structure for and timely completion of detailed documents which will involve writing large portions of the bids as well as organizing a team effort to produce and review each bid. Producing project plans for all tenders and large proposals to ensure all interested parties (internal and external partners) are aware of their responsibilities and the timescales.   Ensure that completed documents are produced and delivered on time, by tracking progress, identifying, and resolving outstanding actions/ issues.   Proof reading, correcting, and formatting documents.  Reporting sales director on overall bid progress and liaising with Operations to keep an up-to-date record of the stages of each tender and proposal submitted.  Support and work in conjunction with other members of the Bid Support team. Experience in insurance, automobile, retail, healthcare & education industry is preferred.  Standard MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Vision).  Experience of desktop publishing applications and Microsoft. Good English in reading and writing; confident and articulate in all communications, i.e. face-to-face, telephone and written.  Ability to cope with varying workloads and out-of-hours demands.  Open-minded, Good communication.

Valid driver’s license with a clean driving history and proficient driving skills. 主要职责 保证最佳客户体验：接待所有进店客人，回答问题，热情地为客户和特斯拉粉丝介绍电动汽车的优点,普及电动车知识。 通过良好的沟通，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态，明确特斯拉的发展前景并鼓励顾客试驾，并通过良好的试驾体验使潜在客户向亲朋好友宣传特斯拉。 收集潜在客户，参加市场活动，探索客户购买需求、激发客户需求，配合销售主管完成门店的销售目标。 对现有特斯拉车主提供高质量客户服务。 沟通最新公司讯息，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态。 认真学习了解公司及产品的相关知识，及时了解最新行业发展和最佳实践。 建立良好的客户关系，并在试驾过程中提供完美的客户体验使潜在客户向亲朋好友传递良好特斯拉口碑。 通过公司安排的内部测试，包括但不限于课程培训及测试、驾驶技术测试、店内测试、角色扮演、能力认证、试用期评估等，以达到正式员工的标准和要求。 和外部客户、外部人员，保持清晰、准确、职业、礼貌的沟通, 和内部同事保持良好的沟通和团队协作（包括同部门、跨部门；同门店、跨门店；同地区、跨地区之间）。 保持库存充足和整洁（如适用）。 员工在试用期期间发生的任何职位变更，包括并不限于调岗、晋升等，均不可视为通过试用期，员工需要通过试用期评估。 其他职责：根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作。 职位要求 应届毕业生或1到2年零售、行业销售、以及大客户销售经验或服务经验； 对企业文化高度认可。 出色的沟通能力和客户服务意识。 良好的自我管理能力及自我学习能力，积极热情地参与改变个人交通行业的变革。 深刻理解并传递业务问题和技术概念。 优秀的团队意识，是可靠的团队成员。 能够接受零售业的工作时间，需要晚上和周末工作；有销售经验优先。 持有有效中国驾照，熟练驾驶，且无不良行驶记录。

jobTitle: BEV Sales Ops Digital Product Lead
description: 福特中国电动车事业部  福特中国电动车事业部是基于福特全球新能源战略及福特中国“电气化、智能化”战略，而专门建立的全新业务部门。  依托位于南京的福特汽车研发中心，福特中国电动车事业部将充分利用福特的全球资源和本土技术优势，以更加灵活的业务模式，推出面向中国市场的电动车产品以及智能驾驶体验，并打造以用户为中心的销售与客户服务体验。  团队鼓励创新，通过吸收多元背景人才，为福特电动车发展提供创新思维。除汽车与电动车领域的专业人才外，还吸引了众多来自快消、科技、互联网领域的优秀人才加入。  岗位职责 协同电动车销售部门，分析业务需求转换为数字产品需求和功能设计，覆盖端到端用户车辆销售、OTD流程、金融、销售用户沟通、门店活动等销售领域业务。 通过竞品分析、产品需求文档、用户体验调研等过程设计面向体验的销售数字化产品。 对内部用户及外部门店合作商进行数字产品的培训。 负责数字产品的持续运营，运营流程的制定与执行快速迭代。 通过数字化技术驱动直销模式下销售运营管理的创新。 跨部门协同，与业务、技术及设计团队共同构建项目管理规范，按时交付数字产品与服务。 基本要求 本科以上5年以上工作经验，3年以上数字化产品项目管理交付经验。 熟悉敏捷项目交付过程。 熟悉销售运营领域流程。 熟练使用原型设计，项目管理等工具软件。 熟练英语沟通与写作。 优先条件 拥有互联网产品、企业微信平台交付经验优先。 熟悉整车销售业务优先。

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

jobTitle: Business Development Manager 业务拓展经理

Job Purpose and Impact  The Commercial Analyst will support the Commercial Leaders to lead our global and regional projects and initiatives on commercial excellence capabilities, including rolling out Cargill’s Commercial Excellence(CE) program on strategic pricing, sales enablement, route to market for various enterprises in line with their “Go-To-Market “ strategies. We seek a professional who will collaborate with senior team members to analyze and translate insight into strategies and tactics and be a key resource on commercial excellence initiatives .  Key Accountabilities Provide analytics support to deliver commercial excellence projects to internal/external business clients by supporting the roadmap and the implementation timeline. Help implement core processes for diagnostics, hypothesis development & testing, development of business recommendations and implementation of core capabilities Build visual analytics dashboards in Tableau/Power BI to support the commercial excellence initiatives Analyze data and survey results to contribute to making the CE Center of Excellence team truly cross functional, with solid and unchallengeable analysis Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff. Qualifications  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience Minimum of two years of related work experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English Demonstrated ability to problem solve and use analytical thinking Strong proficiency across Microsoft Office products (PowerPoint, Teams, Excel…etc). Demonstrated ability to work effectively and confidentially with various levels of organization and potentially customers Preferred Qualifications MBA preferred Minimum 2-4 years’ experience in one of the following: Sales, Commercial Management, FP&A, Trading, Business Development, Demand Planning, Modeling Ability to travel regionally post pandemic – 20-30% Demonstrated strong analytical capabilities –Ability to blend data using Alteryx or similar tools and visualize and analyze it using tools like Tableau/Power BI Commercial mindset, and strong business acumen Ability to quickly understand system architecture Ability to translate business need to technical/functional design for Business Intelligence Language requirements: Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. (Other language could be plus but not required)
industries: Chemicals, Food & Beverages, and Food Production

jobTitle: Inside Sales Manager Ports & Maritime Far East
description: Cavotec is a leading cleantech company that designs and delivers connection and electrification solutions to enable the decarbonization of ports and industrial applications. Backed by more than 40 years of experience, our systems ensure safe, efficient and sustainable operations for a wide variety of customers and applications worldwide.   Please check out our latest video on the following link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tsuKXpMOLwE  Summary  Achieves the order intake target for spare parts and standard products Proactively expands the customer base by targeting spare parts and standard product sales opportunities to existing and new accounts Ensures high level of customer service is maintained at all times  Main tasks & key responsibilities  Regularly contact current, former and prospective customers to generate sales (e.g. Service, spare parts, standard products etc…) against the order intake target Identify prospective customers through market evaluations, business intelligence tools (e.g. Bid Prime) and other lead generation tools including cold calling Follow up on all sales leads from existing clients, RFQs and RFPs, develops a compliant offer Provides pricing and lead time of spare parts and standard products to the Sales Support Manager for project tender submission preparation Actively promote our portfolio (e.g. Service, spare parts, standard products etc…). Prefer have experience working with Automotive or Internet industry Market Good inter-personal, verbal, and written communication skills Strong business development and planning skills, be able to multi-task, be detail-oriented Strong analytical and problem solving skills Innovative leader with a decisive style and passionate attentiveness to current and future trends Ability to impart strategic selling concepts and techniques to others Able to interact with different levels of management and people with different personality styles Typically requires a minimum of 8+ years of related experience Full understanding of specialization area plus working knowledge of multiple related areas Represents the organization on business unit and/or company-wide projects Frequently networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise

University degreeHutner personality with strong business communication skills  What We Offer  50/50 base and commission split  Competitive base rate per year with uncapped commission  13th salary as part of annual compensation  Convenient office location in the city center  iDeals Wellness Package: for medical insurance and health-related activities  Mental Health Support PackagePaid vacation of 4 weeks, sick days, days off, and paid national holidays  Paid family leave of up to 4 weeks  Paid pregnancy disability leave of up to 5 months  Paid Sabbatical LeaveUnlimited learning and development opportunities  Professional and self-development books and subscription services compensation  Sponsorship of participation in inspiration events, conferences, meetups  Obtain company’s support if you decide to become a speaker or writer  Reimbursement of participation in sport competitions  International team-building activities  Support with organization workplace at home  Provided budget for home-office setup  Reimbursement of coworking space expensesInternal growth policies  Regular performance and salary reviews Generous internal referral program  iDeals Suprise Boxes from the People Experience  Excellence, Care, Trust, Collaboration, and Commitment are core values to the iDeals team  Since 2008, iDeals has won the trust of half a million business users. description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Position Summary  Provides technical direction and support to customers on operation and maintenance of company products via email or telephone. Serves as customer contact on technical and service-related problems via email or telephone. Demonstrates uses and advantages of products. Works closely with sales and marketing, QA/QC, research and development to address customer concerns, determine corrective action and customer follow-up. May be responsible for a designated region.  All About You  Responsibilities: Professionally, efficiently and conclusively triage, troubleshoot and resolve customer’s technical questions. Assist customers with the design and interpretation of gene expression, genotyping and “Next-Generation” sequencing experiments Provide technical guidance regarding the choice and use of the appropriate Illumina product to existing and prospective customers Assist customers with the selection of SNPs for custom genotyping projects by utilizing public and private sources and proprietary software applications Triage and dispatch issues requiring field support to Illumina Engineers and Applications Scientists Log and manage customer issues using Illumina’s issue-tracking database Conduct web based product trainings and application seminars for Illumina customers All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Requirements Hands-on laboratory experience using, developing or troubleshooting a wide range of molecular biology protocols such as PCR, Next Generation Sequencing, gene expression analysis, genotyping, and related procedures Teaching experience desirable Excellent analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills required Outstanding written and verbal communication and training skills a MUST Experience working in any service role desired Previous experience in email and telephone support channels would be held in high regard. Previous experience in supervisory roles of technical support teams would be held in high regard. Education Ph.D./ M.S or B.S. plus 2 years relevant lab experience in molecular biology, genetics, bioinformatics or related field 岗位概述：  通过电子邮件或电话，为客户提供公司产品操作和维护方面的技术指导和支持。作为联系人，与客户通过电子邮件或电话解决技术和服务相关问题。演示介绍产品的使用和优势。与销售和营销、质量保证/质量控制、研究和开发等部门密切合作，解决客户疑虑，确定纠正措施和客户跟进。可能负责一个指定区域。  候选人要求  岗位职责： 专业高效确切地分类、查明并解决客户的技术问题。 在设计和解释基因表达、基因分型和“新一代”测序试验方面，为客户提供协助。 向现有客户和潜在客户提供有关选择和使用适当宜曼达产品的技术指导。 协助客户，通过利用公共及专有资料来源和专用软件程序，为定制的基因分型项目选择SNP。 将需要现场支持的问题进行分类，并派发给宜曼达工程师和应用科学家。 使用宜曼达的问题追踪数据库，记录并管理客户问题。 为宜曼达客户开展基于网络的产品培训和应用研讨会。 以上所列的任务和职责是本岗位的基本职能；工作开展中可能需要合理完成额外的任务和职责。  岗位要求： 具有实验室工作的实际经验，能够使用和建立多种分子生物实验方法，或对其进行查错，比如PCR、新一代测序技术、基因表达分析、基因分型以及相关程序； 具有教学经验者优先考虑； 需要具有卓越的分析能力、问题解决能力和人际关系技巧； 必须具有杰出的书面和口头交流及培训技能； 具有服务岗位工作经验者优先考虑； 具有电子邮件和电话支持渠道工作经验者相关度更高； 曾担任技术支持团队主管工作者相关度更高。 教育背景： 分子生物学、遗传学、生物信息学或相关领域专业，博士/硕士或本科学历，外加2年相关实验室工作经验。

description: Join Baker Hughes Drill Bit Team  We are the leader in well construction and production, our innovative physical and digital solutions improve efficiency, production and maximize reservoir value. description: We are open for this position to be based in Beijing or Bangkok (relocation support provided).  Curious about what it’s like to work at the world’s number 1 discovery platform as a Taboola News Account Manager? We’re glad you asked!  What is the key purpose of a Taboola News Account Manager?   The Taboola News team works directly with Original Equipment Manufacturers and Mobile Carriers globally to deliver a high quality, high engagement content experience on mobile devices. Taboola’s personalised content recommendations now come packaged with devices from Huawei, ZTE, Vivo, Samsung, Tracfone, America Móvil and many more. The Taboola News Account Manager will be based in Bangkok and this role requires spending about 50% of your time in China, mostly in Shenzhen, in order to manage relationships with OEMs in the region. There are additional travelling needs, as our customers are global. This is an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of one of Taboola’s most exciting and innovative products  What skills and qualifications do I need?  For this role it is essential that you:  Speak, read and write Mandarin at native level and are also fluent in English. Have a proven track record in a client facing account management role; ability to build strong relationships with a diverse set of internal and external constituencies including senior level executives, legal, technical, finance, sales and marketing. Are comfortable handling technical conversations with the ability to explain technical solutions, establish goals and develop opportunities with tech and non-tech teams. Possess good analytical skills - providing ongoing reporting, analysis of data and ability to identify trends and improve the key metrics, including work with Product Management on A/B Testing and optimization. Have a track record of closing business and driving long and complex sales cycles. Are highly motivated, proactive, dedicated, resourceful and creative to ensure your clients receive world class support and leadership. Have negotiation experience working with customers to jointly define the deliverables, deadlines and expectations Position based in Bangkok. Willing to travel.   Nice to haves include:  Prior experience managing strategic partnerships with OEMs  What will I be doing on a day-to day today basis?  As a Taboola News Account Manager, you will:  Manage and grow relationships with OEMs and strategic partners in China, specifically in Shenzhen and the surrounding regions. Monitor and analyse metrics and proactively take steps to improve results and determine optimisation paths on the current business. Conduct ongoing in-person meetings with key people at the OEMs as well as prepare and conduct quarterly business reviews. Throughout the partnership, provide strategic consultation to our partners, update on new product capabilities and find new areas for growth. Serve as a key point of communication between Taboola’s R&D, product and product enablement teams (based in Israel), so that we can build the right products for our partners. Fully comprehend Taboola, the technology, revenue ecosystem and client needs/requirements in order to intelligently identify new opportunities.  Why Taboola? If you ask our employees what they love about Taboola they will tell you that here they are able to discover their best professional self, explore where they can grow to, and learn from and together with smart and talented people. We work with some of the biggest names in the business. Our clients include Business Insider, NBC, Wells Fargo, Adidas, and more.
industries: Internet, Online Media, and Marketing and Advertising

Provide training course to external key accounts if needed to bring value to customer Keeps informed of new training method and techniques of competitors.  Minimum Qualification (education, experience and/or training, required certifications): Bachelor degree (and above) in Animal Science/Medicine or other relevant majors from reputable university. Excellent skills in communication and organization. Team player able to work in and with a proactive team. Responsibilities Manage the customer’s Tesla experience in the most positive way. Welcome all walk in guests, answer questions and enthusiastically educate all customers and fans about the benefits of going electric, generally publicize going electric knowledge. Responsible for collecting qualified customer information, assist market events, explore customer needs, stimulate customer demand, cooperate with Owner Advisor to meet store’s sales target. Provide high quality service to existing Tesla owner community. Help Tesla enthusiasts and future owners stay up to speed with Tesla by promoting company’s updated news. Employee must learn about the company and products related knowledge, keep up with industry trends and best practices Develop amazing customer relationships on the sales floor and during test-drive experiences to ultimately create a brand experience customers will recommend to their friends. Competency certification, Probation Review, otherwise he or she will not be able to meet the full time employee’s requirement. Communicate with the external clients and partners in a professional way, and also ensure effective communication and great cooperation with internal colleagues (Among same and different function/ store/region). Keep inventory full and neat (if applicable). Other Responsibilities: Perform other related duties as assigned, based on the business need. Requirements Fresh graduate or 1-2 years’ work experience in retail, industry and key account sales with proven track record to meet or exceed targets and goals. Highly appreciate Company culture and value. Strong communication and customer service experience required. Exceptional self-management and self-learning ability. Positive, enthusiastic and passionate about the changes in the personal transportation industry. Ability to understand and convey business issues and technical concepts. Strong sense of team mentality and reliability. Ability to work evenings and weekends in retail environment. Retail, industry and key account sales experience preferred. During the probationary period, including not limited to transfer, promotion, etc., are not considered to pass the probationary period and the employee is required to pass the probationary period. Valid driver’s license with a clean driving history and proficient driving skills. 主要职责 保证最佳客户体验：接待所有进店客人，回答问题，热情地为客户和特斯拉粉丝介绍电动汽车的优点,普及电动车知识。 通过良好的沟通，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态，明确特斯拉的发展前景并鼓励顾客试驾，并通过良好的试驾体验使潜在客户向亲朋好友宣传特斯拉。 收集潜在客户，参加市场活动，探索客户购买需求、激发客户需求，配合销售主管完成门店的销售目标。 对现有特斯拉车主提供高质量客户服务。 沟通最新公司讯息，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态。 认真学习了解公司及产品的相关知识，及时了解最新行业发展和最佳实践。 建立良好的客户关系，并在试驾过程中提供完美的客户体验使潜在客户向亲朋好友传递良好特斯拉口碑。 通过公司安排的内部测试，包括但不限于课程培训及测试、驾驶技术测试、店内测试、角色扮演、能力认证、试用期评估等，以达到正式员工的标准和要求。 和外部客户、外部人员，保持清晰、准确、职业、礼貌的沟通, 和内部同事保持良好的沟通和团队协作（包括同部门、跨部门；同门店、跨门店；同地区、跨地区之间）。 保持库存充足和整洁（如适用）。 员工在试用期期间发生的任何职位变更，包括并不限于调岗、晋升等，均不可视为通过试用期，员工需要通过试用期评估。 其他职责：根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作。 职位要求 应届毕业生或1到2年零售、行业销售、以及大客户销售经验或服务经验； 对企业文化高度认可。 出色的沟通能力和客户服务意识。 良好的自我管理能力及自我学习能力，积极热情地参与改变个人交通行业的变革。 深刻理解并传递业务问题和技术概念。 优秀的团队意识，是可靠的团队成员。 能够接受零售业的工作时间，需要晚上和周末工作；有销售经验优先。 持有有效中国驾照，熟练驾驶，且无不良行驶记录。

Job Description  Associate Director - Sales Effective  About This Job  The role will be responsible for leadership & management of Analytics for key leading FMCG MNCs in China and will be responsible for maintaining the stable relationship and ensuring the sustainable growth. Will lead the team for delivery of high quality Analytic services that deliver strong client return on investment and deliver against high growth revenue targets and drive new business development opportunities.  Responsibilities  Strategic Client Consulting & Management Monitor and anticipate market trends and activities that will impact Clients business and develop strategies that will contribute to profitable business growth and sustainable competitive advantage. Leadership & responsibility of expanding AC scope of influence within clients across a wider range of AC solutions and with greater depth across the client organization. Leverage best demonstrated practices from other markets and bring them into the local client context Foster relationships with key contacts of clients.  Financial Management Develop business and category engagement plans for clients to contribute to total revenue commitments for AC team. Monitor the actual financial performance against budget / forecast and work with team leader to ensure the implementation of appropriate actions that will lead to the achievement of AC financial objectives.  People Management Responsible for management and leadership of account teams. Establish high standards of performance and hold AC associates firmly accountable for meeting those standards. Act as coach, guide and mentor to associates by providing support, recognition and feedback to assist associates towards achieving the desired performance expectations and standards  About You  Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You find potential in percentages. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You’re known for your impeccable organization. Connecting with clients matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through data for a new angle. You can identify the narratives behind numbers, and you’re always looking for what’s next.  Qualifications Ideally 8-12 years FMCG, Market Research, Retail experience with previously demonstrated success within this environment. Deep understanding of FMCG market, HPC and beverage market is an advantage. Experience working with and successfully developing strategic partner relationships & consultative skills. Strong record of successfully working with leading company which requires deep understanding of client business operation Strong record on business development at specific industry Demonstrated success in a demanding & fast pace business environment. Good communication skills Post graduate degree an advantage. High cognitive ability & numeracy capability Good knowledge of Microsoft Office applications Knowledge with Linux, VBA, SQL, SPSS, SAS would be a plus Highly developed and advanced analytical skills Understanding of statistical modelling Effective presentation & writing skills (English and Chinese) Ability to provide insights through integration & analysis across multiple data sources Very strong problem-solver; can easily articulate, decompose and attack most problems Demonstrates drive, courage, determination and energy  ABOUT NielsenIQ  NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.  NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics,
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Consumer Goods

description: Key Resonsibilities: ● Building and executing joint agreed business plans with partners or merchants to drive mutual growth and success. ● Working closely with internal analysts, delivery and marketing teams to drive enablement and lead generation activities. ● Identifying new partnerships or business opportunities, pitch services and close deals ● Building great relationships both on an executive, as well as on an individual level. ● Playing an important role to the next level  Requirements: ● An ambitious person with significant drive to build up new business ● An entrepreneurial individual with a “can-do” mindset ● Courageous - Willing to speak up, make decisions, take calculated risks ● A Detailed Thinker - Passionate and open-minded while meticulous about data and details ● Results-oriented - Able to see beyond their own problem space and dependencies to find solutions ● A challenger- Never misses an opportunity to disrupt the industry and embraces change ● Customer obsessed - Our customers are at the heart of everything we do; their success is our key mission  You should have: ● 5+ years of relevant sales, partner or business development experience within E-commerce or digital marketing & payments ● Bachelor's degree in business or other related fields. ● Great presentation and communications skills. ● Fluency in written English and Chinese

Get a job in the “Yellow Crane City”! Vidoukin is currently looking for an After-Sales Market Quality Engineer in Wuhan.  Job Requirements: ·        Bachelor degree or above. ·        More than 5 years of work experience. ·        Good communication in spoken English is required.  Job Responsibilities: ·        Acting as a window responsible for the receipt of information on market conditions and major cases in the factory that require market disposal. ·        As a formal window, output analysis report conclusions and related instructions to external departments (A&S and related responsible units) (for example: potential issues of warranty data feedback, requiring A&S to send TR and other related requirements during follow-up warranty). ·        Responsible for the information collection, sorting, distribution and daily operation and maintenance of QRQC in the market (unary management table, Q-Fast management table). ·        Responsible for the management and result output of relevant indicators of QRQC operation in the market. ·        -Responsible for regularly outputting analytical conclusions and opinions on the division of warranty appraisal and recovery ratio to the warranty team and the recovery team.  If you would like to apply or get more information, please contact Elsa at elsa@vidoukin.com   #jobs #careers #hr #hiring #recruitment #humanresources #automotvie #automotiveindustry #engineer #engineering #quality

We are looking for an innovative, strategic, results-oriented marketer who will be responsible for our military and ventilator business. To provide leadership and support for the military and ventilator business, by working closely with our business partners, and supporting the country teams and to execute business development and sales plans in the Military and Ventilator segment within Asia Pacific region  This role requires a dynamic, well-rounded marketer with a deep understanding of doing business with regards to the military / government business. In this role, you will work closely with sales to align on business objectives to drive regional marketing strategies, execution and measurement of go-to-market activities. This includes organizing product training, Business Partner Meetings and all ad-hoc support as required.  Job Summary  Asahi Kasei Group (AK), a diversified company that has an expanding global healthcare business, has created an initiative to accelerate the development of its businesses through additional, focused equity investing. This newly created position will serve as a key contributor to implement this initiative. This position will lead strategic equity investing to strengthen existing and new businesses of Asahi Kasei Pharma (AKP). This position will report to a Senior Executive Officer of Asahi Kasei Pharma, based in Tokyo, Japan. This position will also work closely with the Business Development efforts of the other parts of Asahi Kasei Healthcare, as well as with the Corporate R&D’s Corporate Venture Capital (CVC) group.  Essential Functions Develop and maintain business connection with procurement units in military and government outfits in the region Build partnerships with KOLs within the medical military and government field in the region Responsible for achieving consistent, growth in sales revenues through positive planning, deployment, coaching and management of military and ventilator business partners. Building a high-performance business partner organization to effectively achieve business objectives and to maximize revenue opportunities and optimize profits. Implement product and clinical activities according to regional strategy and marketing policy as laid out by global and international military and government teams Execute promotional plans and support the selling of the products in the designated territory Meet with each business partners frequently to assist in training, reviews, and major presentations and sales calls at military and government sites Position will focus for China mainly, but also supporting North Asia Skill Requirements Minimum 10 years in the medical healthcare industry or military / government procurement on capital equipment especially with regards to China. Formal military leadership training with medical procurement experience will be added advantage Has successfully managed business partners or demonstrated leadership in military sales Education & Knowledge Requirements Tertiary Qualifications - preferably in a business/medical/science field. Previous working experience in military procurement or military supplies or distribution Sales, marketing, and distribution experience in medical equipment will be added advantage Willing to be trained extensively in the event that this experience is lacking Excellent communication skills, including strong presentation skills Ability to work independently Problem solving skills with strong resilience Strong team player, proven ability in leading and working effectively cross functionally Display positive, entrepreneurial spirit and is trustworthy and accountable Flexible and adaptable to changing environment and needs Other Duties:  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities will be reviewed periodically as duties and responsibilities change with business necessity. Essential and marginal job functions are subject to modification.  ZOLL Medical Corporation appreciates and values diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Medical Devices, and Hospital & Health Care
