Job Title： Hitachi Vantara – Inside Sales Representative (内部/电话销售) Location: Beijing (北京)  What You'll Do 工作范围： You will build direct relationships with customers while working with channel partners to maximize new sales opportunities and renewals within your territory. 您将通过电话和客户及渠道合作伙伴直接建立联系，在您负责的领域内最大限度的开发新销售机会和拓展现有用户新需求。 You will manage all aspects of the full sales cycle to help customers reach their business goals. 您将负责并管理Hitachi Vantara解决方案的销售全流程，帮助客户实现其商业目标。 • You will position and sell the entire Digital Infrastructure portfolio. 您将通过电话的方式销售公司Digital Infrastructure（数字化基础架构）解决方案。 • You will seek to understand our customers’ business challenges and advise on the value derived from our solutions to address their pains. 您将通过电话的方式了解我们客户面临的业务挑战或者需求，并根据公司现有的解决方案给客户提供有价值的建议，帮助客户解决他们的业务挑战/困难。 • You will become a trusted advisor to help our customers with their immediate needs, as well as their long term goals. 成为客户信赖的顾问，满足他们目前的业务需求并帮助他们实现长期目标。 • You will accurately forecast your monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue streams; driving growth in your account base. 准确预测您的每月，季度和年度销售收益， 推动客户增加采购量。 • You will be responsible for driving new business, as well as fostering your account base. 开发更多的新客户，扩充您负责的区域内的客户资源。  Who You Are您是谁： • Goal-oriented and motivated by performance rewards 目标导向，以绩效奖励为动力 • Seek to achieve and exceed annual sales goals 努力实现并超过年度销售目标 • A strong collaborator with internal and external stakeholders 强有力的内部和外部合作者  Skills and Qualifications技能和任职资格： • 3+ years of B2B selling experience in a similar or adjacent industry 3 年以上B2B销售经验在IT行业或者相近行业优先考虑 • Experience owning the full sales cycle (prospecting, validating, negotiating, and closing the sale). 具备全流程销售经验背景 • Highly motivated with a “hunter spirit” to develop new opportunities and grow business 具有开拓者精神，积极开发新的商业机会并实现业务增长 • Demonstrate strong sales achievement (i.e., consistent achievement at or above quota, or a history YoY growth in your target market) 良好的销售业绩 • Passionate about sales and building positive relationships 拥有销售热情并积极拓展客户关系 • Possess strong business acumen and can articulate the value of a solution to address customers’ current and future needs 敏感的商业嗅觉， 清晰阐述Hitachi Vantara解决方案得价值，以解决客户当前或者未来得商业需求 • Engage in active listening to identify customers’ pain and help them derive the value and potential impact of a timely solution 积极倾听客户的痛点并及时给客户提供有价值的潜在解决方案 • Phenomenal communication/presentation skills 较强的沟通/表达能力 • Thrive in a team environment and enjoy sharing ideas and best practices 融入团队，愿意分享知识和最佳实践 • Experience using digital selling tools such as Salesforce and TechTarget 使用过Salesforce and TechTarget 系统优先考虑

jobTitle: Portfolio Strategy Lead, Marketing: Promo Services & Field force
description: Main Job Purpose  ABOUT PROCUREMENT  Part of the Supply Chain family, Procurement is responsible for over 30B Euro of material and services spend globally with more than 60,000 suppliers, over half of them in MBS. Getting the right services and materials, sustainably sourced and ensuring responsible procurement is critical to ensuring our brands with purpose grow. Our teams work closely with the business to understand stakeholders needs, bring innovation to meet changing consumer, employees and customer’s needs, and drive financial value for Unilever through competitive buying. We’re at the forefront of digital procurement, bringing new tools and analytics to drive data-based decisions.  Our strategy is ‘Procurement with Purpose’ and focuses on buying responsibly, buying better, and growing together with partners around the world. Our ambition is based on three key drivers: being Purpose-Led, Value-Driven, and Future-Fit.  About Mbs  MBS, Unilever’s Marketing and Business Services Procurement team, is responsible for Unilever’s sourcing and supplier strategy and execution for all third party spend across Marketing, Business Services, and IT, supporting the business requirements of Brands, Divisions, Markets, and functions to drive 4G growth through strategic supplier management, cost and value management, sustainability, and innovation, aligned with Unilever’s Compass. The team manages an annual spend of ~9B Euro with a supplier base of about 40,000. Within MBS, the Portfolio Strategy Lead, is responsible for the Promo Services (like Events &Activations, Field Force, Sampling, Couponing) & especially to drive a global Field force portfolio.  The Portfolio Strategy Lead, Promo Services & Field Force Globally will work together with Brand teams, CD, CMI and other functions to increase effectiveness of the portfolio by streamlining accountabilities, building capabilities, digital path, and leveraging knowledge, relationships, and business strategies across markets.  The portfolio lead needs to focus on increase efficiency by driving scale where it makes sense, decreasing fragmentation, prioritizing higher impact areas, leveraging technology, sustainability, and data, to unlock 4G growth for Unilever in this area. The lead needs to explore business requirements to set up the right operating frameworks. Create seamless, catalogue buying experience for the Stakeholders where it’s relevant.  The role will foster and build a culture of collaboration and agility to enable an efficient project roll-out. It will ensure close alignment in strategy with Brand, CD, CMI, Finance functions, and MBS directors, Market Procurement Directors by defining and utilizing a robust support network for the whole team and providing clarity on the ways of works and roles and responsibilities  Key Accountabilities Understand the business needs related to the portfolio, and bring deep expertise and insights across the value chain and supply base to translate the business requirements into effective future-fit procurement strategies Connect strategy & execution aligned to Unilever Compass, Global CD and market goals and priorities, aligned with Procurement with Purpose and OneMBS strategies Together with Brand, Finance, CD & CMI functions deliver transformational sourcing strategies, execution models, and supplier relationships that help drive 4G growth in accordance with our plans, including a focus on Responsible Sourcing strategies. Deliver against financial targets and other KPIs (including value delivery) as per business plan objectives, accountable for delivery of results from all markets, PMUs, Divisions and functions globally Implement Unilever Partner with Purpose strategy, balancing a portfolio of global and local suppliers Liaise with internal and external stakeholders, to support business, market, MBS and Procurement priorities and enable rapid alignment and deployment Lead rigorous execution of the priorities and transformation initiatives across the portfolio, create development opportunities. Ensure Portfolio fundamentals (i.e.data consistency, data insights, recurring stakeholder communications, contracts, etc.) are all put in place Future proof the portfolio by driving digital approaches, while building technology enablers to help manage selected portfolio and scope, while driving impactful sustainability agenda. Support internal performance management and reporting including creation and stewardship of relevant key performance indicators Experience Required  Qualification/experience 10+ years of procurement experience, including proven and deep experience in Promo Sevices, including Field force and events and activations portfolios or other relevant marketing procurement portfolio’s Strategic sourcing, portfolio strategy expertise, with experience in managing complex portfolio/category, at global or multi-regional level Expert in negotiation and contracting Understanding of supply market, value chain, and FMCG knowledge. Knowledge of relevant portfolios and supply markets a strong plus. Experience in strategic supplier relationship management Experience on project management Demonstrated and proven leadership capabilities Experience in shaping and leading transformational business process reengineering, with experience driving Change Management initiatives. Knowledge of and passion for sustainability, including social sustainability General Skills & Competencies Ability to work under pressure and in a complex global environment balancing a broad spectrum of stakeholder requirements Comfortable working in conditions of ambiguity and leading through change Able to create and drive adoption and execution of a shared vision and strategy for change. Ability to interact with senior stakeholders cross effectively and efficiently functionally to understand their needs and deliver effective balanced solutions Delivers change whilst managing the interface between “day to day” and improvement projects. Passion for continuous improvement Strong verbal and written communication skills, including creation and delivery of effective presentations High financial and business acumen Strong in selling ideas and concepts Inspiring, motivational, and accountable people leader, able to lead remote and cross-cultural teams and connect people and ideas Strong in project and time management for complex projects Stakeholder management and people skills Passion and practical creativity Tenacious and resilient in the pursuit of challenging goals Travel  International travel might be required. Not projected to require more than 20% on average (may vary based on location)  Contacts  Internal:  Procurement MBS VP and MBS LT Sourcing teams Supplier Operations in UniOps Procurement Strategy and Insights Procurement Partnership and Purpose team Business Partners Customer Development CMI Brand Divisions Finance Legal External External Partners Suppliers Advisors and benchmarking organization Reporting Channel  Reporting into Global Procurement Director Marketing Promo & Commerce  Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.
industries: Consumer Goods, Food Production, and Food & Beverages

You are responsible for different reportings and support IT projects together with the business teams. That sounds exciting to you? Then take the opportunity and join our international team!  YOUR MISSION Analyze, review and support the development of business processes with the focus on reporting together with the Business Teams and reporting specialists Formulating and developing new and/or improve existing global business reporting solutions Leads or supports IT projects in close cooperation with the business teams Ensure business requirements are met and aligned with strategy Improve connection between global functions representatives / system owners and IT-specialists within Global-IT Report Project Status to management Closely cooperate with other reporting specialists to ensure consistency of structure and data Establishes clear priorities among project activities Provide or ensure 2nd/3rd line of support for reporting in scope and supports users doing their own reporting Coordinate, support or execute key and end-user training activities for reporting in scope Your Qualifications Bachelors’ or Masters’ degree in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or comparable qualification Several years of professional experience as Controller or Reporting Responsible ideally in sales area Fundamental understanding of different reporting methods and tools e.g. Excel, Power BI, OBIEE Quick understanding as well as independent, pragmatic and solution-oriented working methods Good conceptual-analytical skills Very good communication skills as well as joy in working in a global team Good written and verbal communication skills in English

description: Nexperia is a world-class company in semiconductor development and in-house production. A proven global player with an entrepreneurial mentality. At our core is an 13,000+ strong international network with a singular focus. Built on passion and commitment to our work, belief in our goals and a drive to succeed regardless of the challenges we face. We support, reward and challenge individuals equally, in a dynamic and energetic environment.  About This Role  The Sales Operations Specialist interfaces intensively with multiple stakeholder in the Sales Team, Sales Operations Team, Business Administration & Finance, IT, Legal and Reporting to provide business data timely, accurately and transparently.  This position is essential to enable the Regional Sales Head to deliver upon NEXPERIA’s growth ambitions and to streamline processes in reporting, forecasting, DWIN tracking globally with the Director Sales, Marketing and Distribution Operations.  What you will do:  In this exciting position, your responsibilities include amongst others: Support regional sales head on sales operations related Implement, support & execute standardized sales management processes Drive Revenue and Design Win Tracking/Forecasting in collaboration with the Sales team and Sales Operations Team globally Monitor Target Setting and Controlling Chief of regional sales Staff activities What you will need: University background with minimum 5 years Sales Operations experience with Semiconductor Company or Distributor; Strong Computer skills - MS office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other relevant system as e.g. SAP and ModelN Sound understanding of (Semiconductor) and Distribution related business processes and programs and ability to define and drive processes and programs Strong, confident and clear communication skills Ability to deal with different personalities (also push back on things) High dependability, be there to support the business Team mentality, hands-on mentality and service oriented mindset Result-oriented and analytical skill set  Talent acquisition based on Nexperia vacancies is not appreciated. Nexperia job adverts are Nexperia copyright © material and the word Nexperia® is a registered trademark.  Nexperia is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

The Platform Business Manager will also be part of a global monitoring team in charge of the entire network’s health   Responsibilities Identifying and tracking new and existing business opportunities Tracking and monitoring platform and network performance and KPIs  Managing market trends, top players and solution usage Establish growth and upsell strategies for each account Analyze and work with internal and parties to ensure that performance and technical topics are handled optimally with developers The Platform Business Manager is expected to actively contribute to the ongoing success of our platform business, while working in close partnership with global Growth and Sales Teams Analyzing performance trends and insights of existing business  Requirements Experience in business development / business analysis / client management – helps Mobile gaming industry – helps Fluent English  Strong analytical skills Strong interpersonal skills to interact with peers, clients and management Ability to multitask and handle various priorities Details oriented with an ability to see the bigger picture Bachelor degree

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  At EY, Managed Services (MS) is a significant part of our business, comprising more than $4b in revenue with major clients across the globe. We help clients with people based, asset based and integrated solutions, leveraging our deep sector and domain expertise to deliver enhanced value to our clients. In MS we are also ambitious, seeking to more than double our success in the future. Join us in this newly created role and you’ll be right at the heart of the action, directly engaging with clients, influencers and deal makers in ways that will impact EY, our clients and people, as well as your own career.  The opportunity  As the Asia-Pacific Managed Services Client Executive (CE), you will ensure that EY invests in the right opportunities and drive innovation in the right areas across Service Lines and markets. You will achieve this by being in the market, talking to clients about their evolving needs and driving a portfolio of campaigns for priority Managed Services solutions within EMEIA.  Your Key Responsibilities Support the Asia-Pacific MS and Asia-Pacific Solution/Offering leaders to develop and execute Managed Services’ to go market plans specifically in the areas of Risk Management and Financial / Tax Transformation Execute on the MS go to market strategy across Asia-Pacific that is utilised by Area and Regional teams to identify, design, develop with clients, and execute high quality MS pursuits Drive new and existing qualified business opportunities and maximise new sales and cross sell opportunities Experience in selling solutions that are based on a global delivery model capability Foster and maintain relationships across target buyers within strategic clients Develop and maintain partner and vendor relationships Collaborate with our aligned sales community to communicate and promote strategic solutions internally Support Asia-Pacific /regional/solution leaders with the development MS GTM programmes and monitor progress – comprising awareness development, solution prioritisation, campaign design and development, client engagement and pursuit execution. Skills and attributes for success You will have experience of business development, solution selling and the complexities of managed services and Digital Transformation deals within professional services or a similar technology organisation Experience in delivery sales and customers outcomes across an internal matrix organisation as well as multiple customer stakeholders The influencing skills to successfully collaborate with senior client and EY stakeholders Demonstrated success working in a matrix environment The ability to effectively forecast, review projection of performance and targets  To qualify for the role, you must have Bachelor’s Degree with an advanced degree preferred  Ideally, you’ll also have 12+ years of experience executing complex and large managed service sales deals focused on Risk Solutions (e.g. Cyber Security, Third Party Risk Management, Internal Audit) and Financial Transformation (ideally in Tax systems and processes), preferably in a partnership/professional services or technology provider environment Experience in a leadership capacity in a managed services environment Experience structuring , managing and closing multimillion deals Board presentation experience or experience as a board member Knowledge and understanding of outsourcing and offshoring operating and cost/pricing models for managed services  What We Look For Professionals who possess the skills and attributes to drive transformational performance across a portfolio of accounts and solutions Expert client facing and client relationships skills; sustained high-impact c-suite relationships Expertise in the Managed Services field including knowledge of market and industry dynamics Strong content expertise (technical/sector). An innovative and creative mindset Experience in a matrix organization Comfortable managing through ambiguity and complexity, while working in a virtual setting  What Working At EY Offers Exciting work building out a key offering, working a team of like-minded professionals Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you  If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

description: We are open for this position to be based in Shenzhen or Bangkok (relocation support provided).  Curious about what it’s like to work at the world’s number 1 discovery platform as a Taboola News Account Manager? We’re glad you asked!  What is the key purpose of a Taboola News Account Manager?   The Taboola News team works directly with Original Equipment Manufacturers and Mobile Carriers globally to deliver a high quality, high engagement content experience on mobile devices. Taboola’s personalised content recommendations now come packaged with devices from Huawei, ZTE, Vivo, Samsung, Tracfone, America Móvil and many more. The Taboola News Account Manager will be based in Bangkok and this role requires spending about 50% of your time in China, mostly in Shenzhen, in order to manage relationships with OEMs in the region. There are additional travelling needs, as our customers are global. This is an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of one of Taboola’s most exciting and innovative products  What skills and qualifications do I need?  For this role it is essential that you:  Speak, read and write Mandarin at native level and are also fluent in English. Have a proven track record in a client facing account management role; ability to build strong relationships with a diverse set of internal and external constituencies including senior level executives, legal, technical, finance, sales and marketing. Are comfortable handling technical conversations with the ability to explain technical solutions, establish goals and develop opportunities with tech and non-tech teams. Possess good analytical skills - providing ongoing reporting, analysis of data and ability to identify trends and improve the key metrics, including work with Product Management on A/B Testing and optimization. Have a track record of closing business and driving long and complex sales cycles. Are highly motivated, proactive, dedicated, resourceful and creative to ensure your clients receive world class support and leadership. Have negotiation experience working with customers to jointly define the deliverables, deadlines and expectations Position based in Bangkok. Willing to travel.   Nice to haves include:  Prior experience managing strategic partnerships with OEMs  What will I be doing on a day-to day today basis?  As a Taboola News Account Manager, you will:  Manage and grow relationships with OEMs and strategic partners in China, specifically in Shenzhen and the surrounding regions. Monitor and analyse metrics and proactively take steps to improve results and determine optimisation paths on the current business. Conduct ongoing in-person meetings with key people at the OEMs as well as prepare and conduct quarterly business reviews. Throughout the partnership, provide strategic consultation to our partners, update on new product capabilities and find new areas for growth. Serve as a key point of communication between Taboola’s R&D, product and product enablement teams (based in Israel), so that we can build the right products for our partners. Fully comprehend Taboola, the technology, revenue ecosystem and client needs/requirements in order to intelligently identify new opportunities.  Why Taboola? If you ask our employees what they love about Taboola they will tell you that here they are able to discover their best professional self, explore where they can grow to, and learn from and together with smart and talented people. We work with some of the biggest names in the business. Our clients include Business Insider, NBC, Wells Fargo, Adidas, and more.

description: Position Title:Mobile Growth Strategist   Position Description:   We are searching for an enthusiastic sales professional to drive new revenue in the Mobile/Programmatic Media/DTC Advertising space. This individual contributor will be responsible for closing new business with Advertisers & Ad Agencies. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a high-paced, start-up environment and contain an understanding of the advertising space and mobile ecosystem.   This role requires an individual to prospect and develop relationships among the digital advertising community on both the planning and buying side, as well as have strong client management and sales skills. The Mobile Growth Strategist works well both independently and within a team, contributes market/client knowledge to help drive product & marketing and is a true sales hunter.   Responsibilities:   • Generate mobile advertising revenue through new and existing relationships at the agency and client level while also managing a selection of current accounts  • Develop relationships at all levels within the mobile, DTC, and advertising agency community  • Proven experience as strong contributor to multicultural organizations  • Collaborate with Tapjoy's internal teams to win & deliver campaigns  • Represent Tapjoy at Marketing & Advertising events  • Achieve revenue goals as defined by management   Requirements:   • 1-3 year of demonstrable track record driving mobile, online advertising sales or performance marketing in China  • The ability to provide positive customer service and following-through to close deals and build relationships  • Strong communication, negotiation and project management skills  • Ability to build interdepartmental relationships  • Experience with performance-based online advertising and/or DTC is ideal  • Fluency in Chinese and English is a must   Tapjoy is a leading mobile advertising and app monetization company. Our platform empowers advertisers to connect with over 1 billion monthly active users through value exchange advertising that drives awareness, engagement, and the metrics that matter most to their overall growth. Meanwhile, companies such as Scopely, Glu, Ludia, and many of the Top 200 grossing app publishers trust our platform to monetize their content, grow their audiences, and reward their users. Founded in 2007 and headquartered in San Francisco, Tapjoy is a global organization with offices in Santa Barbara, Boston, London, Beijing, Tokyo, and Seoul.   Tapjoy is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity and inclusion lead to stronger, more innovative teams and better business results; we want to draw from the broadest talent pool possible and encourage qualified applicants. Tapjoy does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, color, age, sexual orientation, gender (including identity and expression), disability (mental or physical), religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification protected by applicable law; we will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities, and pursuant to applicable fair chance ordinances, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.   For more information, please visit www.tapjoy.com

Key words: Headhunter/recruitment specialist/ HR function Key Responsibility: Openings on Associate consultant/Consultant/Senior or managing consultant, all in HR practice but dealing with different industry client group including fast-moving consumer/retail industry, healthcare industry, Internet industry and financial service industry Pre-screens candidates resumes via phone interviews, face to face interviews and video interviews. Keep close relationship with candidates, to persuade excellent candidates to communicate with clients Acts as a brand ambassador when representing Recruit first and job opportunities in the external market place Follow recruitment process including interview arrangement, offer negotiation, on boarding Actively doing business development to acquire quality job pipeline Be the owner of your pipeline and result  Requirements: Bachelor's degree or above, 985, 211 is preferred, with previous recruitment/sales experience is a plus Mature and results-driven, always aiming at achieving the goal Humble, hardworking, smart with logical thinking Strong compressive endurance, willing to accept challenges Be passionate about developing your career in sales environment, keen to achieve your ambition within a high-performing team Quickly reaction to clients' requirements, proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, superb communication skills are essential Approachable and accessible, entrepreneurial, energetic, resilient and dynamic team player Positive attitude, Pro-active, Presentable, Self-motivated, Bi-lingual, and Eager to learn Mandarin speakers, who are fluent in oral and written English  What can we Offer: Professional and leading on job & off job trainings Passionate, dynamic and rewarding working environment where we celebrate success Clear and professional promotion criteria and career path in which opportunities will be prepared for everyone to be an expert in the specific industry Friendly, sharing and open team culture, most competitive HR practice in market Deal with the most professional candidate and client group-HRs, learn from them  About us: Hudson China was established in 2000. Since then we’ve built a strong reputation among our growing client base of multinationals, public listed companies and local private companies. Partnerships with our Talent Management business allow you to offer more to clients, including assessments to select for success and pinpoint the perfect people for their roles. At Hudson, we know that matching people to the right roles to create that perfect ‘fit’ fuels business success and transforms people’s lives. That’s why we’re passionate about doing an incredible job for our clients and candidates, and creating a fulfilling workplace for our people where they can be successful.  Resume to: miya.zhou@hudson.com

A mutually rewarding experience.  Work. Realize your ambitions. And realize there’s more to being in business than just making a profit. That’s the Mars philosophy. And the opportunity we offer every one of our Associates. An opportunity to take what you do and make it mean more for you, for those around you and for the planet. What you get here is challenging, interesting work. You get the tools you need to do a great job and you get to have the best possible people on your side to help you do it. And at the same time as getting to find ways to do business better today than we did it yesterday and driving a great career, you also get to build a more enlightened business and drive sustainability.  Because it’s never just about a single person, a single project or a single brand. It’s about how you can grab everything that’s within your reach here and use it to pursue mutual, long-term gain. It’s about having ideas. And ideals. Being prepared to risk failure because the promise of success means we’ll all be a little better off. It’s that mix of integrity and ambition that makes Mars such a special place to work. And why working here is always about more than just a job.  About Mars, Incorporated  Mars is a family-owned business with more than a century of history making diverse products and offering services for people and the pets people love. With almost $35 billion in sales, the company is a global business that produces some of the world’s best-loved brands: M&M’s®, SNICKERS®, TWIX®, MILKY WAY®, DOVE®, PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, EXTRA®, ORBIT®, 5™, SKITTLES®, UNCLE BEN’S®, MARS DRINKS and COCOAVIA®. Mars also provides veterinary health services that include BANFIELD® Pet Hospitals, Blue Pearl®, VCA® and Pet Partners™. Headquartered in McLean, VA, Mars operates in more than 80 countries. The Mars Five Principles – Quality, Responsibility, Mutuality, Efficiency and Freedom – inspire its more than 100,000 Associates to create value for all its partners and deliver growth they are proud of every day.  Key Responsibilities/职位描述  1 Overall management on PDD DTRs(Sales Target and budget management of all PDD DTRs, sales target delivery tracking)  2 General management on PDD top DTRs ( Sales target delivery, operational management on both flagship stores and TP integrated stores) Cooperate with NSO/NDD on promotion price management and CCT issues solving Qualifications/任职条件 Account Management skill 3 years+ Data Analytical Skill FMCG business understanding and planning Negotiation skill Project Management RN:15  Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

description: About the job The Marketing Specialist will assist in championing the marketing presence and strategy for APAC and especially China. This position involves regional marketing strategy & activities as well as assisting with campaigns, events, emailing systems, marketing processes, plans and budget. This position will assist with collaborating with the Regional teams (including Business units, Sales, Project teams, Global Marketing) in order to assist in design and develop new innovative marketing programs and client communication that elevate and advance our brand across B2B sales and lead generation, while also bringing First Advantage closer to our customers and the HR community.  This role is responsible for: Assist in development and implementation of Marketing campaigns supporting all products and new product development projects. Assist and contribute to the development of marketing collateral, new design development and management in accordance with branding guidelines. Contribute to the management of China website's current digital content, identify gaps and proactively relay feedback as well as help localize content. Assist in planning and organizing sales, marketing and client events. Assist in creating brand communication (internal and external). Schedule, manage and implement EDMs/newsletter/ad hoc client notices. Manage and update CRM, allocating leads to reps and building reports as directed. Manage, drive and deliver a range of client and internal projects as directed by the Marketing & Communication Manager.  Required Education, Competencies and Characteristics: Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Mass Communications or other related field. Minimum 2 years professional marketing experience. Exceptional organizational and time management skills. Excellent communication skills. Strong presentation skill an advantage. Strong English Skills. Strong Mandarin Skills. Strong attention to detail. High level working knowledge of digital platforms and social media channels. Experience with MS Office. Expert in MS PowerPoint an advantage. Experience with Adobe Creative Suite an advantage. Knowledge of the printing process a strong advantage. Experience in EDM with strong working knowledge in a web-based email service platform. Experience with web-based CMS systems. WordPress a strong advantage.  Others: Office based environment but expected for some in country or regional travel.  High level of autonomy, resilience and self-motivation required.

description: Description  What You Will Do In Your Role  Manage the sales order process for the assigned market areas and customers  Responsibility Receive, enter & process demand in accordance with customer requirements, forecast & commercial objectives as defined by sales manager Track & coordinate delivery of orders & communicate details to external and internal customers Issue necessary documents Expectation Entering all orders on the same date that I received them with no mistake. Inform customers immediately when there is anything unclear / incorrect in their orders Make sure the agents have a good communication with the end-users, to make sure they understand GP’s standpoint and policies Update customers with the delivery status and reply their enquiry timely manneronce I got any updated information Communicate / monitor more closely with all related parties regarding docs issuance and shipment issues; pushing harder for feedback to avoid late docs Sales planning in collaboration with production, logistics and sales that is to make sure the production and logistics process are able to cater the customers’ need. Monitor and optimize stock levels, to ensure customer will have a stable supply To understand more about the production procedure / production problem(s) that will affect the supply / delivery Cover the work of other CS Reps when they are out of office, need to understand the special preferences for their customers When encountering logistics problem, reflect it immediately to the service providers and our logistics dept. and make sure our requirements are clearly stated When there is remaining allocation, notify managers, see if other area need the tonnage; if my areas need more qty, seeking more advise from managers Figure out the reason for the slow market Negotiate for a lower logistics cost, more free time, waive demurrage / container repair charges Provide solutions to customers when there is any delivery problem, such as re-arrange shipments, provide other grades / sizes for customer to choose Request the customer to try to provide the B/L details before the delivery, so as to avoid holding of goods at port or late B/L issue, since it might cause extra charges to GP which results in decrease of profit. Credit risk and billings  Responsibility Checking Credit Limits and Past Due reports before invoicing Assisting in month end closing Generate commission report at the end of each quarter for Zug office to process the commission payment Expectations Report to credit / law dept. when I suspect any credit related problem or request(s) from customer, such as B/L requirements, etc. To make sure the customers have a good credit status. Provide data for generating the billing report without variance Provide the commission breakdown to the customers on a timely manner. Make sure providing the accurate date to the accounting department and ensure the invoices were settled before we pay the commission. Process customer feedback, advisories or complaints  Responsibility Enter complaints, feedback or advisories in Customer Feedback tracking system with all necessary information to process Implement the proposed solution(s) of an advisory complaint in the process & close out Expectations Investigate the complaints once got that from customer and collect necessary info immediately and enter into the system within 2 days Discuss with related parties on how to deal with and avoid the problems in the future Raise up potential problems and keep an eye on that POPS testing and implementation  Responsibility Input orders in the testing environment Generate reports from the Report Wizard Help to go through the transition period Expectations Follow the testing instructions from the POPS development team. Raise up questions and suggestions, work on report developments Working with every related party to make sure all the orders would be processed smoothly during the transition period. Assist co-workers in learning / get used to the new program Forecast  Responsibility Assisting the HK Office for collecting customer production plan information Expectations Provide accurate information and assist in the forecast in any aspect Discuss the forecast results with managers, so that I can understand and know more about the market situation Inform sales group immediately if there is any sudden change. Office Administration  Responsibility Arrange appointment, travel arrangement and hotel bookings Organize and assist in Exhibition and large scale business functions Manage all the administrative work in the office Liaise with vendors and suppliers Assist in the relocation of personnel Expectations Negotiate for a lower cost / betting terms with vendors / sources services with lower cost without affecting the smooth operation Review the renewal of service contract carefully Maintain a smooth run of the office Able to handle business functions under the least supervision Arrange the production and price negotiation of company premium gifts Working closely with Account department and the Shanghai Office, ensure office expense invoices / documents are sent to Zug office accordingly and paid on time Maintain Centralized-filing system to ensure records are kept probably for easy tracking. Keep working on delivering the old files to the warehouse. Assist the newly joined sales manager during the transition period, e.g. getting familiar with the culture of the company; provide information regarding the S.E.A. customer Assistant to Director  Responsibility Arrange appointments for director. Prepare and retrieve data for presentation Expectation Smooth out the Director’s work.
industries: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: Responsibilities Manage the customer’s Tesla experience in the most positive way. Welcome all walk in guests, answer questions and enthusiastically educate all customers and fans about the benefits of going electric, generally publicize going electric knowledge. Through effective communication, encourage customers to get behind the wheel of a Tesla product for themselves and provide an experience that future customer would highly recommend to friends and family. Responsible for collecting qualified customer information, assist market events, explore customer needs, stimulate customer demand, cooperate with Owner Advisor to meet store’s sales target. Provide high quality service to existing Tesla owner community. Employee must learn about the company and products related knowledge, keep up with industry trends and best practices Pass internal testing including but not limited to training, drive skill test, in store test, Role play and related test, otherwise he or she will not be able to meet the full time employee’s requirement. Communicate with the external clients and partners in a professional way, and also ensure effective communication and great cooperation with internal colleagues (Among same and different function/ store/region). Get a driver's license within the time required by the company and have skilled driving skills. During the probationary period, including not limited to transfer, promotion, etc., are not considered to pass the probationary period and the employee is required to pass the probationary period. Other Responsibilities: Perform other related duties as assigned, based on the business need. Requirements Highly appreciate Company culture and value. Strong communication and customer service experience required. Exceptional self-management and self-learning ability. Positive, enthusiastic and passionate about the changes in the personal transportation industry. Ability to understand and convey business issues and technical concepts. Strong sense of team mentality and reliability. Ability to work evenings and weekends in retail environment. Retail, industry and key account sales experience preferred. 产品专员  主要职责 保证最佳客户体验：接待所有进店客人，回答问题，热情的为客户和特斯拉粉丝介绍电动汽车的优点,普及电动车知识。 通过良好的沟通，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态，明确特斯拉的发展前景并鼓励顾客试驾 收集潜在客户，参加市场活动，探索客户购买需求、激发客户需求，配合销售主管完成门店的销售目标。 对现有特斯拉车主提供高质量客户服务。 认真学习了解公司及产品的相关知识，及时了解最新行业发展和最佳实践。 通过公司安排的内部测试，包括但不限于课程培训及测试、驾驶技术测试、店内测试、角色扮演、能力认证、试用期评估等，以达到正式员工的标准和要求。 和外部客户、外部人员，保持清晰、准确、职业、礼貌的沟通, 和内部同事保持良好的沟通和团队协作（包括同部门、跨部门；同门店、跨门店；同地区、跨地区之间）。 在公司要求的时间内获得驾照，并具备熟练的驾驶技能。 员工在试用期期间发生的任何职位变更，包括并不限于调岗、晋升等，均不可视为通过试用期，员工需要通过试用期评估。 其他职责：根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作。 职位要求 应届毕业生或1-2年零售、行业销售、以及大客户销售或服务经验。 对企业文化高度认可。 出色的沟通能力和客户服务意识。 良好的自我管理能力及自我学习能力，积极热情地参与改变个人交通行业的变革。 深刻理解并传递业务问题和技术概念。 优秀的团队意识，是可靠的团队成员。 能够接受零售业的工作时间，需要晚上和周末工作；有销售经验优先。

companyName: 中瀚石林企业咨询(上海)有限公司
description: 该职位来源于猎聘  We are currently seeking appointment of a Sales Executive, The location of office is Shanghai, China.  You will report to the Director of international Desk in Ireland. Your focus will be developing international business and partnership. You are required to explore business opportunities; maintain and develop the existing customer relationship; cultivate and develop potential customers, identify and, where possible, influence prospect needs, mainly in the international market.  Your role will be that of a professional BD, assisting conduct effective sales presentation, solution proposal, business negotiation and close deals both individually and as a team.  Your responsibilities will also include, amongst others, providing weekly/monthly updates and reviews on individual and market performance and measures for improvement; creating own sales plan within overall framework to achieve quarterly and annual sales targets; and other ad-hoc tasks assigned by leader for the business requirement.  Opportunities And Responsibilities You will enjoy the Stone Forest corporate culture of ”work hard play hard” and working with a closely knitted team of colleagues in Ireland, China and Singapore Demonstrate your ability to be a professional sales person and good advisor for clients investing in China. You will also gain expert experience to provide clients total payroll and HR related solutions in China. Exposure to drive, manage and build operations and develop business Develop the fundamental working competency and capability of the team; appropriate delegation, coaching and mentioning of staff You will learn how to resolve business issues and develop your strength in communication and interpersonal skills Requirements Bachelor degree or above At least 5 years sales experience. It will be a plus if have been working in leading HR related industry Outstanding sales skills with a track record of closing new business Good presentation and negotiation skills in English (oral and written) Skilled at leveraging resources to facilitate relationship building Ability to work under pressure Well-developed interpersonal skills, with an ability to communication well at all organizational levels

该职位来源于猎聘  Key Responsibilities 制定并实施年度培训计划 持续完善现有销售培训管理体系及课程体系 管理日常销售培训课程，追踪培训效果，不断提高课程质量，持续提升培训满意度 针对销售团队需求，协调内外部讲师资源，策划、开发并组织实施销售培训课程或培训项目 跟踪外部培训市场变化，发掘、整合并评估外部培训资源 Education, Background and Skill Requirements 市场营销、管理类相关专业本科以上学历 五年以上一线销售工作经验，三年以上培训和培训管理经验 具备优秀的组织能力、协调能力、沟通能力和表达能力。 做事积极主动，勇于承担责任，且具备复杂问题的解决能力 具有创新意识，不断突破自我，主动承担有挑战性的工作任务

At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  EC Marketing Manager  Your Tasks And Responsibilities Digital brand strategy development: Develop annual Category, Brand strategy including new products in local EC and new business model channel based on thorough understanding for online consumers as well as various channels evolvement Lead brand investment plan through activities in social and platforms to establish solid brand building and enhance consumer education for continuous content output. Drive new products cultivation to expand brand territory according to category trend and Bayer capability, recruiting new users and further fulfill consumer needs Social channel understanding and exploration to further drive consumer engagement Make sure existed brands in-market share growthahead of category. Innovation pipeline buildup: Work with Category team to co-develop annual and long-term Innovation strategy in new business model. Focus on both portfolio expansion plan and procedure optimization New launch breakthrough in continuous shortening the launch procedure and facilitate innovative solution of NPD market test Ensure new business model delicate innovation delivery Multi-function collaboration: Close work with category teams on co-developing online brand strategy. Close work with Local EC sales managers to drive platform sales of new products. Work with agencies to explore business opportunities in social channel, esp Douyin, Xiaohongshu, etc. Work withcompany medical/regulatory/legal/supply/finance teams to ensure brand building with end-to-end support in company. External TP/Customer/agency communication Who You Are Strategic capabilities to build Ecommerce marketing strategy and tactics with strong business sense Comprehensive brand building capability in social 5+ years' experience in managing Ecommerce business with technical understanding of EC marketing Strong ability in leveraging new ways to drive results Fluent English in oral and writing. YOUR APPLICATION  If your background and personal experience fit this profile, please send us your complete application at www.career.bayer.cn If you have any recommendations, please kindly send mail to cnreferral@bayer.com  L ocation:  China : ShangHai : ShangHai  Division:  Consumer Health  Reference Code:  454173

该职位来源于猎聘  岗位职责： 敏锐的商业嗅觉，通过顾问式销售，准确了解客户需求，帮助客户梳理业务 痛点和需求，挖掘潜在需求和商机； 制定销售计划和策略，完成销售指标，负责商务谈判，合同签订、回款等事 项； 快速接触关键用户，洞察行业招聘趋势，用户业务痛点及原因； 从客户业务出发，和客户共同讨论解决方案； 善于进行销售阶段的精细化管理，对项目进行有效推进； 协调实施及CSM团队帮助客户落地成功计划，和客户建立长期、双赢的合作 关系。 及时收集客户的反馈，竞争对手的市场动态，协助公司制定对应市场策略。 任职资格: 全日制统招本科及以上学历； 5年以上销售经验，有B2B软件或SaaS相关产品销售经验者优先，有企业应 用系统（BI，Big Data，APM，ERP，CRM，HR）销售经验者优先； 熟悉B2B采购流程，有学习能力并运用常用的销售方法和技巧，如解决方案 销售、顾问式销售等； 具备良好销售技巧与谈判能力， 具备一定的市场分析及判断能力； 尊重与遵守公司业务管理规范，执行力强，为人正直； 注重效率，具备管理多个工作及项目的能力，管理时间、精力和优先级的能 力； 敏捷的学习能力，目标感强，对新事物的好奇心，强烈的影响愿望和目标意 识； 能够快速掌握行业新方向、新产品或解决方案，能适应高强度、快节奏的工 作环境。

工作职责:  Job Purpose and Impact  The Key Account Executive II, with general supervision, will help build and maintain our customer relations with strategic accounts that typically involve an international partner or major global accounts. We seek a professional who will help identify and contact prospective customers, building relationships to generate future sales and repeat business. In this role, you will contribute to assessing customer needs and suggesting appropriate products, services and solutions.  Key Accountabilities With guidance, help identify, develop and close new sales. Support business growth by disseminating information that favorably promotes our organization and its products and services. Monitor customer and competitor activity and industry trends. Coordinate market research, pricing and sales and merchandising activities. Participate in regular status and strategy meetings with customers' senior management to understand and meet their needs. Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Minimum of two years of related work experience Other minimum qualifications may apply 任职条件:  Same as above
industries: Information Technology and Services, Consumer Goods, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Assistant Sales Manager - WuXi/助理销售经理 - 无锡
description: Job Description  主要工作内容 达成公司制定的业绩目标. 管理核心品牌产品在负责区域内所有门店的陈列,并确保样品陈列的最佳位置. 维护现有经销商关系，寻找全渠道商业机会点，并开发新客户 (传统渠道，即饮渠道等)，扩大品牌在所在市场的占有率. 管理并监控产品的零售价格,并及时反馈. 确保促销活动在合理的预算范围内有效执行. 制定客户拜访计划并保证客勤，SFA符合公司标准. 定期反馈区域内客户绩效以及及时有效的为公司提供所有相关的市场信息. 所需能力 8年以上快消品销售工作经验，如有酒水销售工作经验更佳 大专或以上学历 基本熟练的电脑软件操作能力 良好的社交能力，客户管理问题，解决问题能力 良好的人际沟通技巧 积极主动、精力旺盛、可靠，能在压力下工作 能在带人主管不在同一个工作地点的情况下，积极主动完成工作内容 自驱力，积极主动地寻找商业机会点，并跟踪执行 Worker Type  Fixed Term Contract (Fixed Term)  Primary Location:  Off Site Wuxi  Additional Locations :  Job Posting Start Date  2021-03-31-07:00
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: ENTERPRISE BACKGROUND Our client is one of the world's leading Pre-Clinical Contract Research Organizations, headquartered in Wilmington, MA, USA. They have successfully spread the business world-wide for 70 years. With 100+ facilities and 18000+ employees globally, they integrate resources tactically and offer multiple solutions to every unique challenge occurs at different stages of new drug discovery and development.  RECRUITING BACKGROUND As the biologics & microbial testing business enters China market, our client endeavor to be one of the dominant leadership in Asia&Pacific region. They are in need of outstanding talents to support their rapidly growing business in Shanghai, China.  MAIN DUTIES As a Marketing Specialist, your role is to work individually and collaborate closely with BD/Sales team to design marketing campaigns and promotions to generate high quality leads to expand the customer base. You will report to the General Manager of this business unit directly. When you join our client, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Proficiency in oral and written English is a must.

Overview This is full-time position in the APAC marketing department and includes planning and execution of campaigns and program to win, grow, and retain business across multiple product lines in the M&A and fundraising industry. This individual will have the opportunity to contribute to global, APAC-wide, and local managing campaigns and events, and will be expected to leverage marketing / sales platforms while managing his or her own assigned marketing budgets.  This position reports to the Marketing Manager based in Hong Kong. Working with the wider Regional Sales and Global Marketing teams, you will develop regional marketing plans that align with corporate strategy and support sales objectives. Key objectives include developing and executing marketing activities to create awareness of Intralinks solutions, drive demand generation, and increasing qualified leads & opportunities in the Greater China region.  Responsibilities  1. Develop and manage regional campaigns according to regional requirements. Organize regional event execution and manage: Lead management (coordinate priorities with sales, create leads and follow up with statistics and summary) Organize and manage local events (liaison with 3rd party event organisers, vendors, venue suppliers on branding and design, event logistics, and cost negotiation) Leads tracking, reporting and upload post event results Develop supporting campaign and marketing collateral  2. Sales Enablement Work with sales leaders and reps to identify target market segments Create campaigns in sales systems and ensuring correct tagging of all contacts Work with Marketing Manager and Sales team to support their requirements for regular communication with target market Provide administrative support to achieve sales targets  3. Branding and Social Marketing Liaise with corporate and agency to create content for digital channels (Web, WeChat, LinkedIn, and relevant domains) Work with corporate on Baidu SEO marketing and communications to generate awareness and coverage  4. Marketing Operations Prepare reports to track campaign activity and outcomes Lead management Coordinate on logistics and production of any branded assets for campaigns  Basic Qualifications  Minimum of 2 years of experience in marketing, events management, design/advertising, or marketing operations/ administration.  Understanding and interest in of both traditional marketing vehicles such as mail, email, customer events, as well as new media and digital approaches.   Sound working knowledge and experience in CRM systems, preferably Salesforce.  Proven track record in campaign execution, event management, social, channel marketing programs and field marketing.  Ability to manage multiple projects and work under tight deadlines when necessary.  Sound analytical and reporting skills and attention to accuracy.   Desired Qualifications /Attributes  Knowledge and/or industry experience in marketing and the general finance sector  Strong communicator with a creative approach in marketing communications   Ability to translate and produce bilingual (English & Simplified Chinese) marketing content  Autonomous and with good initiative

TransPerfect China is looking to add a Marketing Specialist to our APAC marketing team. Based in our Shanghai office, this individual will work closely with local and regional leadership to create and execute marketing and sales support strategies that help to broaden TransPerfect’s exposure in China, and throughout APAC.  The primary duty of this individual will be to produce content in Simplified Chinese, both independently and with a team or other internal resource, for digital channels including social media and websites, as well as print materials and brochures.  Candidates must have sufficient Chinese language skill – native speakers are preferred – to author high quality in Chinese, and also must possess fluency in English.   Responsibilities: Work in conjunction with our Marketing Lead and our local sales teams to execute marketing strategy for local market Research, understand and make recommendations to our global Digital Marketing team on best practice for SEO and Digital Marketing efforts in local market, and region. Content creation – use your high-level writing skills and project manage the creation of new materials for the local market, and region as well as creating some original content in-language (for PR, social media etc.) Help launch, promote and grow following of social channels for TransPerfect in local market  You’ll oversee translation and localization process to adapt existing English materials to the local market. Identify, qualify, execute, and track ROI for advertising opportunities in local market Help to ensure success for trade show and conference marketing for local market, including event logistics, promotional items and giveaways, and ROI tracking  Assist in production of promotional events, including conception, venue selection, negotiation, promotion, branding, execution, and follow up Serve as a primary liaison between sales teams and marketing department for requests, needs, and ideas Proofread communications materials, online content, and all client-facing communications Track the success of our internal business group and prepare reports A key contributor in developing and executing marketing initiatives Reliably work independently to complete tasks and ask for help from managers, peers, or other resrouces when appropriate  Demonstrate strong commitment to TransPerfect, to MarComm and to the shared goal of delivering for our clients and growing the company Complete all other tasks that are deemed appropriate for this role, and assigned by the manager / supervisor.  Required Skills and Qualifications: 2-4 years previous experience in a similar marketing role Native Mandarin speaker Fluency and excellent communication (written and verbal) skills in English Commitment to getting projects done, whatever it takes Proven time management abilities and attention to detail Ability to manage large and fluctuating workloads while maintaining agreed service levels and meeting deadlines Interpersonal skills and ability to work with multiple personality  Desired Skills: Prior digital marketing, social media experience Self-sufficient and robust work ethic Must be a self-starter and self-motivated Basic design capabilities (Adobe Creative Suite, etc.) Prior work in trade shows or large-scale events/promotional campaigns Experience working for a global/international organization in China would be valuable Brand management/development experience

description: Who We Are And What We Do  The Straumann Group is a global leader in tooth replacement and orthodontic solutions. It unites global and international brands that stand for excellence, innovation and quality in tooth replacement and esthetics, including Straumann, Neodent, Medentika, ClearCorrect, Dental Wings and other fully or partly owned companies and partners.  As a total solution provider, we take a holistic approach, offering training, support and a wide range of services to dental practitioners, clinics and laboratories all over the world. It is recognized as a leading innovator and works together with universities, clinics, research institutes, networks and communities to enhance the standard of patient care.  Key Responsibilities Engage certified doctors and develop potential for new cases Work qualified contracts to drive more cases Manage accounts in assigned territory Report back to District manager with all assigned reports. Maintain a personal level of product knowledge and competence in Dental and/or Orthodontia medical equipment. Provide on-site consulting/support service to the dentists in treatment. Develop relations with key accounts into lasting business partnerships, Contribute to image-building in your territory Improve market penetration by developing high potential Orthodontists and Dentists Support and evaluate account specific marketing plans Strive for commitment and action by your customer Develop, present and discuss quarterly territory plan for the different customer segments Participation in congresses and exhibitions Work closely with Regional Sales Manager and Distributors to achieve sales target and excellence customer services; Skills And Competencies 4+ years in sales/sales management experience in mainland China, preferably in orthodontic, and/or dental sales and/or marketing experience preferred. BS or BA preferred and/or equivalent experience. A degree in Stomatology or a related science discipline would be an advantage. Alternatively, background as dental therapist/hygienist and acquired valuable knowledge of the industry and its products Excellent oral and written communication skills Pride in excelling and self-directed individual. Well-developed business analysis skills including opportunity and risk assessment. Strong solutions knowledge with business understanding & market knowledge; Computer knowledge is required. Good at English Brilliant team player ready to grow in a cross-cultural environment  Furthermore You  You have a well-developed intercultural understanding and are seasoned in building and maintaining productive partnerships across borders and functions. As some of your stakeholders are working in different time zones you understand that the best time to meet is not always 9-5. And as a true team player you are aware of the potential that lies in a group who share a common will to fight, laugh, win and celebrate as a team.  Open doors and open minds  In Straumann you will join a team of highly dedicated people who share the common understanding that helping each other is key to succeeding in our daily work. Our ambition is to create value for the organization and our colleagues by continuously developing smarter tools, processes and systems that can support an attractive, productive, engaging and compliant workplace. We believe that everyone can contribute to our success.  Remuneration And Benefits Of Working At Straumann Salary and Total Package Straumann uses mercer data to establish competitive benchmarks for pay & benefits We will make a competitive offer based on external and internal benchmarks, your current remuneration and your assessed skills and abilities. Allowances and Benefits Social insurance and housing fund A comprehensive commercial insurance Mobile phone expense claim Mobile phone subsidy Company annual leave Full-pay sick leave …….and we are still adding the list with creativity and humanity. Labor Contract and Probation  A formal offer will be presented to the successful candidate and once agreed a permanent /fixed contract will be entered into with an appropriate probation period.  What is the Recruitment Process?  Based on the role and responsibilities of this position, we are looking forward to assessing our potential candidates with a comprehensive evaluation. If your resume is selected the following process will apply. Screening Interview with HR colleague 1-1 interview with line manager 1-1 interview with 2nd line manager and APAC Leaders Anticipated Start Date  Corporate Culture  The right mindset is a prerequisite for the high-performance culture we are striving to build. Our main thrust over the past years has been to inspire and foster a player-learner mindset throughout our workforce.  Learner  You and I see the world differently. The way in which you deal with such differences defines you as a “learner” or a “knower”. Are you acting as a “knower” pushing your knowledge and opinions on to others? Or are you a “learner” where the approach is to, in a more humble way, use questions to understand the person you are dealing with?  Player  You have it in your hands how you respond to a situation. If you take responsibility or if you act self-disempowering defines you as a “player” or a “victim”. Are you taking the role of a “victim”, always in the hands of external forces and not able to influence the outcome yourself? Or are you more of a “player”, where you are in control of what is happening and could affect the outcome?  Player-Learner  This works best when everyone in the company takes responsibility for their own response to any situation (player mindset) and is truly curious about the opinions and ideas of others (learner mindset).  Player-Learners inspire trust; they are energized and embrace change; they listen, find out, share, collaborate, take risks, find solutions, learn by doing, encourage and celebrate.  Want to know more?  Check out http://www.straumann.com/careers  1409

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibilities Pre-sales activity will include delivery of technical expertise during the sales process including presentations, seminars, individual consultation, and hands-on demo experiments if needed. Executes technical and application based presentations on illumina’s sequencing and microarray platforms, applications and/or workflows. Post-sales activity includes working with post-installation customers providing additional workflow or applications training in strategically important labs. Supporting/assisting customers with sequencing assay design to accelerate adoption of targeted sequencing on illumina’s platforms. Attendance at tradeshows/conferences in relevant fields. Be the point person for dedicated illumina User Group Meetings in collaboration with field marketing and support team to provide sample to data workflow training Assists sales and field marketing on new strategic initiatives requiring both technical and market knowledge Works collaboratively with territory account managers, marketing, service and support teams to ensure effective account/customer management and communication through pre-sales, during and- post-sales cycle, including review and meeting account pull through targets and goals Escalates technical issues to Technical Support for possible resolution for strategically important labs. Develops and maintain positive relationships with customers in assigned territory Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.  Preferred Requirements Life science industry experience preferred Applied Market Knowledge is a plus Extensive experience and understanding of leading genetics technologies and how they can be applied. Detailed knowledge of technological developments and trends in the sequencing markets Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills in Mandarin and English. Strong negotiation skills and ability to persuade Ability to travel within region to carry out primary responsibilities. All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Preferred Experience/Education Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience; or equivalent work experience. 岗位概述  Responsibilities 售前活动将包括销售过程中的技术知识演讲，如介绍演讲、研讨会、个别咨询等，在必要时，进行演示实验。 对因美纳测序和微阵列平台的应用或工作流程进行技术层面和应用层面的介绍。 售后活动包括与安装产品后的客户的协调，提供在具有重要战略意义的实验室中所需的工作流程或应用培训 支持/辅助客户的相关测序阵列设计，加快在客户因美纳平台上目标测序进程。 参加相关领域的展览会/大会。 作为与现场营销和支持团队合作的专项人员参加因美纳用户组会议，提供样品数据工作流程培训。 提供销售或现场营销新战略项目时所需有关技术和市场知识。 与区域客户经理、营销、服务和支持团队合作工作，保证有效的大客户/客户管理以及负责售前、售中和售后过程的沟通，包括回访和会面已经取得成果或达成目标的客户。 作为技术支持提供技术升级，为具有重要战略意义的实验室提供可能的解决方案。 提升和维护责任区域内客户的良好关系。 以上所列的任务和职责是本岗位的基本功能。然而，各种商务条件下可能需要完成额外的任务和职责。  Preferred Requirements 有生命科学行业经验者优先 有应用市场知识者加分 具有领先的遗传学技术及其应用方面的丰富经验和充分理解 具有技术发展和测序市场趋势的详细知识 优秀的中文普通话和英文口头和书面交流和介绍演讲技能 良好的谈判技巧和说服能力 能在负责区域内出差并完成主要职责 Preferred Experience/Education 科学学科的硕士以上学历（分子生物学、遗传学、或基因组学和/或生物信息学优先）

jobTitle: Assistant Manager, Sales, Standard Surfactant Greater China
description: BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With large production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, as well as a global and regional research and development hub in Shanghai, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry. BASF posted sales of approximately €8.5 billion in 2020 to customers in Greater China and employed 8,948 people as of the end of the year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en.  Objectives Manage sales and customers and achieve the sales and profit targets Support business development by identifying sales potentials, new customers and applications Research and update market intelligence to supervisor/team Main Tasks Plan and manage EMO (Oleo Chemicals & Alcohols) business including key accounts and direct accounts/dealers/distributors to meet sales target; ensure account strategies are exploited consistently including new opportunities. Report all opportunities into DynaMO process at least one month in advance. Maximize profitability by contributing to the full utilization of assets in Asia Pacific and not limited by local view Enhance account relationships and meet sales targets for each assigned account and as per KPI’s via replacement or project activities including calling and visiting existing/prospective customers to fully understand and identify their needs to create a long-term customer supplier relationship. Timely response to customer request including product information, technical support via coordination with technical, customer services, logistics, Regional Pricing and Margin Management, regulatory affairs, etc as necessary to solve customer problem/NCM and to enhance customer service and satisfaction Develop strong client relationships over time that provide significant inputs to product planning, price and service strategies, manage and share relevant information, and update in systems Consolidate data and prepare analysis e.g. customer needs, including product application, sales potentials, services requirements, buying cycles, delivery schedules and internal regulations like pricing structure for defined, customer credibility/ profiles to help secure/enhance business opportunities and identify future customers. Coordinate with the personnel of customer services, logistics and inventory control to support the delivery of sales. Carry out pricing and payment policies as per strategies and advice given by Regional Pricing and Margin Management and update database of customer creditability according to company credit policies. Trace the customers’ payment process to ensure timely payment of receivables to meet established sales targets and revenue goals and follow-up overdue payments. Collect data to establish a database to obtain, update, maintain and evaluate market trends, application of products/technology and service needs, etc in order to support identifying new business opportunities. Conduct initial analysis as necessary and requested. Collect and monitor competitor activities, initially analyze data for market research to develop competitor grid and benchmarking on competitors’ positioning and the performance of their competitive products. Analyze monthly sales/profit performance, proactively prevent business lost and initiate action for recovering Provide timely reports to supervisor/ team members Requirements Education: Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry or related discipline Working Experience: Proven successful performance with minimum 6 years’ working experience in sales & marketing Result oriented, able to identify and exploit business opportunities Good communication and presentation skills Selling and negotiation skills Primary Location  CN-Guangdong-Guangzhou  Job  Sales / Technical Sales  Ongoing  For BASF, diversity is one of the essential keys to business success and the well-being of our employees. We promote an inclusive culture that accepts the diversity of people, experiences and capabilities. Join the team and connect with more than 117,000 other minds. Stay alert for possible recruitment fraud!  This can include fake websites, fake job offers, or contact from a person falsely claiming to represent BASF.

description: Enterprise Account Executive – China (based in Shanghai)  About us:  Forter provides a new generation approach to meeting the challenges faced by modern enterprise e-commerce. From attracting and retaining the right shoppers by reducing friction and boosting consumer confidence across the entire purchase journey, to fighting sophisticated fraudsters and reducing chargeback losses, only Forter provides a fully automated, real-time Decision as a Service™ platform. Behind the scenes, Forter’s machine learning technology combines advanced cyber intelligence with behavioral and identity analysis to create a multi-layered detection and decisioning mechanism. Across all our client's sites, we have created a network of over 800 million buyer identities globally. Our success so far in the marketplace has allowed us to achieve a total series F valuation of over $3 Billion. Our investors include: Tiger Global, Bessemer, Sequoia Capital, March Capital, Salesforce Ventures.  About the role:  This is an exciting time for Forter APAC as we have seen great success in the market and are building a team to support the growth. We are looking for a talented and self-driven Enterprise Account Executive that thrives in a dynamic sales cycle environment to join our Shanghai based Forter team. The successful candidate will play a fundamental role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives.  What You'll Do: Work closely with a large list of named prospect accounts, utilizing a consultative approach to identify pain points and challenges that Forter's fraud prevention platform can help solve Manage a sales pipeline and process from initial outreach to presentation, negotiation, and close Identify and build relationships with economic champions / buyers within major accounts and position Forter's value proposition to the appropriate lines of business and technical teams Collaborate with Sales Development and Marketing teams to drive leads and account activity, as well as with our Pre-sales Solutions Consultants to create customized sales presentations and tailored ROI models Provide field analysis and feedback internally to help shape sales collateral and longer term expansion planning Build a strong understanding of the online payments industry, including credit card issuing/acquiring experience and familiarity with its ecosystem (partners, resellers, processors) Represent Forter at industry events and sales meetings with key eCommerce players in China.  What you'll need: High integrity and passion for winning Minimum of 4 years as a top quota carrying direct sales executive, with a track record of outperforming targets and annual quotas Proven success in selling innovative solutions/services to merchants/enterprises is a must; with a focus on FinTech and eCommerce solutions (analytics, platforms, financial and/or technology solutions) A strong network with a proven track record of enterprise sales within top Cross-border (selling outside of China) eCommerce companies is a big plus Demonstrated success in target account selling in a multi-regional capacity across China The ability to build strong relationships, as demonstrated through prior experience prospecting and leveraging industry contacts to develop and close new businesses A strong understanding of the online payment industry, including credit card issuing/acquiring experience and familiarity with its ecosystem (partners, resellers, processors) is also a big plus Experience in a fast-paced startup, with the ability to work in a rapidly expanding and changing environment Exceptional professional presence, with outstanding presentation and communication skills Ability to travel as required Fluency in Mandarin and English is required  Why Forter: Competitive salary Commission Pension Comprehensive and generous health insurance, including vision and dental coverage Generous PTO policy Half-day Fridays  At Forter, we believe unique people create unique ideas, and valuable experience comes in many forms. So, even if your background doesn't match everything we have listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply and tell us why your skills and values could be an asset to us. By welcoming different perspectives, we grow together as humans and as a company.  Forter is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that will consider all qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
